This game is fantastic as long as you don't take it too seriously, playing in a platoon with friends is the way to go. If you play alone, you will get angry, frustrated and rage, with friends you will just laugh it off and have fun goofing around. The grind is real, and anything above approximately 4.0 takes serious time to unlock. The stock grind can also be frustrating because often, a stock vehicle is worse than the unlocked tank that came before it. 
Skill is king, and being killed instantly is usually a skill issue not some unfair bias or hacking, but there are absolutely pay to win vehicles that are stringer than contemporary tech tree vehicles and you will quickly learn which ones they are. Learn positioning, weak spots and target priority and you will do way, way better. I used to get very frustrated with "BS" deaths that came from nowhere, but now I've learned to play and especially position myself better and it is far less of an issue. Much like with crocodiles, its not the tank you see that gets you most of the time. 
Start in arcade, learn basic mechanics, then give realistic and sim a try. They're far less forgiving though, especially air battles. You will rip your flaps off in your first realistic air battle. Overall its a fun game and its worth giving a try if you are interested in a game with serious depth that rewards good play.

Warthunder's primary appeal is the breadth of vehicles and eras of warfare it represents. There's something for just about everybody here, and working towards acquiring your favorite plane or tank can be very compelling. The game can look beautiful and is generally very impressive graphically. It performs very well on most systems. All things considered, it's fairly stable, too. If you don't care about anything modern, then the grind that comes part and parcel with Free to Play MMOs is actually very manageable. WW2-era vehicles can be reached quite quickly.

Unfortunately, Warthunder is not more than the sum of its parts. There are many great aspects of the game, but truly horrific mismanagement by the developers has sunken any and every chance for real improvement. There has been no significant overhaul to the basic team deathmatch or king-of-the-hill game modes for eight years. Gamemodes and features that used to be present, such as historical battle events or multi-hour long "Enduring Confrontations" have been scrapped despite being very popular. The entire game's lifespan is defined by feature creep weighing down a fundamentally barebone skeleton of a game and it is the source of nearly every complaint the playerbase has, from vehicle matchmaking rank, uncounterable weapons and tactics, gross imbalance from one end of the tech tree to the other, and much, much more. Community suggestions are frequently ignored, developer decision making is opaque, and every year sees more of the old-guard playerbase leave, disgruntled with the lack of meaningful progress. Looking forward, it seems likely that we will see more of what has been going on for the last four to six years - more modern kit, more premium content, and no changes to the basic formula. The developers are content to play it safe until the last whale finally moves on to greener pastures.

No, despite having played it more than any other game in my life, I do not recommend Warthunder. It can be fun with friends on voice chat, but it is not a rewarding experience and you get less out of it the longer you play. In the hands of a competent developer it could very well be a knock-out success, but as it is, it seems that competition will gradually swallow up the playerbase. IL-2 has much richer gameplay, DCS has a fantastic community and simulation depth, and World of Tanks fills a casual itch for tank combat pretty nicely. For modern tank combat, GHPC just came out of early access and is shaping up to perfectly fill the casual simulation niche Warthunder failed to exploit.

I am a 43 year old father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my son, who is now 12. My son recently started War Thunder and in less than a week, he had already played for over 20 hours. This was terrible for me, as it was already hard enough for me to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching videos on Tiktok. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing, but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought my son and I closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both my son and I many happy memories.

Don't bother. F2P game that will require more of your time than your probably already failing marriage if you're playing this game enough to actually get anywhere, even with premium and an average to slightly better than average KDA you're looking at raising your stress levels high enough to have a cardiac arrest by the time you get your next tank that is probably going to feel like a downgrade. There are issues in this game that even after 3+ years of them being known aren't fixed, if you and another tank fire at each other and say their shot lands first, doesn't kill you but takes your gunner out, your shell will more times than not just vanish into the ether leaving you cucked from that tiny bit of research towards your next downgrade. Then we'll start on the community, having played all the countries not a single one has people that are respectable, you will get a diamond in the rough but 90% of this games population are all hardcore, level 100 elitists that will push you out and use you as armour just because they want that kill you were about to shoot at. I believe there are roughly 130000 people on at peak time and more than most of them are what I said above. That also being said this game is horrible for people who are new and want to try and get into it, as soon as you leave battle rating 2.0-3.0 and start climbing all them people who are new and at your skill level will start to disappear because they know better than to get into a toxic relationship. Gaijin themselves as a company make Riot Games look competent, they're biased with the countries that get good stuff and as I said before there are issues that aren't fixed that have been known about for years. And finally, their banning system and anti cheat make it look like they don't care, if you ask Gaijin they will tell you that cheaters aren't a thing in their game because they're so far up their own prostate with the money they rake in why would they care. The shear amount of people who don't even try to hide the fact that they are cheating is insane, but they're all level 100 so they have been playing the game for a very long time, I am level 40 and I have 300 hour in the game, It'll be different for everyone obviously but that is the amount of time it has taken me to get to that level, some people are just genuinely good at this game of course but the ones that are clearly cheating and not even trying to hide it probably have close to if not 1000 or more hours in the game and they're still there unpunished.

I have spent a lot of time and money on this game over the years, but i just can't bring myself to play much anymore like I used to. The constant BR compression, the lack of updated gamemodes, and the constant addition of copy/paste nations (China is a mix of US/Russian vehicles until you get to higher BRs, as just one example), has just really killed the game for me. Yes, they keep adding cool new more modern vehicles, but the BR compression will have Cold War era, pre-missle era planes up against planes that have no defense against such missiles, WW2 era up against Vietnam Era, etc. Every now and then, you'll see them experiment with cool game modes like Enduring Confrontation which is a historic focus, large battle map and gamemode, but no matter how many posts i've seen requesting them to make it an actual gamemode, the devs dont listen. Sim battles are pretty dead as well with the constant nerfs in rewards. Basically, since I started playing way back in the Beta, the game has only become more and more PTW and the devs consistently dont listen to their community. I feel my complaints are pretty in line with most of the other negative reviews here, and they go into a lot more detail. 

In short, save yourself the time and money sink that is this game and hope someone else makes one better down the line~

Tank, an armored fighting vehicle intended as a primary offensive weapon in front-line ground combat. Tank designs are a balance of heavy firepower, strong armor, and good battlefield mobility provided by tracks and a powerful engine; usually their main armament is mounted in a turret. They are a mainstay of modern 20th and 21st century ground forces and a key part of combined arms combat.


The first tank to engage in battle, the British Mark I tank (pictured in 1916) with the Solomon camouflage scheme
A British Sherman tank in Italy during World War Two
An M4 Sherman tank in Italy in 1943 during WWII.

A Leopard 2A7 tank in Germany.
Modern tanks are versatile mobile land weapons platforms whose main armament is a large-caliber tank gun mounted in a rotating gun turret, supplemented by machine guns or other ranged weapons such as anti-tank guided missiles or rocket launchers. They have heavy vehicle armor which provides protection for the crew, the vehicle's munition storage, fuel tank and propulsion systems. The use of tracks rather than wheels provides improved operational mobility which allows the tank to overcome rugged terrain and adverse conditions such as mud and ice/snow better than wheeled vehicles, and thus be more flexibly positioned at advantageous locations on the battlefield. These features enable the tank to perform well in a variety of intense combat situations, simultaneously both offensively (with direct fire from their powerful main gun) and defensively (as fire support and defilade for friendly troops due to the near invulnerability to common infantry small arms and good resistance against most heavier weapons), all while maintaining the mobility needed to exploit changing tactical situations.[1] Fully integrating tanks into modern military forces spawned a new era of combat: armored warfare.

Until the arrival of the main battle tank, tanks were typically categorized either by weight class (light, medium, heavy or superheavy tanks) or doctrinal purpose (breakthrough-, cavalry-, infantry-, cruiser-, or reconnaissance tanks). Some being larger and very heavily armored and with large guns, while others are smaller, lightly armored, and equipped with a smaller caliber and lighter gun. These smaller tanks move over terrain with speed and agility and can perform a reconnaissance role in addition to engaging enemy targets. The smaller, faster tank would not normally engage in battle with a larger, heavily armored tank, except during a surprise flanking manoeuvre.

after around 390 hours of playing, and realising the game made me absolutely miserable because I wasn't a sweaty elite gamer, I've decided to move on with my life. Whilst planes and tanks are cool, the gameplay of being punished, instantly dying after making a minor error and not being a 42069 gaming pro and knowing all the good map spots, play styles, dogfighting, energy fighting, turn fighting....and most importantly WALLET FIGHTING.

 I unfortunately do not possess the funds to essentially buy myself wins. there is just too much negative emotion riding on a videogame, videogames should be fun, yet instead I achieve the opposite. It was fun when I was younger and excited at the prospect of working my way up with awesome historical and cool vehicles of war and means of murder, but there came a time when it turned into a grind, a much much bigger grind, and with the learning curve for new players being about as steep as the doorjamb I smacked my head into as a child, it is simply not fun to die all the time. 

Thus I shall play outside and rest easy knowing that I am not spending money on virtual tanks and planes, cause NFTs are pretty stupid, and I can instead buy myself a model plane and be infinitely happier!

Aioli Dipping Sauce:
½ cup mayonnaise
1 teaspoon finely minced garlic
½ teaspoon fresh lemon juice
2 pinches Cajun seasoning
Patties:
12 ounces salmon, minced
1 tablespoon snipped fresh chives
1 teaspoon dried parsley
1 teaspoon finely minced garlic
½ teaspoon salt
1 tablespoon all-purpose flour, or more as needed
1 lemon
cooking spray
Add ingredients to shopping list 
Local Offers
00000 Change
Oops! We cannot find any ingredients on sale near you. Do we have the correct zip code?
ADVERTISEMENT
DirectionsInstructions Checklist
Step 1
Mix mayonnaise, garlic, lemon juice, and Cajun seasoning together in a small bowl and refrigerate dipping sauce until needed.

Step 2
Place salmon, chives, parsley, garlic, and salt in a medium bowl and mix well. Add flour and mix well. Divide into 4 equal portions; mold into patties.

Step 3
Preheat air fryer to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Cut lemon into 4 slices.

Step 4
Place lemon slices into the bottom of the air fryer basket and place salmon patties on top. Lightly spray patties with cooking spray.

Step 5
Place the basket into the preheated fryer and drop the temperature to to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C).

Step 6
Cook in the air fryer until an instant-read thermometer inserted into the center of a patty reads 145 degrees F (63 degrees C), 10 to 15 minutes. Serve with sauce.

I have been playing this game for 3+ years and it has never failed to entertain me with all the stuff you can do.. . Tho the game can be a bit grindy at times its fun if you like a semi to fully realistic military sim for vehicles, such as tanks , planes, boats , and helicopters. Be warned tho that premium makes the game so much easier to progress and without it , you have that chance of having to grind for hours to maybe even a day or two for higher rank planes, and tank tech trees get really grindy with some tanks i have spent weeks of work on. but as you progress and get better it makes it easier to move to the next vehicle. Premium vehicles are helpful but not necessary , really only there if you wanna grind out a tree with minimal effort compared to no premium vehicles or premium account. Also gaijin store is the way to go if you wanna purchase anything they give fatty deals sometimes that can give you more for cheap. 

Overall this game is very fun to play and gives you something to work on if your bored , and once you get high enough you get a sense of pride from starting all the way from ww1 biplanes and early tanks all the way to pretty modern vehicles. Updates to the game are always fun and just give you more stuff to do, and events and challenges give you the oppertunity for limited edition stuff such as vehicles , decals, camos, and so forth.

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead, murdered by my brother-in-law Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a meth empire for over a year now and using me as his chemist. Shortly after my 50th birthday, Hank came to me with a rather, shocking proposition. He asked that I use my chemistry knowledge to cook methamphetamine, which he would then sell using his connections in the drug world. Connections that he made through his career with the DEA. I was... astounded, I... I always thought that Hank was a very moral man and I was... thrown, confused, but I was also particularly vulnerable at the time, something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me on a ride along, and showed me just how much money even a small meth operation could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin so I agreed. Every day, I think back at that moment with regret. I quickly realized that I was in way over my head, and Hank had a partner, a man named Gustavo Fring, a businessman. Hank essentially sold me into servitude to this man, and when I tried to quit, Fring threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn.
Eventually, Hank and Fring had a falling out. From what I can gather, Hank was always pushing for a greater share of the business, to which Fring flatly refused to give him, and things escalated. Fring was able to arrange, uh I guess I guess you call it a "hit" on my brother-in-law, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured, and I wound up paying his medical bills which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge, working with a man named Hector Salamanca, he plotted to kill Fring, and did so. In fact, the bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen in the ranks to become the head of the Albuquerque DEA, and about that time, to keep me in line, he took my children from me. For 3 months he kept them. My wife, who up until that point, had no idea of my criminal activities, was horrified to learn what I had done, why Hank had taken our children. We were scared. I was in Hell, I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, to end this nightmare, and in response, he gave me this. I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. I... All I could think to do was to make this video in hope that the world will finally see this man, for what he really is

The Industrial Revolution and its consequences have been a disaster for the human race. They have greatly increased the life-expectancy of those of us who live in “advanced” countries, but they have destabilized society, have made life unfulfilling, have subjected human beings to indignities, have led to widespread psychological suffering (in the Third World to physical suffering as well) and have inflicted severe damage on the natural world. The continued development of technology will worsen the situation. It will certainly subject human beings to greater indignities and inflict greater damage on the natural world, it will probably lead to greater social disruption and psychological suffering, and it may lead to increased physical suffering even in “advanced” countries.

The industrial-technological system may survive or it may break down. If it survives, it MAY eventually achieve a low level of physical and psychological suffering, but only after passing through a long and very painful period of adjustment and only at the cost of permanently reducing human beings and many other living organisms to engineered products and mere cogs in the social machine. Furthermore, if the system survives, the consequences will be inevitable: There is no way of reforming or modifying the system so as to prevent it from depriving people of dignity and autonomy.
In this article we give attention to only some of the negative developments that have grown out of the industrial-technological system. Other such developments we mention only briefly or ignore altogether. This does not mean that we regard these other developments as unimportant. For practical reasons we have to confine our discussion to areas that have received insufficient public attention or in which we have something new to say. For example, since there are well-developed environmental and wilderness movements, we have written very little about environmental degradation or the destruction of wild nature, even though we consider these to be highly important.

You need a premium account if you dont want to get a stroke from the game (makes you earn more xp and money).

The economics is the first thing that bends my brain into a knot. I have managed to grind my first jet out, but I haven't choosen the best one to dogfight (because there is no point to fly a plane in this game except to go dogfight with it lol), so now I rarely get a kill with it, so I loose money constantly. Doesn't matter that I grinded out the second jet, I don't have the money to buy it. You have to pay if you go to a battle with a vehicle, you have to pay for the ammo, and you have to pay for the repair. In what air force does the pilot pay for the upkeep? I just want to flight and fight, but no, I have to play Mr. Air Force Manager here.
I'm usually okay to pay for some things in free to play games, but I'm not okay with pay to win systems. A jet is 60 EUR/USD, just like a full AAA game. If you start off by buying one, you can grind a whole tech tree with it in no time. With a free account it is just painful to grind and takes forever.

And there are other things like visual bugs, hits that should destroy a vehicle but do nothing, Battle Rating TM compression, crap maps/gamemodes(domination)/gamesettings(ground games are so short imo), stupid ai (bot planes always flies into a hill right after I decide to engage one, and in pve modes 100% hit accuracy), research modules for field repair and to kill a fire, etc.

To start: This game is horribly balanced and doesnt really have anything to keep people playing.

The ability to pick your own nation in so incredibly pointless because only one is actually worth taking. The devs focus most of their resources onto developing new Russian vehicles, this would be fine if they were balanced but they aren't. Some Russian tanks (T-34 for example) have way too much armour for their BR (Battle Rank) and class, I was in a 100mm Italian tank destroyer and could not pierce its front armour at all, this makes no sense.

The main tank game modes are Arcade Battle and Realistic Battle, both of these are boring after a few hours. Arcade and Realistic battles are the same in that you have to take certain points and destroy enemy tanks but they differ in what is given like player locations. The battle types boil down to a death match, they are not fun.

Penetration system is awful, you have to hit tanks in specific places to even pierce them and even then, you probably wont kill them. It is also incredibly easy to get shot, lose your gunner and then die because you cant defend yourself.

Do you want to progress in this game and get modern tanks? Expect 50 hours minimum to even get close and even then, it isn't fun because certain things are massively overpowered.

This game can be fun at Rank 1 but it just gets progressively worse over time.

Iv Been a big fan of World of Tanks (WOT) for the last 8+ years and other than both these games having tanks in them you can realy compare them fairly, there to different.
over the years iv installed War Thunder to play 1 or 2 games to promptly uninstall it again, after repeating this a dozen or 2 times........ i started to get a little bored of WOT not disliking just bored of the same tanks game so i forced my way through annoyance and pain of a new player.
i realy liked the graphics style of War Thunder and with the Different and more modern tanks available to try out i forced my way past the pain of not knowing what the FKK i was doing other then drive for 5 mins to just get 1 shot to WTF just happen there!!!!.
Arcade mode is completly weird and i dont think it should be in the game at all. still to this day dont understand the spotting mechanics or all the extra crap you get att the bottom of the screeen. aslo all tanks feel like go carts so anything i say about the game is strictly Realistic battles as learning how to play the game in just realistic battles made me learn what i needed early on and relativly quickly.
Battle Rating 1-5 is complete dog ass. low tiers are like low tiers in WOT....... you aint using the META seal clubbing tank and you have a brand new crew (crews matter more in this game and i like how theyv done it, kinda) new players get crapped on by players who have thousands of hours in the game just to shit on new scrubs like me so they can feel good getting some kills.
Battle rating starts getting ok after around 6. personally 8-9 feels best so far for me. feels like tier 9 MM in wot.
In my Opinion this game is unplayable Full Free to Play.. the first few days of this play through wereee sooo painfully slow playing with bad stock tanks. just buy premium time its fine. if you have everything you want unlocked i can see F2P gameplay easily done though. its just grinding F2P is not fun at all.
i Did buy pixels for 9.7 Premium tank after i found some fun in the game when i was around BR 5-6 ish in 1 tank. ignore what people say that high tiers are to hard or full of sweat lords etc, thats not true it helped me learn the game quicker. helps me grind points and silver and overall i do much better in my prem tank (Challenger DS) love this tanks play style.
the real issue is alot of games you team dies and leaves the game. when the other team either has backups(that cost real money ) or another similar tiered tank to replace it. this is an issue of the game imo.

Overall Learning tank weak spots Followed with Learning crew/ammo rack locations for those sweeeeet 1 shots is extremly satisfying

Being able to use your jet/plane after something as simple as an early cap is EXTREMELY toxic as 90% of the People you kill will spawn in a plane and try bomb you or die trying. this is by far the worst part of the game you kill someone they see a kill cam of your exackt position then they go the revenge kill right after............ if anything needs changing in the game its that. 2 kills or 1 kill 1 cap then you get enough spawn points for a place. Give players 1 free backup a game to encourage TANK gameplay in the Tank Game mode not bombing revenge sim.

This game is overall a decent game, don't get me wrong. It just has an impressive amount of Pay to Win mechanics that greatly encourage you to spend money if you want to have any fun. Skill will always triumph over all else but whether you have god-like skill or not, the lengths that this game goes to make you try to support them financially is kind of baffling.

Now I understand that a Free to Play game has to make money somewhere. I'm totally fine with that, but you'd expect there to be some sort of balance in a competitive game even if there are some P2W mechanics. In my opinion, this game doesn't really do much to balance things. The game has a vague attempt at balancing with 'Battle Rating', but it only accounts for the vehicles themselves, not any of the upgrades the vehicles or crew have, nor the amount of 'lives' a player has. Here's a list of things that I would consider P2W:

-You only have as many 'lives' as you have crew slots/vehicles. By default you have 2 & it isn't hard to upgrade the slots to 5 with free currency. To unlock past 5 you need to pay real money, effectively limiting a players lives to 5 if they don't pay. Buying slots doesn't always mean you have vehicles to use in those slots either, so you also have to grind with the meager starting vehicles to unlock more (or pay for vehicles to fill those slots). After this you can play a match & effectively have more than 2 lives. If you pay real money, you can also respawn with a vehicle that has been blown up when normally it's removed from your roster for the remainder of the match.

-Each crew slot has individual stats that need leveling up in order to operate vehicles better. This means faster reloading, aiming, driving, more health, etc. The XP to upgrade them is gained very slowly & the cost for upgrades is substantial. If you simply pay however, you can immediately upgrade all your crew to reload faster & withstand more damage. You'll have to do this individually for every crew slot for every faction too.

-Despite being "just cosmetic" the cosmetics in this game I would consider on the P2W spectrum. While obviously a type of camouflage will not work on every map, it still gives a sizable advantage when used in the proper environment. You can buy said camouflage paintjobs to increase your odds that you'll get the first shot before they notice you. You can even buy various bush & plant coverings so that you can ghillie up & blend into the foliage to become even harder to see.

-If you want to play with anything more modern than WW2 stuff, you'll have to grind for ages before you see any of it. Or just pay your way into playing with modern vehicles of course. Not that the WW2 stuff is bad, it would just be nice to be able to hop into matches with newer gear without having to grind or pay.

Of course Pay to Win mechanics like these aren't the end of the world. The arcade game modes alleviate some of these issues but they will always be there, especially if you'd rather play the realism modes that give much more XP & currency. It's very easy to see P2W in action when you look at the scoreboard & see top players that have died over 7-8 times, when you can only die a few times before you're knocked out of the game entirely due to lack of crew slots & vehicles.

You can grind for free to slowly unlock new vehicles, but you'll never be able to use the dozens of 'premium' vehicles that cost real money if you don't pay. The whole time you're grinding, you're often going up against the people who have either played hundreds more hours than you and/or payed hundreds more dollars than you. Having better skill after hundreds of hours is one thing but just being objectively, mechanically stronger than newer/poorer players after playing & paying is silly to me.

It honestly reminds me of Escape From Tarkov a little bit. You can be thrown into a match & be completely & utterly outclassed in every way & there's nothing you can do about it but keep grinding, hoping you get put into matches with people that are actually similar to your level. I will commend this game for having relatively quick matches though, unlike Tarkov. It's usually very quick to get into a new game after being kicked to the main menu for dying.

Since it is Free to Play, it still might be worth a shot if you want to bash tanks, planes & boats together. I'd only recommend trying it however if you're patient & not an impulsive spender... or you're rich & can just buy everything. I mean if you're rich & bored, this game is definitely for you. You will very likely destroy anyone else who hasn't payed as much as you have & that'll probably be pretty fun, I won't lie.

Gaijin Entertainment has made yet another masterpiece in the game War Thunder. Along with being free it is playable on almost all platforms and it doesn't really matter if your computer is a potato that gave birth to a lemon the game will run just fine. The physics in the game like bullet speed and drop and how the vehicles can interact with the environment makes the game extremely special in my opinion. also the limited number of game modes means that the lobby's are always full and the wait times aren't that long. The tech tree makes sure that everyone can play whatever vehicle they want and the decals make the vehicles so much better. All in all there shouldn't be any complaints about this game seeing how it is completely free.
If you want to spiral into the darkest place you will ever be in your entire life this game is right for you.

War thunder is pretty much the undisputed champion of vehicular combat games. It's a punchy, kinetic and easy-to-learn hard-to-master system that's just as fun in scenarios of both terrestrial and airborne warfare.

Pros: Game play is fun and engaging. Low tiers are always a joy to play. I usually play arcade for aircraft and realistic for tanks. Realistic aircraft is challenging but rewarding. Get some friends together and have an absolute ball whether it be serious or just screwing around. Not near as pay to win as WoT.

Cons: Game is very grind heavy. A premium account and/or premium vehicles are almost a necessity for grinding mid to high tiers in a timely manner.

The Combat Flight sim of Combat Flight sims. The level of detail and depth of mechanics is fantastic. The WW2 warbirds have such attention to detail in them.
Things I love
The sound of the engines, no cheap looping recording, it always sounds organic from full throat throttle on chase to coming in for landing with the exhaust after firing (which no other flight sim has ever done as far as I know)
The attention to detail on damage. It's not just bullet hole decals painted on your plane, seemingly every panel, every piece, every spar every rib has it's own states. I got shot from behind in a chase with another player, that bullet hit my cockpit armor and spit through the glass, knocking out the wiring for the tech gauge on my dash which caused the automatic pitch control to struggle to maintain RPM. In the battle log it actually said " Tachometer has poor connection ".
I crash landed during a battle of Britain sim and when my pilot hopped out, I realised I was able to walk around the plane and inspect it and it looked like a virtual image of those historic crash landings you see in documentaries, the engine cover popped off one side, landing gear had a flat tire ripped off the rim on the other and bullet holes ran all through the controls and engine cowling.

The things I don't like? 
It's really hard to convince friends that this game is worth the money as it doesn't have an online progress tree or rewards or loot boxes or unlocks, the reward is the content and finding ways to apply it. If you have friends who are hesitating or you yourself are, I say get the free content and play through the tutorials. It'll take a while to get your controls right and figure out the physics but once you do it's great, then you can move from the free content to some paid goodies like the spitfire, channel map and WW2 assets.

[b] This review is for those who want to play tanks. [/b]

Addictive and painful. With the promise of being free to play but not to progress. 

Where players who don't have premiums are constantly low on silver lions (games currency) and research points (what lets you progress in the tech tree). A game that rewards lazy and unfair tactics such as dropping bombs in spawn instantly killing you and punishing you by making you pay for the repair cost of your tank in the games dwindling economy and often nerfed reward system. Or gluing foliage to your tank spanning from every corner and climate of the world (only yours for a couple euros)  

Gaijin as a company has proved they put monetary greed over balancing with battle pass vehicles out performing others and then later having their battle rating increased when sales have gone down. 
In the balancing department things still aren't looking good because you will find yourself 5 times out of 6 fighting an enemy that is a BR higher than you, This is known as being uptiered and is a word you will say in the beginning of nearly all matches. 

So here we have a game that rewards unfair gameplay where majority of deaths are to things you had no way of fighting against. A game that actively makes progress harder and harder, and a player base that cant go 20 seconds without saying a slur. Then why do people play this game?

Because on a really good day where those things above don't happen as much this game has one of the if not the best and unique gameplay a tank game can have. There is currently no game that offers the type of gameplay like War Thunder does. And if you are a fan of tanks this is really the only option. 

If you are a fan of tanks and want to play this game make sure to bring friends that you can squad up with, because when playing together you can have one of the best tanking experiences out there. But if you dont have that then I can't recommend this game.

And if you made it all the way down here thank you for reading and [i] happy hunting! [/i]

The game is breathtaking when you're in the air, soaring over mountain valleys or Pacific atolls. Just taking a plane up through the clouds, where the world beyond your wingtips vanishes into fog while condensation whips over the canopy, gives way to the most extraordinary joy and elation when you burst into the clear blue sky. It feels like I'm really up there at the controls of a plane, playing among the peaks and valleys of a cloud formation.

More important, War Thunder's air combat is simply some of the best and most intense I've ever experienced. World of Warplanes doesn't come close; its planes are too confined by the game's simple physics. It's a shooter where your avatar is a plane. In War Thunder, I always feel like I'm actually in the cockpit, and every kill is a story to tell.

Unbalanced, pay-to-win ****fest that doesn't get better the higher you get. Firstly, AA tanks are basically twice as effective at destroying tanks than light or medium tanks most of the time. So imagine being in a Medium tank with around 40mm of armour protecting your snug crew, then peek-a-boo your tank is ammo exploded from the first bullet of the enemy AA trucks volley... fun am i right... Secondly, they might as well remove BR (battle rankings) because unless its top tier tanks with their almost equally powerful guns, lower tiers (1-3) is basically German Supremacy, their 'same BR' tanks easily wreck your tank while their crew go full Neo and dodge EVERY fragment that peppers the inside of their tank, 15% of the time however you will actually one shot a German tank and be honestly surprised. But overall if AA tanks and trucks outclassing most tanks of their tier is what you want then go ahead, i'm already in this toxic as hell relationship with the game, almost as toxic as LOL is to be honest. if you look online your see a WHOLE LOT of evidence to support that the game is just a mess overall, but you know, tank go boom i guess.

War Thunder. It's almost fun.

This game has a lot to offer but its Ground Realistic Battles are really fun/challenging if you've got the grit to get through the steep learning curve it really pays off. This game most closely mimics how I expect actual mechanized combat to be more so than anything Ive seen yet though and is still fun to play at the same time.

The WWII stuff in particular looks and plays strategically exactly how WWII tank engagements often went. Only its not a game mechanic they force on us, its simply the by product of all the vehicles in the game performing close to how they actual perform in real life. Its really fascinating to watch happen and if, like me, you don't have the time to grind new vehicles with your friends, you can use the #money cheat to give yourself enough help to keep up. 

It feels weird saying in game purchases are a good thing but they've definitely kept me engaged with this one.

I have been playing this game for a few years, went from playing on PS4 to PC, and the biggest issue with this game has to be the BR compression, especially in ground battles. The developers say it was done to help find games faster, and that you won't end up fighting tanks that you can't kill, which is definitely not true when you end up sitting in your neat little BR 2.0 tank and you have to fight a KW-2 because Gaijin just seems to 'forget' this rule when premium tanks are involved. 

Sure, the game CAN be fun, but only if you are someone who gets lucky not having to constantly deal with the bad results of the BR compression, or if you spend money on premium tanks.

Avoid this game! There is no fun factor and despite it being free the only real method of progressing efficiently is by buying their premium subscription. Mind you this subscription does not include the battle pass. Additionally it will literally take you years just to finish 1 tech tree. On average if you would play this game with premium it would take 8 years to unlock everything. I would like to mention the fact that their in game economics has failed to allow a fair amount of rewards and is overly complicated. Furthermore, there is a limited set of battle modes that scales vehicles of different eras and of completely different purposes together. This creates biased matches where you are at a disadvantage and almost forced to loose. There is nothing positive about this game aside from getting to see some of your favorite WW2 era vehicles in action. The community is mixed but with so many senior players and no method of separation between those trying to learn and those being competitive there tends be a very toxic environment (especially within matches). So, I say once more. Avoid this game.

Alright look, it's got all the usual things that come with free to play gaming.  Multiple imaginary currencies, cash stores, battle pass, premium, multiple tech trees with days-long grinds that can be easily bypassed for some more of your money.  But it's also got something that you can't get anywhere else.  It's hands down the most realistic representation of historical vehicular combat available to play.  The vehicles, the damage models, the ballistics are all presented with a very clear focus on accounting for as many of the real world variables as possible and including them in the simulation.  Despite the F2P spectre, it remains fun at every level, making the grind quite a bit more tolerable than average, and sometimes leading me to go back and play at lower levels just for the fun of experiencing the variety of vehicles.  I highly recommend to anyone who enjoys aircraft, boat, or tank fighting.  Especially WW2 era, 'cause unless you're paying, that's where you're gonna be for a good while.

You play this game because either you are a ww2 fanatic or enjoy a long grind. The amount of fun you can have at lower tiers  is insane with fun maneuvers, quick fast action, and genuine satisfaction once you learn a thing or two about how your tank, ship, or plane work to the best of its abilities. HOWEVER that is where the fun ends, you are not going to be able to use the Abrams, the Leopard, the IS-3, any kind of jet, or a good high quality ship/air craft carrier anytime soon when you play the game. The creators of this game could easily fix this grind-fest conundrum by implementing the sparsely used used 'folder' mechanic. Additionally with the desecration of the simulator mode where it is a shell of it's former self this game is more of a 'play for an hour every four months' before you quickly realize why you stopped playing in the first place.  Either way if you play this game, enjoy it extremely casually for you will break either your mind or your surroundings.

This title "Yamato-Tamashi" means the soul of Japan nation. This special phrase refers to the inherent courage and brutality of the Japanese nation, and the spirit of loyalty to the Mikado -- the emperor of Japan. Release this title on September 3rd hurts not only Chinese people, but also other victims of Japanese militarism. This day should be the day that all people from countries which win Asia-Pacific War. But here in warthunder, you guys release a in-game title that contains a fascist & militaristic character. This behavior already broke your own rules like Warthunder rules 1.1.18 & 1.1.21. .This issue  already  make a huge boycott in Chinese community. To prevent this thing become an international political scandal，to show your empathy of all people and nations who  suffered under fascism during WWII， I believe Gaijin will make a wisdom decision -- withdraw the title "Yamato-Tamashi".

Разнообразие карт тоже деградировало. Раньше выпадали разные карты, сейчас на определенном ранге - определенные карты. И по итогу, играешь на 3-4 картах, вместо 20+.

TL;DR - Don't try it,  not even once.  You won't be able to stop yourself 

======================================================

Its like an abusive relation ship,  and you are the child.  Mom is an abusive crack whore, addicted to anything she can get her hands on, most of which she gets from you.  The only way to afford the addiction is through Micro-transactions fueled by unbalanced premium vehicles that cost exorbitant amounts and will stay unbalanced for months to drive up sales, after which it will be nerfed into oblivion so they can say, "Oh its worse then the one you can get for free, the game isnt pay to win!".  

The father is distant, uncaring and cold,  allowing the mother to do as she pleases.  He only steps in to fix the smallest, and least of the issues that the mother creates.  Sometimes he balances things correctly, but never having the confidence, wherewithal or intrest in fixing the big issues, or better yet, leaving the relationship.  

But the worst part of the game is the niche it fills,  There is no other game on the market that scratches this itch, no relief from the want to play it.  You know its horrendously unbalanced, and that the problems are so abhorrent that you can see them even though you haven't played the game in years, but it keeps calling.  

Louder and louder,  The new vehicles like a siren's call, beckoning you, slowly.  In your moment of weakness, you give in, you download it.  You play it with the promise of "I wont buy anything this time" or, "Ill just avoid the microtransactions this time around".

But you see, they always get you.

A Battlepass that only costs 500 GE.  Ehh I shouldn't, I made a pro- wait that's an obviously broken vehicle that will only be accessible for the next month, and its only 500 GE to unlock it without having to do the battle pass? Oh but there isnt a 500 GE option.  Oooh but 1000 GE is only $6.60 might as well.  Oh wait if i get 5000 ill save 25%.  

Its a vicious cycle.  It happens every time without a doubt.  Maybe I'm weak willed, but the issue stems more from Gaijin using predatory business practices on their customers.  Statistically there are at least 10-20 Thousand others just like me that play this game.  They'll continue to make the game how they always have

Predatory and abusive.  
Refusing to fix the bug riddled mess.  
Refusing to acknowledge the atrocities they've created.  
Refusing to fix a system they created, and blaming the vehicles that they cant balance, instead of the way they've designed the system.  
Setting repair costs on problematic vehicles astronomically high to stop people playing them,  and if that doesn't work, removing the vehicle almost entirely. 

For your own good, don't.  Its a siren's call.  Play something else.  Maybe if they fix it, maybe if they decompress BR's, just maybe i'll suggest you play it.  But for your own good, and the good of the game aswell.  Dont give Gaijin your money. 

Even as I write this,  agitating old wounds,  uncovering memories of the past.  I want to play it.  Don't play this game, for your own good

Incredibly realistic graphics and amazing damage models - instead of WoT, etc, the game has independent modules that take damage independent of eachother. You can detonate ammo racks, have all your crew members killed, or be burnt down from an engine fire (among many other ways to respawn). Extremely fun to practice aim and Hand/Eye coordination, especially with this games beautiful graphics. The only issue is the grind, and my goodness is it an issue. I've been playing for quite a while without spending a dime, and I'm not even at mid-war tanks (in any nation, of which there are quite a few), let alone the MBTs and helicopters the game advertises. While I do recommend it, the game requires commitment, or if you don't want to wait, it'll cost you a pretty penny. Happy flying!

This is my first review on any game on steam, and I have quite a bit of games and history on this platform. To be honestly speaking, It's quite a good game on graphical and gameplay. But, I would and you should not play this game unless your a 24/7 no shower shit in room tryhard grinder addict to this game, as I have seen someone exactly like that, spent his entire life grinding this game and spending hundreds on this game. 

For people who are new to this game, basically you can fight as any vehicle/plane/ship you want. Twist is, you have to grind so hard and spend just to unlock the thing you want. The top tier modern tech will likely take you 1-2 years to get. Unlocking vehicles isn't like other games, waiting it out or spending ingame points and immediately get it. In this game you have to grind and kill other players to unlock research points and etc, which you get barely any. To get alot of research points, you will have to play realism mode. Which will take you at least 5 or 10 minutes to actually meet up with the enemy and you get killed the first second you enter the battlefield, no matter how ready you are, unless you are a literal tryhard who has enhanced vision in spotting camouflaged tanks or planes, you also die permanently no respawn. Even if you can get one or two kills, the vehicle or plane you want to unlock requires, for example 1000 research points or silverlions/etc, one kill might get you 10 or 50. In arcade, you spawn right in the middle of the battlefield, and you can respawn and fight again, it's also quite easy and you can get so many kills. At this rate still, maybe you can get 1 research point per kill, ONE POINT (literally dogwater). I have played this game myself, Some fans of this game might call me shit or criticising it too much, but this is my honest opinion. It is a turn away for so many new players unless you are really interested in this shit.

Progression is extremely slow and tedious (even for low ranks)
matchmaking is so bad that it almost feels like it's rigged to make you lose no matter how hard you try

it's a typical gaijin game.

Edit: I have started playing world of tanks and despite that game being grindy as well, it is a FAR more generous game in regards to progression speed. the game also gives more quite a bit of free stuff every now and then. you can also gain and use free xp for FREE (no paying gold unless you are converting xp from an elite tank).

you still have to pay for ammo and tank repairs but you usually end up with alot more money compared to warthunder.

also for those who like in game purchases. premium currency in world of tanks is cheaper compared to warthunder.

Interesting game, but the menus are a complete mess and progression is poorly explained. Specifically "research" is not explained what so ever or how to get it, nor is why you're constantly asked to buy "crew", and what they do is never explained, and much more. Additionally, it feels like a flying straight simulator for a good while until you actually get into range in which the fast TTK can result in you having to take the long trek back into the fight from spawn again if the mode even lets you. It does seem like you can upgrade speed to eliminate this problem but you will require a significant amount of this mysterious "research", or you'll just have to open your wallet and pay premium currency.

The game presents itself very similarly to a mobile game with numerous pop-ups on the menu screen, multiple currencies which go unexplained, seemingly game-play affecting real money purchases, and a premium currency as well. It's a fun game, but with the interface in such a sorry state, and so much going unexplained I can only leave this as not recommended.

Its Pay to Win, But if you stay on the lower side of the BP you will do well and have fun. Just watch some videos to help you understand how the battle UI works or you might get angry your tank/planes get oneshot. If you do want to play higher matches i recommend you get premium because you will get to a point where your stuff cost more to repair then what you get from a match. Bring a friend and get rewards! Along with special limited time events with rewards. War Thunder also has a market place where you can trade rare Rides, and if you're lucky you can get a discount coopons in your daily openings. Also WARNING not all planes/tanks/helis/ boats are good. Even if they are bought. You might be a victum of nerfs that may or may not have effected it playablility in battle. Also don't play arcade, you will thank me later.

I would not recommend playing this game, it's very grindy and pay to win. 

here's a comparison and my reason for not recommending it:

let's compare this PvP game to another PvP game that you actually pay for, Tekken 7 is a game that you pay for but it goes on sale a lot of the time; Tekken 7's base game (without DLC) has 36 characters and 23 stages which are unlocked to you from the get go, the DLC also adds 15 additional characters and 6 stages making it to 51 characters and 29 stages, not only that but there's also another DLC which unlocks a whole new offline game mode bowling mini game (if you're interested in Tekken 7 then I'd recommend buying the game and all the season passes since the season passes also contain some new skins) and not only that but most of the cosmetics/skins can be unlocked through an offline fast mini game and you cannot buy them. you can also play Tekken offline with friends and it has a single-player.

now how about War Thunder? it's a "free" to play game, all of the tanks, planes, ships, etc. are in the base game but you have to heavily grind to unlock them or you can just buy them with real-life money, the skins, well, there aren't any skins for the vehicles. well, then, how's the DLC besides buying the vehicles? there's none really, there's the OST which costs money (I don't mind that) and there's high res texture packs which are free, there's no additional game modes, mini games, etc. the game also has a very hard to follow crafting and fixing system which confuses me. the game is always online and there's no single-player. I would not recommend playing this game because it's grindy, pay to win and the DLC offers nothing.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Possibly the greatest free-to-play game ever created if it is a game you enjoy... Started on PS, moved to the application version then just switched over to steam because its easier (so lets just say I wish it was only 80 hours spent). 

It is a very unique game, definitely not a game everyone will enjoy. There are different aspects that may appeal to different people, for example I pretty much exclusively play using air planes and on realistic mode (not arcade, not simulator). That is the real appeal of this game for me. Some others may enjoy playing air planes but only on simulator battles which are just too difficult for my liking, however I think if you aren't able to get into realistic mode and only stick to arcade the game becomes boring pretty quickly. Maybe some people would disagree with that though it's just my opinion. Then there is also boats and tanks which some people only play on those modes as well. I am sure someone out there mixes it up and plays different vehicle types.. The main point I am trying to make is that there is a little bit for a lot of different people, but not for everyone. I find ww2, planes, and flying all fascinating subjects which makes it an appealing game for me. 

You can play the game 100% free or you can spend money on things to make the game much easier. I have never spent a dime - at times you definitely feel a bit of a grind type of game play especially as you get into higher tiered vehicles. This both makes the game awesome by giving a real sense of achieving something when you unlock something, but can also be discouraging when you spend all this time and seems like you're not getting any closer. This can be avoided by spending money on a premium account or by purchasing better vehicles only available for purchasing. I feel as though those people are losing out on the greater fun of the game - and I don't feel that greatly disadvantaged by the other players using the pay to play planes. You can gain a much larger advantage just by becoming more skill-full at the game. So if you are turned off by the fact someone with a pay-to-plane just killed you I wouldn't be too discouraged. As you get better at the game you will start to take down players with paid planes (or other vehicles). I also really like that these developers still create new content/updates for the game even though it is not new. Sure you can criticise some of it (I am not crazy about the new Israeli air plane tree) but overall i have more respect that they keep adding to it

I do not enjoy war thunder, it has predatory monetisation that leaves you with the feeling that unless you spend money on research or silver lions ( ingame currency) and premium you aren't going anywhere and aren't achieving any actual progression, the game has several issues with balancing and leaves you in higher ranks unexpectedly leading to games where you get stomped just because you have worse equipment. 
However the actual combat can be very fun and enjoyable with the planes and jets feeling fantastic to control, the planes especially are incredibly fun to play around with however actually getting them can be so grindy that the only option is to either play 10 hours a day to unlock 1 new thing or pay your way through.

Entire game feels like its been made to rinse as much money out of the player as possible

This game is great if you love propeller aircraft or ww2 era tanks (Tiger, sherman, t-34 type stuff), but if you came to play modern tanks (abrams, t-72, leo 2) and planes TURN AWAY. The shiny F-14 at the end of the US tech tree will take you MONTHS of DAILY grinding for hours to get, even after you bring out your wallet and throw your money at gaijin to ease the grind (more than 2-3 tripleA games worth). This game is really fun if you play the early vehicles because the grind isn't a full time job, if you go past rank 5 you WILL be spending weeks grinding for each vehicle (longer if you aren't playing 40+ hours a week). This game has become a sad cash cow in recent years with the makers just increasing the grind constantly, if you want to unlock every vehicle in the game it will take you multiple years (not a joke), and thousands of dollars. DO NOT GRIND THIS GAME FOR THE MODERN VEHICLES (imo their not even much fun because of broken gameplay)

War Thunder is a game with high highs and low lows. Some days you will get 13 kills and feel like a pro, other days you will have the worst matches and question your sanity. Most days you will be average.

Tips :

  Play arcade battles as a sort-of "introduction". Angle your armor and stay above your opponents to lessen the headache. This game has an awful grind that can be aided by money. don't expect to be to top-tier in 6 months. I have 200 hours and I'm only at 6.0. DON'T BUY THE CREW SLOTS!!! I made this mistake early on in 'Merica and now all 5 of my slots are so much lower than 3 could have been. Turn off free repairs, you will save SL by doing so and have an excuse to do something else for the 2-3 days for repairs(higher tiers). Low tier is fun tier. Find a low tier vehicle that you can A: have fun with and take a brak from higher tiers for a bit with and B: (if you're very poor like me) can use to make a steady source of money with( 3.7 Russia can give like 12k for good games and for MVP matches up to 32k). Rush the Helicopters as they (as of now) are the absolute best way to get SL.  HFGL.

STRONGLY do-not-recommend until:
- Match balancing is immediately implemented (Top tier players constantly annihilate new players trying to learn the game and prevent the new players from gaining the experience and modification points to advance to better vehicles (or limit that advancement to nothing).)

- Fix new matching (e.g. Ground) where "green" (max dmg) shots are 95% "No damage" while the bots one-shot you.

Game play:  2 of 10

Overall it looks like a great game, but once you have more than a few matches, you realize the game is extremely unbalanced ... has been for years (hundreds of posts) and zero care or help from the owners/devs.  To me, this is very depressing because for the first 25-30 matches, I was really getting into this game ... but it is blatantly designed to force new players to accept their role as whackamole, without exception.

Note:  This is MY review, not yours.  If you don't like it, you know where to go, and post your own.

This game is fantastic.. at lightening your wallet. In tanks, you will be shot by a round from a mile away that barely scrapes the ground, passes through a window, goes through an entire field of high grass and brush, scrapes the ground again, and somehow finds your tank in a completely vulnerable spot, without you ever seeing the enemy.

In planes, you'll watch someone going straight, line up on their tail, and watch them lag in 7 different directions before pulling off unscathed. 

When the game plays correctly, it's fantastic. When it plays like it usually does, it's like banging your head against the wall until your ears start to bleed.

After getting past your first 4-6 hours, the games a blast.  For anybody who enjoys grinding games, you'll never run out of stuff to work on in War thunder. Whether it be the massive list of vehicles and upgrades available throughout tons of country's and different uses, or the massive skill ceiling, there's always more to do. This is truly a game you can grind for the next 5 years and still have more to accomplish, which not many games can claim. If you enjoy grinding through games, and have the patience to get past the first through hours of learning the basics and unlocking enough to have a proper game, you'll love it.

War Thunder is a good example of how the business model can ruin an otherwise good videogame.
It's well known at this point that the grinding in this game is almost unmatched. No amount of patience can save you from considering dropping the game at least once. Given that, you'd at least expect the matches to be short and/or fun. Unfortunately, this game is at least in part pay-to-win. Matches are often frustrating, not least because of the realistic damage system, which will sometimes turn your tank into another piece of map cover from a single shot sent from across the map. Given that, progression in this game ends up being slow and often painful.
The game is also extremely unfriendly to new players. I had the luck of starting the game alongside a friend who was more experienced, but that won't be the case for many people. It almost feels like Gaijin doesn't care that much about new players, since most of the newer updates introduce mostly late-game content.

On the other hand, the number of vehicles and the range of customization is admirable. The game is also gorgeous, and, aside from the glitches and such, provides an immersive simulation.
I'm sorry to say that's not enough to outweigh the cons, however.

The game itself is good. BUT

The business model is predatory and hidden pay2play. Once you have grinded yourself through the first few tanks you will notice that the economy is designed in such a way that you will mostly break even with your repair spending compared to what you earn in free currency for a game. So if you want to progress you are more or less forced to buy premium to earn just enough extra bonus currency to progress in a meaningful way. 

This issue gets worse since you cant skip vehicles by just researching them, no you also have to buy them, even if you dont want to play them! Also your performance is not measured by active combat but by getting killshots. In combination with the fact that aircraft can bomb you at the spawn and that aircraft spawns themselves are broken means that you can play 15mins completely present and to the best of your abilities but you leave the game not only with 0 currency but you can actively lose crowns by having a bad game which will then undo 30mins of normal gaming. 

All to push that stupid premium.

update: so many bugs just uninstalled couldn't play this broken game any longer. I've heard people say this is a skill based game couldn't be further from the truth. My first ground realistic battle I went 6-1 without playing any tank games previously. This game is not skill based, the only factor in winning is picking the German or Russian faction or a premium vehicle. Experienced so many bugs (visual and gameplay). Invisible walls which will make your tank slow down or car stop, walls that will reappear after you destroy them preventing you from seeing through them but your enemies will be able to see through, played vs A.I. one game and a bot in a BT7 one shot me through 4 bushes and a hill without ever seeing me (not a bug but the A.I. needs a lot of reworking, they either shoot into the aim and completely miss or shoot you through the landscape without ever seeing you). SO MANY lag spikes down to 10-20fps (playing on movie settings but there shouldnt be any lag spikes with a good gpu, 32gb ram, and nothing running besides the game!) ABSOLUTELY wouldn't recommend this game to anyone.

Don't let the meticulously developed ballistic modeling fool you, there are plenty of short comings with the game. More importantly, though is the player base.

There are 2 types of players in WT. Those who cover each other with lanes of fire and smoke concealment, help repair and/or tow damaged vehicles, who call out seen enemies, and coordinate activities. There are also those who grief - push your vehicle into practically inescapable ravines and chasms leaving you to sit the match out, endanger others by requesting help,  or lose the vehicle to rejoin the match, incessantly shoot the back of your vehicle with their machine guns preventing you from hearing or seeing, and spam the same message over the radio with as much speed and frequency as they can. The former is always the enemy team, who will surround you and shoot you from at least 8 different directions at once, while every single member of your team, the later, will be up in the air (in a ground battle) but providing no support or recon until all of your ground vehicles are dead. If at any point you try to help out in a battle, the enemy will immediately cease firing the shots they took the time to line up on your useless team mate and turn around to 180 no scope one shot you.
In a mode called assault arcade, they will all shoot at the frontal armor of a single vehicle for minutes on end that none of their guns can penetrate, declining to take a few seconds to flank and make a useful shot,  while ignoring 20 other vehicles capturing the point your supposed to be guarding. All of those 20 vehicles will aim and fire at you from the very second they spawn in and they can see through concealment and cover.

As with any Gaijin game, it's extremely unpleasantly grindy, but at least here you advance tech by national army, whereas in Enlisted you advance tech by theater, meaning that as they expand that game, you'll have to do the same research for the same army multiple times.

If you want a better ground vehicle experience, use Gunner Heat PC, or Steel Beasts. For air, DCS or Falcon BMS is better. For generic combined arms OFP / ARMA / VBS is king, though the offworld titles like Post Scriptum and Squad and their inspiration in Project Reality Battlefield are good too.

First of all, the "free to play" tag is a wee bit missleading, paying for premium time/premium vehicles is encouraged by Gaijin and most experienced players as it significantly speeds up the grind and helps you stay afloat (it certainly isn't a necessity, but highly useful)

Second point, you will (I certainly have) want to punch a wall or uninstall this game a few times while playing, so get some friends and joke about it, it's hard, and I've certainly wanted to throw my pc out of the window more then once, but the game keeps drawing me back to click that big, red, shiny "to battle" button.

Third point, this isn't a massively demanding game on the hardware (mentally? oh yes, the learning curve is pretty steep)and it can be run on some pretty basic systems, which to Gaijin's credit, means that they have a much more forgiving game then some other MMO's

Forth point, this game has a pretty steep learning curve, and as such I would recommend grinding your first nation naturally, from tiers 1 to 7 (if top tier is your goal, it isn't for some people) and then diversifying into other nations. I would strongly recommend against buying a top tier premium straight away, or even before you've gotten to that tier in-game, since you end up being more of a burden to your team then anything else.

I would recommend it as it 100% has some rewarding and funny moments, but it can be a bit rage inducing at times.

I've tried grinding out this game for a while, but the matchmaking in this game is atrocious. You will constantly be up-tiered and fighting against tanks/planes that are impenetrable with your cannons (especially if you are not playing USSR). If you haven't already grinded the game for a long time, you will get destroyed by extremely advanced and experienced players.
Oftentimes, you will find yourself getting killed in unbelievable/unreasonable ways to include spawn camping, 1km one-hit-wonders, shots that go through impenetrable geometry, ammunition exploding despite it not getting hit in the kill feed, and losing to a shot that should not have penetrated while somehow bouncing when it should not have. 
Cheating is still a major problem and Gaijin does nothing about it.
Without a premium account/vehicle, the grind is unbearable for both currency and matches in general.
Many people have also reported event/premium vehicles simply being taken out of the game without a refund while others have had premium currency removed without warning or explanation.
Playing solo is asking to consistently get rolled by pre-mades who spam rockets and CAS. This should only be a game played with friends that have communication and/or with people who have grinded the game for years.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

I've been playing this game since it started in 2012. Heck, I remember when this game wasn't on steam, so really the steam hours don't do it justice for how long I've killed my soul over this game. I'll tell you its great and terrible all in the same sentence. If you value your time and soul, nowadays I wouldn't even really touch the game. Since the grind is about as horrible as it can get, your probably going to take about a month to get to top tier, and that's IF your good at the game with premium account. Its also littered with bugs and problems here and there, when they go to fix them they create about a 1000 more. Damage models have simplified over the years, where a rifle caliber bullet can take out a B-29 in 1 shot nowadays. Veteran players tend to stomp the competition into the ground, they also have access to all the old event vehicles from the past, in which some are amazingly broken. The events now require you to grind a job and use a marketplace (for PC) to get anywhere. Teammates tend to think they can accomplish all the things by themselves, which in turn leads them to die immediately and cause your team to suffer. It is a team game in the end now matter how broke it is, and you can see it when a full squad of players that are good carry a team of lemmings to victory.

All its a lot of bad with some pretty good times. Its the only game of its kind out there and that's what makes it great. And the developers know this based on their money schemes. The community can't decide on anything to hold the developers accountable, which in turn makes them run in circles on various issues, making it pointless to get anything done. The game has gotten better in some aspects, worse in others (I've seen the highs, and the lowest of lows). Pick up it up at your own risk, so you can figure out how you feel for yourself. Form your own opinion. There really isn't a game like it, and I've invested too much to ever put it down, so I'll still be playing this until the game dies.

If at any point things change in this game. Ill update the review accordingly. Until then, its a game I recommend even with its flaws just for how unique it is.

When i feel like my day has been just a tad to good, I jump on War Thunder to make my day a little worse.

The game itself is actually really good, and extremely addicting! Each tank, plane and boat has individual parts and crewmembers that are vital to operating the vehicle. If a component is damaged or destroyed it will effect the vehicle in a simmilar way as if the same component had been lost on the real vehicle (for the most part).

The problem is the way Gaijin handles monetization. Unlike other games where you either have to pay for the game or have the option to pay for new skins or such. Gaijin makes the grind so incredibly long and the repair costs and upgrades so expensive, that it feels like you have to pay to progress. And with their latest advertisements focusing on high tier jets and tanks, It seems contradictory to have said jets blocked behind a 1000h long grind or a paywall.

I enjoyed playing this game with my friend when I did not have an unlimited Steam account. I really liked the graphics of this game, the controls, and the fact that this game is free. Not to mention that this game is completely free. Although I am thankful that this game is free, I really think the developers deserve so much more. Personally, though, I never really enjoyed dedicating so much time in this game, that's why I only have 12 hours in this game which honestly took months to build, but I have already gotten an idea of what the game was like. The reason for not playing this game is really just because of my taste of games of indie offline games, and I don't prefer online competitive games, especially if anyone hardly invites me to play.

War Thunder is a military vehicle shooter where you upgrade and collect all sorts of military vehicles from planes, tanks and even warships to fight your enemies in a massive all out battle from both the land,sea and skies. You can use a variety of weapons to take down your foes going from machine guns, shotguns to even missile launchers as you navigate your way across the battlefield to achieve your mission.

It's difficult to progress and more pay2win/pay2progress than most good free games. The game is good and it's definately something to try with friends. But I can't recommend it knowing how far it's fallen. With the addiotion of the sifth and seventh rank of vehicles as well as ships has ruined it for me. They are losing focus of  what the game was when it was only aircraft available and are trying to make too many things within one game. For tanks I would go to world of tanks. World of tanks is more arcade than realism but in my opinion better. For ships I would choose world of warships because even trying to understand the gameplay of ships, I can't figure out how to hit enemy ships with any consistancy. Aircraft gameplay is still amazing but I'm only at the lower ranks (3-5) and can't say how well it is at the top ranks.
I still play it as I have fun using the japanese Zero's and the Kikka but I wouldn't recommend spending too much money on the game.

If you choose to play. Pick a mode (aircraft, ships or tanks) and stick with it. Buy a low rank premium and later a higher rank premium (I don't recommend higher than rank 4).

I hope this helped.

Overall a great fund game.  If you want to play mostly early to mid WW2 vehicles from a variety of countries, this is for you.  If you want to use late cold war to modern, right away, then look somewhere else as it will take months to reach those vehicles.  There is something for everyone.  Be kind to yourself, don't get frustrated, keep at it, you will get better. 

Although free to play, spending a little money on a premium vehicle can help unlock other vehicles.   I wouldn't listen to the greater community as there are a log of complaints and complaining about the pace of unlocking vehicles and the economy of the game.  Almost everyone in-game is great.  I recommend joining a squad.  Overall a great multi-player game that has some of the most accurate models and realistic play.  Much more realistic than WoT or WoS, which is much more arcade.
