The dissolution of the Soviet Union, was the process of internal disintegration within the Soviet Union which resulted in the end of the country's and the federal government's existence as a sovereign state, thereby resulting in its constituent republics gaining full sovereignty. It brought an end to the General Secretary, Mikhail Gorbachev's effort to reform the Soviet political and economic system in an attempt to stop a period of political stalemate and economic backslide. The Soviet Union had experienced internal stagnation and ethnic separatism. The USSR, although a highly centralized state, was made up of 15 republics that served as homelands for different ethnicities. By late 1991, amidst a catastrophic political crisis, with several republics already departing the Union and the waning of centralized power, the leaders of three of its founding members declared that the Soviet Union no longer existed. Eight more republics joined their declaration shortly thereafter. Gorbachev resigned in Dec.1991 and what was left of the Soviet parliament voted to end itself. /Both the Revolutions of 1989 in the Eastern Bloc and the dissolution of the Soviet Union marked the end of the Cold War. The process began with growing unrest in the Union's various constituent national republics developing into an incessant political and legislative conflict between them and the central government. Estonia was the first Soviet republic to declare state sovereignty inside the Union on Nov. 16, 1988.  Lithuania was the first republic to declare full independence restored from the Soviet Union by the Act of Mar. 11, 1990, with its Baltic neighbors and the Southern Caucasus republic of Georgia joining it in a course of two months. In Aug. 1991, communist hardliners and military elites tried to overthrow Gorbachev and stop the failing reforms in a coup, but failed. The turmoil led to the government in Moscow losing most of its influence, and many republics proclaiming independence in the following days and months. The secession of the Baltic states was recognized in Sep. 1991. The Belovezh Accords were signed on Dec. 8 by President Y. of Russia, President K. of Ukraine, and Chairman S. of Belarus, recognising each other's independence and creating the Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS) instead of the Soviet Union. Kazakhstan was the last nation to leave the Union, proclaiming independence on December 16. All the ex-Soviet republics, with the exception of Georgia and the Baltics, joined the CIS on Dec. 21 signing the A-A Protocol. On Dec. 25, Gorbachev resigned and turned over his presidential powers—including control of the nuclear launch codes—to Yeltsin, who was now the first president of the Russian Federation. That evening, the Soviet flag was lowered from the Kremlin and replaced with the Russian tricolor flag. The following day, the Supreme Soviet's upper chamber, the Soviet of the Republics, formally dissolved the Union.

I don't get the 78% positive reviews, as soon as you leave the reserve vehicles this games going to shit.
This whole game is just designed to sell you premium and premium currency, i mean you can play without premium but you would have to be REALLY good to enjoy yourself playing and/or play Russians (tanks atleast). 
The last years they keep pumping out Modern stuff but completely negleject to actually balance the game, instead they slap their arbitrary BR on every vehicle they add. Its completely bollocks how their vehicle tech tree is looking, you have to grind and grind and grind, just to unlock ONE vehicle thats useless the next 20 hours you play with it. 
You have to pay to unlock the vehicle and then again to "train" the crew, so you cant just switch them around, they have to be on the same spot again or oh well its another 50k down the drain. 
Without premium its abysmal to grind for anything really. With cheap rank 1 vehicles you can only research up to rank 2 and with Rank 5 vehicles you can only research back to Rank 3 but not 1 and 2. 
Except of course you buy a premium vehicle. With premiums you can research any Rank vehicles, they also give massive bonus research points and ordinary currency multiplier. A BR 7.0 premium gives massively more Exp and money than a normal 7.0 vehicle. 
Their map and game mode design is also horrendous, tank battles are almost always brawls at 5-500 meters. if you dont kill with your first shot theres a high chance you are dead before you can even shoot a second time. 
With swedish tanks its so bad you get shredded by 7.62 MG bullets the whole time, they have good ammo but that doesnt matter since half the enemy team is T-34 which should actually be easily penable. But Gaijoobles decided for some reason that the T-34 need indestructible objects inside the hull, so even if you pen the hull, theres till some invincible object blocking your kill. 

The whole BR system is complete and utter BS, their game modes are BS (so boring to capture points each and every round), The grind is bad with premium and almost unbearable without premium.
This would be the only game i play but the greed bad design choices and blatant ignorance for their customers is just too much to give it a positive review. Its sad theres no other game with such high fidelty models and damage systems but its not worth it anymore.

My name is Walter Hartwell White. I live at 308 Negra Arroyo Lane, Albuquerque, New Mexico, 87104. This is my confession. If you're watching this tape, I'm probably dead, murdered by my brother-in-law Hank Schrader. Hank has been building a Virtual Youtuber empire for over a year now and using me as his recruiter. Shortly after my 50th birthday, Hank came to me with a rather, shocking proposition. He asked that I use my Live2D knowledge to recruit talents, which he would then hire using his connections in the Japanese utaite world. Connections that he made through his career with Niconico. I was... astounded, I... I always thought that Hank was a very moral man and I was... thrown, confused, but I was also particularly vulnerable at the time, something he knew and took advantage of. I was reeling from a cancer diagnosis that was poised to bankrupt my family. Hank took me on a ride along, and showed me just how much money even a small indie channel could make. And I was weak. I didn't want my family to go into financial ruin so I agreed. Every day, I think back at that moment with regret. I quickly realized that I was in way over my head, and Hank had a partner, a man named Motoaki "Yagoo" Tanigo, a businessman. Hank essentially sold me into servitude to this man, and when I tried to quit, Yagoo threatened my family. I didn't know where to turn. Eventually, Hank and Yagoo had a falling out. From what I can gather, Hank was always pushing for a greater share of the business, to which Yagoo flatly refused to give him, and things escalated. Yagoo was able to arrange, uh I guess I guess you call it a "hit" on my brother-in-law, and failed, but Hank was seriously injured, and I wound up paying his medical bills which amounted to a little over $177,000. Upon recovery, Hank was bent on revenge, working with a man named Riku Tazumi , he plotted to kill Yagoo, and did so. In fact, the bomb that he used was built by me, and he gave me no option in it. I have often contemplated suicide, but I'm a coward. I wanted to go to the police, but I was frightened. Hank had risen in the ranks to become the head of the Cover Corp, and about that time, to keep me in line, he took my children from me. For 3 months he kept them. My wife, who up until that point, had no idea of my vtubing activities, was horrified to learn what I had done, why Hank had taken our children. We were scared. I was in Hell, I hated myself for what I had brought upon my family. Recently, I tried once again to quit, to end this nightmare, and in response, he gave me this. I can't take this anymore. I live in fear every day that Hank will kill me, or worse, hurt my family. I... All I could think to do was to make this video in hope that the world will finally see this man, for what he really is

To new players, if you are not prepared to spend money or grind, I recommend it with a word of warning. But, if you stick with it, you will have some bad times, and some REALLY good times. I really do enjoy War Thunder, but I take AMPLE breaks, some of them lasting months. Granted, I also really like Escape From Tarkov, so maybe I just hate having fun.

Loving and hate relation with the game.

It is great if u ask me (i love tanks allot!), but there are times that you can burn it and just alt f4 after 1-2 games.
Getting in to the higher battle rank games without knowing any details (where to hit / wat ammo / how to block shots / etc. ) you will die allot, read ALLOT, and not make any money or progress.
My advice, read up on information, ask for help and try to play carefull... defensive even better.

Premium tank or account does help mountains, especialy in progressing past the trees, but honestly it is not needed if you know your stuff.
PS: every half a year there is a massive discount on the 180 days premium, totaly worth it if u ask me wait for this!

This game requires you to earn an in game currency to keep playing and progress. Ignoring the fact that progression is unfathomably slow to the point of absolute frustration, the way the in game currency is handled takes any fun one can have out of the game. While you start out having plenty and it may not seem a problem, as you move on you have to start playing well above average to even out.

As someone who is ok with losing in most games, I simply cannot be in this one. Every loss is so absolutely frustrating that I can't even focus on what I did wrong to improve since I can see I'm bleeding money. Most wins are not enough to recuperate losses. To add on the additional problem of seal clubbing mixed with players who grind longer having better versions of the same plane and pilots with greater ability to spot the enemy, handle g-forces, etc, (or crew with better loaders, gunners who find it easier to aim, etc) it becomes very difficult to find enjoyment.

There is a good game here hidden behind a monetization system that cares not for your time, money, or enjoyment (as the premium accounts barely help, and the premium vehicles only marginally help as well).

Like pain and suffering but can't afford to pay a Dominatrix? Then boy has Gaijin got something cooked up for you. Looking for something to grind? Well start now and in a decade, you too can be flying top tier jets!
Don't want to wait that long? Buy a premium jet for around $100 just so it can get BR bumped in a few months and become totally worthless! Money never back guaranteed, satisfaction N/A. 10/10 would play again to remind me that life can always be worse! o7

alright for those that dont want to read a long form of text, is it a good game,,, NO its a terrible game its one of the most infuriating annoying and unrewarding games i can think of,

now to the long form

ive played warthunder since there were only germans, ussr and the americans, the game has always looked very good and the models were detailed and u would see and learn about things u might not have seen before, but the grind was slow... like very slow,,,, even tho the roster was smaller it seemed like it was impossible to reach some of the higher tiers if u dont dedicate every waking hour on the game.. 

there were other issues like an excessive amount of spawn raping and overall toxicity but not that much more than most other pvp games, the issues just kept racking up the further down the tech tree u went however because the insane imbalance of the game becomes very apparent the further down u go, i played most of the nations on a bit and in the tanks its a little more playable and adaptable because with the planes u cant really take cover much or anything if u meet a superior plane u are pretty much just dead if they have any time in it,

someone said once that there are many different game modes,,,,, i must say i struggle to see that,,, in the end there is a point or points somewhere, and everyone running around just trying to kill the others the objectives are usually a afterthought,,, then there is a horde mode kindof that u can play against bots, wich essentially just shows u how they cant balance bots because they will be the most laser accurate things u have ever seen and just spawn in directly in ur line of sight,,,,

the sound design is usually very good,,, i say usually because they seem to change it more often then they change their underwear,

the matchmaking.... well there isnt really one u just press battle and hope u dont end up getting sent against tanks in much much higher tier than u are,,

is there cheating ??? oh boy yes there is, and it seems like the community in this game has such a lack of dignity that honestly im shocked that there isnt more blatant cheating in the game, but as some say u are gonna have cheaters in any pvp game its a reality of pvp games today,,, wich is sad but seemingly true,

the controls are fairly good and a new player can easily take up flying fairly well and or driving,,, no idea about the sailing since i havent played that much,,,

the menu and ui however are very messy and unclear for a beginner

how stable is it, its fairly stable and im sure u could run this game on a old phone but the downside of this is also there are gonna be people taking advantage of the potato mode exploit where they car just lower the graphics down all the way and see people for miles

how predatory are the microtransactions,,,,, lets just put it like this..... u can buy a ****load of bushes and make ur tank almost unrecognizable with them and u will see that alot,,, i hated when they added that feature and im not alone there, but then there is premium membership,,, if u want to progress at all really, and a whole load of premium tanks so those with little self control with their money can end up spending way more than they think on this, possibly rivaling dcs world´s amount of purchases

realistically speaking if u see the ads showing u all the cool jets and tanks u can use in this and figure u might join, u have been fooled most of them will take u ages to get to and more than half the people that join the game will play for 20 - 30 hrs realize they arent progressing at all and just quit, and i dont blame them

this is a majorly unrewarding, extremely frustrating, beautiful looking game filled with alot of toxic players and behaviors, 

note, that this is my opinion if u disagree and enjoy the game good on u, no one is taking that away from u, game on and have fun

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 220 degrees C(425 degrees F).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 175 degrees C(350 degrees F), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories

Literally the most aggressively unfun game I have ever played. And I have played League of Legends, DotA 2, and Battlefield 2042.

I stopped playing for quite a long time and decided recently to play again. I didn't play much this time around but my experience was a little something like this:

Queued for tanks, spawn my tank in, get one-shot from across the map. Spawn a different tank in, remembering where the offending enemy was (and still is), carefully try to sneak a shot at him, get one-shot by a different tank. Spawn my third and final tank, carefully cower at the back of the map, get a kill, get one-shot.

Ok, let's try the airforce. Spawn my plane, decide to climb to altitude to bully bombers. Find a bomber to bully and light it up, team mate gets a kill but at least I get an assist, however an enemy fighter is on me so I try turning to fight it, turns out my fighter is a boat. Try putting distance between us, unfortunately it's also a slug. I'll try spinning, that's a neat trick. Fucking dead. Not once could I even get my crosshair on him. So I spawn my next fighter and climb again to bully bombers. This time I don't get interrupted and get two bomber kills and a kill on a fighter that attempted to climb straight up to me. This, however, was basically shooting fish in a barrel.

Well, let's give the tanks another go. We'll try Russia this time since my friend said the KV-1 was very strong and I have that. But first I pull a ZIS whatever the fuck gun tractor thing. I find a nice little woody area where I can see the objective and wait for prey. Unfortunately I get immediately shot by some 8.8cm German skudstafuck or whatever and it cripples my tank, and because I don't have parts yet, I just get to sit there and wait for it to kill me. Well alright, take it easy, I still have the KV-1, but people are still dying like crazy to TDs so maybe I'll wait a little more, so I pull my AA for a little bit of chill back lines support crap. I shoot down one bomber, but a bomb lands near my vehicle. Fortunately, my SPAA is apparently slow as shit and couldn't get away in time and gets blown up. Alright, last tank, KV-1 time. Spawn that sucker in, and I'm on top of a bomb and die.

Uninstalled.

It's a great game, only if you're playing it causally. If you're here to play with the advertised "[u]Modern Era[/u]" side of War Thunder you should look elsewhere.

If you want to unlock every vehicle in a major nation, or simply complete one single vehicle line to a top tier vehicle, within a few months or a year, you'll need to spend "[u]Potentially[/u]" thousands of dollars or spend hundreds of hours grinding non-stop before you reach top tier in any nation.  

The grind and game balance has always been a problem in this game, but it's because of issues like these that the monetization has only gotten worse and worse in recent years. 

So, after all that said if you do decide to give War Thunder a shot or continue to play, don't cave in to spending money and play in moderation. And if you're in it for the long haul. Keep up with your mental health, tell your friends and family you love them, and...

Highly recommended to anyone who enjoys arcade style shooters. Extra recommendation if you love military planes, tanks, and boats. Be warned that the learning curve for higher tiers can be steep and the game is a huge grind at those higher tiers unless you buy all the microtransactions. I've been playing off and on for years, before tank and boats were added and always come back. Anger can insue, but I still love the game, unless I get killed by a $200 premium tank that has no right being the same battle rating as its F2P version.

Early tiers are manageable for progression and can be pretty fun, but as with all of these F2P types of games, it turns to P2W very quickly about midway through all the progression trees.  If you're a grinder or have tons of money to spend, you can easily abuse the system as some of the later tier vehicles can easily run $60+ USD.  If that's not your speed, I recommend not playing this game.

I am a 75 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 34 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Gaijin are a terrible company who want nothing but your money.

I tried to like this game, I really did. But it's Con's outweigh it's Pro's. The gameplay mechanics are great, but the game is nothing but an absolute Pay-to-Win trash bag and Gaijin know this. The game is borderline unplayable if you don't open up your wallet.

Progression is unfathomably slow. Currency does not acquire fast enough and research is just as bad. And when you finally gain enough research that new vehicle? well you better have some more in-game currency to purchase it AND train the crew!

"Why don't you just play more" 
Well I'd love to, but it would be nice if I wasn't up-tiered literally every. single. match. Regardless of whether its realistic or arcade battles. every single match is against up-tiered opponents who you physically cannot kill, who at the same time, will kill you head on with a single shell. 

So the issue here, is that in order to gain more currency and research to unlock better vehicles, I need to win matches and kill opponents, but the game doesn't want that and instead wants me tot spend my money. So to do this, it will force you into thinking the only way to progress at an actual sensible rate, is to use your money. Don't do it. The game could be fun, but it's not. It's the Tarkov of vehicle combat.
h

I will NEVER reccommend this game to anybody. I have played my fair share of hours and I can safely say, the current state of the community and the support from devs has never been lower. The following review might be long, but I reccommend you stil through it and tell me what you think in the comments aswell.

I downloaded the game back in 2014, when the game had first introduced ground battles. There were some problems, most notably tanks not being able to go over trenches. When the community addressed the problem for the first time, Gaijin would just let the demand for a traction update fall on deaf ears and continue developing more tech trees, with more  tanks, thus adding more bugs to the vast field. The trench question was later fixed in the "Hot Tracks" update. It was released in 2020. This goes a long way to show how little support and care the devs give for their game, [b] but the community is no better. [/b]

In fact, you would be mistaken if you thought that the only ones who try to milk content for profit and clout were the game developers. No. The community does that too. Let me tell you something: we gave up a long time ago, devs never listened to us, they just kept on adding and adding but never stopping to fix. We asked for new gamemodes, nothing came, the gamemodes are like this SINCE 2014, apart from poor naval battles that are boring and confusing and the PvE helicopter gamemode which no one asked for and is pretty ahrd to get to, considering the grind you have to go trhough to even get to a single helicopter. Why not add some new gamemodes? Maybe with fleets, air forces and ground forces combined, for instance.

Resuming what I was previously discussing about the community, it's just bad. Content creators, for the most part, milk the game's flaws into videos with titles "Gaijin'd" or "War thunder moment" where they just CONSTANTLY release videos on how they did not get that kill because of a ghost shell and have a good laugh about it. Even the players have the same problems. You can see yourself in reviews. Most of them are just people saying that the game will ruin your life, but they still give it a positive review. I can see why the game is good. The graphics are stunning, the physics, even if with some lacklusters, are very advanced. But that's not what defines a game in the slightest. The two most important aspects of the game are feedback and response, and both first and second are left unticked from the constant pressure the devs add into making every premium tank and pack look like a bargain, something that will make you finally get to that top tier ABRAMS, you just have to spend 50 bucks. Then you spend more. Then you get a premium account. Then you get bushes on your tank and buy golden eagles. That's what the game does. Instead of fixing, they provide new content which is profitable. And the community memes about it, instead of complaining. 
The game has been dead for a long time. Chat remains unused, there is no comunication, clans are dying and discord servers inactive. There is no fun left in the game anymore and no one is friendly, but thinks about how they must get the highest score possible for medals and silver lions without providing good cover to teammates, without flying in formation, without capturing points. I've played multiple games where we had the top fraggers with 12 tank kills, using the best premium, but still lost because we could not capture points. Again, there is no teamwork or concept of having fun in the game, just greed, to get to the top and then start over with another nation.

If you got to this point of the review, by now you'll know that all I want people to understand from this review is being serious about the game's issues. We tried, as a community, and failed. Then we stopped trying. What we should have done and should be doing is quitting the game for good, until the issues are resolved. Give the game the reviews it deserves, make videos about it on youtube, address problems on the forums, on reddit, do everything possible to make the devs understand the game needs to be changed into a quality product. We don't want new vehicles, we want balance. We don't want to buy premiums to grind, we don't want to drive for 10 minutes to get on point in realistic battles and then get sniped from across the map by a meta tank destroyer. We want to have fun.

TLDR = Don't get the game. Wait until the community makes sure the devs give us some feedback and the pay to win aspects of the game are removed.

I won't lie to new players, this game is a mess since its earlier years.

Back in 2013 progress was an absolute pain in the butt, the only real way to progress as someone whom sucked at flying was to just get in a bomber and kiss the lower atmosphere to drop bombs on a target you can barely see until you have the experience/Silver Lions to afford enough vehicles to move to the next tier. But, with enough elbow grease and practice you'd find a combat simulator game that was a lot more casual to get into mechanically until you began to perfect your practice with your preferred aircraft model/style.

Fast forward to now, it's impossible to progress without spending enough money to take out a mortgage on your house if you want to have even the slightest chance of maxing a country out within A YEAR.
The events are painfully slow with the developers not even hiding that they expect you to pay ~1000 Golden Eagles (Their premium currency, worth roughly $6.60 USD) for one token. By the way, it can take up to 8-10 event tokens to get a free vehicle that will probably only be worth ~$40. 

TANKS-----------------------------------
The game is honestly horribly balanced, low tiers can be fun but new players be warned you will be rushed by far more experienced players with at least months to years of experience under their belts.
Mid tiers will typically be dominated by German tanks with their absolute F-you cannons/armor or Russians with their Stalinasium armor/rounds.
High tier Realism is honestly the only real fun thing in this game, but expect pretty bad balancing as well with fast pace combat that will usually lead to either you or the enemy dying within 2-3 hits. 
--You will probably also buy into this tier, DON'T. I repeat, only buy a high tier premium if you are around Tier 4-5 so you can get used to the mechanics and game play overall. I made the mistake of buying an XM-1 with a minor discount that was honestly not worth it, and I actually didn't really get to use that tank until 1-2 months later when I farmed close enough to justify using it.

PLANES-----------------------------------
I honestly just don't want to touch on this, it's fun and it's not fun at the same time. If you are new and struggle with aiming just go Russian, their early planes are decently fast and they have way too many machine guns.
The game play doesn't really get more interesting until you get fast propeller/jet planes but that is also when the grind will get painfully slow, so try to spade* your vehicles.
High tier itself is in a pretty rough place right now, as long as you fly a plane that is below Battle Rating (BR) 10 you will be spared the nightmare of having a Top Gun fan splooging his rocket load all over your poor existence.
Also sometimes the entire enemy team will be composed of F-14 Tomcats with all aspect lock on missiles while you are likely trapped with rear lock on only.

NAVY-----------------------------------
They made a lot of changes since the original release of Naval combat..... They took the tech tree and split shallow watercraft from bigger boats, allowing bigger boats to rest at BR 3-4+ while the smaller guys can start without having to deal with bigger opponents until they have better armaments. 
Most Naval combat is 3+ minutes of travel time to get in range of enemies with angled movements to avoid giving a full broadside shots to the enemy, after will usually follow a barrage of fire, head on charges, and lots of torpedoes. WW2 bombers/fighters will be dealing with small watercraft utilizing Cold War lock on missiles, most planes will end up suicide bombing you even if they could have avoided a needless death, and players will regularly attempt to beach you or ram you if it means a chance at them kill stealing.

All in all, it's not a horrible game but do not fall for the illusion that the developers try to throw up with the support of their more fanatical fans. Times are hard and Microtransactions are harder, if you play practice self control and only pay for the Premium to get a "NORMAL" flow of experience or Silver Lions. Without premium you may find yourself logging out after matches to avoid paying the repair fee via the timed repair mechanics due to dramatically increasing prices the more you progress.


TL;DR, good game heavily damaged by predatory monetization schemes and poor balancing, which by the way, will only hurt you as the player due to their entire balancing system being about the statistics of how new and old players perform on vehicles without actually taking the stats of the vehicle into account outside of initial release.

Ok this is a good game that has great graphics and loads of cool vehicles to research and play.  The game modes and maps get super repetitive but the maps are not bad per say.
The game is ruined by two things.  Bad Server infrastructure and bad matchmaking.  The game will constantly put you in battles against vehicles 2-3 battle ratings (BR) higher than you.  The difference in combat effectiveness between ranks is huge.  So the majority of the time you will just get stomped by superior vehicles.  The high pings create situations where you can never win 1on1 encounters because the enemy has come around a corner, seen you, aimed and fired before you even get them rendering on your screen.  Add to all this the insane randomness of shot hits and penetration and it gets frustrating.  Hell, even the insane repair costs will prevent you from playing your favourite vehicles because even with premium you will lose in-game currency per match.

My advice is to play low tier vehicles as a free to play with friends and you will have a lot of fun.  Don't give these developers any money because they don't deserve it.  I could fix all the issues with this game in 5 minutes with just the matchmaker code parameters.

War thunder is a great game in a lot of aspects and as you can see by my hours played, you could say I enjoyed it for the most part. Now why the negative review? I will come to that in a bit but first the positives:

Positives:
1:It's sort of a free game
2:Seeing the damage you do in the mini HUD is the coolest feature for me personally in this game.
3: Jets,smart bombs etc etc. Cool to do when you get there.
4: Bigger tanks the further you progres which is a nice feature.
5: Can be played with friends
6: Simulator battles which makes it more realistic.

The negatives and I will put these in ranked order:
1: Ungodly amount of campers in realistic battles. Ruins everyone's fun but the camper's. If everyone would be camping there would be no game to enjoy but people don't care and come with some bullshit excuse that it falls under ''tactics'' and that is what they used to do in 2nd world war. However, they forget the part that even those campers didn't know where the enemy approaches from and in-game you do which makes this arguement absolete. Again, they don't care as long as they can camp. I propose that after a minute of not moving in an area of 20 meters you will be visible on the map.

2: Spawn camping where they will wait for you to spawn and shoot you, it used to be discouraged by getting your vehicle blown up if you got too close to spawn. This was a reasonable idea but they would still camp but then on the border of the spawn area. Now only your position gets shown and nothing happens. The spawning tank is immune for 10-15 seconds to damage but when you are surrounded by 4-5 tanks, You can do fuck all.

3: The overpowered CAS by which I mean planes. It takes some practice but can be easily learned but when you know how to bomb and shoot your cannons to destroy tanks. You will be raking in kills and tank can't do much but either spawn a plane themselves and going after you or spawning in an anti-air and hoping they will get a hit which is like 10% chance as most don't know how to lead their targets.

4: rockets and apfsds shells. Why in the hell did they add rockets to this game because people thought it was cool. I am from a war thunder time where rockets weren't in the game and neither were the apfsds shells. Where the maus was the highest tank you could get on the german tech tree. A time it took skill to kill a maus by trying to flank the tank. Now we got light vehicles/tanks (UH-S which is pure cancer) loaded with rockets which can pierce nuclear bunkers so your armour doesn't mean shit. Oh you got 305 mm turret armor, watch how fast you get obliterated by the most ridiculous vehicles who are 3 times less your size and 10 times as strong. Object 120 with its apfsds will annihilate any tank it shoots.

5: The matchmaking system is the worse thought out system ever created. In this game you have battle ranking system. 1.0 BR is the lowest while 11.3 is the highest. If you have a tank line up from 6.0 to 6.7, the largest contingent of tanks you will get, are tanks from 7.3 to 7.7 putting you at a huge disadvantage. If you thought your armour would save you think again, the 7.3-7.7 vehicles have bigger pen shells so again you will get destroyed easily without a sweat. Put the BR system from 6.0 to 6.7 and keep it like this.DO the same to other Br ranges (1.0-1.7,2.0-2.7 etc). No uptiering to 7.7 and no downtiering to 5.7. Such a ridiculous system. Whoever thought of that to be a good idea should be fired. If that means somewhat longer queu times so be it. I will wait for another 5 mins. This way the game actually gets the balance it so desperately needs and not this garbage which it currently is.

6: The enormous grind. The game is f2p and Gaijin needs to make its money from somewhere which is totally fine I get that but be warned players who pay have a huge advantage over players who dont like shorter reload times, better movement, better ranging and so on and so on.

7: Low graphics cheat: people put the game on low graphics as it renders differently than those who put high quality. For instance, buildings get rendered from a shorter distance as well as bushes and trees. This way makes it so easy to spot other tanks as you can see them through bushes,trees and houses. They (gaijin) said they fixed this issue but I tried it out and when I turned down my graphics, I could see through 4 buildings and knew exactly which way the enemy team was going which is pathetic.

So in short, do I recommend the game as of now? No, I don't unless Gaijin actually adresses these issues especially the camping problem and BR matching system. I do not recommend.

Game is not made for everyone. Harware issues and server lag is real. You have to run trough specific networks (VPN's) to have a stable connection  as the server rejects packages if you have more than 150ms ping.

Very limited game play in start. 

So all in all. If you want a game you can play for 6 months till you figure out what you like and what you don't - figure out which vehicles you like are also like by the devs so that you can play and enjoy the game - then start playing the game - this game is for you.

I'm sorry but I cannot in my best faith say War Thunder is a fun game.

It is a good game, yes yes. Great graphics, lots of vehicles, it's pretty cool.

That's where the compliments end.
-The game is a legal scam, designed to be as hard as possible to play without putting money into it. And incredible imbalance to people who do put money in, being able to buy OP premium vehicles.

-The game sucks gameplay wise. The penetration mechanic is so inconstant that it's maddening. One minute I punch right through a Panzer IV's front turret, and then the next shot the same shot in the same place bounces and gets you killed-, like bruh wtf.

-The game is terrible for new players. High tier tanks are so hard to play most pros just stay in Tier 3. Tier 3 is where most new players will be for a long time, it takes a long time to grind to tier 4.
So you, as a new player with 100 hours of grind to get to tier 3 now have to play against 10,000 maidenless sweats who've never seen grass. 

Have fun dying in less then 2 minutes after spawning and barely getting any RP or silver lions back cause you didn't get any kills and most of those silver lions you did manage to earn went to tank repair costs uwu

-The tanks are all balanced based on bias. Gaijin is a Russian company, guess which tier tree is the easiest to grind? You guessed it, them Russian tanks are fucking crazy good.

German tanks are stupid good too, although shit next to Russian tanks

I use the American tree. Russia doesn't like America very much. So yeah, the American tanks used to be decent, but in recent years have recieved such severe nerfs that they're shit next to the German and Russian tanks of their same tier.

If you wanna have fun playing War Thunder, run the other way. This game has fun moments, but is not fun at all. If you can get through the unfun grind for the fun moment, go for it! 

If not, save yourself the headache, waste of time, and frustration and go wishlist and download the Gunner, HEAT, PC! demo, it looks even better, has better gameplay and sound design, and the game is challenging, but fair, and every death doesn't make you wanna pull your hair out. Rather, the game tells how you fucked up, and you can learn from that fuckup in your next run.

Don't download this game please. Gaijin doesn't need to have this game anymore, and it's best if we just let it die.

https://www.patreon.com/GunnerHEATPC

This game could be great in its genre but the developers are putting greed first and fun (maybe) second.

They will sell you crates with a really small chance to get something good out of them for silver lions (the game's free currency), they will make the grind unbearable so they can sell you Premium time and/or Premium vehicles just to shorten it a bit, they will make events extremely annoying and grindy so you feel exhausted and more inclined into buying multiple skips that can skip the entire event, etc. etc.

This game is a good example of creating problems just so they can sell you the solution.
Every game mechanic feels like is there just so it can annoy you.
The higher you go in tiers, the worse it gets! First, a vehicle will cost more research and silver lions to the point that reaching modern vehicles will take ages. Second, once you reach Tier IV/V the matches will often mix WWII vehicles with Cold War ones, making the WWII vehicles experience terrible. Third, increasing repair costs which means if you lose too many vehicles or don't do well enough you're actually going to lose silver lions.
But guess what! If you buy Premium time and/or vehicles you're going to get more research and silver lions every match!
Oh, and in ground battles there's a serious issue with many of the maps' design/balance. I don't even know how many times one of the two teams ended up being spawn trapped while the game does nothing to prevent it. Only thing you can do is leave and hope the game doesn't lock your crew for 5 minutes or something.

So, is it not fun? That's the issue!
It will make you feel absolutely miserable but sometimes, just sometimes, you will actually have fun and it will give you that dopamine rush you just needed to keep playing... only to feel miserable again.


Should you try it? I mean, it's free.
I'm not going to say "avoid it" if you really want to try it. It has a lot of cool vehicles from different nations/eras and there aren't many games like it.

Just know that your experience will probably suck, a lot.

War Thunder is often described as "almost fun." Having come back to it to give it another chance with fresh eyes, I can safely say that is entirely accurate. 

The vehicles of the game are beautifully realized, and absurdly broad. You can sail everything from torpedo boats to dreadnought battleships, fly anything from biplanes to supersonic jet fighters, and drive armored fighting vehicles from pre-WW2 all the way to the modern era. Driving these vehicles strikes a balance between ease of use and realism that makes it far easier to pick up than a simulator while being more "real" than a more openly unrealistic game such as World of Tanks or Armored Warfare (not to knock those games- they set out to provide different gameplay). 

The problem, naturally, comes in the game that is built around it. 

It's the economy, primarily. It moves at a glacial pace to encourage players to spend real money on the game. Both Research Points, used for unlocking new vehicles, and Silver Lions, the in-game currency, which is used to purchase, crew, and upgrade vehicles. Earnings are across the board pretty bad. This can give the impression one is bashing their head against a wall trying to get enough to research, purchase, and crew vehicles. This is, naturally, the point. It can take months or even years to grind to endgame vehicles for one tree of one nation. This means that experiencing a lot of the content must be sacrificed if you are to get to top tier in any reasonable period of time.

You also use Silver Lions to repair vehicles (you can, theoretically, simply not use SL to repair, but from about the middle of the tech tree onwards, vehicles take days to repair). Due to the realistic nature of the game's damage system, death can be instant and can be the result of one small mistake. Meanwhile, repair costs are painful compared to earnings. It's not uncommon to actually lose SL on a match even if you kill multiple opposing players due to repair costs (skill issue, skill issue, i know.), meaning you would have been better off if you hadn't even tried to play! Death comes easy in War Thunder, but it's not cheap. 

Stock, unupgraded vehicles, perform worse than their fully-upgraded counterparts, as they should. This isn't a problem on paper, heck it's the entire point of having vehicle upgrades, but sometimes it gets absurd. Stock ground vehicles can not extinguish fires nor repair damage. That isn't just a handicap, this is kneecapping. 

I haven't spend any money on War Thunder, and while I've heard the SL grind is less severe if you do, I have also heard the time to get from low-tier to top tier (where all the shiny toys Gaijin advertises, like the Abrams and F-14 Tomcat, are) is still absurd- on the order of months of continuous grinding for one nation. And that's if you're paying!

I really want to play and enjoy such a broad game with wonderful vehicles, but I simply cannot stand just how much this game was designed to fleece money out of people frustrated by it. 

There's fun to be had, but compared to what else the game dumps on you, I don't think it's worth it.

Do you like eating severely burnt toast with no teeth? Do you also like being crushed by a hydraulic press while doing so? Do you also like being in a dark room with strange vaguely Russian-tractor-engine-sounding noises coming from the shadows?

Well then, War Thunder is for you! Welcome to a genre which only has 1 vaguely playable and fun [strike] 5am-9pm job [/strike] "game"! Be ready to sacrifice either your soul or your credit card to our lord and saviour Gaijin Entertainment, especially if you like jet planes! Or helicopters! Or modern tanks! Or battleships! (on a serious note, don't listen to the memes saying the naval gamemode is dead, while its less populated it's definitely not and it is still fun.)

You will also enjoy the fun and balanced vehicles and teams of the game! The game is balanced off of player performance statistics rather than the actual vehicle's ability, and so nations with worse performing players (cough, Germany, cough, Tiger H1, cough, Panther D, cough, panzer 4 H) get more "Balanced" vehicles than the nations better people play like France! Or Italy! Or Japan! (I am so so sorry if you play Japanese ground forces). This goes to the point where in for example ground battles if you don't play certain nations you will often face opponents you can barely put a dent in head on whilst they can oneshot you from 2 kilometres away. And that's if you're NOT uptiered!

Seriously though, give some of the minor nations a go. They have some of the most fun vehicles in the game (Sweden 2.7 is my go-to fun lineup). Air battles are also pretty well balanced and are far more skill based. I haven't played enough naval to make a comment on that. 

10/10 game, I am a masochist, please help.

(Just a P.S. most of my playtime is on XBOX/PS4(which i lost the account for rip 7.7 britain lineup). Only recently got a decent PC and moved over to Steam. My proof for my experience is on my ingame profile and in the singular jet I've gotten so far.)

The mechanics and such are fun, and it's not terribly grindy. But from my understanding the devs just go for cash and there are some broken things that never get fixed is the general consensus. Of my 2 weeks into the game, I can say map design is lopsided and there's a shitton of spawn camping once the match swings in favor of a team. There are people smurfing and no one actually wants to be helpful in game or even stop with the toxic camping to make it a game where new people like myself want to stick around. I do okay in the game so far regardless so I'm not bitching about sucking at the game, just the wasted potential to make it really good. Shame as I do have fun in the game too, it's just neglected. You have lobbies of 30 people no-one types communicates, almost feels as if your muted or just bots are playing. Most of your team is in a clan sort of thing if you look at their name but you see them and their buddy both leave sometimes a total of 4 people will do this in a single game right from the start. I would not recommend to anyone without a true absolute love for tanks cause it might be ruined in this game and also to have a stable income cause it will take your money as soon as you feel tempted there goes 20 but before you know your spending hundreds of dollars on a game that you cant even enjoy cause you may win 1/5 or 2/5 matches regardless if you are teamed up with someone. All n all the game is a rough 3.1 out of 10.0. Score being so low not cause the game is bad itself but cause the way the advancement is structured, your time will be wasted unless you bring your credit card or mom n dads. Also VR is only for planes which makes it slightly more enjoyable but not really.

Don't playing this game if high levels of stress may affect your health. Unless you are a communist you wont have it easy in this game by any stretch of the imagination due to the sheer amount of Russian bias in this game. Besides the aforementioned bias every game you play you're statistically at a disadvantage since the chance of you not getting matched with enemy players that are whole Tiers and BR levels above you is about %20. Its like the Russians who made this game never learned how to count single digits numbers properly, that or they're just blatantly trying to force people into buying golden eagles. Even if you buy Golden Eagles unless they're used in the Russian Tech tree you'll still get abused by people who did put them in the Russian tech tree so if you come into this game with any hopes of enjoying your time playing a country other than Russia its gonna be an extremely frustrating struggle. If you're a communist and/ or you like Russian technology then this is the game for you because the developers will hand hold you throughout your experience throughout the game. Now to be totally fair the Bias only gets you so far so if you're a terrible pilot/ tank commander/ sea captain your Russian bias wont always be able to save you. Same goes for people who aren't playing Russia, If you have a keen eye and you know where and how to land your shots you'll find success in this game, But know that every vehicle and tier in this game weren't created equally so even if you are a great shot and a good pilot your equipment can still drag you down and it just makes the Bias afforded to some countries in this game that much worse. To sum it up War Thunder can be both a immensely rewarding and infuriating game depending on your play style, skill, and which country you choose to play but it suffers the same pit falls that most free-to-play games suffer and you'll often be confronted with this. I wish the Steam review system had a middle ground option cause under normal circumstance I wouldn't just flat out endorse this game but I also wouldn't say there isn't anything to enjoy here. For now I'll recommend the game but only under the pre-tense that its fleeting levels of unbalance can really hinder the experience at times.

I love this game (1,372 hours) having played this over the past 5 years. Nice graphics and sound, awesome variety of planes, ground vehicles and naval vessels. That said, I can't stand this game primarily for the two following reasons:

1. the tech tree grind is murder. The devs keep adding vehicles between  my current vehicle I'm researching and the highest battle rating vehicles in the tech tree. Just as you think you'll finally get there the devs keep pushing the top end vehicles out of reach. Grinding at the highest levels takes forever and you end up getting out matched by wallet warriors.  I have several higher end vehicles I was researching which I can no longer work on because 4 or five new vehicles have been added between me and my goal. This goes for my American, German and British tech tree. Very frustrating for someone who does not want to spend hundreds of $$$ to buy golden eagles (the in-game currency).

2. the  russian bias in the game is ridiculously painful. A fellow player once remarked that a German WW2 tank just needs to be close to a russian tank and it will spontaneously explode. A funny exaggeration but it does echo the sentiment of many players. Come up against a KV1 or JS and you may as well blow yourself up regardless of the tank your in. As for WW2 russian planes, they far outclass every other plane (whether American, German, British, etc...). True they were generally more rugged but their performance is far too exaggerated (overpowered, over-gunned, protected by some sort of invisible shield). I wager the hitboxes on russian planes are tweaked in their favor. I'm actually very good at shooting down planes with AA; knowing how to lead them based on trajectory, distance, ammo velocity, etc... . American, German, British, Italian, etc... no problem; I'll score kills. However, when trying to shoot down a russian plane it's like my first time with AA. I call BS and have thrown in the towel.

Fix these glaring issues and maybe I'll come back to the game. In the meantime I've run out of patience.

𝐻𝒶𝓋𝑒 𝒶 𝓇𝒶𝓃𝒹𝑜𝓂 𝒷𝓊𝓉 𝑜𝓊𝓉𝓈𝓉𝒶𝓃𝒹𝒾𝓃𝑔 𝓅𝒾𝑒 𝓇𝑒𝒸𝒾𝓅𝑒!
-------------------------------------------------------
Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

The game is currently unplayable on AMD GPUs (at least the RX6000 series). Visual glitches WILL appear randomly obstructing your view COMPLETELY. There's NO fix as the problem is in the game engine itself.
It has been this way for months and Gaijin has done nothing to fix the compatibility with AMD cards. Several other people got the same problem. Appalling.

Went into this with some hope of a good and fun game, but oh boy is it in need of serious work. Encountered at least 5 different bugs that broke my controls. 

It is not possible to make aircraft controls behave realistically. Inverting controls only sometimes works. The user interface is illogical most of the time. The tutorial is lacking detail. Players in matches have way stronger tanks than you do, so I can hit them twice, not kill them, then they kill me in one shot. The grind to unlock is excessive and, quite frankly, all of these things make the game not at all fun and you'd be better off playing a Battlefield game (just not BF 2042).

Honestly Warthunder is my one favorite hack'n slash open world RPGs with dating sim elements this combined with amazing graphics and a stellar story with amazing writing, characters, and voice acting makes this the ultimate gaming experience enough to rival gaming greats such as Superman 64 and Big Rigs over the road racing. My step dad literally stopped beating me into a pulp every Wednesday night after he saw me playing this game feeling completed as a father he/I blew his brains out with a 12 gauge shotgun (Take that Jerry).

Plot 

The year is 1984 and the world is torn apart by BR compression subsonic jets are forced to fight for their lives against top tier missiles as tigers are hunted to extinction by the evil HEATFS slingers. Our protagonist PhlyDaily is tasked with hunting down the legendary crystal of BR decompression, but he must get there before the evil Gaijin Entertainment for they plan to use the crystals power to resurrect the T-14 armada and bring forth and age of Russian bias. Along the way he will meet many challenges including but not limited to stock HEATFS at top tier, painfully slow F2P grind, high repair costs, the entirety of the french tech tree, and trying to understand anything that comes out of Oddbawz mouth.

Plot Rating: 6.9/10



Game play 

Gaijin have really outdone themselves with Warthunder the combo system is crisp and fast paced the world is open and full of life and the dating sim elements don't feel shoehorned in. Ultimately if you enjoy games like the Persona series or Garfield kart then this game is for you

Game Play Rating: Tyler Blevins/Fortnite


Visuals 

Looking at old beta footage it's clear game director headache kojingles had a very clear image of what he wanted the world of warthunder to look like the visuals are clear and crisp never once did I not feel immersed in the games world.

Visuals Rating; 6/10 too much water


Final Overview

SEGA and Gaijin along with game director Fortnite Jonesy have really out done them selves with this action thriller horror survival game/Dating Sim. Overall the game has just a little something for everyone

Final score 0/10

I am a 58 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. TLTR: While I enjoy this game more than I dislike it, I in no way recommend it.

Cons:
- It has 2 flat-out pay-to-win features that is firmly reinforced by the structure of the game in general. Crew-skills ensure that you play with debuffs for a year or more (if you play consistently) unless you pay your way out of it. If you play Arcade Battles you may also need to pay for premium vehicles to not play with additional debuffs, because you need a lineup of 3 vehicles of more or less equal overall strength in this game-mode. While you can avoid the premiums by restricting yourself to only vehicles with a full line-up, you can then end up having very few vehicles you can actually play. If you play Realistic Battles or Simulator Battles only crew-skills are true p2w.

- It further has a predatory funding method in the form of gambling, for addicts and children.

- The dailies and other special tasks are restricted to people who've played a lot, consistently, have played for a while, and who do well in PvP.  A veteran of 10 years playing who enter matches against players who've only played for a few months can complete them in 15 minutes. A player who've been at it for a couple of months can struggle to do them in a 10-15 hours session (depending on what task you randomly get).

- Expect having to play consistently for a week or more before even getting access to dailies and periodic special-reward "objectives".

- Events are for the elite only. The special events are restricted to players who do nothing but play every day for the duration of the event.  During the current summer-event (dubbed Suffer Event by the community) I have to play 40-60 matches of 10-20 minutes each within a set 2-day period at least 4 times during August to get the minimum worthwhile prize. I haven't done the calculations but I believe I have to play 120-180 matches within a set 2-day period at least 10 times during August to get all prizes. As it happens, after 370 hours of playing I only have access to vehicles allowing 1/3 of those prizes. As it stands I don't bother with the event at all despite playing quite a lot most days. The event goals are simply way out of my reach, as have all events during my time playing this game.

- Getting in-game money is a struggle, and that assumes that you pay for your playtime. You won't notice at first because the first repairs of new vehicles are free, but you'll soon find that repair-costs equal or get greater than the rewards of matches all depending on what vehicles you use. You will rarely see youtubers addressing this as their experience in racking up money (Silver Lions - SL) is such that it's a non-issue for them, making them oblivious to this issue. But many new players come to the forums asking how they can make more SL than they loose to repairs. In my experience they most often get no answer. The vehicles have varying repair-costs however and the only way for a newish player (for example one who's played for 370 hours) is to not use the best tanks with the highest repair-costs. Starting with Russia or China helps, as most of their vehicles cost less to repair than those of other nations on the lower ranks. If you don't make SL you can't get new vehicles, can't improve the ones you have, and in the worst case you have to wait for a week or 3 to play a particular vehicle again because you can't afford to repair it.

- The pay-to-play feature (subscription on other games) is considerably more expensive in this game than in the vast majority of MMOs. Further it's far more important than in most "free-to-play" MMOs as you get far less SL if you don't. On the upside you can purchase their subscription one day at a time, so if you only play during weekends it ends up being cheaper than other MMOs regardless. If you play for an hour every evening instead..

- Long Grinds. It can take a year or more of consistent and long game-play sessions to grind a single nation's techtree. It also takes an even longer time to earn SL enough to purchase the researched vehicles. This assumes you pay to play. Free to play will take more than double. As such you should only consider the first 3 ranks of any nation for grinding and ignore the remaining vehicles. Let them instead come when they do naturally, and enjoy the WW2 tanks in the meantime. You'll be using them for a long time no matter what.

- The Battlepass, a second subscription you can get on top of the normal one, is very poor value. Don't get it unless you've already progressed enough along it that paying will get you a premium vehicle.

- Most big youtubers who make WT vids are sponsored by Gaijin and are cop-outs. Don't trust them. They are also veterans who haven't had a new-player experience in this version of WT. The game was entirely different when they started, and they have long since forgotten even that. This means a lot of what they say is irrelevant to your experience as how you play greatly affects any advice or analysis given in WT. You should still watch their content if you want to become good at WT, just be aware that not all of their glitter is gold. Also, almost all of their showcased vids are cherry-picked best-wins against noobs. If you see them live-stream battles you'll soon learn that they die as much as anyone else most matches and have days when they suck despite their 15 years of experience. With certain exceptions, self-grandiosing cop-outs.


Pros:
- It can be quite fun sometimes if you're willing to ignore all the above and just play for the random matches for their own sake. Forget events, objectives, tasks, and just play some matches when you fancy.

- It's very skill-based. While it has clear pay-to-win elements, you can expect a veteran using the worst tank in the game to totally trash you while using the best one. I'm not kidding. The pay-to-win elements are dramatic when you play someone your own skill-level, but differences in player-skill from best to worst are far wider than the difference between a fully functional vehicle and a fully debuffed one.

- Damage model. It's not based on hit-points and you can one-shot anyone, if you're good or lucky enough. Or do no damage at all if you suck or get unlucky enough.


Conclusion
I play it and enjoy it. I absolutely do not recommend it. It wouldn't take much to make War Thunder shine, but the devs have no intention of taking those steps.

I can't speak for tanks or ships, but I can speak for planes, so here goes.

USA: Pepper everyone with 12.7mm 50 cal, if in doubt, add more 50 cals. Try to fly in straight lines and avoid doing too many turns once you unlock planes late Rank 2 and above.

Germany: 20mm cannons. Early planes have low ammo count, so make every shot worthwhile. Never ever get into turnfights in them, especially with the FW 190. You hit people and run away, strictly boom and zoom.

USSR: Probably balanced when it comes to performance. Make sure you practice your marksmanship. The Russian planes prefer having guns mounted on the nose. Pay attention to your ammo count.

Britain: Early planes pepper enemies with 7mm, then you unlock the 20mm cannons which can definitely wreak havoc. The Spitfires can turn, but doing too many of them will make you lose a lot of speed and energy for more fights. Excellent strike fighters though, except for the Firebrand, that one is eh.

Japan: Same as the British, good turners with powerful guns. A fair amount of Japanese fighters will be quite slow compared to others, especially the A6M and Ki-43. The Ki-49 series of bombers are eh.

Italy: 12.7mm BREDA-SAFAT will give you a head start in early planes. Some of the later planes will have German 20mm cannons. They play similarly to the Germans, use boom and zoom tactics.

France: I haven't played too much with them, but a good amount of their early designs have 20mm cannons with only 60 rounds, 90 if you ask nicely. Make every shot count. There will be some American and British designs with French roundels painted on them.

China: Has a mix of planes from all the countries of the above, haven't played too much of them but it allows for a mix and match of fighting styles.

Israel: Have not yet played them, you need Rank 4 planes from USA or UK or France unlocked. They start with a BF 109 with terrible performance (IRL). It will improve from there on though.

They are all fun. I tend to play a mix of Japan, USA, Germany and Britain, though as of this writing I primarily main Japan.

Look, this game is extremely unique. It offers gameplay that is unlike anything else on the market. That being said, the devs of this game seem to be allergic to listening to their community, and/or dont care about the issues presented. They'll fix bugs, but as far as providing a balanced experience you can get stuffed. 

Example i will use is Close Air Support. There is a way to play planes in their own undisturbed mode just good ole wings on wings. BUT if you want to play boats, or tanks, players can spawn in their planes as a kind of "kill streak". For me this is what makes the game incredibly unenjoyable sometimes. 

This is totally a "git gud" issue where i cant seem to get good enough at the AA or the planes to prevent CAS from being an extremely frustrating experience. But honestly, after 400+ hours I feel like there should have been some kind of improvement. In a typical match, half of my deaths are from planes i can't do anything about. 

Don't get me wrong, the game has a bug here and there, sometime hit reg can wig out, but those happen 1 out of every 10 games if that for me. I die to CAS minimum twice a match. 

I wouldn't even have an issue with this if there was literally any way for me to use my tanks in Realistic Battles. The only way i can have tank on tank gameplay is to suffer planes. 

My suggestions are two fold: 1. Give a gamemode that allows tank and ship RB without planes. 

2. Buff AA. Give it the ability to get a soft lead on the target at low levels just to make sure more people can make hits. 

If either of these things was implemented i would more than happily change my negative review to positve, because i honestly love the game, i just hate not being able to use my tanks. (and high key the toxic community who's response to any time of CAS criticism is just "Get gud, you suck, use fighters, master AA", etc)

It's a good-looking, smooth and versatile game. And when I say versatile I mean VERSATILE. IMO a must play.

This review is a bit more difficult than "would you recommend this, yes or no?". There are two opposing views when I think of this game, and I'll address them in a bit.

War Thunder is a product of Gaijin Entertainment, a company I am NOT a fan of. My disdain for their company practices began years ago when they silenced members of the War Thunder community (of which I had been a part of a long while ago) who had posted videos of glitches and bugs on Youtube. They would copyright claim people's accounts, and issue penalties against accounts which were associated with these videos. The practice of preventing fair and honest criticism of a product is shady at best, downright dishonest at worst. The public (in my opinion) has a right to voice concerns about the products they consume in any open forum, and that should not be abated. That being said, I understand what Gaijin did was legal, but not every legal action is the correct course of action, and I do not condone their behavior when it comes to suppressing dissenting opinions about "features" in their games.

-----------
The Good:
-----------

- War Thunder is a diverse platform in which several fields of combat take place at once. It is fun to interact with a battlefield where air, land, and sea battles are all taking place at once. 

- The gameplay is short and episodic: You don't have to be tied down for an hour or more in one particular match. You can get in, play through (and kick some ass doing it) and be done with a match in less than 15 minutes. This makes it perfect for when you don't have a lot of time to commit, but you don't want to sit on your hands for 20 minutes.

- The tiers are challenging, but doable: I know, I know about the "Russian bias" and "Power creep" issues (especially with certain premium vehicles), but I find that despite the difficulties, there are not insurmountable problems, and I don't believe every battle should be winnable despite the circumstances. To be frank, I like that not every vehicle can reasonably kill every other vehicle. It makes it more realistic. [ I still think it's bullshit to have almost $1,000 worth of DLC where you can pay-to-win, but we'll get to that. ]

- It's a pretty game: It's very atmospheric and (while you aren't dying) you feel pulled into the environment. Sometimes its nice to test fly around and just look, ya know? And even during combat you get a sense between strafing runs and having your wings sawed off by 12.7 mm fire that someone cared on the design team. I appreciate that.

---------
The Bad:
---------

- I do not appreciate Gaijin as a company for how it operates: This seems like a small criticism, but this issue ALONE meant I hadn't touched this title in over half a decade. I have only recently picked it back up, so time will tell how things go.

- Pay-to-win is not a concept I enjoy. Don't get me wrong, I like playing a game with some difficulty and bite. But if I'm going to put my balls in a vice and squeeze them into a paste, I at least want to feel like that was my choice. Being forced to play with people who credit card-warriored their way onto the battlefield feels less like being indulgent in masochism, than it does indulging my wall in the blood and viscera from my now flattened skull.

- It's disappointing to use "free experience" or whatever they call it to train units, only to see that the conversion takes premium credits to use. This may be a small gripe admittedly, I don't believe that's actually what it's called; but why hang this feature over our heads and then force open our wallets to use the experience we've earned?

- Premium features. I don't appreciate a game requiring recurring purchases to allow for more flexibility and ease of advancement. It's another pay-to-win strategy, and a blatantly obvious one at that. "For a meager investment of [insert money here] you can get [insert time here] where you earn TWICE as much as the peasantry who doesn't spend there money here!" That one's still harsh. (And I have played games from Wargaming, so I've been dealing with that for quite a while.)

-----------------
The Conclusion:
-----------------

War Thunder is a fun (and frustrating) experience for players at all levels. What you might lack in skill you can make up for in boldness and tenacity, and I feel as though the playing field has POTENTIAL for level gameplay (please imagine that POTENTIAL as bolded, italicized, and underlined for extra emphasis: it isn't often enough the case). I recommend the game because it is fun, not because it is my favorite or even that I would suggest it to everyone I know, I probably won't. I have only recently picked the title back up to play with my friends, and I won't likely go further than that. 

If you decide to play it, understand the good and bad (for me) are balanced enough to make this review difficult to swing one way or the other, but not so bad as to make me lean towards "No" on the "Would you recommend this game to other players?" question. 

If anything I've said here has been inaccurate to any degree, please do forgive me, as I've been away for quite some time and have only just started playing it on Steam. This is simply a review I feel ought to be read, but perhaps it is best taken with a grain of salt.

I have been playing this game for a very long time, before they even add the UK or Japan ground vehicles, and I must say that I am very disappointed with the way Gaijin treats it community. I guarantee you that after a while you will stop at tier 3 and everything becomes extremely grindy. You will have to spend money in order for you to progress the tech tree. Not only that, the gameplay is extremely repetitive and unfun for certain nations at certain BR. It is always the same task: drive or fly for 5 minute, dive in, fight people, die, and repeat. Sure that the map have AI and objectives but those are worthless and unfun because you will be shot down very fast if you do those, even if you are a high altitude bomber. I also think that certain nations are very very OP but I am not an expert on that. Gaijin just keeps adding new toys to play but after a while you will see that they all have the same gameplay and do not offer anything new to the game. I will give them credit that they add a lot of nice looking/unique vehicles into the game and nice looking texture, but that is only it.
Overall, if you are looking for a tank and plane game that is nearly realistic and pretty graphic, this is the game for you because WT is sort of the only game out there in the market. But I hope that Gaijin change it ethic and improving the gameplay before it is too late.

Do not play this game
It's addictive, but it's horrible. You will get dragged into it and you will suffer
Please do not make the same mistake I did

Matchmaking is absolutely horrendous. No skill based matchmaking, but tank rating based matchmaking. You will always get matched against enemies at the top of the "Battle Rating" difference, making you extremely underpowered. Premium tanks are incredibly OP in most cases

Map feel horrible. It's just open fields where you get spawn camped from 1 kilometer away

The physics make no sense. Your tanks are made of paper, your 102 mm armor gets penetrated by some piddly 50mm gun, at almost a straight line, not even an angle, and you just explode
While you hit someone directly into their side, scoring a critical hit, but they still keep on driving and shooting like nothing happens
Or you can't even penetrate a flat 50mm surface with your 88mm cannon 
It's absolutely the worst, least logical physics engine I have witnessed in a game.

If you do decide to play, it can be fun until tier 3 tanks. You get decent maps and battles in Tier 1 and 2. Tier 3 is abysmal. No matchmaking and nothing makes sense.
Lower tiers will make it seem like the game is fun. You can get kills, you can die, you can play the objective. ANd that will suck you in. Do not make the same mistake

BUT IF YOU'RE STILL IN THE MOOD... Just choose Russians. Literally no other faction matters. Russian tanks literally beat everything. They get best armor, and even if their armor seems weak, they get some sort of a magical protection. They absolutely dominate everything.
There are so many factions in the game, but Russians are the only actual useable faction. Incredible bias

This game will cause you to lose sleep over the glaring issues with this game. You will have hit registration issues, ghost shells, balance problems, and just plain BS sometimes. You'll lost hundreds of hours grinding for a vehicle just for the tech tree to get moved around and now you have to research something else in order to get to your original vehicle you wanted. You'll die of fires and broken engines before unlocking the modules to fix those issues. You'll suffer at the hands of imbalanced gameplay that is justified by a spreadsheet and player statistics as well as vehicle winrates. You will be on the edge of your seat, playing for that next big rush of seeing "Target destroyed" on your screen and the neuron activation that results from it. You are playing the videogame equivalent of CBT and you will enjoy every second of the pain caused by being bombed from orbit, your ammo detonating in naval, and being hit by invisible missiles in air battles . You will suffer, you will have fun while suffering. Your soul will be sold to this game.


Overall I'd give it a 9/10. Would do again.
