good game, don't listen to people who say it's pay to win. It is very grindy, yes, but you don't need to spend money to get better tanks/planes/boats, paying just makes it go faster. There are premium vehicles that you can get for the funny premium currency, but they are never really objectively better than other options. It can be very fun if you're with friends in a squad, especially in planes.
It will get frustrating in the mid tiers when all the nations discover that you can have round armour that stops bullets, or engines that can actually work, but it's pretty skill based in the end.

It's got pretty realistic physics, or rather, as realistic as a pvp WW2 sim can get. Armour penetration is a thing, tanks and boats don't have health bars but rather thick and thin armour depending on where you shoot the thing, and critical parts can be shot in planes like the engine, fuel tanks, oil coolers etc...

There are also simulator battles, these are better in planes but basically it's like realistic mode, but it's more, well, realistic. VR works in it too which is hecking awesome in plane battles since you are the actual pilot, and not some omipresent entity controlling what the pilot does.

Short explaination of the modes:
Arcade - Your crew is 100% efficient and you have visual aids like penetration crosshairs and longer range of spotting enemies.
Realistic - Your crew is 100% efficient and there are less visual aids; you still have ally player name tags but you go off your knowledge of how to penetrate tanks, and enemies are spotted when they are seen or marked by allies.
Simulator - Just like realistic but your crew are as efficient as you are yourself. There are minimal visual aids and no ally player name tags, so you must go off the knowledge of your tanks and planes in general.

P.S. T-34s are my arch enemy
Ready fun, but it takes time to learn the skill sets before you can actually start defeating your enemies.

If I could describe what War Thunder has become in one short phrase, it would be "An exercise in frustration". 

I've been playing for 7+ years and the game state has progressively gotten worse as Gaijin has insisted on adding more content, or completely and needlessly overhauling its systems, instead of balancing and fixing what it has. What started out as an air battles game with a few nations and a few game modes, with vehicles from WWII and earlier, now has evolved to include ground forces, helicopters, coastal forces, and blue water forces, 3 game modes plus events, and 9 nations with vehicles all the way to current day. Under the correct conditions, this could be a major selling point- in fact, I think Gaijin uses it as such- but, there is a problem: War Thunder is a multiplayer game and there aren't enough players for the absolute glut of content. To "fix" this, the devs compressed the battle ratings, (what determines match making), and now it's entirely possible for a late World War II prototype tank to face a mid-Cold War vehicle with composite armor panels and ATGMs. 

Numerous other issues dot WT, the most game breaking of which usually are fixed in a few weeks (like hovering tracks blocking out your vision while aiming), but others persist for years; many are the result of Gaijin's own discontent with leaving well-enough alone. Volumetric shells and the universal penetration calculator were complete overhauls that threw the balance into chaos and took years to resolve. Mostly. The balance in ground forces, (what I play most), is still dubious, at best, with the same vehicles showing up time and again for the BR. Then, when you think you have one of these easy-mode targets dead-to-rights, War Thunder's most important feature kicks in: RNG.

Don't get me wrong, RNG is the spice of gaming, but WT got carried away and dumped the entire bottle. The RNG and balance issues are so legendarily bad that the suffering they cause are memes unto themselves. Ammo and fuel explosions? Random. The closer to black, the better the chance of an explosion, but there's no guarantee that they'll explode... likewise, a tiny bit of random damage can blow it up. Ricochets? Random to a very high degree. Penetration? Partially random. Destroying barrels and tracks? Because Gaijin made their destruction dependent on impact angle, and movement and server syncing can upset it- yeah, random, more or less. Combine all of this with long repair times in-game and higher ranked battles turn into repair simulators with a distinct sense that the game is trolling you.

This is actually just the tip of the iceberg of the games issues- for instance, the way games are designed to progress via points, along with the nature of match making, make most games horribly one-sided. You either stomp or get stomped. Good games are maybe 1-in-30. Still, the truly sad part is that it doesn't have to be this way. The core game is very good and extremely unique... it's just that the focus, as is typical with Free-to-Play and MMO titles, is more content-oriented over other issues. It needs fixing, it needs balancing; bigger maps for high BR and the decompression of the match making would do wonders. Also, keep in mind, I'm not bashing the devs, but the leadership. Should you choose to play this game, it won't take you long to appreciate just how much content is in it. That it works at all on the old engine it's based on is impressive, but the more content that's added, the harder it will be to truly refine.

the grind is absolutely atrocious, but the gameplay can sometimes be fun as a casual player; grab some friends to make the grind more bearable, and the game just a bit more fun. 

if games that take blood, sweat, and tears to grind don't fancy your niche, don't play this game. i've played for two years and i have not even reached top-tier; given constant breaks, however.

Overall, it's a good game. I think that the fact that a greedy company owns the game must be accepted. The bugs and issues of the game, such as terrible battle rating(BR) balance, "ghost shells", and poor servers must be accepted. The complaints that others issue regarding the game are valid, but do not play the game in a way that mitigates these issues. Notably, not caring about any progression or specific vehicles. Surely the issues persist, but not caring to win the game and messing around with the vehicles at your disposal with friends is the BEST option available to all players. Destroying people in a 2.3 BR vehicle in a 6.0-7.0 BR match is simply put hilarious. In truth, messing around with the players could be the heart of the game, as most join to hate the company that owns the property. I think that a shift in how the game is played is more than likely better for the experience of playing the game as a whole. These words are naive, but the players can make the game more enjoyable. 
Note: It's not worth spending any money on a game that is already free. Sometimes the daily rewards of the game that serves as an incentive for the player to log on will provide multiple opportunities to gain in-game currency, both lions and eagles. So, you could gradually save up to a specific pay-walled vehicle or talisman.

This game can be incredibly frustrating and the learning curve coming from most other games is fairly steep, but it can be extremely rewarding and satisfying when you finally start to understand how the game really works. This game is super grindy, which isn't necessarily a bad thing (personally, that's why I like it), just take into account that the 100+ hours review filter is not really any different than having zero filters. I have 620 hours on this game and I still feel like the majority of the player base that I interact with are more experienced and have more hours than me. With all the time I have spent on this game I still am only at BR 8.0-9.0, I have one 9.7 jet and nothing Higher. Tip for new players: get to know the game with one of the 3 main nations, and then play a smaller nation so that you can complain on the forums about balance issues without completely embarrassing yourself. Just kidding, you should probably stick to the main nations for while if you value fun, or want to reach top tier and have a life. Also playing f2p after BR 5.7 or 6.7 is extremely difficult and I would recommend either stopping there or getting some premium time/premium vehicles.

When providing feedback, posting information, or discussing a product in Steam, whether it’s negative or positive, please make sure you are being relevant, constructive and polite. Developers take feedback from all kinds of sources into account, even though they may not have the time to respond to every post or question.

Please note that Administrators/Moderators reserve the right to change/edit/delete/move/merge any content at any time if they feel it is inappropriate, abusive, or incorrectly categorized.

General Rules

No Backseat Moderating
Let the moderators do the moderating. Backseat moderating is when people who are not moderators try to enforce the forum rules. If you see a person breaking the rules, take advantage of the Report () button or simply ignore the offensive post(s), thread, or review.

Report Posts to Moderators
Should you observe a fellow Community member breaking these rules please report the post or item by clicking the Report () button located on every item, post, and review.

Repeated Offenders
Repeated offenders of the above rules and guidelines will be banned from the Steam Community. Any moderator has the ability to ban a user for violating the rules at their discretion.

As much as I would like to say anything positive about the game in a broader spectrum, I really can't. With the 200+ hours on record, most of that time has more or less been torture in every sense of the word and I'll give you reasons as to why that is.

For whatever reasons unknown to me, I may be lacking historical context of the game as it tries to replicate the realistic part of history from WW1 to the Cold War, there is just problems in the game's mechanics and gameplay that ruin the experience for it. Once reaching the turning point of around 5.0-5.7 BR (if you are a diehard player you know what I mean) things hit the fan so hard that you might as well consider uninstalling the game once you get to it and here's why in one word: Germany.
The German tech tree is in a league of its own, ground vehicles in particular, aircraft have their own strong presence that to the ire of all players who vs German mains, the air firepower is manageable, it's the tanks that ruin it all. Each other country tech tree has it's own unique line of tanks that have strong frontal armor, which is fine, right? Most fights usually will either be forward, front plate vs front plate action or flanking and easy pickings from shooting through the side of the tanks. German tanks in forward combat is horrible to go up against, doesn't matter who you are as most of the tanks in the German tech tree can eat just about any bullet calibre from nearly any main cannon from prominent tanks in the US, Russia, and other tech trees, and spit it right back and kill you and one shot
AND let's not forget that even strong frontal armor tanks have said weaknesses that are reliable to use in dealing with them, long range is a different story but you get the point here, making most tech tree matchups manageable, till you start dealing with the god forsaken Panthers and Tigers, cause for some stupid reason, both of these tanks have stupid front plates that have small, weak spots that are impossible to know about unless you have friends who know how to deal with them as well as hit reliably.

Now lets strike the one thing that Gaijin can't seem to find an answer to, the game economy, I'm sorry but this is just tragic in its own right that if I could provide multiple work arounds to it here I would. But to keep it simple, it sucks and it sucks bad. In the current stage of the game while I make this review, progress is horribly slow now thanks to the reward system. Winning players all get 100% RP (research points) and i believe 47%(?) SL (silver lions) but losing players get only 1/3 of the RP. Let's give a better perspective:
5.3 matchup:
10 kills (ground), 1 air kill, 4 assists, 1 capture, X amount of deaths = roughly close to 4k RP if you are on the winning team
Losing end? Not even 2k
This is also where vehicles in the game are reaching a solid near 50k RP requirement to unlock for purchase and these metrics are estimates and not even consistent, you can achieve far less than that too, making the grind even longer and more painful.

Final thing: Matchmaking
Again, why? In one session of playing I've had 6, again 6, back to back uptiers (1.0 BR higher than your highest BR in your lineup) and the matchmaking is based off of only 2-3 players on your own team having those vehicle BRs in their lineup, how does that make any sense? With such a large playerbase how can I end up with 6 back to back uptiers in the game Gaijin? It makes it just horrible to face off against vehicles a full BR higher than you and expect a good outcome out of it, more often than not it yields a horrible match result. Again, if I could provide some plausible solutions to this here, I would but I will lay out some of the problems I have faced and encountered while playing this. If you want to play this game as a newcomer, you are going to have a painful time learning it, I know I would've if it had not been for my friends helping me from the start.

As of writing I have ~1,400hrs 
Rank 4 for USA, Germany, & Russia
Rank 3 Britain
Rank 2 Japan
Rank 1 Italy
Rank 3 Sweden

...So i have good overall experience with the game but not with higher Ranks, but much of what is endemic to War Thunder carries through...

Pros:
<TARGET DESTROYED>
Low tier battles are good
There are a some fun premiums you can get at reasonable prices

Cons:
Heavy Tanks are often useless in up-tiers and unstoppable in down-tiers
Some Nations have such terrible starting vehicles they will probably put you off from playing them at all (*cough* Italy *cough*)
Revenge Bombing
SPGs being too niche for most situations
WWII vehicles facing Cold War ones

THE REAL PROBLEMS:

Grinding becomes exponentially soul destroying with each passing rank

BR compression is completely unbalanced, should reasonably be </>0.3 br not 1.0

Some vehicles are blatantly at the wrong BR (ex; pvkv III is completely unusable after a 1.0 increase no one asked for)

Many unique vehicles are only attainable via coupons that may go for 100s of $

Grinding upgrades for vehicles is ludicrous. Too many vehicles start with dogshit stats, with rounds that are little more than pebbles while their br is based on a round that will take you an unknown but undoubtedly unfair number of hours to unlock, or will start with crippled engines.

Gameplay is fun for the first rank or two to draw people in only to grow more and more unrewarding and grindy to push people into buying GE.
SL economy and repairs become worse as well.
These issues are drip fed to the player in the hope they will have already become too invested in their sunk cost (if they have already dropped $ on WT) or to push people into buying vehicles and upgrades over time if they are struggling which they almost certainly will be.

this game is fun, so much was put into the game and I have a love hate relationship with this game. out of the 601hrs I have i have bought about 2-3 weeks worth of premium, which has maybe been about 200 hrs of my play time. I have put my time into the Great Britain planes, I have jets up to 9.3 tier. and USA tanks up to 6.0 tier. this game is free which i understand the must have some micro transactions to improve the game and pay staff. the gripe that I have with this game though is that it is EXTREMELY hard to progress without premium. when you get into higher tiers your vehicles repair cost starts to creep up more and more. and eventually around tier 6+ your repair cost can be quite large sum of silver lions (in game currency) to the point where in Air realistic battles you can kill 2 players at the same tier and get shot down your self and lose silver lions in the process. and it get even worse when you get into jets the amount of lions is so small compared to repair cost. I have a jet bomber that has a max repair cost of 15k silver lions, in one game of Realistic battle with premium ( give +50% more silver lions) you get about 5.5k silver lions per base you destroy, if the stars aline you can get 3 bases and earn about 16k silver lions. this is fine if you know how to avoid detection from other fighters which can take you out very easily in jet tiers. and i have a fighter that has a max repair cost of 17k silver lions and destroying an enemy play rewards about 5k silver lions. these tiers are extremely brutal and you have to kill 3 enemy vehicals at the same tier to not lose money if you get shot down this is pretty rare even if you are pretty good at the game. without premium its even worse, you can lose so much and have so little chance to gain. Again I understand that this is a free to play game and the need some sort of in game transactions to keep the game going. the difference between premium and non premium is night and day and often for me some days you can lose so much money in just a couple games. the game is fun, but if you are looking to play for absolute free don't expect to have alot of fun in the high tiers.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

I originally played this on the PS4 and I wasn't too great at flying the planes and would end up getting easily shot down by PC players. But now that I'm on PC, I'm the one doing the shooting down. 

I would recommend this game if you're into tanks, planes, boats and helicopters. It has good game play mechanics and is very easy to learn the controls. The game is constantly full of action and is fun to play on your own or with a bunch of friends.

There is a big grind to get new vehicles which can take days, weeks and months just to get one the higher up the tier levels you go which can get really tedious and tire you out, especially if you're not gaming all the time. Some require you to purchase them, but they don't relativity give the other player a huge advantage in the first 3 tiers as I was able to easily take them down within a few short bursts, but they do eventually give advantages the higher you go.

If you're just a casual player who is looking to play with a plane, boat or tank or someone who doesn't care about levelling up then staying in the first 3 tiers will be great for you since it's not much of a grind and there is still lots of actions.

But if you're the type of person who is more of completionist or wants to get to the top tiers, then I don't recommend this game to you as the grind is far too long and honestly from my opinion it is not worth it as you can have the same fun in the low levels. 

8/10 because of the grind.

To start, I have 300 hours in this game, i am NOT even HALFWAY down a tech tree, although i have tried a couple nations. Unless you have thousands of dollars to throw at the devs, no matter what BR, what nation you play. Russian tanks just win, basically no matter what.

Due to the BR system, the game is practically unplayable at earlier tiers because you go up against people with thousands of hours in the game because they want to bully people with only low-tier. UPDATE: Today i have played roughly 20 games, EVERY SINGLE ONE i was either UP-tiered, meaning going up against LATE WW2, EARLY COLD WAR TANKS going against my sherman with 60mm of armor, or in the ONE GAME I was matched against tanks of my tier, I went up against a 4 stack of players with 55 DAYS on tanks EACH. I have less than 20 hours on tanks btw.

Not to mention the premium tanks that are just better, how can you say that the pay for tanks are not pay to win, when they are literally just a direct upgrade in every way to most of the tanks.



Dont even get me started on the "REALISM" they try to portray. Devs had said before they don't like having concept tanks in the game, such as the mighty german MAUS, UNLESS youre a russian player that is, then you have access to MULTIPLE "CONCEPT" tanks that NEVER have been produced, such as the basically in-penetrable IS-7 which if you even wanted to use would set you back a small fee of $1400 Yes you read that right. FOR A VIRTUAL TANK, THAT WAS NEVER CREATED.

All in all DO NOT DOWNLOAD THIS unless your a millionaire or an UNBALANCED RUSSIAN user.

Gaijin, if you are reading these reviews, please make the economy in this game more practical. Otherwise its a really great game.

This game has its ups and downs

Ups:
#Once you find a tank/plane/ship its really fun
#It Is really good on low grade pc's
#Pretty well balanced
#You choose how to play, and don't have to learn a completly new skill set to play. Want to support your team taking points fast and getting to the back and stoping the flow of enemies on the battle feild, be a light tank, Torpedo Boat, Or fighter. Want to hold points, take out others in one hit? Be a heavy tank, bomber, or battle ship.
#Game gives you a challenge

Downs:
#Its a grind to get to a plane/tank/ship you want, boosters don't help much, and its a long time before you get to even WW2 tanks.
#Not exactly pay to win but, it is incorged a lot.
#When you get up tired, you get up tired, you go from a sherman fighting Panzer 4s, to trying to take on two tiger Ds. 

Overall:
Good game, long grind, better with friends, and over all fun once you find how you like to play.

The game has gotten grindier over the years as they've actually lowered the amount of RP you get each battle. They've also been adding more vehicles in the middle (not at the end where many might not care if they're there) of the tech trees. Additionally, Air RB has gotten sort of BS with how little time you have to play each battle. For reference, battle time was 45min a couple years ago. There's also no historic matchups at all anymore (this one is mostly a personal gripe). It feels like the player skill level has dropped at low battle ratings. Landslide victories seem to happen a lot more. Battle ratings aren't done well for some vehicles and there's compression, meaning you get vehicles you can't deal with at the upper levels a lot of the times. It's an issue for all vehicle types apart from ships. Speaking of ships, game modes aren't well done and ship gameplay is basically just W keying towards the enemy and shooting/torping. AA cannons are king for coastal boats and anything larger is basically a slugfest at range. Maps for all gamemodes haven't been updated in years and they don't introduce new maps for current generation vehicles. All the maps are sized for at most early Cold War era vehicles & anything past that can snipe spawn. Even aircraft get WW2 era maps in late jets a lot of the time, despite the fact that you get to the operating area within a minute or two. There are probably a lot more issues I forgot about, but they compound into a pretty unenjoyable experience, even despite the fact that I've played for years. Can't recommend as someone that has thousands of hours outside of Steam, even though it's basically the only game in it's class.

Good:
Game for many hours of gameplay. Game is more fun in party with friends. Mostly unique nations (some vehicles are copy pasted). Every aircraft, tank. ship (except discontinued vehicles) are obtainable with Free2play account. I only invested 7 euros just to buy 20d premius time (only research and currency booster). You can earn Gaijin coin through events and selling event items (some are more grindy). Main price from events are around 60 GJN which is 1x 60 euros premium pack with vehicles and premium time. Premium vehicles and time will ease your grind with nations.

Bad:
Few things unbalanced. Major bugs like ghost shell and desync are still present. Devs are braindead when buffing/nerfing stuff. Repair costs dont make sense. F2P - players are not that good/competetive. Aircrafts, ships and helicopters have their own gamemodes but tanks have to play mixed battles with aircrafts where players will just kamikaze revenge kill you with bombing aircraft.

Overall:
Good F2P game to play with friends. You can get bit competetive in some squadrons. No need to invest huge pile of money into this game (PLEASE DO NOT) but some do. You will find low level players without skill and knowledge of the game using premium vehicles on high tier degrading team PvP a bit.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Welcome to BugThunder, now with stuttering to ruin your experience even further. If you want to play this game for the ground battles, forget about it. I mostly played ground battles, so I'm gonna talk just about them. They are quite literally the most painful part of the game. Beyond the fact that players can put giant bushes onto their tanks, the balance is awful. Especially when it comes to less popular nations like France. But the icing on the cake which will make you throw your mouse and break your keyboard are planes. You will get bombed back to your garage once enemy players get salty or run out of tanks almost every game. And there's little to nothing you can do about it, especially in low ranks where anti-aircraft vehicles have their crew completely exposed and their firepower can't outmatch the planes' firepower and manoeuvrability. (R e a l l y neat way to convince new players to keep playing your game. /s) And even if they don't bomb you, the plane's engines will scream above your head for the entire second half of every game no matter where they are in the sky, thing which completely ruins the experience and also gets in the way of hearing the engines of the vehicles around you on the ground. Besides all of that, bugs and shitty mechanics will be a thing every game session. Tank shells disappear in thin air when shooting at certain small parts on enemy vehicles like machine guns or side skirts (because Gaijin is too lazy to not make them physical objects on which shells bounce and waste all of their penetration). There's also the chance of enemy tanks randomly disappearing for a second or two, but that happens very rarely. The stuttering problem is relatively new and, for the love of God, I hope they prioritize fixing it. That's about all I have to say. I hope ya'll enjoy trying out the game tho, it does have its good parts.

War Thunder allows Seal Clubbing. The game allows level 100 players to match up against level 10 players. It's serious abuse, and WT can stop it via their match maker. Let the level 100 players play each other and allow the new players to actually LEARN how to play rather than die near instantly after spawning. 

Players with 1,000's of hours of battles should NOT be pitted against someone who is trying to learn the game.

A fun and skilled/luck based game with a toxic yet fun community. The worst is for sure the grind however in my opinion the best is low to mid tier so I dont mind that much. Dont expect modern or even cold war when you first get this because unless you use real money you got years ahead of interwar and WW2 of tanks and planes. However even with its faults, cant knock it too much, its free after all and compared to World of Tanks, I dont regret staying here. Learning about what to shoot, where to shoot, where and when to drop bombs and rockets. Its something else and get such a dopamine rush seeing those burning wrecks with 8 kills and 0 deaths. I can't guarantee you'll have a great time, even at 1.5k hours I still don't at times but those moments that you actually do it. Bouncing shot after shot, kill after kill, feel like a true tanker or pilot is something else. This will be a game you either fail and quit or fail and become the next addict for the snail.

Not recommended. If you're looking for a game with proper balance, this isn't it. Gaijin are notorious for pay to win games. However, the game play seems entirely random. By random i mean: shooting a light tank with a tank destroyer 7 times with nothing but critical and regular hits, only for the light tank to repair, adjust its turret, and destroy me first hit. I've hit tanks in the green area for criticals, and I've hit tanks in the red areas (Do not shoot, too much armor) for one shot kills. The game is entirely random and I've died in one hit more to players who paid for elite tanks, than I have to players who play entirely free. In other words, the creators lean more toward players who will pay for their in-game extras (though I don't blame them for doing so, money runs the world). Each update seems to become less and less balanced, hens the randomness. Planes can kill tanks very easily in ground battles, but in air battles, you barely do any damage to ground targets. While flying planes, any pilot with an elite aircraft will have no problem picking you off. You can throttle down, menouver as much as you want, one they are behind you, there is no shaking them. Pilots and ground crew alike will pass out or become knocked out even if the shell or bullet clips an area of your vehicle that makes no sense, ie: A shell ran through the back corner of my vehicle and went all the way through, killing just the loader sitting in the back. This resulted in my entire crew getting knocked out somehow? A bullet clipped my aircraft's landing gear and my pilot passed out? A tank shell bounced off the bottom of my tank and into the ground, knocked out my entire crew without actually penetrating the tank? What i'm saying is, sure, real war is most likely pure luck, so if you enjoy dying from pure luck, this is your game. But if you want something more balanced, this isn't it. You will be shaking your head in confusion more than anything else per game hour.

To best describe this game in my opinion would either be A) Cock & Ball Torture or B) a free to play in disguise. What do I mean by both? Well for A it depends on who you are playing as a nation, your patience and lastly how much money you are willing to spend. If you are a new player choosing Japan as a F2P player you are going to want to uninstall in about 3 days. On the other Hand if you are one of the big 3 (USA, Russia, Germany) and spend about 60 dollars it will be relatively painless*. Why? Well for starters War thunder is not a beginner friendly game, pro players are able to get into matches with new players which is not a fun time, not saying there should be the ungodly system known as SBMM but there should be a limit on how many tanks a pro should be able to take into the field. Second, any nations that aren't the big 3 except for china are mostly disregarded by the devs so balancing is bad with them and some of the trees are disorganized, empty, or have bad BR gaps. Lastly and linking to B this game is not meant to be a F2P, the devs intended almost every player to get at least 1 premium top tier tank, it is mentally straining to play the game spending no money due to how P2W it is. If you are planning to play this or get back into it I would highly recommend buying a premium tank from top tree.

If you plan to play only 1 nation (or 2) and dont care about pro-russian balance propaganda about their vehicles, then this game is for you. 
For everyone else, who is playing ANYTHING ELSE that is not russian army you are just wasting your time. 
The russian bias was a long live meme going on in this community, however since 2020 it became to be real thing and you are going to find it the hard way once you invest hundreds of $ and hours into the game. 
Russia has:
The highest win rate at top tier (and many other tiers besides).
The most vehicles.
The lowest repair costs.
Some of the best vehicles in their class (MiG-23MLD, MiG-27K, Ka-52, Tunguska, etc).
Even when they don't have a best in class vehicle, they are still very competitive (T-80BVM).
Artificial buffs to soviet vehicles, such as the lack of spall on top tier tanks.
Completely under tiered vehicles like the BMP-2M and PT-76-57.

History has shown us time and time again that people, even within large organisations, do not always behave rationally.
The Russian government is a totalitarian state, their interference cannot be ruled out. War Thunder serves as an excellent tool for propaganda, it wouldn't do well for the Russian military if it appeared weak. Speculation, but one based on sound logic.

I am not the one complaining about balance in the game often, but when it comes to such ridiculous length then i cannot be bothered to play this sht anymore.

[h1] Is War Thunder worth your time? [/h1]

[b] Well that depends on what you're looking for... [/b]
So if you don't mind time-sink MMO's, then you may be in the ball park here per say, cause you should not come into this game expecting a quick time investment, this is for all intents and purposes a long form game, like WOW as an example, you will not be able to complete this game without years of investment put into it. Though you can play this game more casually, it should also be understood how difficult it is, and how time consuming it can be to grind up a tech tree. That all said, you also need [u] enjoy the gameplay. [/u]

[h1] Gameplay [/h1]

The game is simple, relatively speaking, theres multiple gamemodes, but as I am mostly a ground player (realistic) I will be speaking from that front, with my limited time in air battles I can say that its definitely what the game was created around, and may be more your speed compared to ground, its a lot faster paced than ground usually, at least in arcade battles, Realistic air battles feature one-life gameplay, meaning you die, you leave, while arcade lets you use your full lineup. 
[b] Speaking of lineups [/b] in this game you unlock vehicles to fight with, you do this by accumulating enough research points for a vehicle of your choosing in the tech tree, its like a skill-tree looking system, you then buy it with the games free currency, silver lions. Vehicles get more expensive and grindy the further you go up, with the technology and time period advancing from pre-ish Ww2 to modern day mbt's. Once you buy a vehicle, you also have to buy that vehicles modifications, a vehicle is basically terrible without them so... Better grind em' up! I consider buying a vehicle, buying half of its effectiveness, you have to grind the rest of the vehicles maximum effectiveness by purchasing its modifications, these also add to vehicle repair cost, every time a vehicle is destroyed you have to repair it, these can get insanely expensive, and often lead you to not making any progress cause of how expensive they are... You can buy premium time to make more rewards per match to make up for this, with real money.

Naval is kind of dead, but you can still likely find matches for it, theres also helicopters so thats something, mind you those are insanely grindy of themselves...

However, the game is simple, you have objectives to go fight for and defend, you get punished very intensely for making mistakes, in fact, if you screw up simply by mispositioning whether in air or ground, its very common you'll just die... In ground often times in one shot. Do not enter this game expecting tanks to be tanky, you should behave like a squishy boy, even if you're in a heavy tank. The games vehicles are all ranked, higher ranks meaning advancements in history and thus usually better vehicles, you can get uptiered at least 2 tiers up from where you are... So thats uh, frustrating, this game is frustrating, using a realism vehicle damage module, meaning you have to either destroy the vehicle or pick the crew out, every part is present in a vehicle and can be destroyed, in ground you usually will find the crew knockouts or ammo ignitions are the most common ways of death dealing. Arcade is recommended for beginners, realistic in my opinion is basically the real game though, but to each their own. You will struggle with this game at first, not knowing where to shoot people to kill them, and the game can be janky as hell on occasion. Map design usually sucks, with enemies firing into your spawn from [u] THEIR [/u] spawn.

[h1] Is it pay 2 win? [/h1]

Kinda? Not really? Depends, but to say throwing money at the game will not give any advantage isn't true, but to say its egregious is also not true, it varies from circumstance to circumstance honestly. But to explain.

Gaijin likes money, so of course they'll do the typical game company thing and release a new shiny, op vehicle, and of course to get it you have to spend golden eagles, the games premium currency you get by spending real money. Besides packs and all that you buy and steam, you'll be able to purchase premium vehicles that make the grind easier with better rewards, you also don't have to buy any modifications for your vehicles. They'll then nerf these vehicles after. Theres also bushes, the most obvious pay to win mechanic in the game, they really are that deceptively good, you buy them with real money, put them on your vehicle, sit in a tree line with some bushes, and you are essentially invisible, bonus points for turning your engine off. You can also use bushes to cover up your vehicles weakpoint, or mask its front profile, making it difficult to destroy, more so than usual depending on vehicle. This is either as frustrating as it sounds, or MORE frustrating than it sounds. 

[h1] Conclusion? [/h1]

Try it yourself, its free, but consider the points in the review, if you like the game, I'd say its really not so bad. I wish I could give a maybe recommendation, but I'd say if you like grindy MMO-like games and war vehicles, and the realistic styled mechanics are your cup of tea, then yeah I'd recommend it.

[b] Pros [/b]
[*] Unique gameplay systems
[*] Lots of vehicle variety
[*] Lots of nations to choose from for all your nationalist needs.
[*] Active community and dev team
[*] Very good graphics
[*] Can be very fun and satisfying like no other game in some cases.
[*] Game is well optimized, and servers are usually good.
[*] I've hardly seen cheaters present in this game
[*] Lots of nice in-depth mechanics

[b] Cons [/b]
[*] Grindy 
[*] Pretty bad sound design
[*] Predatory monetization 
[*] Can be insanely frustrating
[*] Can be addictive, which could also sort of be a good thing.
[*] Minor pay to win features
[*] Lopsided dev additions, Naval staying kind of ignored, minor tech trees not getting the attention the major ones get despite already being the best tech trees in-game.
[*] Balance can be kind of a state of mind, aka, poo.
[*] Players can be pretty toxic, worth mentioning.
[*] Servers and optimization as said before, can be really good, but sometimes its trash, and its frustrating as heck.
[*] Ground battles specifically, has this terrible balancing between aircraft and ground vehicles, you can play both, and honestly aircraft can be great, like getting a Maus in a 6.7 match, a vehicle so unbalanced you can't even get it anymore! You can bomb it to avoid it just carrying the match... Though usually aircraft don't fit in well, and they feel more like a F-U button, like a random punch in the back of the head, and they just aren't balanced for ground, SPAA's, which can shoot them down, and other countermeasures are not as effective as they could be in terms of taking them down, so I think I need to mention that for ground mode specifically, they have been the result of MOST of my grievances with the game in all honesty.

The game is filled with bugs that devs do not care to fix.
Opening a support ticket is a waste of time because support proceeds to ignore what you tell them and continues with classical "update the graphics driver, verify integrity, allow it through the firewall, block background programs" and other pattern BS that:
a) Never works.
b) Keeps getting repeated even when you tell the support in advance that you've already done all that.

As for the gameplay itself - it is awesome at first...
... and then you start playing at the higher tiers.

You'd expect noobs to camp in corners on lower tiers, but no. It is the opposite.
The utterly grindy economy model forces players to preserve tanks in order to earn in-game currency that allows you to progress. The result? Well.

Camping is gameplay.
Baseraping is the only tactics of the winning team.
Playing alone is a waste of resources and time because you'll get ganked by 4-player-squad clan butt-buddies 10/10 times.

That's it. Skill play is locked to first 2 (lowest) tiers. You can actually experience enemies making maneuvers there, the gameplay is vivid and based around skill and realtime decision making.

You'll experience the best the game has to offer within 2 days of playing the game. Then you can delete it and downvote on Steam.

I am a 58 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

You have similar titles like WoT, DCS, IL2, etc, but they don't offer the same variety of gameplay or selection of vehicles and they're either too arcadey or way too technical. There is not really anything positive to say about the game other than that it is the only Tank game on the market that is even worth playing since all other competitors just have infinitely worse in-game systems and gameplay mechanics (looking at you World of tanks and your 'spotting' and 'stealth' systems). For instance, it is easy to tell Devs put no effort into balancing maps, to be specific, spawn locations. The only thing that seems balanced in this game is the Gun/shell systems. There is no spawn protection or anything to stop the enemy team from killing you as soon as you pop into the game. If your team loses the first battle from the initial spawn for a match there isn't a point in continuing to play a match since the enemy team will push your spawn and get into positions to shoot at your spawn before you have a chance to respawn and take a proper position to not get shot at in spawn. It seems that EVERY SPAWN location in this game is in AN OPEN FIELD often times can be shot at from several locations from elsewhere in the map. This is a serious design flaw in any of WT's maps. Why not add cover to the spawns? buildings? ruins? Anything? There just is no way to justify this poor design choice. It's hard to believe that this game is almost 10 years old and the devs can't design any quality maps or balance them properly.

GRIND IS REAL in this game if you are an average free to play gamer and not a pay to win gamer

First of all, the "free to play" tag is a wee bit missleading, paying for premium time/premium vehicles is encouraged by Gaijin and most experienced players as it significantly speeds up the grind and helps you stay afloat (it certainly isn't a necessity, but highly useful)

Second point, you will (I certainly have) want to punch a wall or uninstall this game a few times while playing, so get some friends and joke about it, it's hard, and I've certainly wanted to throw my pc out of the window more then once, but the game keeps drawing me back to click that big, red, shiny "to battle" button.

Third point, this isn't a massively demanding game on the hardware (mentally? oh yes, the learning curve is pretty steep)and it can be run on some pretty basic systems, which to Gaijin's credit, means that they have a much more forgiving game then some other MMO's

Forth point, this game has a pretty steep learning curve, and as such I would recommend grinding your first nation naturally, from tiers 1 to 7 (if top tier is your goal, it isn't for some people) and then diversifying into other nations. I would strongly recommend against buying a top tier premium straight away, or even before you've gotten to that tier in-game, since you end up being more of a burden to your team then anything else.

I would recommend it as it 100% has some rewarding and funny moments, but it can be a bit rage inducing at times

War Thunder is a great game on the surface, with it's stunning graphics and interesting gameplay. But don't be fooled, this game will suck your wallet dry and leave you feeling a plethora of emotions from angry to upset, in possibly the most effective way I have ever seen in the history of freemium games.

The process begins, and you pick whatever nation you want to play, as you are thrust into the world of War Thunder. Initially the game starts off rather well, you see that you are able to progress, starting at the biplanes in the interwar period (1920s-1930s), and eventually being able to progress to the jets of the 1960s-70s. The first two ranks are a breeze as you swiftly progress through them, releasing dopamine into your brain eventually forming an addiction, as you progress with ease through the second rank you reach Rank 3, it is here where the problems arise.

Planes here have started to become more expensive and a lot harder to grind, it is around this rank that you will consider buying a membership for a premium account, this can cost £7 (roughly) for a week of premium. From here it becomes even harder to progress, but it is still manageable to play the game, once you are done with Rank 3, a fairly arduous grind but nothing unmanageable you will reach Rank 4, things here are more expensive and it only gets worse as you climb, repair costs for your vehicles start to increase and soon enough the game gets more difficult as the skill level begins to go higher and higher. I find that here there is a wall where premium accounts are a must buy for people who want to progress at all due to repair costs being too high to handle even if you get a kill in a match.

Once you reach Rank 5 (jets) you notice a sudden change in the game, you are all of a sudden being paired with jets that are a whole rank above you, this is due to a little thing called BR compression which players complain about, but Gaijin (the company) refuse to fix. Due to this br compression you will be matched against planes that have a much higher skill than you and ultimately you will die a lot more than you did in previous ranks, the repair costs start to stack up even more here as you are finding it way too difficult to kill a single thing and some people who are less skilled than others will opt to buy more money so they can buy planes that will hopefully be easier for them to play.

You can clearly see the pattern that things only get worse from here on out.

For people who want to progress quickly through trees, they have the option to buy premium vehicles which cost varying amounts depending on ranks, (roughly £7 for Rank 1 and roughly £50 for Rank 6). Gaijin presents these premium accounts and vehicles as optional but unless you want to go through a slow grind, (I remember seeing someone say over 400 days to grind out a single tree without a premium account), you pretty much have to buy a premium account.

The devs from what I've seen and in my experience don't listen to the community at all, look back to the issue of BR compression which they refuse to fix.

There are also the allegations that the devs have a Russian bias, being that they are a Russian company, which makes the Russian vehicles better, (the T34 is literally made from Minecraft bedrock, I've seen a friend take several shots without dying and a bomb dropped practically on top of him which only destroyed his tracks.) I've also seen that the Russian repair costs are much lower, with British rank 5 jets costing around 13-15k SL and Russian jets costing a mere 6k.

If you value your wallet, I'd recommend you don't play this game.

Heute kann man diese Maschinen gar nicht mehr anfassen, da sie gegen Jets antreten müssen, welche mit Lenkwaffen ausgestattet und deutlich schneller sind. Von Panzern will ich gar nicht anfangen. ATGMs vom Hubschrauber und absolut idiotische Schadenskalkulationen mindern immer wieder den Spielspaß und spätestens wenn es ein 105mm Sabot mal wieder nicht durch die Seite eines BMP3 schafft, weil eine dünne Metallplatte in ihrer breite als massives Stahlteil berechnet wird oder wenn (wie heute) ein Holzflieger vom Typ Yak-9 einen direkten Treffer mit einer 75mm APHE Granate übersteht, möchte man einfach nur noch in die Tastatur beißen.

Der Fortschritt im Technologiebaum geht recht schnell voran, man kann recht schnell neue Fahrzeuge freischalten ... wenn man in den niederen Tiers spielt. Sobald es dann in die Richtung BR 8.0 und höher geht, wird der Fortschritt dermaßen langsam, dass man schneller einen anderen Tree auf 8.0 hochgezogen hat, als ein neues Fahrzeug über 8.0 freizuschalten. Liegt aber zum Teil auch daran, dass die Reparaturkosten irgendwann so durch die Decke schießen, dass man sich seine guten Fahrzeuge einfach nicht mehr leisen kann auf Dauer. Es sei denn, man kauft Premium.

Achja. Außerdem bewegt man sich schon seit Jahren immer weiter Stück für Stück in Richtung Pay to Win. Aber wer 60 Euro für nen Panzer ausgeben und dann nochmal 3 Euro für jeden Zweig zur Tarnung drauflegen möchte, ist hier absolut richtig.

Let's be clear here. I play this game and there are times that I enjoy it. I plan on putting in more time after I post this review. However, the baseline on whether a review should be positive or negative, as described by Steam itself, is "Would you recommend this to other players?"

Simply put, no, I would not. 

Having played the Air battles, Ground battles, and even dabbled a bit in the Naval battles, I can say that War Thunder wants most of all to present a 'realistic' portrayal of combat. Ground battles being the gamemode I have the most experience in by far, I will be discussing them in particular. I obviously do not know enough to rate how 'realistic' it actually is, so instead I will rate this as any reviewer should: As a game. Meant to elicit fun. 

Put simply, this game is just terrible for anyone looking to just play a game. There's horrible grind not just to unlock new vehicles, but to have any chance of surviving in said vehicles as they do not by default have the ability to repair themselves nor the ability to put out fires (fires particularly will kill your tank if allowed to burn). The feeling of unlocking a new tank is always followed by "ugh now I have to unlock all the modifications for it to be remotely playable." 

Compounding this issue is that there are threats that most ground vehicles are utterly incapable of dealing with to any reasonable capacity, namely, planes. You would think in a game mode titled "Ground" you wouldn't have to deal with anything in the air, but nope, you would be wrong, because artificially inserting aircraft gameplay into game modes it has no business being in is a War Thunder core design concept. While ground vehicles being able to get air support is realistic, the simple fact is when I'm playing Ground battles - and particularly Ground Arcade, literally not meant to be realistic but rather a just-for-fun gamemode that still earns in-game currency and research - I want to fight other ground vehicles, not worry about being bombed instantaneously upon leaving my spawn.

Which brings up another serious issue that the developers have abjectly refused to do anything about for years - spawncamping. Maps in the ground arcade and realistic game modes will have at most 2 spawn points. If those two spawn points are both being camped by somebody with a tank capable of getting kills, you are screwed and may as well leave the match. 

AA vehicles are also a contentious point, because while their individual shells are generally far less powerful than a shell fired from a tank cannon, their general combination of extremely high mobility, extremely high fire rate, extremely high turret traverse rate (how fast the turret can turn relative to the chassis of the vehicle) and lots of ammo storage makes them in many situations more lethal than actual tanks. This is while AA vehicles at most BRs fail to make a dent on the enemy planes because, simply put, hitting a plane at all is extremely difficult without proximity-detonating ammo, which is unavailable for the majority of AA vehicles. Therefore the natural conclusion is to hop in an AA and run riot over the battlefield, rolling over enemies one after the other because unless somebody actually manages to kill you before you remove their ability to retaliate in any one of a half-dozen ways, you'll get away scot free.

And it's important to address the reason why they get away scot free as well. Unless you are playing with friends in a voice chat, you do not have teammates in this game. The game will tell you that you have teammates. They will show on the map in blue (by default) icons. However, there is a reason War Thunder players have a saying of "teammates are just enemies in blue." See, while winning matches gets you bonuses, individual kills/assists and capturing points give currency and research. Therefore, """friendly""" players are incentivized more to shoot at enemy tanks than actually defend or support their allies to any degree, even if they are not actually working towards winning the match by doing so. A good example is the common situation of your team not bothering to defend already-captured points in favor of attempting to camp the enemy spawn. This means that if you are being shot at by an enemy tank and are on your last legs, trying to repair your tank, generally any nearby allies will ignore you entirely and only try to shoot the enemy, leaving you to die so they can snag the kill. The game reinforces this behavior by having kills be far more valuable than assisting a teammate with repairing etc. 

One could argue - and many have argued - that many of these issues could be fixed by just having a game mode that doesn't have planes at all. Then you're not dealing with bomb-spamming, AA vehicles have no right nor reason to be there and as a result could be safely shifted up in BR as reasonable for the purposes of said game mode or banned outright, and it's entirely based on your skill in defeating enemy tanks with well-aimed and well-timed shots, not who has the best plane. However, given that the War Thunder community has been asking for this for literal years, and the developers have studiously ignored this request for this length of time, I doubt this will ever occur. 

The game is free to play, but that's too expensive for the amount of frustration it will give you.

I am a 58 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

[h1]Why you should not play War Thunder[/h1]


*To make this review a bit more interesting, you could try taking a shot every time the word vehicle is mentioned*


As of now I have spent almost 200 hours on this game.

I do not think you should waste your time, and definitely not your money on this game.
Here is why.

[list]
    [*]Gameplay
    [*]Micro-transactions & Pay to Win/Play Mechanics
[/list]

[b]Gameplay[/b]
First off is the grind. This is what the whole game is centred around, and this is what you will spend most of your time doing.

[b]Lineup[/b]
Before entering a match you can select a lineup of low tier vehicles, designated with the "Reserve" battle rating (BR).
Each vehicle has a BR which determines the rank of you and your enemies vehicles. This also helps to indicate what era the vehicles belong to. However this is not always the case, I will get into further detail later.

Your lineup starts with two open slots, to which one vehicle can be assigned.
You can purchase a few slots for Silver Lions (SL), which is the normal currency in the game.
However, if you then want to purchase even more slots, these will have to be bought using Golden Eagles (GE) which is a premium currency you will need to spend real money on obtaining. I will get into more detail later.


[b]Game modes[/b]
You have the option to play either "Arcade" or "Realistic" game modes with either aeroplanes, ground vehicles, helicopters or ships.

Arcade is as the name suggests this mode is more arcade-like.
Here you get aim assistance which works by either letting you know how far to lead ahead on planes, or where to aim on a tank to be able to penetrate its armour.

Besides this, close enemies are also marked with a red outline.

Vehicles also move faster, and tanks for example will move their turrets faster as well.
This is to entice a quicker way to play the game. This will earn you less currency (SL) and less research point (RP) when compared to "Realistic"
RP is used to research the next vehicle with a higher BR.


Realistic on the other hand attempts to be a more serious way to play the game, and the one which me and many others have spent the majority of our time.

In this game mode the vehicles behave in a slower and more realistic way.
You will not have any aim assistance, or outlines on enemy vehicles.


[b]Balance[/b]
Here is where my first issue with this game arises.
The game will match you up with other players based on your lineups BR, which is determined based on the vehicle with the highest BR. Here the game will either "Up Tier", "Down Tier" or "Evenly Tier" you against enemies.

This is in place to assert some sort of balance to the gameplay.
However in its current state it is far from perfect.

It is worth noting that based on my own experience, it seems more likely that you will be up-tiered in most matches.

One example being up-tiered in WW2 vehicles by getting matched up with cold war era vehicles, instead of other WW2 vehicles.

Since there are big leaps between these two era's when it comes to technology and performance, the cold war vehicles have a big advantage. This is obvious and leads to a bad experience for whoever got down-tired.

Of course this would be acceptable if we were talking about early WW2 vehicles vs late WW2. 


Now in Gaijin’s defence, this is most likely necessary in order to get people into matches faster, instead of spending a long time in queues.

However the community has complained about this for years, with nothing being done by the developers.


[b]Hit Registration[/b]
My second complaint is with the hit registration in the game.
You fire your weapon and if you hit an enemy, a small window will display what happened to the enemy you shot, and whether or not the vehicle’s modules were damaged or if the vehicle was destroyed.

During this moment the system will also calculate whether or not the shot penetrated the enemy's armour. Here a phenomenon known as “getting gaijined” comes up. There are many examples of this online, and it basically boils down to you hitting an enemy in a spot you expect to penetrate. But the game decides that you didn’t.


[b]Good Parts of The Gameplay[/b]
Now there are of course also good moments in this game, which is what has kept me from uninstalling it so far.

Getting into evenly or up-tiered matches, and straight up just being lucky does make this game feel good.
However I believe that the developers have managed to refine these types of matches, so there is just far enough between them for you to keep your interest in the game.


[b]Micro-transactions & Pay to Win/Play Mechanics[/b]
Now this part of the review ties into the gameplay, since the main goal of this game is to reach the top tier vehicles, the developers decided to include micro-transactions.

These include the following.

[list]
    [*]Golden Eagles
    [*]Premium Account
    [*]Premium Vehicles
    [*]Convertible RP
[/list]

[b]Golden Eagles[/b]
The GE currency is used to speed up your grind, or to give you an advantage over your enemy.

Here is a price comparison of the amount of GE you can buy in-game.

[table]
    [tr]
        [th]Golden Eagle Amount
[/th]
        [th]Price in EUR[/th]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]150[/td]
        [td]0.99[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]1000[/td]
        [td]6.6[/td]
    [/tr]
    [tr]
        [td]2500[/td]
        [td]16.5[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
        [td]5000[/td]
        [td]33[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
        [td]10000[/td]
        [td]66[/td]
[/tr]
[tr]
        [td]250000[/td]
        [td]165[/td]
    [/tr]
[/table]

Price per GE is 0.0066 EUR

To speed up your grind, the GE can be spent on instantly unlocking extra equipment for your vehicle, purchasing 3D camouflage to make important parts of your ground vehicles hidden, and also make you harder to spot.

[b]Premium Account[/b]
Buy spending either real money, or GE you can purchase a premium account status.

This will currently give you the following bonuses.

+100% RP gain from all game modes.
+50% SL for *active actions in **random battles.
+100% SL reward for battle time in **random battles.
+50% SL from other game modes.

* Active actions are all you do ingame, like capturing a point or destroying an enemy.
** Random battles are modes inside the arcade and realistic

Besides these benefits you also increase the amount of missions, which gives rewards.
You are allowed to exclude some maps from you map pool.
You get an extra 2 slots for stickers on you vehicles (not camouflages)

[b]Premium Vehicles[/b]
Premium Vehicles give +100% RP and 2x more SL, and can be bought for GE.

A high tier premium vehicle will set you back around 60+ EUR

Do also keep in mind that if said premium vehicle is in let’s say tier 5 and you are researching a tier 7 vehicle then the amount of RP awarded towards that vehicle will be diminished, just as it would with a regular tier 5 vehicle.

[b]Convertible RP[/b]
This part ties into the part about GE.
At the end of each battle when you are rewarded, you will also save up some convertible RP.
This can be spent freely on research of any vehicle, at the cost of GE. 1 GE = 45 RP.

This is set in place to entice people to spend real money to skip the last part of your grind for a new vehicle, by unlocking it a little faster.


[b]Conclusion[/b]
The concept of this game is great, but is executed in a very bad way, and entices people to spend a lot of real money in order to progress at a reasonable pace.

My only reason for still playing this game, is that there really is no better alternative out there.
World of Tanks is an option, and is perhaps better or worse in some aspects. It is a game I have also spend a lot of hours in, but not one that I would recommend either. These games are both equally frustrating and equally money hungry.

My advice is to save your mentantly and wallet from this excuse of a free to play game, and find something better to spend your time on.

I hope you all have a great day :)

I've been playing this since 2016. I thoroughly enjoy it, but in order to enjoy it, don't worry about the grind...just have fun playing in each tier. Every tier has it's own pros and cons for gameplay...but if you only want to play top tier and buy a single premium vehicle to try to grind a whole tree...you're going to have a bad time. If you just jump in with premium, you are going to get clobbered by people who have been playing for a long time and have superior knowledge from maps and techniques, to weak spots on specific vehicles. Mid-tier is probably the most well balanced and fun, around the 4.7 to 6.3 mark. The grind is long, but it's not a game that's designed for you to have everything instantly.

Wow. Just wow. This game is a big pile of shit. War Thunder is the worst of the military games out there; heck, I have more fun staring at a wall than playing this piece of shit game.

You can tell the the developers spent a lot of time making sure people experience the play-to-win model of the game and to have the terrible experience of grinding out pointless vehicles for thousands of hours. Here are some examples of what I am talking about:
1. You only need to play with no brain to have a good time playing this game, which means you can feel no emotion as you are insta-killed across the map.
2. [REDACTED FOR HAVING GOOD OPINION]
3. [REDACTED FOR HAVING GOOD OPINION]
4. [REDACTED FOR HAVING GOOD OPINION]
5. [REDACTED FOR HAVING GOOD OPINION]
6. [REDACTED FOR HAVING GOOD OPINION]
With that in mind, the game is simple enough that my 5 year old nephew was able to figure it out how bad it is after a few rounds..
Course design is brilliant and immersive, not to easy or difficult, plenty of fun and beautiful landscapes to get lost in. Furthermore, the online community is shit; the first person i played with was a grandpa with ptsd from World War 2, who knew the games inaccuracies like the back of his hand, he literally told me how much he hates life after playing this game.

There are hidden Germans on every course, lots of fun!

To conclude, this is a terrible game priced quite low for what i normally expect out of free title. Worth selling my soul to play - a steal if on you get it on sale. What are you waiting for? Play literally anything else! Better to spend thousands of hours in your life doing something not as degenerate as this shit.

Very hit or miss game. It has many strengths and weaknesses but overall pretty enjoyable, especially if you dig "realism" and war. Its worth picking up and trying out, and if you get into the game, here are some suggestions. First, make your keybinds comfortable. Second, if you want to spend money on this game to ease your grinding, buy premium account time first, its worth it and its pretty cheap. Third, DON'T BUY TOP TIER PREMIUMS! Limit yourself to nothing more than rank 4 for premiums until you have at least 100 hours on the game. This will make life way better because your tm8s wont be upset about you being absolute trash and dead weight. Also you won't get destroyed every match if you buy a lower tier premium. You also get a huge research point penalty if you research low tier vehicles with a top tier premium. I said what all needs to be said, enjoy the grind fellow comrades, and I'll see you on the battlefield.

I played this game a lot on xbox and then crossed over to PC to start over. I have a few things to say...

I know I have the experience so playing is much more than someone starting out. As an experienced player, I've pretty much unlocked all T1 tanks for Italy, China, and more than half in Germany without much effort in less than 6 hours and that's decent. So unlocking tanks isn't that hard IF you know what you're doing. Even in T2 and T3. It doesn't take that much effort if you play for medals. The best I can recommend? Play the tutorials no matter what your combat focus (air, land or sea) but do them all and pay attention. They are dry, but they do help - and you get rewarded generously for doing them in-game. 

Secondly? For tankers - Your enjoyment as equally as your frustration hinges on the Battle rating on the tanks you field. If you field a 1.5 battle rating or higher tank in all slots the odds of you facing tanks that are tier 2 or better are increased. And this is bad for people who aren't prepared to face it because your T1 tanks (or just tier 1 fewer tank level) are hot garbage against higher tier tanks. With some heat rounds, the right maneuvering, getting in close, and the distraction of your piers getting decimated, you might be able to take one out if you know precisely where the weak points are - but don't count on it.

For Flyers - don't kamakazi ground units while playing in ground warfare. It looks cool - but it doesn't work.

For Navy players... what can I say other than your going to likely be terrible at it until your not.

For all Players: Always unlock the repair stuff and crew replacement stuff first. Nothing is more frustrating than dying in a fire, or sinking in your own ship, because you don't have someone to fix it.

And this is why I will recommend this... Keep your overall battle rating low if you don't want to fight the next tier higher vehicle more often than not. Mix up your composition, don't just take the best vehicles you have all the time or your just going to face things you can't beat.

Thousands of highly detailed combat vehicles like Destroyers, Gun Boats, Biplanes, Tanks, Gun Trucks, and iconic Aircraft from WW2. Invite friends in game for realistic flights in every theater from WW2.


Don't start out paying and jump up in classes. You will get overpowered by pay to play people.  
SOLUTION: Enjoy the game and earn upgrades at a normal pace and you will stay in the class with equal combat vehicles. 
When you start paying to get that Spitfire or Mustang on your first day, the pay to pay players who have maxed out that class will be zeroed in on you. 

If you want to experience great 30 minute missions like flying in formation escorting bombers over the English channel, the single player or invite your friends missions vs the computer are just outstanding fun.

Remember: Just level up like we used to do before micro transactions!

The battle ships and ocean combat in this game is GREAT.  So many ships and boats to choose from from all over the world. Firing the main guns on a destroyer, huge guns and  shells from 15km for example gives the feeling of ocean shaking explosions. 


Pros:
- Super fun combat at any skill level. From slow 100mph dog fights in biplanes to bombing enemy city from 30,000 feet in a flying fortress. (I love playing the tail gunner and knocking the fighters out the sky)
- Open ocean battleship combat is so much fun with 1000's of real ships and boats from every country in WW2
- The game is very educational. I see all these Tanks, Trucks, Ships, Boats, Planes and then watch them on TV documentaries or read about them in the In Game Wiki. 
- The game is updated and patched frequently and has a very active player base.
-  Fantastic and realistic graphics and animations. 
-  Entry level skill to realistic simulator  settings easy to swap around and experiment 

Cons:
- Turn down the in game voices (they become repetitive and sound dated) example: "Serves him right" When you shoot a tank for example"  Whats your status? On Time and On Target"  while in the plane. 
- Would like to see more single player battleship and tank content ( I haven't see it all yet at 360 hours of game play)

Presently the game allows planes into tank battles too early on.  Once planes are in, it is very hard to survive a tank game, which should primarily be tank on tank.  The balance of power between planes and tanks is very uneven.  Especially when they are bombing spawn areas.  If planes are to be allowed in tank battles, then there should be AI anti-aircraft positions at the spawn areas.
In addition, when going into a game with a highest BR of , e.g. 6.3 you shouldn't end up playing against vehicles of more than one or two BR's above you.  You should not have a 6.3 max BR vehicle fighting against 8.3 BR vehicles
game is very unevenly balanced when tanks vs aircraft.

The repair mechanic is awful.
I am not nearly close to late game and I already have to wait hours for my plane to get repaired. If you repair your vehicles by paying silver lions you get no progress. That means either way you lose...
Except you buy *premium time* or *premium vehicles* to magically boost your progress.
If you are willing to pay for this game, it might be actually fun.
But for me even if I really had fun playing this game, I just can't play enough of it because of this stupid mechanic.
For that reason I have uninstalled this game and don't want to touch it again until this problem gets fixed someway someday.
If I am mistaken for something, please correct me, but I think there isn't anything I go so wrong about, that this review isn't viable.

Edit: I just improved my grammar and nothing else in this review.

Also don't forget about the UPTIERS that happen...chilling in my A-10(Br 9.7) and this massive F-14A(Br 11.3) Tomcat comes by me at MACH 2 and I get thrown into a flat spin and die.

PLAY THIS GAME AT YOUR OWN RISK.

I add a new reason to why you shouldn't play this game, when i get killed by something bullshit.

Buttons in the menus sometimes don't work. the most infamous is the leave queue button. when you start a queue, a cancel queue button would appear it its place (as you would expect), pressing that button to leave the queue is like playing the lottery, sometimes you can leave the queue, sometimes it puts you in a match. The fact that they cant even fix a cancel queue bug for 10 years is amazing. Shows that devs dong give a shit.

Bushes are a pay to win expect of the game that makes it ridiculously annoying to fight against. Bushes break up the tank silhouette, and makes it hard to distinguish what tank you are playing and where its weak spot is. sometimes it can just the tank almost invisible if you are in a jungle map. The only way to get the bushes is to either buy it for real money, or to grind everyday doing incredibly annoying missions to get it. FYI, instead of nerfing bushes, devs made it so that as the match goes on the bushes gets dirty, which makes it fit better into the surrounding as some bushes are bright green, which might not be good in a dessert map, but as the match goes on, the bush become brown and make it impossible to see the tank from afar.

Please do not play this game. game devs want money so much i feel sad that they are not embarrassed by the tactics they used to try and get money from your wallet.


The only reason this game is famous is cause it has a monopoly in the market. Its the only "war simulator" that is somewhat realistic, without being full realistic like needing to memories a manual to fly a plane, but.

The latest update is the best reason on why u shouldn't play this game. Instead of balancing and fixing the game, they decided to add shiny vehicles to earn more money. When asked why drones are added to the game, their response was, "caused its a part of the modern battle field", no one asked for it, people prefer balancing but instead shit like this is what they do.

This is the shittest game you will ever play in your entire life, with constant bugs, glitches in the game. Devs more focus on changing sound every other day, causing sound bugs,. Removing helpful features, making more premium vehicles, which are overpowered and hidden behind a pay wall. Bombarding you with message about how your premium account has expired. This is [b]not a free[/b] game, every time you die you pay a repair cost. from the in-game currency, which is used to pay for new vehicles and modifications. The repair cost is outstandingly expensive so is the price of vehicles that u have to grind for hours to get 1 vehicle, but a way to counteract this is by spending real money. Balancing is hilariously trash, with certain vehicles fighting way easier targets while other have to fight other. This is especially true with premium vehicles. The devs will not listen to your advise to fix the game, if you want a war simulator like game, go find another game and save your time, money and effort.
