Gaijin has set up a system SO inefficient to try to force people into paying premium. 
There is a reason why you will get tons of XP boosters and you will receive Silver Lion boosters MUCH less often. It's the same reason you get a 100% boost to XP if you buy premium and only a 50% boost to Silver Lions. 

Everything that comes out in the game has this mission of inefficiency in mind. New jets will come out to encourage people to spend money, not to improve the game. It's like a mobile app game just with more controls. Pay to win, different packs you can buy, planes you can only get if you pay real money. 

People have spent hundreds of dollars on a SINGLE airplane... But it IS free to play, insanely fun in matches, and you will climb to rank 4 planes pretty quickly. But after that, it's a CRAWL and premium is not cheap. For the money you could spend on another great game or two, $30, you get 3 months. You can only buy premium with golden eagles which is what you buy with real money. They funnel everything through Golden Eagles except the planes you literally have to fork over like $60 minimum for anything useful and in a useful tier. 

It is a cruel, blatantly inefficient game of progression. But hey, if you buy premium, you can put 4 stickers on your plane instead of 2. Gaijin doesn't even allow comments on any of their updates. Hmm... I wonder why. I just wanted to see what people had to say and Gaijin doesn't even allow that. There wouldn't be reviews if the game wasn't sold by a bigger and better company.

overall a very grindy game, however the combat makes sense (most times), visuals are stunning, many planes,ships,tanks etc, to choose from making yourself stronger and leveling up in this game makes sense, needing to play games for research, hence the grindy part. this game can be fun on your own or with friends, everything in this game is great with controls like planes turning at a reasonable rate, guns jamming, and only being able to shoot in one direction; in front of you. tanks turn slowly and give the game a bit of suspense not knowing of you will be shot during this time, bouncing up and down over hills will make your tanks cannon move along with the tank itself,not just locking it wherever you had it last,you can also turn your entire tank to make the cannon turn in the direction you want it to go even though it might be risky, however doing this could get you the advantage on your target. You cannot get the tanks cannon to go up completely, however they add a machine gun to most tanks in order to to shoot other tanks while reloading or shoot planes out of the air to support teammates, tanks also have crew members even if one or two are eliminated the others will still keep the tank going, this is one of the ways to eliminate enemies and the most common. The other ways are to target engines on tanks being much harder to do, but engines are not the only part of the tank that can be damaged, cannons, tracks, radiators, etc. can be damaged. Another way to destroy a tank is by hitting ammo, this makes the ammo explode most times killing all cremates inside the tank. this is my best detailed review of tanks and planes I hope this helps

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Well.. It's a great and beautiful game - can't argue with that - but if you aren't ready for the grind then this game is not for you. Despite being free to play, it takes year(s) of commitment and active playing to get to the top-tier tanks and planes. If you want to get straight at the modern warfare stuff, you probably gonna have to play thousands of dollars per playable country (idk haven't done the math, just felt right).

I started playing this game since its early days and still haven't got into any of the top-tier stuff with any of the countries (haven't even committed in any other than USSR, Germany and Allies...)

But all in all, great game, great fun, but nothing compared to the IL-2 Sturmovik game series when it comes to sounds and simulation.

The quality of the game is decent and some of the battles can be fun, even if the game modes are basically just skirmish. However the reason I give the thumbs down currently is that the silver grind has gotten so bad you have to have BOTH a premium vehicle, premium time AND perform above the 50% mark to make any silver ingame. Otherwise you will ether not earn enough to cover the cost of a loss or you will only make like a few hundred silver when just selecting a crew for your new tank can be in the 120 000 silver cost AFTER you just payed 500 000 silver to get it...

Therefor I recommend people saying away from the game until such changes.
Those that say you can do this and that to earn disantly might be correct, but what they fail to tell you is that you BOTH have to have luck on your side (using gambles tokens etc) and to be skilled. Some of the tokens basically means you have to be in the top 5 to earn anything.

Even with premium time and premium vehicles, both air and ground, I have about 10 mid tier German aircrafts (no jets) I havent unlocked because I just dont have the silver to do so and that is in the context that I actually do perform well often.

In short, if you suck at video games. You can techincally pay 50EUR for a high tier premium vehicle and only be "allowed" to play it 30 lives (because you get 30 free repairs) before you are locked out for days because you lack silver to repair it. That shouldnt be possible, if you ask me, but it IS in WarThunder.

While I play this from time to time. I would recommend people that have never played to save yourself the hassle. Spend your money on another game and get more in return. WarThunder borders to a mobile game in pay 2 play.

Although I do not have the amount of playing hours as other players do, I have thoroughly enjoyed unlocking all the mods for both planes and tanks. Something that I've learned is that you just gotta play for fun. If it's not fun, take a break or play something else. Don't try to actively grind for a specific vehicle, just play for fun and casually unlock stuff. This game has consumed me, with over half my play time being in the last two weeks. I think a lot of credit has to go to Gaijin creating this game with VR support. I have tried the VR mode with my HTC Vive and it's crazy that I get to experience all the planes I have unlocked in VR. The grind sucks and I think the game is mostly enjoyed in low BR tier vehicles.

A God awful game with an unquenchable thirst for a Russian Bias. The physics are terrible and the tick rate is disgustingly bad. (The tick rate controls the latency of player movement.) They treat your common signing into the game as a joke, given you trivial rewards for signing in multiple times daily. I, as of writing this, am on my ~150th day of signing in, and I have gotten 150 Golden Eagles. That is the only thing worth mentioning. 

The games armor penetration stats are unrealistic and unpredictable. Planes get hit without a round colliding with them (TICK RATE!) You also can't change the round in your cannon breech without firing the already loaded round, because that totally makes sense. 
Ships are balanced terribly. 
Tanks are balanced terribly, and there are tanks that shouldn't be in the game, such as Artillery Vehicles, which are commonly found on the FRONT LINES! (They shouldn't be.) As well as tanks that were prototypes, such as the KV-220. And for the cherry on top: the German prototype Panzer VIII (The Maus) was removed on the fact that it was a prototype. Lovely, right? The Russian Bias prevails in many aspects of the game.
They allow spawn camping in their design, and do nothing about those who do it constantly. Last game, I was spawn camped twice and it has been this way for the 5 years I have played. The total ignorance of this serious problem says a lot about the developers, and is an absolutely disgusting oversight.

Also, planes and artillery is allowed in every game, for every player, on almost every tank; which is extraordinarily stupid. Artillery is spammed by every player who has it, which is impossible for one artillery battery to undertake. Planes bomb you all of the time, in ridiculous places and anyone can use them. They need a new TDM or domination game mode without PLANES AND ARTY! My Lord, how is that too much to ask for?
Modern tanks and planes fight WWII tanks in planes quite commonly. In an ME 262, it is possible to be hit by an Air to Air Missile, which the plane cannot defend against.
Ranking does not exist, so vet players can drop from max tier to min tier and kill everyone, usually by spawn camping.
The grind is also awful, requiring you to spend an exorbitant amount of money, causing the game to slowly become unfun. 

I could go on for thousands and thousands of characters, but I haven't the time or the brain capacity to comprehend this abhorrent pay to win video game.
I have played for 5 years across PS4 and PC, I still play it because it's addicting, but I hate most of the time I spend on it.


 TLDR:
Bad armor pen stats.
Prototype tanks are only allowed if they're bad or Russian.
A severe Russian bias is prevalent throughout the game.
You can't change rounds or mags in tanks without firing.
Their servers and their development of maps is terrible which allow you to be sniped and nudged forwards, allowing people to kill you easily, even from across the map and through rocks/buildings.
Their allowance of spawn kills and planes in every tank battle is blatant and obvious.
You fight modern tanks and planes at some points with WWII tanks.
Non-existent and prototype tanks are only allowed if they're garbage or Russian.
Players are allowed to spam planes and arty, causing death around every corner.
There is no ranking, so max level vets can play against noobs.
Awful grind that almost requires the spending of money.
Spawn camping is unbelievably common, and they won't do anything about it.
And they don't reward you well for playing the game regularly.

Gaijin only cares about money. They care not of their player base. Money is the only thing that matters to them.

This is my first ever Negative Review on a Game... I love Aircrafts and the Military in general a lot, so to be able to see some cool Aircrafts, Tanks and Ships that they occupy is Pretty Cool!

One Problem I have is the Grind... U have to Grind OVER 250 Hours just to get POSSIBLY get 1 Jet. Don't you think that is Insanely Absurd?! I'm not saying the games mechanics aren't bad as I have played a lot on console but its just the aspect of the grind that is ridiculous.

If this game just had a friendly match mode where you could use any aircraft and battle your friends all together then I would probably give this game a 7/10 but since it has RIDICULOUS LEVELING AND PROGRESSION I just Do not think that this game is worth sinking time into. 

You might as-well play DCS World or VTOL VR as they offer a much better experience and can either be realistic or not. 

My final review for this game is a 3/10.

War Thunder. Its quite an experience. Is the game fun? No. Can you have fun playing this game? Yes absolutely. However there is so many things that are just frustrating about the game that really detract from it. One of the biggest ones is having to fight tanks a whole tier above yours which happens to me and can happen to others almost every game. This wouldn't be terrible if you could have the choice but unfortunately no matter what you don't have a choice. So you have armor that works great at your rank and oh look now your armor is pointless. Then there is the planes oh boy that's fun. I want to play a nice game of ground warfare and oh look I just got bombed, pretty much happens every time I spawn.So instead of having two separate ones like ground only and mixed battles where you can play both planes and tanks that would be fine but instead you are yet again without a choice. There are just too many things that are frustrating about this game to list, this is already more of a rant than a review at this point. So if you have literally nothing else to do and are an extreme masochist who likes torturing other masochists then you might as well try War Thunder.

Don't get me wrong, War thunder is, or at least could be a good game. Decent graphics, more variability between arcade and simulation as World of Tanks. And I also understand, that F2P games need to earn money somehow. But man, in WT it's just ridicolous.

I mostly played tank arcarde battles, sometimes plane battles. I rarely advanced to rank3/5.0 ratings and got stuck there. It takes an eternity to advance farer. Guess I will never see the high rank vehicles, which are shown in fancy influencer videos...
(Please notice that I already pay premium account, to double research points - it's like 10€/month which seems an accaptable abonement price).

Gaijin for sure offers you options to advance faster, by buying premium vehicles or convert more research points. But: 60€ for ONE f***** tank? 60€, seriously?
Ppl are complaining about Diablo Immortal, but games like WT leveld the way for time. That math was already done: Buying all premium vehicles would cost > 8k €. I couldn't figure out costs for converting points for normal vehicles, but should be way above 8k (not easy to calculate as it depends on your repair costs and success in missions).

This is just crazy. Dear gaming industry, please decide: Give me a decent game for an acceptable price OR give me an acceptable abonement offer, were I can access all parts of the game in relatable time.

War Thunder gives me neither. It let me pay for a de-facto abosystem(premium account to advance faster, but far away from fast enough) and requests ridicolous prices for A SINGLE VEHICLE. Prices can go up to 150€. I can get two full AAA games and some smaller indies for the price of one WT-tank, wtf. Shit like this is destroying gaming industry. 
Ain't anybody has time for this (grind).

The economy and balance in this game is terrible. Repair costs can put you into an economic downspiral, and you can consistently face tanks/aircraft a full tier above your lineup. For example, I am currently running the 1944-49 American heavy tank lineup (T34, T26s) and it is impossible to learn how to play them because you cannot *gain* silver lions without having a full on 3.0 K.D, which is absolutely ridiculous. Not only that, but I get matched against Type 61s and Leopard 1s - both of which have HEATFS rounds which can oneshot any of my tanks AND are far faster than my tank.

Map design is also terrible - large open maps may sound good in theory but in reality it can very quickly prevent one team from leaving spawn, and devolves into a sniping standoff in which most tanks don't get enough barrel depression in order to even be able to get anywhere. City maps have good design in general, would like to see larger ones if possible.

This game has greatly affected me on a emotional, physical, spiritual, cognitive and financial level. I no longer even find joy in killing enemies on the other team, the short lived joy from the tiny squirt of dopamine that was once released isn't released anymore. I only find mild solice in the thought that killing an enemy will be bringing upon them the hardships this game has bought upon me. This game will turn you into a masochist in where the only pleasure you will find in playing this game will be derived from the pain you will receive by playing it.

A game I have been playing, on and off, for a long time. Although a lot different from when I started, and with it's flaws, it is a great game if given the patience to learn and progress.

It is a long, grind type game. So if that is not your taste, then will likely not be to your taste. But if you do not mind grinding, and like the WW2 time period, at least for the majority of the game, then it is at least worth a try. It is free after all.

Not pay to win, but certainly pay to progress faster. Premium account does allow for you to research new tanks at a MUCH faster rate, but nothing that cant be done buy spending nothing, although the grind can get pretty insane in late game... one of its major flaws.

I'd say it is one of, if not the best War sim out there and is worth a try if you are interested

if you can't sit and grind a game for hours upon hours to reach the tip of the top on each tree, this isn't for you. If you can't handle games without health bars and displays upon which you can see your own and enemy health and stats, this isn't for you. If you dislike games that require you to be precise with your aim, require you to rely on teammates, or games that are relatively slow paced, this once again, is not for you. War Thunder is FREE to play, though pay to win in a definite number of ways, ultimately there are ways around it even for the poor man and the high schooler alike, it's got fairly decent graphics, even as far as great at the max if you can run it, the tanks are few and far between in terms of likeness, but accurate and an experience to learn and master. Me and my family have enjoyed this game both together and with friends we've made and simply joined squads with, from before ground when it was just planes this game was a blast, give the game until Tier 3 in a nation, also definitely try italy because they're fast and they f**kin deliver the pain pizzas. If you decide you really invest in this game, don't spend money on it until there's a good sale on golden eagles, then grab around 10000, ideally this sale will include premium days, because you want to buy 365 days of premium for cheap, honest to god the best thing you to can for yourself well before buying a premium tank is the on sale premium, life is much easier when you're not free to play. *This isn't to say F2P is impossible, honestly it's slow and tedious, and you could always buy a talisman (basically the 100% booster a tank you have to buy has) for a free tank that you really like at any time instead of the cost of buying a tank on its own

If you like tank warfare, War Thunder is the way to go. Combat is more realistic than World of Tanks.  WOT gives each tank a hit point pool that must be depleted to kill it.  WT is all about shot placement.  One good shot wrecks a tank. You have to play to your tanks strengths and be aware of its weaknesses.  Learn to use cover and angle your armor to bounce enemy shots.  Research is a bit of a pain, but if you purchase a premium tank, it will go much faster. Don't level up one line faster than another. Once you cross into the next tier, all your battles will be in that tier.

As much as i enjoy the tank combat i can't recommend you get into war thunder unless you want hundreds of hours of misery and endless grinding. Ive put a little over 380 hrs into WT on PC and probably about the same back on console. Sure it might seem fun at first but once you get around to 5.0 BR (battle rating) you'll really start to see the grind and Gaijins predatory monetization, they will feed off of your frustrations by tempting you with premium and premium tanks. The BR Compression is absolute dog water and is an issue they will skate around. So while War Thunder can be very fun especially with friends it can be very volatile with your highs being pretty high but your lows being down right desk smashing rage inducing. Id have to give it a 5/10. It has a lot of promise and could be very good and it is at times but it falls short because of the devs being greedy and stubborn, they will be the death of their own game

This game is Heroin. You know it's bad for you, you know it is slowly destroying you from the inside out but you want it. You want more. You're sat there at work scratching your arms, clicking your fingers, thinking about the next hit - hmmm my next plane is 46,000 research and that's only around 40 more matches away, maybe less if I play really well. You get in, you fly, you've foolishly decided to play an interesting nation and then your tail is cut off in one burst of gunfire from a highly overrated American plane. You swear and throw your headset across the room, accidentally killing your cat - but you just click the next plane in your roster. Back in. Let's try again. You manage to get a kill and you feel the hot flow of dopamine hit your brain, you want more. You need more. You feel like if you stop nothing will be the same. I've been an alcoholic and quitting that was harder than not playing this game. 9/10.

Game currency is Silver Lions this is earned by completing battles. All the upgrades cost Lions, as does ammo replenishment and vehicle repairs. I have been playing ground forces so by the time you get to rank 3 vehicles if you do not play well you end up paying out more than you get in. This is after you have used the free repairs, so if you do not have enough Lions for repair you have to wait hours for it to be done. As you progress everything costs more so the only way I can see to get further is to spend a shed load of real money, and that is not going to be done by me.

The grind is very hard yes but between low tier vehicles, and event vehicles (there are some that are very easy to acquire if you play at the right time of the year), there is enough easily accessible content for anyone to enjoy the game. It's up to you if you want to unlock higher tiers.

The problems with pay-to-win and cheaters are real, but fairly minor. Premium vehicles and camos generally don't offer an advantage, but bushed up tanks are very annoying. And most "cheaters" that people complain about are not actually cheaters, just good players, but a few cheaters do exist. The biggest problem is tank spawncamping, because of lazy map design that Gaijin has no apparent intention of fixing.

BR compression is mostly not a problem, despite the whining from other players. Only the highest tier heavy cruisers/battleships and jet planes face excessive BR compression.

If you buy some gold and play tank battles, I recommend that the very first thing you buy is extra crew slots and crew XP for your favorite nation(s). It will be a big help, in the long run more important than premium time or anything else.

(I have way more hours in this game, just not on Steam.)

Pros:
- Tank models are nice

Cons:
- Hits sometimes don't register
- Graphic settings massively impact how good you do in the game
- Objective based gameplay is horrible / executed badly
- Balance is non-existent (there are several battle ranks where you get up-tiered so much that you barely do anything to most tanks)
- In game economy makes playing high tiers extremely hard without premium + premium vehicles

Well here I am with five thousand hours, and I now look back to where I came from to get here other than a lot of great memories and used up time. 

If you are interested in a semi arcade, semi tank sim game and you have plenty of extra time and money this is it. The game has many pros to it, the massive amount of vehicles, interesting mechanics, and a fun repetitive loop of combat. It also has many cons, the massive amount of grind needed to get anywhere, the skill level needed to grind efficiently, map knowledge, compression etc. There are plenty of videos on YouTube discussing these topics and I would suggest viewing them if you are interested. 

However I don't think that much about what makes a game good or bad, as you can generally feel it once you've sunk some time into it. Since War Thunder is free to play I would suggest to download it and give it a go, albeit that you are likely interested in top tier game-play which you can't try out early on.I would suggest enjoying the game at your own pace, trying new things out as they interest you; and if you get bored you can always wait for the next update or event. 

Things you should consider is that if you are interested in grinding is purchasing some Premium time which very helpful for grinding, if not almost required. I would suggest getting a couple friends, a squad, or joining a Clan as they can give some great moments like world war mode. I heavily suggest learning at your own pace, and enjoying the process to top tier rather than top tier itself, as if you only grind for top tier you will burn out.

This game is full of issues, though many players such as I still love playing it. Why is this? I genuinely don't have the perfect answer for it, because its just such a complex answer. If anything, it's probably that the game is a one-of-the-kind combined arms vehicle combat simulator. One moment I could be on the ground in a self-propelled howitzer helping my team out by taking out super-protected targets, and the next moment i'm in a fighter taking down enemy CAS. That kind of game play just doesn't exist anywhere else (at least from what i understand), and for that reason it is THE game that players like myself enjoy playing. Another part of it too is just how simple though realistic the game is too. Instead of big health bars that float above enemy vehicles, you have to take out individual components of the vehicle in order to deal damage. You also are able to control an aircraft with nothing but your mouse, and the way you can do it too is super intuitive and easy to use. Things like that is why i believe we as a player base love this game.

However, We as a community also hate this game, for many reasons. While I understand that programming is a difficult task to do (I program things myself) Many bugs exist in this game that are obvious and should not have made it past the development stage of each patch due to how common and obvious they are. One thing I will concede to Gaijin however is how they are actively fixing many bugs and making many things more historical, and from the time this Review is published there have been 56 patches that address many bugs, including the obvious ones. Another problem with the game too, is just how monetized it is. A single vehicle can cost $60, the same as a vehicle in DCS, though DCS vehicles have so much more to them than a War Thunder vehicle. These vehicles however can be more than powerful on the field when used by the right person, though ruin entire matches soon after a sale, when new players get into a vehicle with an insanely high skill floor. 
Yet another problem with the game is the game play itself. It has gotten incredibly stale over the years, for example there is only 2 match types for ground battles over the almost 10 years that the game has existed. Sure there are new maps that you can play on, but capping one or three points doesn't change much no matter the fancy new visuals (not to mention some maps are just absolutely awful to play on). This can be remedied of course by adding new game modes, but it is unlikely that Gaijin will do such a thing.

So in short; The game is a one of a kind, and is fun to play if you DON'T take it seriously or try to grind. However, the game's monopoly on the combined arms multi generation vehicle combat genre has led to painful monetization, poor implementation, and stale game play.

Only buy this game if you want to play as russian tanks. Gaijin has been struggling for far too long to make this game polished and unfortunately has completely destroyed the ability to play as any other tech tree. The game has a repair system very similar to World of Tanks and for some reason they decided to make tanks cost more based on "potential" instead of statistic. Heavy weight tanks are obviously going to be more expensive as a result of being able to take more shots... but no, they decided that (particularly the british) the tanks would have repair costs based on active win ratios of global players. As a result, some of the most unplayable british tanks are insanely expensive to repair, such as the fv4005, fv4202, and the conway are all tanks that CANNOT survive a single shot from anything else in the tier, but they all cost 6k+ silver lions to repair. If you want the context of what silver lions are worth, Russian tanks in the same rank that are heavier and much more strategically advantageous, cost 2 to 3k less. such as the SU 122. which might even be a higher rank ffs.

The best part is how painfully obviously garbage this system is. Because higher rank vehicles are as cheap, if not cheaper than where I am at right now. I cannot progress in the British tech tree because it loses me so much money.
I am also progressing in the Isreali, and german tech trees, and I just do not have the same problem.
The inflation of repair is most notable when comparing the German and russian tanks, with any other tech tree. If they really do want to keep announcing regular "its fixed!" updates, then they can start by making the game playable. In the meantime, im just gonna play world of tanks. IT TRULY IS EMBARRASSING how poorly thought out this game is.

If you're only in it for planes then your good. The developers care only for aviation and that section of the game is very good. No complaints there.

EDIT: This game seems to have a community VASTLY superior to WoT... therefore I am going to move back to it... GG.

[h1]Best war vehicle simulator at the core, worst game and community on the outside. [/h1]

 That is pretty much the TL;DR. Without sugar coating - this game isn't worth your time/money/nerves. Any positive review for this game you see is from a player who either didn't play this game enough or is one of the people who are ruining this game, there is no in-between.

 There were several attempts at writing this review and honestly I could never summarize my hate for the community, moderators, developers and anyone related to this game. So instead, I'll just explain with my experience playing as a Japanese nation main.

 I've beta-tested this game both in aircraft and airplanes, hence I did try several nations before settling on Japan. Japan is a minor nation, Gaijin (developers of the game) hate minor nations, especially Japan for some reason. They [developers] disregard balance and only appeal to major nations, because those have the most paying customers. To give you a few examples:
[b]1)[/b]
[b]A6M2 Model 11[/b]
[b]Nation:[/b] Japan
[b]Battle Rating:[/b] 3.7 (BR is a number used by the matchmaker to make "balanced" fights)
[b]Introduced:[/b] 1940
[b]Survivability:[/b] no armour, no speed, relying only on the ability to turnfight
[b]Armament (that matters anyways):[/b] two 20mm cannons with 60 rounds each 
[b]Repairs and Gains:[/b] Repair Cost 3165; 90% money payouts and 130% research gain

[b]P-51C-10 Mustang[/b]
[b]Nation:[/b] USA
[b]Battle Rating:[/b] 3.7
[b]Introduced:[/b] 1942
[b]Survivability:[/b] decent armour, a lot of speed, bad at turnfights (not that they need them anyways)
[b]Armament:[/b] four 12.7mm MGs with 280-350 rounds each
[b]Repairs and Gains:[/b] Repair Cost 2888; 130% money payouts and 136% research gain

These are stats for 2 aircraft for [b]Realistic[/b] Air Battles. This is what Gaijin considers to be Realistic and fair to both sides. 

[b]2)[/b]
 And that problem is at a decently low Battle Ratings. Some time ago when I wasn't playing Gaijin decided: "You know what? We need more money, let's sell overpowered vehicles!" and so they started doing that. Unfortunately, that wasn't enough, so they said: "How about overpowered premiums of the highest rank in the game that could be bought by any noob and essentially ruin the gameplay for everyone?". Those decisions now plague high Battle Ratings. If you spend enough money - you can get a jet plane that's faster, more maneuverable, has better guns, has countermeasures, cheaty rockets in comparison to any "normal" jet at same BR; same goes for tanks. Essentially you get a pay-to-win vehicle that might as well be considered a cheat. (Sidenote: 80% of players at BR 8.7-10.7 in Air Battles are using a p2w vehicle, it's extremely not fun)

[b]3)[/b]
 With all that in mind - imagine if a player without a real life (usually 10+ thousand battles) takes a premium of a major nation. Yes, the match becomes utter garbage. And you know what? You can't curse at him, because you'll get reported and moderators (who are probably without a real life either) will mute you for 15 days. Think about it for a second: [b]in a game that heavily relies on chat communication, because developers weren't smart enough to make good chat commands; in a game that has 18+ pinups; in a game that has a built-in chat filter that's enabled by default; you can get muted for 15 days because you cursed at a player that was ruining your game experience by abusing pay-to-win[/b]

 These examples unfortunately don't even begin to uncover all the problems this game has, but the review will be too long and more of a rant otherwise. You can't complain to Gaijin about any of the above, because they don't care, will probably ban you and delete your post or just completely ignore it. The Gaijin that made War Thunder a decade ago isn't the same Gaijin we see today. It's full of greedy people nurturing a community that can't play without paying and essentially killing the game.

It's very addictive and has very good graphics and is very detailed. But when you get into a game you'll probably get frustrated by the unbalanced matches and unfair deaths. It's very pay to win and progressing in the game takes ages. I never bought premium and after 2000 hours I've not even come close to unlocking a modern tank. Maybe if you're willing to put loads of time and money into the game as well as having a quite powerful computer and actually focusing on becoming a very skilled player you'll have more fun than frustration, but I decided that despite the frequent urge to play the game, it isn't worth it as I always feel worse after playing. Now I get to sit back and laugh every time the player base complains about each new update somehow making the game worse. It's very clear Gaijin doesn't care about its players, and each decision it makes actively makes the game worse, so personally I can't recommend wasting your time on this game no matter how attractive it looks. It's a great concept with terrible execution.

Game has some annoying issues..

- Pay to win... but that's to be expected
- Not very balanced, there's a lot of imbalance in the maps and the tanks.
- The maps are pretty bad, not as bad as in World of Tanks but still...
- The lighting in this game is really awful. Shadows are way too dark but the snow burn your eyes.
- Nuclear sun. I get a lot of nuclear sun maps which are awful and most of the time unfair for the team that has to fight while looking at it.
- It's a grind to get anywhere. This may depend on your personal preference if you like this or not.
- 6.0 and up I almost exclusively get uptiers
- Air battles are incredibly boring, it takes a lot of time taking of and flying to battle. I try grinding my planes in ground RB but that takes a long time.
- Spaghetti code. The game is 10 years old it's to be expected that it's not very well optimised, and it isn't. I go from 140 FPS to 60 often, which is annoying.

I have to say one thing, I haven't played 7.0+ BR, but from what I've heard it's not great compared to lower BR's.

Should you play War Thunder? 
Absolutely it's a lot of fun.

Gaijin is a lazy, greedy developer and Warthunder is an example of why a monopoly is bad for the product and consumer.

Problems with the game.

-Arbitrary 'Balance' decisions based on average player performance rather than actual vehicle performance. The same vehicle can have different BR and repair costs because the average player performance is higher in that nation.

-Similator mode forgotten about. Teamkilling is unavoidable because many nations have clones of the same vehicle.

-Flight and Damage models are often dodgy and never get fixed because the developer is focussed on making new content rather than polishing the game they have.

-Repetitive gameplay and non-existant map design. 

-Matchmaking BR compression is laughable. Vehicles designed the 40's regularly face vehicles from the 70's LOL

-The devs have nerfed the income in recent patches  and the above mentioned vehicle costs make progression impossible unless you Kill multiple enemies per death which hilariously will over time increase the repair cost for the vehicle. What a joke.

-The high repair costs and low rewards incentivises a cowardly base rushing and campy play-style in groundbattles and Kill mobbing like the seagull scene in Finding Nemo in Airbattles. 

-The Gaijin store requires you to spend money within a year to use it even if you have spent $100's in the past and came back to the game after a hiatus.

-If you measure the grind by event rewards playing this game is effectively like working half american minimum wage.

The game is simply not fun to play and the company has earned the right to go out of business as soon as competition emerges. Gaijin has straddled this niche and should be punished for their short term money grubbing mindset.
I would not recommend this game to anyone who hasnt played it for years in the past and unlocked vehicles from before the RP system.  The time investment and grind simply is not worth it. Go outside, touch grass, find love and live a real life.

Arcade is highly recommended to start out. Realistic does give you more in terms of rewards, but you have to play it knowing you can be one shot, or shot down by anywhere. Blindly rushing any objective can end poorly 9 times out of 10. Work with your team, join a clan or platoon and learn from them. They have good tips and tricks. For tank battles I can't recommend using binos and range finders enough. They are helpful and can save you from being sniped from across the map. Don't forget to angle your tanks when fighting, and this goes for both your hull, and turret. Missed your shot? Rotate it left or right to ricochet the incoming round. Can't pen the frontal armor? Aim for the barrel, or if he doesn't notice you wait for a side or rear shot. Tracking enemy tanks to potentially sacrifice your tank, but guarantee his death via team mates is always a worthy play.

I am beefy tank boy.

The game is decent, I'm a plane nut, so I've really only spent my time so far on aircraft, and though the flight controls could be more realistic, it's good for any average joe to pick up on to get into the dogfight, but I'd rather someone I'm fighting know how to fly, and not just follow a 5 minute tutorial on how to use your mouse to fly a P-51 Mustang, that's just not how it works. The P2W aspect of the game is also quite disappointing, as for a multitude of reasons, first, I would like to fly certain models of aircraft without having to pay, and go up against other players. The Test Flight procedure is quite nice for flying that craft, but I would like to fly and attack other people. Secondly, there are some seriously jacked planes that will beat any other in a dogfight, higher tier specifically. The USSR has a Bi-Plane with high caliber machine guns on it in rank II, that can out maneuver any other craft and gun it down with ease. Third, and last, the pricing for most of the DLC you can order, are above 30 US dollars, usually, and it's all really overpriced. Overall, the game is great for experiencing what a skirmish would look like during either of the world wars, the Korean war, or the Vietnam war. The variety of aircraft is great, plenty to choose from, and it's almost completely realistic. I do recommend this game to others if they are willing to grind a little bit for their most loved aircraft, as I have gotten some that I am satisfied with and can dogfight with great efficiency. Good game.

Despite all you may hear and see, the game is actually good. It's fun, it's challenging to play, your skill matters and you will learn a lot of mostly real and historically accurate things about all the vehicles (don't confuse this with historical accuracy and realism in general though). You may need to adjust your expectations a bit, but I really like the gameplay as such.

The level of grind and sweat required to get to unlock even just late ww2 vehicles is insane though. It's motivating, yes, there's always something more, it's even a hook to play more, but you can forget anything top tier for the next few years, it takes that long. (And "premium" subscription is more like required than giving you much of an advantage, but I don't have a serious issue with some monthly sub cost for a game like this.) Just ran away if you still can.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Just don't play this, take this from a player who is addicted to a very unhealthy game. It cost to much to have fun in this game, and I'm not just talking about money, this game takes away your sanity, from unstoppable amounts of CAS and amounts of BS that happen, to having new updates filled with premium tanks that make top tier unplayable. If you think you can play low tiers and starting tiers and have fun in this game, think again, you'll only run into noob crushers and seal clubbers that are max lvl and have over 500 hours in the game. Trust me its not worth it to put in so much time in a game where you might have 1 moment with friends that is fun maybe every 3-5 months. The game is full of bugs, that aren't always game breaking but are extremely annoying. I hate to say this, but from my perspective its the truth, if you plan on playing this game for the ships or for the tanks, DON'T, air players will bully tf out of you and there's no game mode you can play in to stay away from air players and still make decent amounts of research and money, Ground RB eventually becomes air RB with tanks as a second feature, ground arcade just isn't realistic (obviously) and you don't make even close to the same amount of money and research as in ground RB, naval RB has planes in it, I cant say how bad since I dont play naval in war thunder all that often. To sum it up simply, don't play this game if you are expecting non-stop enjoyment. But if you do still plan to play this, good luck.

This is a "fuck you and I'll see you tomorrow" game. (FWI I'm talking about air combat since thats what i play) Because all that happens each game is two teams are just go in the middle and are told to fight, it's just a confusing moshpit where you get one or two kills and die bc there are like 10 other enemies. Than eventually one team dominates and than occupies the air space, and since everyone on the other team died at random times, the other team just trickles in one by one to get killed by the ever growing swarm of enemies. I would be lying if I said I never had moments where I felt like Maverick and barely won a dog fight and got a rush from it, but they are few and far between compared to the amount of times you either just get steam rolled or steam roll. Even steam rolling is a bit boring since most of your kills get stolen. Also it's grindy as fuck. So many tech trees, so many planes, so many silver lions (in game coins) and reaserch points (whats used to unlock planes). It's also like Rainbow six where you can "technically" get everything without paying but only if you sell your soul to the game.

TL:DR Fun but grindy as fuck and sort of unfun gameplay loop all for few moments of a rush from narrowly winning a dog fight. "Technically" free to play but the only way to unlock stuff in a timely manner is paying for it or selling your soul. If you want to play with jets you could become a pilot in the military faster than getting to them in this game.

You know those people who slave away for half of their life doing a job they hate because they want to save money for their retirement. [b]"I'll suffer in the present for a better future!"[/b] But we all know those people will be 60 when they retire, and they'll be too miserable and old to enjoy their life.

This aforementioned example perfectly describes insanity and the average War Thunder player.  

Imagine grinding away, day after day, and finally unlocking a brand new shiny vehicle; but then you need to pay money to buy the vehicle, then pay money to assign a crew to man the vehicle, and then pay even more money to make that crew better at manning the vehicle. Oh, but then after bringing that vehicle to a match, you find out that it runs as smoothly as that computer you found laying around in your local landfill. Turns out, you've spent all that money and time grinding for the most defective version of the vehicle you want. Jokes on you, now you have to spend even more money and time in order to upgrade the vehicle so that it's remotely functional. [b]Ah yes, this is the true War Thunder experience.[/b]
Only fun when you do good, though.

before I played this on steam, I played it via a gaijin launcher, so I have waaaaaaaaay more hours in this game than steam suggests, around 100 hours more. And even then with 200 hours (all spent with the soviets) in this game, I still am at BR 3. You have to play for weeks to unlock a single vehicle. You want to play multiple nations? well too bad, you'll never get out of BR 1. You want a strong vehicle? too bad, all stronger vehicles are "premium" and cost real money. You want to play in modern times? too bad, getting there easily costs thousands (yeah really) of hours. 

This game has a very good concept, that I have never seen before. That makes it such a shame that gaijin is an absolute shit show of a company, they hide in niches, so that they have 0 competition and can absolutely load the game to the brim with micro transactions and the inability to make any progress if you play f2p. I sincerily hope that whoever made these horrible anti consumer decisions gets shot in a fusillade.

Driving across the map for 4 minutes only to be one-shot by someone sat in a bush 1km away is not my idea of fun gameplay. I do not want to miserably play War Thunder for 100+ hours so that I can one day be the player sat in a bush.

EDIT: Played for an additional 116 hours and I'm still not the player sat in a bush one-shotting everyone else.
EDIT 2: Nearly 200 hours in. This game makes me irrationally fucking angry. I have no idea why I'm still fucking playing it. I fucking loathe War Thunder.
EDIT 3: Just over 300 hours played. I am sometimes the player sat in a bush one-shotting everyone else. I am now chasing the dopamine hit of "target destroyed" at every available opportunity. Also, Germany suffers.
EDIT 4: 400 hours played. Jesus Christ what is it with 1 death leavers?!

I am a player of multiple years and over 1k hours. It is now at this point the most frustrating to play that it has ever been. 1 quart vegetable oil for frying

1 (10.25 ounce) can beef gravy

5 medium potatoes, cut into fries

2 cups cheese curds

Directions/Instructions Checklist

Step 1
Heat oil in a deep fryer or deep heavy skillet to 365 degrees F (185 degrees C). While the oil is heating, you can begin to warm your gravy.

Step 2
Place the fries into the hot oil, and cook until light brown, about 5 minutes. Make the fries in batches if necessary to allow them room to move a little in the oil. Remove to a paper towel lined plate to drain.

Step 3
Place the fries on a serving platter, and sprinkle the cheese over them. Ladle gravy over the fries and cheese, and serve immediately.

i have been playing war thunder for 8 years, and lately the game has become extremely crappy, the over time the ingame currency Sliver lion has been tweaked to a reduced levels compare to 2-4 years ago, if that wasn't bad enough the additional changes to the repair cost has been absurd, many planes (non-premuim) around past rank 4 costing often 8-10k SL and even worst 13-20k on above rank 6, which makes impossible to break even unless you get 3 kill on a lose, even premium account doesn't sometimes cover the cost, combining both of these problems makes it a joke to even try to grind the top tiers, 

add to the fact that at the top tiers thanks to power creep, a lot of lower BR planes such as mig-15 and F-86 will have to face Mig-21s, lightings, a-10, which are equipped with missiles and with exception of the A-10 can out speed the mig-15s without any problems, bare in mind most of these aircraft that the mig-15 and f-86 are facing were designed in the 1960-70s, often you would be placed about 6-7 / 10 times at the bottom BR, this along with the power creep of new premiums being introduced at lower BRs with 95% of the original stats of the tech tree variants just makes all of the matches in RB unbearable

all together if you want to play jet, either be quite good with good platoons to make the higher tiers a bit less tedious on the economy side or you buy premium, the lower tiers in arcade mode are the only good thing about war thunder theses days, the BS of Gaijins "balancing economy" is not as bad as it is on higher tier, plus there is less power creep, right now i only use war thunder to help me with choosing colours for my models that i paint.
I like Pilot Men but, game is far to grindy with overpriced dlc.

[h1] How to have fun in War Thunder [/h1]
Step 1: Install
Step 2: Discover Customizations on the craft
Step 3: Using the Flip and Mirror Make Smiley faces on all your tanks, boats and planes. 
Step 4: Find a Friend to Play with on Discord and both of you smile together
Step 5: Focus on being ridiculous instead of competition 
Step 6: Don't move up a tier until you have multiple vehicles of the same (BR) then play same (BR) rated vehicles

Overall Review: Don't spend much money, Don't worry about the grind, you don't need it to have fun.  Low tiers is where the interesting funny stuff happens.

Edit: Extra Steps
1. Spend under 10 dollars to buy a hat or a bear
2. Start Roleplaying with your in game friend with the tanks, moving your barrel up and down to talk to eachother
3. Play the Italian Tanks, they're smol and adorable 
4. Remember, anything you spend, you're never going to get back.  So only do it for "FUNNY".. never to competition, if it is competition, that makes you vulnerable to getting angry.
5. Always assume the enemy is more skilled than you, so giggle and tease them with your hats, adorable eyes and smiles.

War Thunder is very boring. It’s not satisfying, thrilling, or even unique, it’s just boring. It might be unique in the sense that there really isn’t another game out there as detailed and within the same scope of War thunder, but it’s also safe to say there are several games out there better at doing one of the various means of play War Thunder shares. War Thunder is boring because it is slow and unbalanced. It is both physically slow, in the sense that most early tanks for instance, can only crawl across most distances, and god forbid you encounter a small slope. This snail’s paced gameplay is also the result of imbalance because you don’t really have this problem with tanks on the Russian and German skill trees, so choosing to play as say the italians starting off is almost akin to intentionally gimping yourself. But of course the deeper down you work into a certain nation’s skill tree the more balanced tanks feel, however it can still take so astronomically long to get to that point it’s hard not to get focused on the pile of garbage standing between you and that sweet-spot of balance. This slow, mismanaged progression can also lead to very boring gameplay. When playing tanks, it is so much easier to perform well while sitting still in one very cheeky spot, racking up kills, than actually playing proactively and PTFOing. When playing in aircraft, it’s infuriating to pump what feels like hundreds of rounds into enemy planes only for them to squeeze a single burst in your direction and kill your pilot. It is agonizing to drive your tank up 90% of a hill only for your engine to give out right before you reach the peak and fall back down. Spawn camping is also an endemic problem on most maps for tanks. Not only because a lot of levels treat the spawn zones more like barrels full of fish to shoot from overlooking hills, but also because gaijin(and a lot of players too) seem to think of this as a non-issue. A simple byproduct of a fair vehicle-simulation shooter.

So, I'll say I have 32 hours on xbox. I have played this game for 11 hours and have unlocked 2 or 3 planes. Do you happen to see an issue with this? The progression is painfully slow unless you fall into a very specific set of gameplay standards, the dogfighting is fun and all but can be repetitive in arcade. Realistic battles are as slow as the progression, I mean would you like to fly for 5 minutes only for someone to have a single bullet hit your pilot and have to do it all again? This game needs a serious progress overhaul in general. It seriously panders to players who will pay money for stuff, you can purchase "premium accounts" which grant you a 30% or so increase in research speed along with downed repair costs. Oh yeah I forgot you have to pay the in game currency to repair your plane, needless to say this leads to frustration and fear to using new planes.

Overall 5/10 good dogfighting, horrible progress.
If you can stomach the grind, this game is very enjoyable.

Its a bit hard starting off but you will soon get used to it, Here are some in game tips
1. i reccomend doing all the tutorials first and then get started in games

2.i would start off in tanks and get used to it, and then planes, and then ships if you want, i dont like ships that much but its not for everyone.

3. Save your GE (Gold Eagle premium currency) for things that you really need, dont spend it on boosting research unless its worth it

4. Dont sped your SL (Silver Lion main currency) all at once, i would save at least 50k - 70k

5. Before you spend anything on boosting research or buying a plane, always test drive it!! i made that mistake many times and i was left with 0GE (Gold Eagle premium currency) and a bad plane

Thats all the tips i have for now, :)

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single father to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Please hear me out before you judge. This is one of the most frustrating games I have ever played. There are a lot great things about this game but there a lot more wrong with this game. One of the reasons I went into this game is because I really want to battle with my favorite World War 2 vehicles and some modern ones too. But here are some reasons why I stop playing.
This game is not fun to play it is down right frustrating. 1. You spend so long trying to get anywhere in this game. The grind is insanely long to the borderline of insanity. I've gotten further in the two of the World of games. (World of Warships and World of Warplanes.) Than I ever did in war thunder. I see past the bells and whistles on war thunder. 2. The company behind  war thunder are greedy as hell and do everything they can to get your hard earned money. 3. After a battle if your vehicle gets destroyed you have to wait for vehicle to be repaired and the higher the tier the long the repairs. You could use your silver loins to speed it up BUT you need sliver loins to buy new vehicles. 4, Tech tree vehicles are outclassed by their premium vehicle counterparts. 5. WAY to many events. 6. I can't get over the fact that Gaijin advertise and says war thunder vehicles are "authentic and historically accurate" when they do whatever want with the technical specifications. I'm a gamer and I love great games that developers pour their hearts and souls in. But this games has been straight up ruined by a greedy company. And I hate it when a great game is ruined by greed. Please im begging you save your saintly and don't play this game. Thank you for reading. (P.S. will edit if i think of some others to say.)

Garbage russian game that favors their tanks, I've made it to tier 4 and had enough. The rabid fanboys are gonna advocate how there's no russian bias, but try it yourself at tier 3.3 - 4, how retardproof are their tanks... all their T34, KV1 variants that magically bounce anything regardless what penetration values the projectile has, when you finally pen, then the magic door hatch on T34 or gun mantle on any of those tanks will absorb all damage even from a nuclear blast. So in order to kill em, you have to meticulously aim for the weakspots such as lower front side of the hull or the area around the front door hatch, whereas any other tank, especially german tanks get one shot almost all the time, no matter where the hit pens. 

Absolutely sickening, how people with those tanks can play like absolute braindead apes and often pass by pretty much unpunished, because the stalin blessed armor be like trololol and bounces or absorbs any incoming shot. Try to play like em with any other tank from other nations and see how it will work out for you. 

I'm not gonna bother with anything beyond that, don't wanna know how many BS tanks await at higher tiers... I already know playing  beyond tier 7-8 is a miserable experience and without a premium account you will go bankrupt. Premium tanks cost as much as a triple AAA game, just lmao. If I had to, I would rather burn money on some shitty anime gacha game than on this dogshit company.

Graphics and layouts are awesome. Movement is great also. But there is a lot left to be desired on the programming of this game. Being a programmer for 20 years, I know these problems can be fixed if they want to do research on this game. But as of yet, they haven't addressed them. For instance, their map will show no enemy near but in reality there are 3 enemy a few hundred feet away on the other side of the building. Also their legend will show your only damage is the tread on your tank, but you can't move your turret or shoot even though all personnel on board are okay and no other damage indicated. They have said they addressed shooting thru mountains and certain buildings, but yet the enemy still has the capability to shoot thru solid rock mountains for the kill. Now long range kills are good except certain people can shoot across the total map without seeing the enemy for the kill. I am sure if they address and fix these problems this game would be totally awesome. But as of now I would not recommend wasting your time or money on this game.

I have played this game since the open beta way before the steam hosting and... well, it is not the same anymore.
So much to say why, but the most annoying feature is the economy. despite the game is free to play, you can no longer enjoy it as such. it get harder and harder for the average players to earn a fair amount of RP and SL that push quickly this player category out. lots of players don't really "play" the game because they found no value to play objectives, or "high risk, high reward" as it's not worth for them.
The remaining player base is premiums users, or hardened vets, and can't recycle...
The game became more and more frustrating about grinding crew and vehicules, with the single aim to make you bypass it with real money. At this stage, it's like casino addiction...
They are very good at creating 3D models, but if you want them you need to work, not playing, and to be annoyed by the stock effectivness of it. it's a "military encyclopedia visualized"
Last but not least is the game design, battles objectives are always 1, 2 or 3 strategics circles across the map... nothing more... and a repetitive sickness...

The only way they keep players in this game is by adding new hyped planes, tanks and ships, that people want to come back a look at. this is Gaijin game schedule developement since the modern era were added. but i think they struggle as they started to fix more and more bugs spread across the game developement years, way too late...
and there is way more to say about balance, comunity behavior ect....
This is war thunder, subscribe or step aside

The developers have created a system of inconveniences that they then offer a means to pay to get through moderately quicker. If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

If you're looking for a game that will take thousands of hours or dollars to reach the late game, this is it.

460 hours in, and I'm barely halfway through two tech trees. Currently, to unlock a single vehicle with the average research points per game, I would need to play ~130 games. These are 10-20 minute matches. On average, that's 32.5 hours of gameplay to unlock a single vehicle at BR 7.0. It goes up to 11.0 currently, and the RP costs even increases at those levels.

To purchase the research of this vehicle, you would need 2889 of the currency bought with real money. This costs around $20 USD.

Additionally, it feels as if there is a mechanic that places you in losing matches as soon as you start doing well. Almost every map in this game is unbalanced - it is way easier to spawn camp and defend on one side than the other. Mark my words: if you start doing well and earning a little too much RP, you will find yourself on the worst side of every map you play for the forseeable future. Ironically, I've noticed this rarely happens when I have purchased a premium membership.

Egregiously, any premium vehicle purchased gives you a massive bonus on research and currency - but be ready to fork over $20+ for a single vehicle.

In short, this game is a bit pay to win, and MASSIVELY pay to progress. Unless you spend over a thousand hours in this game, I doubt you'll ever make it past mid tier in a single country's combined forces. You might reach top tier if you focus only on Air, Sea or Land singularly.

Не надо сюда заходить,не надо сюда донататить. Это игра убивает тебя морально,она в первые часы кажется хорошей,но когда ты узнаешь что такое : объемные снаряды,без урона в борт 120-мм НАТОвскими ОБПС которые просто сжигают осколками в 2000 градусов челов в реальной жизни - в этой игре не на наносят урона вообще,как это должно быть. Карты вообще отдельная тема 90% карт - это неиграбельные поля по которым ехать до точки вплоть до 1.5km на танке который едет в среднем 25-30 км/ч. Что насчет игроков - то все плохо,многие  стоят дрочат где-то у камней перед базой,ехать вперед никто не хочет особенно на рангах повыше и разработчик с этим ничего не делает. Только поощряет.......
Игра подрузумевает себя как реализмо-подобная,но от реализма тут не осталось ничего,это WOT только без ХП. Игра делается чисто для пиндоса-коммюнити,а как известно пиндосы не любят соревновательный и сложный геймплей - им нужен фан,а фан в этой игре на пиндосов предоставляется достаточно : непробития в борт,непробития сильнеших орудий мира по ЛТ - это все пиндосы называют весельем. Ну вот им и дают,а мы СНГшники которые любит более соревновательный геймплей сосем огромный член самца улитки.

Ground RB:

You kill people with your tank. 

These people get angry.

These people spawn in plane and fly to your location they saw in their killcam.

People attack your location in their next plane or tank. Sometimes win, sometimes lose. Or they try to bomb you.

Game would be better if the killcam wasn't around. Please turn the killcam in Ground RB off.

The game damage mechanic is realistic but don't expect it to be a simulator grade, also flight characteristics too, still some bugs in it, but you rarely see them, until they update a new patch which brings a ton of bugs (currently there is a tank track flying around and obstruct gun sight). 
This game graphic is amazing flying in sky among cloud, texture on ground is great every detail on vehicle are polished however cockpit still don't match what they do on other, and it doesn't bad either. 
Every vehicle in game are based on real vehicles that are in production or prototype (/coughing E100, Ostwind 2), so you don't have to see fancy vehicle, if it isn't prototype.
Gameplay section, this game has countless hours of grinding to get a vehicle especially cold war era, so if you aiming to get it, have fun pouring 100-200 hours into this suffer hell. This game is free to play does it mean it pay to win? No, you can fight everyone, just paid player has less time grinding.
Would I recommend this game to others? Of course yes!

Before I go into the negatives I will bring up the positives first. This game in the beginning and towards about 2018 was a blast. The hit registration was alright, plane spam wasn't an big issue in the slightest on ground battles. Also I will only be talking about ground battles for the tank lovers out there. I have had a blast with this game. I love the tanks you can unlock, the maps you play on, the sounds and how they have developed over time. But recently I don't even want to pick up this game to play it on my PC anymore. The reason being is the hit registration is very spotty sometimes at best. That isn't what really bothers me. What bothers me the most is the amount of planes in the sky on ground realistic battles from both the friendly team and the enemy team. Let me go into further detail with this. When most of the community didn't think about using planes in ground battles you actually had to have skill on the ground in order to win a battle. Now for some of the matches I have played it comes down to who can use bombs with the greatest proficiency or who has the most planes. Granted this is all in ground realistic battles for tanks. It wasn't terrible at first when people started using them more but in the past year it's a whole other story. When I get into a game I usually know by the time I capture an Objective I am most likely going to get bombed. I have tried hiding, being deep in a city, hiding behind rocks. It's very irritating to say the least about getting bombed just about every single match. All I want to do is play against tanks and I can't do that without having to look up at the sky and try to out smart the plane coming into bomb me. Also for those wondering revenge bombing is a huge thing now in ground realistic battles. I know I will get the question "well what about AA"? The AA is subpar for a lot of factions. Granted you may think a 30mm Bofors gun will work very well against planes right? Well yes if they are close to your gun or are coming straight at you. The fire rate is also terrible for them as well. Now the USA has the M16 AA gun with 4 .50 cal machine guns firing in the same direction. Now when you have that AA gun working you can do okay. But if you don't a high fire rate well you better be john wick in the AA or your only going to hit them but not kill them. Now some people might think about radar shells that was developed later in the second world war and think "can't you use those shells or unlock them for the Bofors gun"? That would be a no. You do not get any shells like that until at least 7.0 or higher that have proximity fuses. Best part is you don't even get lock on missiles until about 9.0br for AA. Until they fix the amount of planes that anybody can spawn in during a tank match I will no longer be playing this game. I hope this review helps some of you tank lovers.

This game looks pretty good before you begin and is very likely make you enjoy at the early stage. However, after graduating from early, or WW2 stage, you may find the game is extremely poor on details. Firstly, there is no balance. USSR vehicles are always the best among all the other technology trees, from Rank 1 to 6. Please choose these as your only team. Secondly, pay to win. People may say the ones players can get without paying have the capability to fight against the ones of real money. Yes but misleading. Vehicles bought with real money always have lower Battle Ranking, sufficient attributes to face every enemy they meet, higher Silver Lion and EXP received, etc. As long as a player PAY, he/she enjoys. Last, anti-cheat is very close to 0. Cheaters will ONLY be banned when a video is sent directly to the ad.

So, please disregard my hours invested. I just happened to realize the egregious dumpster fire that is this game and its development team. Hopefully, Steam is transparent and will not remove genuine reviews, because allegedly, Gaijin Interactive are notorious for removing opinions or comments that shine a negative light on their "efforts" towards their game, their monetization practices, and their gameplay designs.

However, to be fair and transparent myself, I feel obligated to include some positive opinions I have towards the game and it's community.

1. The ballistics, are for the environment, and the type of game, incredibly realistic and true to life. The vehicle models, behaviors, and designs are fantastic, and the historical accuracy is outstanding.

2. Gameplay, if you don't suck at the game, can be addicting, which might explain one of my disdains.

3. There is a great deal of depth in terms of replay value, investing time and effort in to further progressing in the game.

4. I haven't done anything in VR yet, though I plan on doing so, but I would most likely use it for combat flight simulation outside of DCS and VTOL VR. It is a nice addition to add that to a game that includes aerial combat.

I don't have any other positive comments, so oh boy do I have disdains.

1. Maps are egregiously unbalanced. Most maps are balanced to give an outstandingly unfair advantage to a specific team.

2. Unfortunately, as a result of the ballistic realism, especially with vehicles, certain tanks, in certain locations of the map, are blatantly unbeatable, and some specific tanks are just all around stronger, like the Panzer series tanks.

3. The gameplay is designed to punish people for not paying to win the game. If you obtain the game and continue to play it for free, you will STRUGGLE to make any progress towards higher tiers in research. Premium players will typically make the same research in half the time as they earn twice as many research credits as FTP players. The game is designed to force you to purchase something in an effort to advance, otherwise you might as well invest your money in to a 401k or retirement plan because progressing in the game is a career without premium.

4. matchmaking is broken, a lot of players will intentionally downgrade in skill level by intentionally failing to get put in to lower skill lobbies and completely dominate new players.

5. Artillery and air units deployed during ground combat matches are almost completely unstoppable unless you risk a respawn utilizing an anti air vehicle with the hopes that not only air units will come, but with the hope they will give you the opportunity to eliminate them.

6. I obtained the game, years ago, and stopped playing for these reasons, and mostly only came back to play VR mode with the A-10 Warthog. However, you either need to already be progressed far enough in to the game to obtain it, be a premium player and purchase it, or purchase it as a DLC for the price of a new AAA title.

7. Gaijin entertainment has no regard for their community and has no respect for constructive criticism or the opinions of its players. As a result, negative reviews or opinions that they can do something about, are typically removed. There is fundamentally no reason to do this other than to censor players acknowledging the flaws and corrupt practices of the company.

In conclusion, as with most Chinese nonsense, it is nothing but a way to steal money from people in exchange for nothing but rotten dog water and low quality garbage made by children in exchange for a meal a day. I genuinely recommend you treat this as a trap and a method to steal your money.

what is the meaning of the battles? over time I have seen drastic changes, but now I would like to tell you my humble opinion:

1) Ground Battles - Ground battles from BR 6.7 and up are a continuous uptier. in addition, the maps that are proposed randomly are inadequate. one of the examples I can do is when you use a Jagdtiger and find yourself in a spawn in sight of the enemy one. 100% chance to receive a missile in the first 30 seconds of battle, pay repairs and exit the battle immediately. when I have this dynamic I have a 90% chance of receiving a battle defeat notification.
or we have the night battles, better with few players, 3 cap, big map and what could go wrong besides the campfest? helicopters of course...
the examples that can be done are many, from ghost shells to transformations of tank battles to aerial ones (ground RB to air RB), as over half of your team is in the air doing revenge kills by crashing into the enemy with their Premium plane.

2) Air Battles - what's the point of using a strike aircraft? for example an A10A: survive the take-off avoiding the premium F5-C crashing all the time and then 2 minutes and 35 seconds later (I also timed) your team is gone and you have just reached the first AA position on the map. needless to say, but then you find yourself surrounded and you give whoever killed you a free kill, instead you have to spend on repairs without earning anything.
Alternatively, in about 3 minutes, your team has killed all but one enemy. then you who have just arrived in the mission area ask your companions to save it because you have not yet scored points, you have just arrived but no. "no one has to score, it is only allowed in dogfight" for example.

Naval Battles - take for example an IJN Mikuma, you buy it to grind something. the spawn is forced into the open ocean. aaaaand wait, the best is yet to come: seconds later (SECONDS) from the enemy spawn you get a series of EXTREMELY PRECISE shots that do you several critical damage to the ship + fire (we don't miss anything) and while you try to escape, you have the others ships alongside blocking you. take a smaller ship then! a destroyer? ok. you spawn and the result is that either you get continuous fire from another ship (usually American) of the same class, or you get killed by a few shots from a WW1 battleship at 13km where in the middle there are maybe two islands with mountains and trees. I don't understand the meaning of the battles.

in conclusion, I have always gladly spent my money on WT as skins, premium vehicles etc but it seems to me that the game is going very badly. also because reading some developers/players who come to tell you "if you don't like it, don't play it" means that they don't care who willingly spends money often, but they rely more on the many who buy vehicles occasionally and nothing more.
I think money talks, I still have 44 days of premium time, after which I think I'll spend it elsewhere.
