Remember when this game was fun?
These times are long gone!

I played this a lot back in around 2014 where the "sabre" and it's counterparts were the latest jet planes in the tech tree.
Getting research points and thus planes was somewhat of a grind but it was bareable. And you got to those lovely WW2 warbirds rather quick. I did so for 3 nations. The game has had a steep learning curve then but eventually, with the help of some YT tutorials, I managed to get quite good.
Since the number of planes was half of what it is today, I knew most of the planes, their weaknesses/ strengthes and how to fly each plane in order to come out on top. And I would've considered myself a casual player then, spending maybe 2-3 h a day on the game.

TODAY, however, the grind is insane! INSANE, I tell you!
If you aren't willing to spend a lot of money AND time into the game you aren't getting nowhere. Back then I had so many silver lions, I didn't know how to get rid of them (as a free-to-play player!!!). Today, you earn so little of them that you can barely pay the high level tier repair/ rearm costs.

Like one of the top reviews already explains: You get paid with silver lions/ research points by performance. Low performance = low reward, furthering the difficulty of getting into the game.

Furthermore, today's learning curve is much, much more higher. Now with steam support, there are much more players there. Hence, there are much more good players there but also those who have maxed out the stats of their crews and planes. The lack of a proper battle rating system (the one in play is airplane based, rather then player based) frequently matches you up with the afore mentioned. Plus, there are much more planes/ tanks/ vehicles nowadays, which means much more stuff to learn and remember in order to win.

Thus, YOU WILL LOSE MANY GAMES - especially in the beginning. You will get LITTLE reward for that "weak" performance. It will take a long time to crawl up the tech tree - even as a premium member!
Be prepared to be frustrated a lot.
You will need a loooooooong breath and a lot of patience.

I for myself don't want to invest this much effort into a game.
I won't play this "pay-to-win" game anymore.
And neither should you.
gud game

Following the murder of Tuomi, Dahmer began to actively seek victims, most of whom he encountered in or close to gay bars, and whom he typically lured to his grandmother's home. He would drug his victim with triazolam or temazepam before or shortly after engaging in sexual activity with them. Once he had rendered his victim unconscious with sleeping pills, he killed them by strangulation.[111][112]

Two months after the Tuomi murder, Dahmer encountered a 14-year-old Native American male prostitute named James Doxtator; Dahmer lured the youth to his home with an offer of $50 to pose for nude pictures. At Dahmer's West Allis residence, the pair engaged in sexual activity before Dahmer drugged Doxtator and strangled him on the floor of the cellar.[113] Dahmer left the body in the cellar for one week before dismembering it in much the same manner as he had with Tuomi. He placed all of Doxtator's remains (excluding the skull) in the trash. The skull was boiled and cleansed in bleach before Dahmer noted it had been rendered too brittle by this process. He pulverized the skull two weeks later.[114]

On March 24, 1988, Dahmer met a 22-year-old bisexual man named Richard Guerrero outside a gay bar called The Phoenix.[114] Dahmer lured Guerrero to his grandmother's residence, although the incentive on this occasion was $50 to simply spend the remainder of the night with him;[115] he then drugged Guerrero with sleeping pills and strangled him with a leather strap, with Dahmer then performing oral sex upon the corpse.[115] Dahmer dismembered Guerrero's body within 24 hours of murdering him, again disposing of the remains in the trash and retaining the skull before pulverizing it several months later.[116]

On April 23, Dahmer lured another young man to his house; however, after giving the victim a drugged coffee, both he and the intended victim heard Dahmer's grandmother call, "Is that you, Jeff?"[117] Although Dahmer replied in a manner that led his grandmother to believe he was alone, she did observe that Dahmer was not alone. Because of this, Dahmer opted not to kill this particular victim, instead waiting until he had become unconscious before taking him to the County General Hospital.[118]

In September 1988, Dahmer's grandmother asked him to move out, largely because of his drinking, his habit of bringing young men to her house late at night and the foul smells occasionally emanating from both the basement and the garage. Dahmer found a one-bedroom apartment at 808 North 24th Street[91] and moved into his new residence on September 25.[119] Two days later, he was arrested for drugging and sexually fondling a 13-year-old boy whom he had lured to his home on the pretext of posing nude for photographs.[120][121] Dahmer's father hired an attorney named Gerald Boyle to defend his son. At Boyle's request, Dahmer underwent a series of psychological evaluations prior to his upcoming court hearings. These evaluations revealed Dahmer harbored deep feelings of alienation. A second evaluation two months later revealed Dahmer to be an impulsive individual, suspicious of others, and dismayed by his lack of accomplishments in life. His probation officer would also reference a 1987 diagnosis of Dahmer suffering from a schizoid personality disorder for presentation to the court.[122]

On January 30, 1989, Dahmer pleaded guilty to the charges of second-degree sexual assault and of enticing a child for immoral purposes.[123] Sentencing for the assault was suspended until May.[124] On March 20,[125] Dahmer commenced a ten-day Easter absence from work, during which he moved back into his grandmother's home.

Two months after his conviction and two months prior to his sentencing for the sexual assault, Dahmer murdered his fifth victim, a mixed-race 24-year-old aspiring model named Anthony Sears, whom Dahmer met at a gay bar on March 25, 1989. According to Dahmer, on this particular occasion, he was not looking to commit a crime; however, shortly before closing time that evening, Sears "just started talking to me". Dahmer lured Sears to his grandmother's home, where the pair engaged in oral sex before Dahmer drugged and strangled Sears.[3]

The following morning, Dahmer placed the corpse in his grandmother's bathtub, where he decapitated the body before attempting to flay the corpse.[3] He then stripped the flesh from the body and pulverized the bones, which he again disposed of in the trash. According to Dahmer, he found Sears "exceptionally attractive", and Sears was the first victim from whom he permanently retained any body parts: he preserved Sears' head and genitalia in acetone[126] and stored them in a wooden box, which he later placed in his work locker.[n 5] When he moved to a new address the following year, he took the remains there.[128]

On May 23, 1989,[124] Dahmer was sentenced to five years' probation and one year in the House of Correction, with work release permitted in order that he be able to keep his job; he was also required to register as a sex offender.[129]

Two months before his scheduled release from the work camp, Dahmer was paroled from this regime. His five years' probation imposed in 1989 began at this point.[130] On release, Dahmer temporarily moved back to his grandmother's home in West Allis[131] before, in May 1990, moving into the Oxford Apartments, located on North 25th Street in Milwaukee. Although located in a high-crime area, the apartment was close to his workplace, was furnished and, at $300 per month inclusive of all bills excluding electricity, was economical.[132]

he missile knows where it is at all times. It knows this because it knows where it isn't. By subtracting where it is from where it isn't, or where it isn't from where it is (whichever is greater), it obtains a difference, or deviation. The guidance subsystem uses deviations to generate corrective commands to drive the missile from a position where it is to a position where it isn't, and arriving at a position where it wasn't, it now is. Consequently, the position where it is, is now the position that it wasn't, and it follows that the position that it was, is now the position that it isn't.
In the event that the position that it is in is not the position that it wasn't, the system has acquired a variation, the variation being the difference between where the missile is, and where it wasn't. If variation is considered to be a significant factor, it too may be corrected by the GEA. However, the missile must also know where it was.
The missile guidance computer scenario works as follows. Because a variation has modified some of the information the missile has obtained, it is not sure just where it is. However, it is sure where it isn't, within reason, and it knows where it was. It now subtracts where it should be from where it wasn't, or vice-versa, and by differentiating this from the algebraic sum of where it shouldn't be, and where it was, it is able to obtain the deviation and its variation, which is called error.

Definitely a fun free-to-play game. There's a steep learning curve once you get into the higher tier matches, but overall its a good time as long as you're aware of your surroundings and don't drive headfirst onto the control points as soon as the match starts. 

Progression is fairly slow if you don't spend any money, but you can still move up through the tiers if you're willing to grind it out. Though there are a good number of great tanks/planes that you can only purchase with money, if you have a good understanding of the game you're not at any real disadvantage. 

The only gripe I have is that the camouflage you add on to your vehicles is only purchasable with Gold Eagles and not Silver Lions. It isn't expensive and of course this a free to play game, but the camo gives an extreme advantage in many situations.

Well hello there. You are wondering if this game is for you... Belive me it is not. the game is free but it is constantly trying to make you spend money on it in order to buy a premium account. It is close to impossible to grind without premium. The game also has a issue with players. Most skilled players aren't playing in top tier. They are playing in lower tier in order to have more fun witch creates the unplesent grind for new players. Hard core players have no respect for new people and dosen't give a damn if they are making new people quit. Trust me this game is not for you unles you like to play games with:
1. Balancing issues when adding new veichles. When gajin adds new veichles (but most of the time premium or event) these veichles tend to be "op". They fix this by adding a extremely high repair cost to these veichles those making them unplayable for people that dose not have the money to use them. In general the repair cost is just bad in this game and gajin is not planing on doing anything about it. Just like Bethesda tends to do with most of their game.
2. A endless grind. Many factors makes me say this. From new veichles being constantly added to the game those making newer player have to grind more in order to complete a teir. However a tank i the swedish tech tree has the option to be by passed when that tree barely has any tanks compaired to Germany, Soviet and Amerika (These trees dosen't have any bypassable tanks,planes and so on). There are also big problems with the ekonomy those making newer players finding themselfs on the edge of being poor due to the enormus smurfing problems that the game has. (This isn't gijins fault but the fanbase, and if you don't agree as a top teir player then i would like to see what br you play during events).
3. A constant reminder that the game wants you to spend money on it in order to aither progress faster or earn more rewards.
4. Veteran players are abusing lower teir matches and makes sertain br and teirs (ahem ahem teir 3) unplayable. I have over 200 hours on the game and have not gotten above teir 3 due to higher teir players constantly abusing map knowledge, camping and premium veichles. In other words you won't play against players with the same amount of experiance as you have.
5. The economy of the game is garbage and you can lose a lot of money in one match. the ekonomy is just made to be grindy due to the game wanting you the new player to spend more time on the game. You won't be able to buy veichles when you progres to teir 3 or beyond due to a lak of silver lions. (The game want's you to spend money on it in order to get that money to buy the new veichles)
But if you think that these "qualities" are for you then go on. This game is for you then. But be aware that the game is close to unplayable if you are a new player. You will always have that one guy witha fancy decorated tank and bushes all over it that has over 10 kills in your lobby and you can't do anything to kill him. But remember that these veteran players are just fatherless and you can't do anything about it.

[h1]The bad...[/h1]
[hr]
[h2] A chasm between gamemodes[/h2]
Arcade battles feel extremely cheap because as long as an enemy has you in their field of vision, you'll be visible on the minimap and a big red nametag will appear over your tank which can be seen through several buildings and basically at an infinite range as long as you lock onto the target with the middle mouse button. [i]Neat, huh?[/i]
Realistic battles are better in that regards but they're extremely punitive for new players, especially given that map knowledge and knowing sight lines play an immense role in this mode. [i]Ever played Dark souls and Elden ring? Child's play compared to this game.[/i]

[h2] A hit to realism [/h2]
The game adverts realism but the grand majority of the tanks unlocked in low BR struggle with the slightest inclination and in some cases they even get stuck on a lower portion of the map where they can't easily get out of ([i]I'm looking at you 47/32 L40 on Ash River, point A[/i]). Partially because of this reason, it is not uncommon for you to spend several minutes just driving towards the capture point at an awfully slow pace and god forbid if you hit a destructible decoration: those ludicrous 12 km/h will be halved in no time. [i]It's a [b]tank[/b] i'm sure it can drive over a wooden fence with relative ease, no? Welp, there goes my precious speed.[/i]

[h2]Grind? I barely know 'er![/h2]
Researching vehicles and parts is painstakingly slow and, in all honesty, the grind doesn't feel rewarding in the slightest and that's something said from someone whom played grindfests like Warframe for thousands of hours. It's there purely because Gaijin wants you to spend money to buy premium currency so that you can either assign "convertible research points" to what you're trying to research or straight-up by it immediately.

[h1]..and the good[/h1]
[hr]
Despite the shot fired at the lack of realism in the tank movement, the game actually manages to deliver good realism in terms of tank modules, volumetric armor and even bullets to the point where the game can become rather technical and overwhelm new players with all the kinds of bullets and MG belts that some vehicle have.
The game has a pretty high skill ceiling thanks to the different strategies you can have when fighting your foes, especially given that every tank has weak points so the best approach might not always be blasting right away at center of mass.
There's a cubic FRICKTONNE of vehicles in the game (exactly 2000 at the time of this review) buut a good portion of them are premium vehicles that can only be bought through Gaijin own version of the steam market and [b]OH BOY[/b] if some prices are high.
Last but not least... the game can be quite addicting sometimes. I don't know why but placing a good shot onto your enemy and watching it go up in a blazing fireball of glory gives you a rush of dopamine that makes you yearn for more death and murder. [i] I promise, I'm not not a psychopath... i think[/i]

[h1]The conclusion [/h1]
[hr]
From what i experienced so far, the game is not bad but at the same time i don't think i would really recommend it, especially for casual players. The suffering and grind required to get out of low BR games is extremely painful to the point where it just ruined the game for me, especially given that some countries like Italy or France have awful reserve vehicles making the grind even painful.

If I could give the game a mediocre rating instead of a yes/no, I would. It's not a good game, but isn't necessarily a bad one either.

I don't care for air or naval combat in this game, so I won't talk about the gamemodes primarily focusing on those. This is a review strictly for ground battles (Arcade Battles and Realistic Battles) from the perspective of a working adult with relatively limited amounts of time to play games.
If you are planning on playing this game without spending any money and would like to play relatively modern vehicles, prepare for an extremely tedious grind or look for something else. If you're happy playing WW2-era vehicles, the grind is very easy.

[h1][b]Game economy[/b][/h1]
Premium resources:
[list]
[*]Currency, Golden Eagles (GE)
[*]Convertible research points (Convertible RP)
[/list]
Standard resources:
[list]
[*]Currency, Silver Lions (SL)
[*]Research points (RP)
[*]Warbonds (WB)
[*]Crew XP Points
[/list]

SL is used to purchase parts and vehicles unlocked with RP as well as to repair vehicles after combat.
Research points, convertible research points and silver lions are granted according to your battle performance.

[h1][b]War Thunder features P2W or P2W-lite mechanics[/b][/h1]
Premium vehicles
[list]
[*]Highly increased in-game currency and resource  generation
[*]Historically often released as overpowered and nerfed later on or not nerfed at all
[*]Costs (money needed to be put into the game) vary from slightly less than 2€ to about 60€, and some vehicles need to be bought from a webshop directly
[/list]
Premium account
[list]
[*]Highly increased in-game currency and resource generation
[*]Price per day varies depending on the length of premium account time being purchased
[/list]
Convertible resources for premium currency or money
[list]
[*]Convertible RP
[*]Crew XP Points
[*]Premium currency can be converted to standard currency (GE -> SL)
[/list]
Gameplay-affecting cosmetics
[list]
[*]Camouflage paint (can be acquired by grinding)
[*]User-placeable bushes for vehicles https://i.redd.it/1kdzncxlvyy51.jpg  ,mostly a problem in RB and SB
[/list]
Booster items
[list]
[*]Up to +75% resource generation for 1 day / 10 battles
[/list]

[h1][b]The good parts[/b][/h1]
[list]
[*]The amount of vehicles for 10 different nations, with only minor overlap
[*]Generally enjoyable new player experience
[*]Crossplay for PC/PS4/XB1
[*]Graphics settings can be adjusted to a level where the game will almost run on an actual toaster
[*]Solid vehicle modeling
[*]Battles feel engaging when a team is working together
[*]Lower battle ratings can still have solid competition between teams
[*]Distinct battle modes (arcade, realistic, simulator), out of which only simulator is somewhat realistic
[/list]

[h1][b]The eh-whatever parts[/b][/h1]
[list]
[*]Most lower-rank anti-air vehicles do a better job focusing on ground than air
[*]Needing to research the ability to repair a vehicle and to extinguish a fire, grind for the sake of grind without any reasonable sense
[*]Traction-physics were changed some while back to combat players climbing into unintended spots on maps, instead of just fixing the maps. This resulted in even less logical traction-physics which are at times borderline comical.
[*]Larger tech trees need to spend more time unlocking vehicles from previous ranks to progress onto the next one
[*]Tutorial only applies to arcade modes and is mediocre at best
[*]Not a lot of communication-options for teamplay, unless you can type real fast
[*]The game features lootboxes
[/list]

[h1][b]The bad parts[/b][/h1]
[list]
[*]Map design is quite simply extremely poor from a gameplay standpoint; Unbalanced spawn points, ability to snipe from spawn to spawn, spawning in an open field, one side of the map given better cover, old tanks on very large maps, modern tanks on very small maps. There has been very little care put into the creation of most maps and it shows. This would not be such a large problem without the respawn-system, but it is amplified tenfold because of it.
[*]Engine sounds especially for wheeled vehicles sometimes just quite simply do not play regardless of distance.
[*]The game does not encourage teamwork. Defending a captured objective is a good thing to do but you won't get rewarded for doing it as your progression is tied much more directly to how you did in a match instead of how you and your team did, which leads to a lot of people avoiding playing the objective in favor of personal progression. This is slightly less of an issue in RB compared to AB. Personal progression generally does not win games, but it is what is being rewarded the most. I am guilty of doing this as well to speed my progress through the grind.
[*]Massive repair costs for smaller tech tree vehicles at higher tiers makes people leave a match after a single death to avoid losing more currency. Non-surprisingly by paying for a premium account this is much less of an issue.
[*]Ground Battles are called Ground Battles, but also feature airplanes and helicopters (at higher ranks) whilst Air Battles does not feature player-controlled anti-air for example. Naval Battles also include aircraft. I don't personally mind this too much, but it would make more sense to call the modes combined arms (ground, air or naval) and this has been an issue for a few friends that wanted to play tank-vs-tank but had to deal with aircraft as well and thus stopped playing the game as it wasn't what they thought it would be. In RB you also need to grind your chosen nation's aircraft tech tree, as winning without air support can be very difficult especially when you start encountering helicopters.
[*]Increasing crew-level for a given vehicle takes a large amount of time, unless you pay money in which case you can start out with a straight up increase in vehicle performance as opposed to a person who hasn't spent money on that particular vehicle.
[*]Some tech trees are an enormous pain in the ass to grind through (Great Britain is suffering and I'm just bad at playing Swedish paper tanks) due to lacking vehicle performance
[*]Swapping tech trees is quite simply a massive pain as the grind starts again, although low-tier France has been quite enjoyable
[*]Game objectives fall into three categories: (1) Capture and hold a single neutral point, (2) defend your team's point and try to capture the enemy's point, (3) capture and hold three neutral points. 1 is by far the worst one out of these, as if one team succesfully wins the initial push, defending the point is extremely easy on most maps as long as nobody is too horny for kills. 2 easily devolves into just a team deathmatch, which actually makes it the most enjoyable as pushing into enemy territory requires some coordination, which is severely lacking in this game. 3 would be good but due to map design either the points are too close together or don't have any cover, meaning that the winning move is often to play team deathmatch until you can push enemy spawn to an extent and then cap the points at which point it's already [i]gg.[/i]
[*]Ultra-low quality graphics settings make things way too easy to see and essentially turns this into a point-and-click adventure game. I played 10 games on high settings and then 10 games on ULQ and did noticeably better on the lower settings as seeing enemies was incredibly easy, sometimes you can even see enemies behind buildings that haven't yet been rendered. Probably doesn't matter too much in AB, but it's an issue in RB and SB.
[/list]

[h1][b]Some thoughts[/b][/h1]
Mechanically the game has a lot of things going for it, but is held back by greedy monetization schemes, bad design decisions and poor management. Whilst the actual combat is mostly enjoyable, anything outside of that is not. Stay in rank IV and below for sanity and healthy blood pressure if you're planning on minimal monetary investment.

War Thunder is simultaneously the most fun and the most boring game. You spend as much time killing enemy tanks as you spend getting destroyed by them.  While at first,  the game seems realistic, realism is thrown out the window.  T-44s in War Thunder can survive multiple  88 mm rounds at point blank range from rear and sides.  In real life, the 88mm round would penetrate the T-44 from over a 1 km.  Tier 2 tank destroyers 1 shot you from across the map. You are just as likely to feel like you wasted your time playing a match of War Thunder for a measly 50-100 XP towards your chosen vehicle that you are researching as you are having fun destroying tank after tank earning at least 1000 XP.

Now I'm coming from PS4, I can't play War Thunder on my potato laptop because I don't have enough space. but boy.. oh boy, do I got something to say.

This game. it's an absolute [b]grind-fest.[/b] I'm stuck on 3.0 in the american tree and had to buy premium tanks ( german and russian, because I've heard they're at least half-decent. ) to even enjoy a battle, and even then, in PVE modes, I can get deleted by enemy tanks from 'AmMo ExPlODeD' or 'CrEw KnOcKeD oUt' because the A.I has the aim of Chris Kyle.

I tried regular PVP battles before that. I can't even bother to try them now. I'm no god in this game, but there's a point to that. you need to play with people that are on your skill level, not people below, not people above. without that, the game just doesn't work.

The only redeeming features I can even think about in this game is the acrobatic servers you can occasionally find in custom battles. and that's it.

I sank money and time into this game trying to enjoy it. I occasionally go back to it just to see if It's fun at all. it really isn't. it's stressful, it's un-fun, you get thrown into multiplayer matches against players that are either gods at the game or have tanks that are x10 more powerful in armament and armor than yours.

and I haven't even started with air battles. I so desperately wanted to climb the ranks of fighters and find my way to the F-14, but with how little RP you get out of PVE battles, I honestly just can't help but be discouraged. It's saddening to see how far this game has fallen from when I played it last in 2015 ( my first time playing, i wish It was the last aswell. ) and then I swung back around ( late 2019-2020, probably. )

Gaijin. [u]fix your game.[/u] the less you listen to your loyal community the more players revolt/leave. and once again. if your not willing to spend actual money to get even the slightest fair chance in a fight, whether air, land, sea or somewhere in-between. [b]DON'T GET THIS GAME.[/b]

As an intro: I played this before from gaijin launcher - so steam counter is not relevant in representing of how much time I spent in this game in general.    
     
     So after some graphically impressive adds acompanied with impressive promises I desided to give this a try on my new rig (i7 12700 + rtx 3070ti) - to try it out and see whats going on in this game itself. And my expectations haven't matched reality, unfortunately. 
     
     Game is incredibly boring, uncreative and everything in it is too dated - tech game design, gameplay design etc. It feels especially good after playing other online games: BF 5, CS, COD, Overwatch. Unfortunately, this is just a "better" clone of WoT (despite both of this games ain't any good). 
     
     Gameplay accents on "realism" despite putting player into unrealistic battle surrounding. As a result - you play slow tanks on a 1 square kilometer of space with ~20-30 other tanks, with zero infantry and objectives being "kill all enemy tanks and\or control 1-3 points for some reason". Incredibly tealistic if you count on the fact, that many (if not most) tanks that are in this game are made without an idea of being "tank destroyers".
     
     Maps are plane and encourage camping from predefined spots. All of them are basic and made ib same ideology. Basically, its a WW2 styled "massive tank battle" with (too) straightforward ideas, and it doesn't matter what you are in: ww2 tank/plane or an MBT or jet - on a modern tank or jet you will do same and fight same as on pre ww2 one and any other in this game. And yes, you will fight on an MBT/jet on WW2 styled locations - near burning Reichstag or soviet village. And vice-versa - on a ww2 tank in modern port or city.
     
     If you throw away the "realism" and concentrate on competitive aspect - you won't get what you find. Matchmaker may easily drop you versus a higher level of tech or lower, despite time finding you a match sometimes baing few seconds - why isn't it possible to make it 30 seconds - 5 minutes? Or make a setting for a player's choice: to find game faster or to wait a bit for a better match? And in general - while playing, you can't find for yourself any competitive value in the process.
     
     Despite objectives on the map being team based, there are few ways to communicate and coordinate with teammates - there is no viable voice chat and even text chatting is limited - so nobody use that. In fact, most of the time players are solo and everybody doing whatever he wants. Thats why you ain't getting satisfaction even after wins.
     
     The gameplay is made slow on purpose. Well, the gameplay itself is uncomfortable. You easily get frustrated and bored even if you kill several enemies and your team wins because of zero creativity in gameplay. Match these factors - and you will easily get bored after couple of days or even hours playing. 
     
     Leveling of tech is too grindy and tech itself often has no difference with previously opened one, making leveling (even with premium) too grindy and boring. 
     
     Graphics are generally good despite physics system and game engine itself being dated, and you easilly feel it. It's an old, poorly technically designed game with HD textures. Many tech issues: random fps drops, stutters, game feels sluggish and laggy from time to time despite being played on modern pc (12700 + rtx 3070ti). 
     
     I can't recommend this game even for those, who doesn't care about everything mentioned below, because I can't even find any real, convenient pros. Tech itself is made based on history specifications. But I can't recommend it even for those, who just wan't to try out a realisticish designed tech because of grind and prices - it isn't worth paying 40-60 bucks to try out a leopard, abrams, any other to be disapointed of game itself after couple of days. Maybe ones, who play world of tanks may find this somehow interesting, but the question to those: why are you wasting your time in 2022 playing games like that if there are a lot of much more games to play in your free time? 
     
     Value your free time and spend it visely - and definitely won't recommend you spending (or rather wasting) it in this game - most likely that you won't get any satisfaction, only regrets.

After playing this game for about 500 hours I can say that this game is unique. There is no other like it but that doesn't excuse it's egregious grind and balancing issues (especially when it comes to BR compression). Don't get me wrong, it's a pretty good game but the more you play it, the more you'll end up hating it due to balance and grind. The first couple of tiers is easy to grind but later it becomes a huge slog, not only that, it becomes more of a slog because of tank repair cost making it twice as grindy. The only way to truly enjoy this game is with premium and even that's up for debate. 

I'd give this game a solid 7/10, it's definitely not an average/mediocre game but due to it's grind and forcing you to purchase a premium account is a big no-no in my book. Premium should help enhance the game, not be a requirement.

Was actually really enjoying the game until the latest update with buggy textures that literally obstruct your screen when youre trying to aim. went from 140fps to barely hitting 60 now aswell. the game is extremely P2P. 

sure you COULD play through the game without spending a penny if you dont mind:

-playing 300+ games to unlock a single vehicle
-constantly being outclassed by a player that just spent money to buy a premium vehicle 
-overpowered decals that allow players that pay to hide their tanks with bush decals you can ONLY BUY WITH REAL MONEY that give a massive advantage in realism mode
-Dealing with buggy textures randomly that completely obstruct your view and get you killed
-random frame drops
-toxic teammates
-one sided matches
-getting killed the second you spawn on some maps
-playing what feels like the same 5 maps over and over again
-constantly getting pestered to buy premium one way or another when you login or try to use anything on the store
-Terrible support if you have any account issues
-Russia bias
-buggy hit registration (a shot that scrapes the side of your tank can sometimes insta kill you and other times a clear side hit on a tank can ricochet from point blank range
-arcade mode is flawed with its planes feature you can spawn in and instantly jam your gun so guess what now you get to fly around for another 40 seconds without any weapons while you wait for the timer to finish so you can go back to your tank

Positives:

-cool tank graphics when you hit someone showing what happened to the shrapnel and the shell (even thought half the time it isnt accurate to what actually happened)
-planes feel pretty nice

final note: the game is fun for about aslong as you can tolerate mindless grinding with the same vehicles over and over again with no variation

I doubt anyone reads reviews for "Mostly Positive" or higher rated f2p games or that anyone who does havent played this game yet but in hopes that someone came upon this review I made sure to leave my 2 cents to spare the mental health of some of those people in touch with their psyche and how manipulative tactics work. This game is pure frustration hidden behind good looking models, and flashy explosions. 
 It is obvious for many but as we see in "Mostly Positive" ratio not that many, that games are made for money and money alone, not for players, our entertainment, respect or any humane approach to us other then possible contents of our wallets and the same goes for War Thunder. Players call it F2P, some (mostly kids) call it free game, while it is free to install and play as much as You want it comes with plethora of manipulative tactics such as horrendous grind and monetizetion of any and every part of the game so that player will get frustrated enough into easing some of that frustration by paying into many possible and I would say crucial micro transactions if one wants to get access into the features of the game in any faster amount of time that will be still frustratingly high. Amount of vehicles You can take into battle will be limited by slots that You can pay for effectively meaning that those who have more can stay in the match longer then You, vehicles come with price for vehicle alone, for adding it into the crew, for teaching the crew how to use it effectively despite You could have already spent time and or money on that said crew and then You even pay for dying in the match, using ammunition etc so You will be paying for everything in the game with ingame currency that is called Silver Lions that gaijin is much and much better at balancing so that You will be starving of the more and further in the game You are effectively pushing You into investing into the game to buy the said currency, to buy premium time or premium vehicles.

Gameplay alone is again something that is made to look, flashy in the means of models, explosions, sounds, kill messages and post penetration camera views, which will make sure to keep You in and away from the real design of the game that is based on chasing the carrot. You will either be clueless player who never had idea about tanks and planes etc and just sinked in and You will be amazed by all the possibilities and effectively outplayed most of the time by people with more knowledge or just simply more ingame time. There is no skill based matchmaker and not even a slightest try at adapting one from the devs, You will be mixed with every player who has chosen vehicles of certain BR which is the way the warthunder classifies what will You encounter in the game by picking said vehicle. That will also be influenced by players trends in the means of which BRs are most popular and most likely to be paired with Your choice and also by pure steered matchmaker that is made to frustrate You as You are more likely to be matched into unfavourable odds once You start showing up in the higher part of Your team score more and more often.

While my time spent in the game might contradict my negative review the answer to it is simple, there are barely any products of war machine oriented games with atleast some focus on realism, which this game has, I also tend to be unlikely to leave things once I am invested in them and there is a lot of time investment and things to collect, create in this game. It is in the end made to be addictive product based on serving players with quick doses of dopamine, a very dangerous and irrespectfull marketing tactic meant to create a bond with player just like drugs, alcohol etc do. That is why I have decided to make this review in hopes of maybe saving one or more people from wasting their time and mental health on this game. Many of my gaming friends made pass on it based on understanding of how it is designed and I hope I might save a soul or two here too.

This game is great at times and at others; infuriating. Once you reach rank II on a decent tech tree you are almost addicted and must commit to it. Don't grind the USA or German tech tree (Unless you are getting the Pz.VIII MAUS) as they are annoying and you WILL transform into a g-noblin. Maybe try the British tech tree if you hate yourself, it has decent vehicles however Gaijin hates us Brits and make our tanks terrible. Russian tech tree is pretty fun, there is no such thing as Russian bias, so shut up. China and Japan, nobody plays and if you are weird you can play the Swedish tree. Play France if you like Croissants and suffering and maybe try Israel if you want to cheat. There is the regular bug or as everybody calls them 'Gaijin's' ("I've been Gaijin'd") which can be pretty annoying and inconvenient. The RP rewards are unbelievably low, for example I got 550RP for 6 kills and one deaths (for comparison 4 kills is good and an early tank requires 40,000RP).

So finally, in conclusion; play this game and don't care for progress, it will make you sad or agitated. If you really wanna have fun in this game play it with some friends, it can help a lot. Good luck with the grinding of over 2000 vehicles. But, most importantly: Have fun!

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Basically just a bad drug. Fun at the start, when you don't know anything. After a while of playing, you finally get a feel for it. After that, you'll start seeing the bugs, hit reg issues, ghost shells, components absorbing shots that get you killed (engine, tracks, fuel, breech, etc), fuel and ammo not exploding after you hit them WITH a tank shell. Apart from mechanics and the like, you are on your own. No teamwork, no relying on teammates, nothing. If it does happen, it's rare. Outside of gameplay, everything is focused on you spending real money. Premium account is required unless you want to spend anywhere from 1 to 3 years to get a single nation to top tier. Premium vehicles to make it easier to earn experience and/or to buy your way to a higher BR. The marketplace for buying and selling tanks, skins, helis, jets, anything. If you buy this game and get even remotely hooked, you will spend money to make things go faster. I've seen it happen to people who said they wouldn't do it. If you're fine with putting up with all of that and still having to sink months and even years to get to high BR with multiple nations, buy the game. Otherwise, don't even try it. Treat it like heroin.

If you want to fire a 20mm rotary cannon and do basically nothing to a Soviet MBT but sound badass while doing it, then this is the game for you!

In all seriousness this game is pretty solid. It's not what I would call free to play (free to start is more accurate) as I would say a premium acc is all but necessary to make decent progress. After about 800 hours and a few premium vehicles I have most of the US ground tech tree and around half of the Chinese and Israeli ground trees. This is a game thats a serious time investment even after forking over some cash... BUT and this is a very big butt, There's nothing quite like ripping tanks apart with the A-10's GAU 8 cannon while dodging missiles from the enemy SPAA only to be blown in half by a HE shell from the main cannon of some random tank on the opposite side of the map.

This is a very skill based game and some match ups just aren't fair.  Get over it, there's not much you can do about that issue other than look at what you did wrong and try to play more passively until you know the map layouts and understand what your specific vehicles (as well as the enemy's) CAN and CANNOT do! In CQC I'm very aggressive in something like the IPM1 or ZTZ96A but hang back or support other players in vehicles like the M3 Bradley and PTL02.

As far as Air RB goes I'm still very inexperienced but have had quite a bit of fun in the Supermarine Spitfires and A4E Skyhawk. It's very clear that the skill ceiling is very high in the air modes (pun intended) and that it's going to take significant time to understand what to do in each vehicle.

Naval? Haven't played it and don't intend to until they finish working on mechanics.

Overall I'd say that if you're looking for a game to replace 90% of your time gaming and enjoy fairly "realistic" interactions between military vehicles then this is about as good as it gets.


PS: I will one shot you and drink your tears :)

fun game but issues that keep it from a game i want to play a lot 

first of the the game play for the most part is great id say im a casual player but ground rb is a ton of fun and nothing feels better then pulling off a good flank or learning a tanks weak spots then using that against them, the damage setup is pretty great as well and each tank looks great and the art style is solid.

the issues i have a re few but they stop the game being fun

the first is up tiers, this alone is not a big issue but other issues make it worse, it often feels like the game is using you as fodder, again you get this with most games but here other issues add to make it worst

bushes, bushes are pay to win sure you can "earn" them but they are a cosmetic that on some maps make you near impossible to spot and even upclose can be used to hide weak spots so you can't ID the tank they also don't come off when a tank is hit or a tank uses a gun covered by them so it feels like the realistic aspect they could play is gone (use them to get to a good spot well hidden) and are something players to pay get a big advantage.

repair costs, these are what ruin the game for me, when you're trying to progress into the higher tiers they become the main thing that stops you, you're already paying for the tank, then the upgrades THEN ammo most of the time, then you can get slapped with repair costs, if the matches were balanced and fair sure ok but they are not you WILL get up tired and on some maps its super easy to spawn camp so you can get a brand new tank and not even want to use it.

your only option is to see the tanks you want and grind for them and not even use the tanks you unlock to try to save, that or grind hard on lower tiers to get lions, some defend them and say "balance" but just no the only reason i kept playing i won a million silver lions the progress was so slow and the set backs could be so annoying i was ready to quit, the worst part is the game WON'T show you repair costs unless you go to your inbox and look at the battle report message so you can think you're fine but all the while you're losing lions,

overall the game i fun but some systems make it so i just don't want to play anymore i'm not opposed to grind i have 1500 is warframe but this grind feels bad and cheap and lazy

I fucking hate this game and would never recommend playing this to even my worst enemy, so instead of writing an in-depth review explaining why this game is such a waste of time and space, I will instead write a step-by-step guide on how to uninstall it and or remove it from your account.

1. Navigate to the banner on the top of your screen and click 'library.'
2. Locate 'War Thunder' on the left-hand side of your screen (game titles will be in alphabetical order, so it should be towards the bottom of your steam library.)
3. Right click 'War Thunder.'
4. Hover over the 'Manage' option.
5. Click 'uninstall' and or 'remove from account.'

Riddled with Pay to win, Bias, and a slew of other things this game is either for the rich, or the Russians. For a game so centered on realism they seem to make a lot of crappy mistakes that love to bite each other in the back. Whether that be artificially nerfing/buffing a vehicle to suit it more to its br, or changing a vehicles br it never truly feels realistic nor are they consistent. It doesnt make sense ww2 era vehicles face guided missles but here we are. It also doesnt make sense how some things are br placed. Like the Marder a1 vs Marder 1a3. They are the same damn tank aside the fact the marder gets access to a round with like 15mm more pen yet its placed at .7 br higher. Or the german tam vs the tam2ip. In every aspect the 2ip is either the same or better, there is no downside to the 2ip, aside the fact its a premium vehicle so you have to spend money, yet they are the same br, definetly for sure not pay to win. What I hat most about this game is with how terrible it is I still find it addictive given its the only game of its type, WOT sucks harder.

Untill they fix the obvious russian and prem bias im not spending another cent on this game.

War thunder is an exceptional technical achievement, it's combat gameplay is one of a kind, the level of detail is spectacular, but the gameplay itself is incredibly unrewarding and even at times can be disgustingly unappealing. The sheer amount of playtime required to progress in this game is unacceptable, I cannot expect the average player to have the thousands of hours of free time that is required to progress the game. The amount of progression materials you are rewarded at the end of an average multiplayer match is insultingly miniscule, meaning you have to play the same vehicles for multiple dozens of matches to unlock new vehicles and repeat the proccess all over again. On top of this, after these matches you are cited a repair cost for any damaged or destroyed vehicles you played that game. This cost increases with the teir of your vehicle, which means that by the latter portion of the game you will be spending more time playing with lesser vehicles than the ones you work so hard to unlock just so you can repair them. This creates a soul crushing, grindy gameplay loop that is not at all kind to any of the games players whether new or expierienced and tends to destroy the will to play for any new players who don't have the time or patience to play as the same couple of vehicles for dozens of matches in a row. This all wouldn't be as great an issue if the combat was fast paced and exciting but even in the casual gamemode "arcade" the combat is very slow, very short, and very unforgiving. You will spend minutes just getting to the enemy players and you'll likely die shortly after unless you see them first, or they're just bad shots, because damage in this game is realistically simulated and getting hit by enemy fire can range from being an annoying nuisance to immediately lethal. The unforgiving combat mechanics would forgivable if the rewards for exceptional combat performance were also exceptional, but they're not. The only rewards for playing this game is either the relief you get after you stop playing it or the regret you feel for spending a tenth of your lifespan getting your first jet.

Continual refusal to address fundamental issues with the game (Map design, spawn camping, power creep, poorly thought out Battle Ratings to name but a few) makes it impossible to recommend the game.
This is a great shame as the actual business of driving tanks etc is very entertaining — probably best in the field.
I played for a while many years ago, when it came out, and again more recently.  The problems that drove me away from the game the first time are still here and, as far as I can tell, there has been no attempt to improve anything.  In fact, if anything, it's worse than it was before.

New players: Steer Clear.  You may be able to avoid some of the problems in the very early game, but as soon as you start progressing it turns bad.  Typically, not long after you decide to spend some money to get over some mild inconveniences.
Returning Players:  If you stopped playing because of problems you had with the game design, sorry, best move on — nothing to see here.
Current players:  If you enjoy the game as is, great!  I'm glad that you do.  I just hope that the shrinking playerbase doesn't end up affecting you.

To add:  The CAS situation is out of control.  If you want to play the game for ground forces, don't.  Especially if you don't already have the aircraft to play cas yourself.  Grinding the Air part of the game, just so you have options as a tanker is Not. Fun.
Constant updates.  Large variety of historical vehicles.

However the ECONOMY is made by a 95 year old white politician trying to preserve minimum wage and child labor from 1873, but its actually inflated like 2046. 

play about 60 games without a premium tanks or premium time. Make about 10k-15k credits a game with some tier 4 vehicles. Decent games with 6 kills in a majority of them. Repair cost ends up eating more than half the "profit". End the day making 70k credits.

Repair is another two whole levels of Bullshit BTW and the team that "designed it" need to have their breeding rights revoked. 

First off Repair cost is based off of global play by the whole community of that specific Vehicle. The more everyone plays that specific vehicle the more it will cost to repair that vehicle. So any vehicle that turns out to be decent with a good "credit multiplier" ends up getting overplayed and its repair cost is blown out of proportions where a lower tier vehicle will have way more repair cost that a top tier vehicle.

Part two of the Reta*d*d Repair system. Keeping this with the Realistic gamemode lets say you want to avoid Repair. Theres this thing called Free Repair.

Currently Im at Tier 4 tanks with Italy as well as planes. The tanks for some reason have a 5-7 day repair time and thats with me having maxed out my Repair crew skill to reduce it. So me who just wants to sit here and play my Italian tanks all day and make progress i cant because ill be making pennies on the dollar thanks to how stupid repair works in this game. its not finished there either. Lets say you decide to move from your Italian tanks that need repair to your Italian planes and fly a couple of arcade matches for fun. Well that means you just removed your tier 4 tanks from an active crew and the repair time is now 30 days. Okay so lets say you want to buy more crew slots so you can have more spaces to be "free repairing" your vehicles. you gotta pay real money for the slot and NOT ONLY THAT sometimes it will cost you over 30k credits just to "train" the crew to the vehicle. That means in the slot only those specifically trained vehicles can fit in so you better not have a tank you want to play in a vehicle slot thats repairing another tank.

I know people will just say dont die then. well its all to damn easy to kill in this game. Almost anything is a one shot and if you dont shoot and wound them first youll most likely die first anyways. Like yesterday i had a game in my Italian M18 and i got a flank on 6 tanks, easy free kills in less than a minute. 
Thats 6 people who now have to pay anywhere from 3000-6000 credits to repair the tanks they were driving , while i made a cool 1500 per kill because, economy. There is literally a plane in the Italian tech tree I remember that had like 27000 repair cost. I think it was the G56 and you made like 3000-4000 per plane you shot down, meaning that if you didnt shoot down 7 planes (a majority of a RB lobby sometimes) then got shot down yourself you'd loose money.

Gajin will say Why TF you hung up on Italian tanks we got 2000+ other options. Gajin STFU dont tell me what i want i dont care that there is 2000+ other vehicles. Half of them are filler "stolen and leased" american and or German vehicles in other nations tech trees. Thats not variety its convolution. I wanna work down my Italian tech tree without the bullshit before i move over to another tech tree. 

If you ask me the Grind and Economy earn this game a HARD PASS. Gajin just sucks.

Maybe one of the best tank and aircraft games i have played. War thunder has a unique way with hitpoints. You dont have a 100hp, instead you have models in your tank and plane. (engine, fuel tank, crew members, ammo) The game has a battle rating system to determine who you play against. Lets say your tanks have a combined battle rating (BR) of 3.7. That means in a match you can face against enemies with 2.7-4.7 BR tanks. But it lacks a SKILL BASED matchmaking with i don't like. Your account can be level 7, but in the 3.7 BR match you can play against people of any level. I hate getting sh*t on by no life 5000hrs level 100s. Overall the game if fun, realistic and free to play so give it a try.

After 150+ hours in this game, playing since 2012, I can honestly say that people shouldn't play this game.
Gaijin have gradually made progression beyond tier 4 almost impossible without a premium monthly subscription, and the situation is only getting worse.
While the game is a lot of fun and quite addictive once you get into it, you really don't feel like you're making any progress at all, and there's nothing you can do about that outside of giving Gaijin insane amounts of money.
What started off as a wonderful and more friendly alternative to hardcore war flight sims, and later World of Warplanes (and later World of Warships / Tanks), has turned into a painful cash grab.

I honestly cannot recommend anyone play this game unless they're happy to spend uncomfortable amounts of money on it.

War Thunder is awesome if you love air combat. Great flight mechanics and easy to play.  My dislikes about the game are #1 Too many newer players complaining.  (Which is sort of Gaijin's fault.)  And #2. Gajin gives no incentives to win matches as team (gameplay is too individualistic).

1.  Newer players don't respect the art form, they respect plane. They expect instant gratification along with thinking that if they upgrade their planes they will automatically turn into Tom Cruise.  But the bottom line is if you're an awful pilot?  You'll get shot down no matter WHAT plane you fly. Because they climb when they should dive. They fight when they should run. They work alone not with the team.  SO they grind for the better plane and the end result is the better plane is a Dragon ....................... but the pilot is a Penguin.
Mix that with a desire for instant gratification and you have unwarranted complaints about the game. 

# 2   Gaijin gives NO incentives to work as a team in a team focused game.  It rewards individual accomplishments rather than team accomplishments.  Because of this some players will throw the match for their own personal agendas.  This frustrates players who are trying to win. which turns them into spawn campers (because the extra effort isn't worth it anymore), and creates arguments within the match.  IMO Gaijin should penalize the side that loses and reward the side that wins.   But that's just me..... :-/

OVERALL?   This is an Awesome game!!!  No other game can touch it at the moment.  The only thing it TRULY needs is new TYPES of missions rather than just the same ole' Domination and ground strikes that influence TEAM effort.

Warthunder's strongest selling point is variety. Combat on land, air, and sea, with hundreds upon hundreds of vehicles spanning nearly a century of technological development. While progression is painfully slow and punishing without spending real money, Gaijin provides very few opportunities to pay to win the game, far fewer than any other free to play game. There are other, more true to life simulator games out there, but Warthunder strikes an excellent balance of realism and accessibility. Give this one a shot, I avoided Warthunder like the plague for years, thinking I wouldn't enjoy vehicle combat games versus more traditional shooters, but this game is just good clean fun.

I play this game 80% for simulator air, 20% for ground. I want to talk about air, because the gameplay is a lot of fun and flying/dogfighting in VR is a lot of fun. Enduring Confrontation is a great gamemode and I enjoy it thoroughly.

Now, I didn't come here to submit a positive review, so I'll skip straight to the problem.

The economy in this game, to put it lightly, is fucked. I have a premium account, I fly premium jets. I typically have a 2:1KD of players I kill to times I die from ANYTHING.

If I get a solid 15 player kills (not to speak of the dozen or so AI kills), and die 7 times in total, I LOSE MONEY. I lose money after PAYING FOR PREMIUM AND A PREMIUM JET, while performing VERY WELL. This is just fucking outrageous.

I never rant and leave angry reviews, but this game makes me angry. I can't play the game mode I enjoy without spending MORE MONEY on currency so I can fly the jets I like to fly, even if I perform exceptionally.

Gaijin, seriously, I just don't get it. How can you be so so greedy that a premium account with a premium jet isn't enough for you to throw me a bone.

Fun game ruined by shit economy, even World of Warships is more generous and that's saying something.

THUMBS DOWN

This game seems like a lot of fun. but u get thrown in with no actually good tutorial, you will probably wanna rush up to the tiger 1 and smash out those pesky m4s, but you will soon find out you cant actually pen those m4s, but dont worry they will slap one shot into you and either kill all of your crew, or activate your ammorack. this is a game of almosts. you almost got to shoot someone, you almost had fun. if u plan on playing this game make sure to make you plan a head a few weeks to start turning your turret around, and dont get the panther.

Shithole company is one of the greediest ive ever seen. If you dont spend money, progression is a snails pace while you go up against guys in PTW tanks that can 1 shot you from across the map in the absolute thickest part of your armor, but you cant kill them with 7 or 8 shells point blank because for some reason the thinnest parts of their armor are invincible.

Just for example: the tanks your allowed to use are determined by "research" which is just an outright mobile game feature. Its something meant to limit your abilities unless you pour 4000 hours into the game, or just a convenient $40 here or there. They sell Tanks on their own in game market place like Skins in CSGO, and use their own Crypto currency shill shit. 

Oh but don't worry, Gaijin generously put something called "convertible research"that you can use to unlock any tanks research! ...that is, as long as you pay a huge fee with in game premium currency. They pretty much piss in your hands in the tutorial and give you like 150 GE. which is less than .99 cents worth of premium currency. awesome. So the only two ways to play the tanks you actually LIKE or WANT is to open up your wallet to gaijin and pay *extremely* inflated prices for these tanks. some of these tanks cost upwards of several THOUSANDS OF DOLLARS and you can ONLY UNLOCK THEM BY PAYING FOR THEM WITH CASH.

And lets say, for some reason, you DO decide to spend, say, $6.60 for the second Currency package. Not only is this not enough for literally anything just one tier above the starter tanks, this also will probably be stolen from your pockets due to the predatory practices of their Item Shop. The "Trophies" don't explicitly *say* that they're just some random expensive loot-box, out of which you get pretty much *nothing* unless you beat the statistical anomaly that is the rigged RNG of one of those to somehow get the tank the trophy pack offers. How they show that tank in the pack bothers me though, since they just explicitly say "CONTAINS" directly on the picture of the tank, which *makes you think you're just buying the fucking tank unless you read fine print*

In short, this game is just some long running cash grab by one of the greediest companies I've ever seen, and that's with Nintendo running around on the market. Gaijin sucks. Which really blows because without all of these issues, the game could be really fun.

I strongly and i mean strongly do not want anybody to play this game, warthunder is a mess of a game with a rival that is on the same par. Here is the good, vehicles look right. That is all that is good, now for the bad. Warthunder's ballancing makes no fucking sense. Your telling me that a Yak 9 at 3.7 can meet a KI 61 which is 4.7 in the same match. Japanese planes have for some reason stupidly tight turns that are not possible. meanwhile the game is constantly asking you for money and without paying a penny the game is a grind. Then tanks which make even less sense a T34 from 1941 can meet a PANZER 4 H in the same game and the H was being built in 1944 i bet when you reach 5.7 you just meet a god damn abrams. In arcade battles everybody can see your planes weaknesses no matter what. for planes its a bit fun in arcade but if you go to realistic in planes may goid have mercy on your soul. you have 1 shot, 1 singular shot at the match and if you are new you are gonna get shot down immediatly because high level players are always in low tier battles. then in Ground arcade everybody can see what will and wont penetrate your tank and in ground realistic you are either in the bottom of the leaderboard or at the very top because of the issue of high level players. this game would be better if realism was at its core and before you say it, no this game is not historically accurate at all, its like saying COD WW2 is historically accurate. The only real fun you can have is in the mission editor and Ground Assault Arcade. Low level naval battles are fun for a second but once you get a tier higher you get sunk faster then the Empress of Ireland. So in all I under no circumstance support and recommend this game. plus the fact that the devs have sent money to Luhansk and Dontensk during whats going on in Ukraine so yeah (TLDR Fuck this game, Fuck its Devs, Fuck its balancing, Fuck its "historical battles" play something that isnt made by gajin.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas in 2021 from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just watching YouTube. So I decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. I loaded into the game, picked my character and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. I loved it as it was the best time I had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.
As a pretty good player I can say this game is not for everyone, but its FUN.

I Have played this game since 2017 and there are some things I must say about this game. Overall the content is all their, vehicles, maps, tanks, ect. However my problem with Gaijin is that as of late they are ignoring and outright making the game worse. Gaijin has been ignoring the worsening Battle Rating (BR) compression in air and tanks. Anything above 6.3 in air RB and you automatically get put up against cold war era jets while your in a Jet from the WW2. This can be especially frustrating when your just flying a super prop and have to face up against aircraft that were developed 5 to 10 years later, aircraft that have better weaponry, speed, missiles, flares, you name it. It also doesn't help that Gaijin has also nerfed The economy to the point. That you have to have 3 to 5 kills to break even at high tiers. This game forces players to spend real money to Grind and to break even with the economy. Gaijin in their infinite wisdom is making the economy really really bad. The only way to break even is to fly with a squad mate, but even then most squad mates only want to fly at really high tiers.

The only reason people play this game is because Gaijin basically has a monopoly on the World War 2 Simulator Genre.
play it if you like nazi's, WWI, WWII and in the future WWIII live

It will take you a while to get to the modern tanks and planes.The planes and tanks look realistic to their real counterparts and the damage system in the game is very immmersive and your bullets actaully hit where their supposed to and you can get a slo mo view of your bullet hitting another tank and watch is blow up its very satisfying.

Few games have made me consider uninstalling the game in the heat of a rage-quit more, and even fewer games has made me throw money at them for premium accounts and vehicles at the same time...

Make no mistake, this is not a free-to-play game. The grind is so goddamn massive without a premium account running that you'll die of old age before getting to top-tier... But man do i love this game at the same time...

I really love the game, but with the amount of grind involved and the mechanics that constantly push you towards spending money on premium-account time and premium vehicles I cannot really recommend this game to new players unless they already have friends who play and want  to join them :/

So it's not really a bad game. Just feels like a massive chore to get through the research part and getting to the next tanks.

All of my hours are me playing with T1 tanks and on rare occasions trying T2 Swedish tanks. But it's not really helping because then everyone else has better tanks than me and after my T2 tank dies I have to use my T1. Not that fun.

I kinda wanted to try out the later Tiers but I believe I'll be stuck in the lower tier for way too long.
Unless you throw money at the game that is. Which I'm sure the game is meant to do.

So my experience so far? Well I hardcore mode and picked Swedish tanks. Basically I get one shotted A LOT. It's a bit annoying.
I have gotten kills, I have won games and stayed to the end. I've also gotten one shot kills too and it feels good.

But overall I believe the game would be better if you could get through research a bit quicker because they have a ton of tanks now. Even air planes, boats and now choppers. 
People would probably stay for longer if they could try out more and new tanks instead of grinding one tree tier for hours on end.

Isn't bound to any one type of vehicle, so there's hours of fun to be had with not only different landscapes, but also different perspectives of modern warfare. 
Not only this, but historical background about each unit is given in its profile. So in addition to having great fun, you might also learn something. Who knows, that knowledge might enhance your game play even further.
The effects and graphics are stunning even on low resolution and the movement of all of the units, save a few of the aircraft, are extremely realistic!
multiplayer compatibility could allow for inter vehicle type combat, but perhaps that comes in later? Possibly my only gripe. 
Without question, best modern TECHNOLOGY warfare game out there!

Just don't play it. 

It's a soul-sucking grindfest. 
If the fact it took them EIGHT YEARS to put a rewind button in replays but had plenty of time to push out a perfectly timed "Top Gun" themed update (packed to the brim with premiums!) in time for the movie, that should tell you everything you need to know.
They have also taken the time to make the very planes and tanks you grind out for months, if not years to get, so economically unviable as to punish you for playing what you've earned. Wanna drive that Leopard 2 or Abrams? Wanna fly that F-4 or Mirage? Better hope you have an undefeated streak with multiple kills or you will bleed currency like a severed carotid artery.

TL:DR 
Don't play. You grind and then get punished at the end.

I've been clean for 6 months now and I've honestly never felt better. War Thunder has been on a downward spiral for so long and I'm concerned for all the new players picking up the game. The grind is aggravating and intentionally so because the devs know people will pay for premium time to ease the frustration. It's because of this and the recent economy changes which slowed progression to a near halt that the playerbase has been so much more toxic, selfish, and generally on-edge. It's no wonder chat was banned for three months, but it's not the players' fault. Update after update Gaijin continues to develop their cash grabbing schemes while actively neglecting the dedicated players that time and time again willingly violate international law for a chance to influence the game in their image. 
    I don't mean to say noone is allowed to enjoy things, but me and so many others who have been playing for years share the same sentiment about this game. I only hope more people can find the strength to quit. War Thunder is one hell of an addiction, but I promise you the withdrawal is better than the grind.

This game hurts to play...... but i like the pain so i keep playing.The amount on grind in this game is on a scale i've never seen before,i've had more fun in minecraft digging through a mountain. Warthunder can have its moments though few and far between especially if you play Americans (which i do) early American tanks (everything before and including WWII)  dont have the armor or fire power to go toe to toe with other nations, meaning if you have any American tank (heavy included and any other tank under a battle rating of 6) and you are directly facing a German panther in any of its variations your dead end of story unless your will to live kicks in and you the destroy the barrel (a very small target) you my friend get to see another day, but keep in mind you only disabled them for like 30 seconds alternatively if the panther shoots you in the center of your tank your dead, your american tank cant penetrate the front armor of German tanks. You are Effectively the underdog so you have to play like one, if you see a tank look for a way to face its side or get really good at destroying tank barrels because your never going to win in a gun fight fair and square. That being said i still like this game i just dont want people to play this game expecting to see all the modern vehicles really quickly,ive had this game for 3 years playing on and off and im just now getting Vietnam era tanks. if you do pick up this game i wish you luck.

I tried to like this game. I really did. I've given it several tries both on and outside of Steam totalling about 500 hours played together and I've enjoyed most of it. The game is fun, realistic, but ultimately rather frustrating to play due to many scummy practices designed to keep the players playing (I'll get to that soon).

So, I should probably start with the obvious. The game rewards being good and punishes being bad. Which in and on itself is something I fully support... but only if you put players at a level playing field.

When you get a new tank, you first need to research the modules so you will be nothing more waddling hunk of steel with a toothpick attached for the next couple of games. So you join a match, go to a decent spot and get hit from god knows where by an RU-152 ice-skating around at mach 3. Your gun is blown to bits, your engine is wrecked and you can't even repair yourself because your crew somehow forgot the existence of a cogwheel in the brief amount time it took you to retrain them for the new tank. Now you have to ask your team for help and wait 8 minutes until someone maybe notices you, or simply give it up and go to garage.
You've achieved nothing, have been nothing but a burden to your team and got back to your garage knowing all that with but a poultry sum of experience and money. Oh and did I mention you could actually LOSE progress? So you better hope that the gearing up won't take you too long because you WILL go bankrupt.

Second issue makes the issue 1 all the more infuriating. There isn't a system by which the matchmaker would sort out the experienced players from the the inexperienced players other than the rank of your vehicle. That means that you can easily lose just thanks to the enemy team getting 5 players who played this game since the stone age while yours didn't.

The third and last issue is the one which I hate the most. The power your credit card has over this game. You can play the game "normally" and spend thousands of hours grinding without ever getting to the rank 7. Or... you could just take out your credit cards and get the same progress is 1/10th of the time! There's legendary vehicles like Katyusha, Brummbar or Centurion ACX, all locked behind a paywall that you cannot pass without taking out your credit card. You can buy camo and place it on your tank, giving you a competitive edge over your enemies! For the small price of 3.30 euro of course.
But I think you can get those very rarely from the spinning wheel of daily rewards that so tentatively goes over all the luxurious rewards you think you can get, only to land at that one, single 10% booster you need to play 2 hours daily to actually get any use out of. Unlucky! So they even gave you the option to double the camo on your tank for a monthly fee, so you can live out your dreams as a moving bush.

All'n'all. The game is fun, I enjoyed it. It's realistic and enjoyable for both new players and experienced ones alike. But it's also designed to be as frustrating as possible with a simple fix to all the frustration being money. I guess that's pretty realistic as well...
Anyway, if you got this far into this outburst of mine. Thank you... and I'm sorry. I needed a place to vent after I sunk so much time into this game hoping it would get better eventually.

Rant over.
