I do not recommend this game to people who are looking for a game to play long term. 

However, this does not mean the game is "Bad" by any sense of the imagination. It's the contrary actually, The game is beautiful with amazing detail in terms of the visuals with amazingly detailed vehicle models and weapon/destruction effects. 
If you are are a lover of war machines that float, fly or rumble across the ground with semi-realistic battle characteristics this game will be enjoyable. 

Now, the reason I can't recommend this game is due to how the end game content is structured and released. As well as end game and new maps that are contradicting to the modern mechanics that are actively being added to the game. This portion is specifically talking about ground forces. My Ground forces playtime is not comparable to the tiny bit a time that I have with planes or ships. 
The late or 'End" game for Warthunder is an absolute mess that is reminiscent of a test server or sandbox accept for the fact that is's actually on live servers. The modern vehicles and their weapons systems are great but they feel out of place with the maps that we currently have. These new mechanics and features feel like they are being bottle-necked due to the size of the maps in Warthunder. Some nations ideology behind the intended use of these vehicles are poorly represented in game due to the maps and the game modes. This is very apparent when grinding through the German and British Ground force tech trees for example. The top tier British MBTs are considered bad not because of the vehicles characteristic but because the game simply does not support the ideology because the use of challenger MBTs. Instead the game modes force these vehicles to be aggressive on really tiny maps that completely disregards the ideology that Gaijin balances into these vehicles. Resulting in them being considered "bad" or " Not Competitive". Which is really a shame for a game that goes into such detail and tries it's best to be semi-realistic. There are many examples of this in game that will make grinding through tech trees a real hell.

This brings me to my next point, progression hell in the form of Gaijin intentionally making stock grinds as terrible as they absolutely can be, Creating an "artificial problem" and selling players the "Fix" in the form of allowing players to purchase modifications with Golden Eagles. They do this aggressively with many tech tree vehicles that nearly make them unplayable and forcing you to either endure many battles of absolute dog shit or circumvent the dog shit by giving them Money. Just to give an example, a few of the top tier MBTs only have HEAT available for the stock vehicle while putting the better APFSDS at tier 3-4 modification level. This means you will have to use HEAT at top tier for a while before you can get the better shell types. At top tier nearly all of the modern MBTs  are nearly impervious to HEAT. 
The same idea does with multiple vehicles that only have APCR as stock ammo that you have to grind through for the vehicle to finally be usable or even remotely fun. 
Not only do they do this with Shell types, but also with Thermal and Night vision modifications, Fire extinguishers, repair kits...ect. Imagine playing top tier MBTs without Thermals, no APFSDS, no FPE and no repair kits. And you are expected to either grind through this shit or give them money. They create so many problems and sell the players solutions that should be Quality of Life improvements. They monetize heavily with Premium vehicles every update, events and with premium account status bonuses. They have no excuse to completely disrespect their players time with stupid marketing techniques like selling QOL improvements that should be standard game QOL updates.

Once you reach 3.0 you start to get messed up my modders who shoot you through buildings and mountains. They really have to fix this problem. I payed for premium (which I now regret) and now im disgusted by the sportmanship of some of these people who mess up the game for everyone. Fix it or youre gonna lose a lot of players if you havent already. Im out.

War Thunder is a great game that does a good job of balancing pay-to-play and regular players. The BR system ensures that paying does not give an overwhelming advantage and keeps the game enjoyable for all. With that being said, expect to put in a ridiculous amount of time if you want to advance to higher BR without paying. Progression is slow and costly. This seems like it is done on purpose to entice you to pay which makes sense. If you want to play just to enjoy the early game definitely go for it. If you're expecting to fly jets and the latest tanks, give it a pass.
its a amazing game

This game clearly does some things right and you can definitely have a lot of fun while playing it. But there are so much glaring issues that I have to talk about.

[b] Map Design [/b]
It's clear as day that gaijin has 0 clue on how to make maps that would be actually playable. Most of the maps are just not playable with tanks, like sure, they are realistic, but they are not designed for tanks. Nobody comes to play war thunder for the realism, because realism is not possible with uptiers and downtiers.

[b] Uptiers & Downtiers [/b]
I'm going to try and simplify this: Let's say your vehicle is at tier 6.7 (usually late WW2 vehicles) you have a chance when in a match to face off against players that either are lower or higher than you. For example if enemy vehicles are at 6.3, 5.7 then it means you got downtiered which usually makes your game a lot easier because of your superior vehicle and skill. But it's way more likely that you're going to be uptiered, (booster are basically going to make you always get uptiered) which makes you get pounded by enemy players with early Cold war vehicles who make your vehicle 80% completely obsolete. It wouldn't be such a big issue if it wouldn't happen every one or two matches. It's honestly just terrible game design, it's not fun and no-one likes uptiers, like literally no-one.

[b] Pay to win [/b]
No matter what anyone tells you, this game is 100% pay to win. You can purchase "premium" vehicles for real life money or in the marketplace which usually ranges somewhere from 40$ to 100$+. These premium vehicles are usually experimental models of typical vehicles who got up gunned or up armored. They are usually at the same tiers as their typical counterparts but lets say with a lot of benefits. First of all the vehicle itself is usually superior to others of it's tier, and they pack something called a talisman, which helps you grind research points (used to unlock vehicles)

[b] Terrible economy [/b]
This game's economy is shit. You have to be the best of the best to make up for your losses in the match. There are 3 currencies in the game: [u] Silver lions [/u] - Basic money, used to purchase normal vehicles, their modifications, repair them if destroyed in battle (basically if you get killed you have to repair the vehicle), [u] Research points [/u] - used to unlock vehicles and their modifications. [u] Golden Eagles [/u] - can be bought by real money, has a chance to drop from a lucky wheel box (0.1% or something like that). Used to purchase premium vehicles, can be exchanged to silver lions or can be used to boost the research progress of unlocking a tank, can also be used to buy lucky wheel boxes, battle passes. talismans, vehicle backups and everything else in the game. Now This system itself is pretty scummy, but the really major issue is with silver lion ration between getting and losing them. To simplify - if you don't perform really really well in a game you will lose money, bad streaks of games basically result in losing tens of hours worth of progress. You will usually find yourself with 2 or 3 researched vehicles that you cannot purchase because of lack of silver lions. It sucks.

[b] Pro Russian Devs and Russian bias [/b]
Gaijin (the devs) were originally based in Russia if I'm not mistaken. It's clear that the Russian vehicles are balanced to favor the Russian Team, The Russian vehicle repair costs are cheaper than any other nations, the Russian tech tree also has the most and the best premium vehicles, For example a Modern Russian MBT - T80BVM has a max repair cost of 3,960 SL, while a modern German MBT - Leopard 2A6 has a max repair cost of 5,410 SL, now this isn't the best example of the level of unfairness in the game, but one of the Japanese little cars with a missile launcher that can't kill anything has a 11,000 SL repair cost which is insane. This persists in lower ranks as well. It's clear that Russian Bias is in this game and there's no denying of it.

[b] The FUN [/b]
There is some fun in this burning pile of shit. You can definitely have a good time. There is just something so satisfying when you play your cards right, get 4-10 kills per game and win. It's so satisfying. Although there is some fun to be had here, there are so many issues which prevent you from enjoying this game

Its an abusive ex girlfriend. She berates you. Her behavior has no logical threads. And when you think you have her figured out and happy, she'll spit in your face, drain your wallet, and sleep with your best friend's neighbor.

But when she's good in bed, when you wake up in the morning and she's got breakfast waiting for you with the smile and care of a loving housewife, you'll want to put a ring on it.

Okay, metephors out of the way.

Avoid this game.

It is not friendly towards casuals. The skill ceiling and curve is impossible if you're just looking to play this game and kill time for a little bit. Yes it has "arcade" battle modes that are a bit more forgiving but the skill curve to adapt to them, even at the beginning stages of the game, are a grind-a-thon of annoyance, inconsistency with game mechanics, leveling up skills, grinding the tech tree, and just overall frustration.

And if you aren't a casual, you will also hate this game. You will either hate the fact that your favorite plane/tank/ship is not the indestructible war machine you *think* it is, you'll hate the RNG applied when you actually do hit your targets and do zero damage, you will hate how you have to deal with aircraft in ground forces mode, you will hate the economy, you will hate anyone who criticizes your chosen nation, you will hate the community that hates this game, you will hate other players for their lack of awareness, you will just hate everything (don't believe me? Take a trip over to the discussion forums and just see the salt mines at work).

Maybe once in a blue moon you'll have a good game or two, but that's only if you can completely detach yourself from any emotion when playing this game, are able to just focus on scoring your points, and just moving on. The moment you celebrate and the moment you think you're having fun this game will crush your gonads in a vice.

This is one of the absolute worst games i've ever played.

I'll start with the positives, it has very satisfying ground combat with different parts of your tank being damaged depending on ammo types and where you aim your shots. Finding a target 1km away, zeroing in on your target and landing that perfect shot is immensly satisfying. And the game has lots of tanks with different guns and ammo types to learn about and adding replayability, but that is sadly where the positives end.

Now to the negatives, if you are solely interested in playing tank vs tank combat or atleast ground vs ground combat this game isnt for you, you are gonig to be constantly killed by different types of aircraft and an absolutely excessive amount of ATGM (Guided missiles) and often you have 0 chance of defending yourself. This gets even worse with players being able to respawn because when you find yourself in a good position taking out a couple of enemies you can be damn sure one of them respawns in an aircraft and comes back to kill you. 

And theirs to my knowledge no way of playing against only ground vehicles so you are stuck getting bombs dropped on your head ruining all the fun.

The maps are absolutely terrible, alot of them consists of really open spawns with dense hard cover in the center, which means ones you loose the center you wont get there ever again. This results in lots of spawn camping which makes the games absolutely terrible even if you win, because either you loose the center and theirs not even a point respawning, or you win the center and all your opponents leave resulting in very short unsatisfying battles.

Also, progression is extremly slow, even with a premium vehicle, premium time (Which is way overpriced) and a silver lion booster you wont make much money. And alot of the tech trees have extremly similar tanks one after another that you either have to buy even if you want to skip it, or you have to progress through the exact same modifications on basically the exact same tank again before it gets decent enough to play. And you also have to progress through large parts of the tech tree even in you are only interested in a single tank because you have to unlock a certain amount of tanks in each rank to be able to research tanks in the next rank.

And lastely the game looks absolutely dated, these graphics would have been okay in 2013 and impressive in 2007 but in 2022 they look god awful and the UI is EVEN WORSE.

To me and my friend group, War Thunder is a team-deathmatch arena shooter in slow, lumbering armored vehicles; its emphasis on tactics, measured precision and light vehicular management instead of twitch reflexes makes it palatable to older gamers who can no longer keep up with the esports-y multiplayer shooters of the world. This one quality barely allows it to transcend its many, intertwined issues with its matchmaking, match design, and F2P grind.

We exclusively play a mode called "Realistic Battle" (RB); a midway point between the goofy, tactics-free "Arcade" mode and the oppressively hardcore "Simulation" mode. In RB, teammates are usefully tagged in the mini-map and HUD, but enemies must be called out manually or scouted with special vehicles, adding a layer of stealth-action. Between its variety of physically simulated vehicles and chaotic combat, it can be a good "situation generator"; its best matches are fought down to the wire with risky plays and clutch moments.

Unfortunately, those games are few. The peculiarities of War Thunder's F2P grind and lack of thoroughly conceived match design means 20-40% of players on either team are playing in bad faith; running match-sabotaging farming metas that the game fails to punish. Half of the matches are a blowout, decided by which team has more committed players rather than quitting after their first death.

This phenomenon can be mitigated by playing in a large enough friend group (4+) of competent players; it's possible to enjoy winning streaks by virtue of stacking a side with good-faith players. But solo, the War Thunder experience can be quite demoralizing, especially when you play with factions and tiers that have a concentration of poor or bad-faith players (e.g. mid-tier Germany).

This game has been around for a long time and the devs have exhibited no will to fiddle with their gameplay formula, so I expect these issues will never be fixed. War Thunder can be a good game under the right conditions, but an oppressive one otherwise.

This game is flagrantly pay to win. Unless you have friends who play and you want something you can just slowly plug away at, or unless you have a really stacked bank account that you could use some help draining? I wouldn't really advise anyone to play anything with a PTW platform. I've long been of the opinion that that particular business model needs to go extinct and even if it happened tomorrow? It still wouldn't be soon enough for me. Having said that? I also have complaints that aren't based on the PTW model.

Such as the fact that 'Arcade Mode' really isn't all that 'Arcade'. Just about any tank shell from any tank on a similar or higher tier than yours? Is basically guaranteed to kill you. Some will do it more slowly than others by first killing your driver or gunner, or setting your tank on fire. In either of those cases? You're basically paralyzed and left out in the open for everyone to shoot you. If the game is feeling particularly merciful? That shot will, instead, just kill your whole crew in one blast and let you respawn in with a second tank.

I haven't tried realistic combat mode yet, because frankly, if Arcade mode is that much of a nightmare? I'll need to buy a new keyboard, mouse, and possibly a monitor for all the rage that 'Realistic' mode would inspire. 

Also? Matchmaking doesn't exist here. Completely new players are tossed into the muck with all the veterans who decide to go back to their tier 1 and 2 tanks just to troll. Ultimately, the game itself wouldn't be half bad if it weren't so impossible to do anything without first shelling out fifty bucks for their 'gold eagle' currency. Researching new tanks, planes, ships, and boats? Well, you'd probably get faster results watching paint dry. I started off by spending 15 bucks on starter packs. I imagine I would be hating my life for having played this much more if I hadn't.

Still, there are plenty of players out there who really enjoy this kind of game, so I can't say it's entirely bad. It just really, really is not what it says it is. The Cake Is A Lie. And so is Arcade Mode.

Being a WWII aviation enthusiast, I love this game, and anyone of a similar mindset will have hours of fun playing this, especially if you have a squadron of friends to accompany you. However, I can confirm that flying in the low level tiers is much more fun than the high level tiers. I'm achieving 7:1 KDs as opposed to 1:1 KDs (if I'm lucky); the dog-fighting is more intense and exciting and there's considerably fewer one-shot kills from overpowered (Russian) aircraft. Gaijin seems to think that the .50 calibre machine gun is better than cannons for air combat, which is not the case. All bombers need a serious buff; the Lancaster was [i] not [/i] made out of soggy cardboard and fully upgraded AI gunners are unable to hit the side of a barn at fifty paces. 

I have little interest in jet aircraft so I can't comment, but if you enjoyed the likes of Tom Clancy's HAWX in ye olden days then I think you will enjoy War Thunder. 

In terms of the naval and ground warfare, both have a more arcade-like feel than World of Warships/Tanks. New players will have an enjoyable time as there isn't any camping around in foliage only to be suddenly sniped by an invisible Tiger. I do get the distinct aura of playing a Playstation 2 game when I'm riding around in tanks.

If a more realistic or immersive feel is what you're aiming for, then I would probably point you in the direction of WoWG for all but the aviation, in which War Thunder is the trump card. I particularly praise the simulator mode, but it would be nice if a group of friends could all operate the same aircraft. That may be asking too much though!

My Review for War Thunder:
I very much enjoy this game, but it does have many pros and cons. For one, it's graphics are pretty solid at around 8/10. It's cool to be able to drive the tanks and fly the planes this game has to offer. However, The number of cons for this game, in my opinion, has been steadily increasing. Gaijin's scummy business model is basically "Make the grind so goddamn terrible the player pays for a premium", which really ticks me off. There's also an issue with the volumetric shell system and "ghost shells", which is a major detriment to players of all tiers. The issue with BR compression is by far the worst, though. You'll have a Tiger II fighting M4s in a downtier and early-cold-war tanks equipped with HEAT-FS in an uptier. Overall, I'd say that this game is addictive and fun at most times, but the cons may detract from your experience.

I desperately want this game to be better than it is, but it has all the stuff I hate in free to play games done quite badly. It could be worse, but it could certainly be a hell of a lot better. It's really too bad, because its the only real competition to World of Tanks (which I refuse to support for personal reasons, though from what I've seen, the creators of this game have their own shady side, so they're little better) and I very much want a nice, realistic tank/fighter sim with combined arms warfare that isn't Battlefield because I like my big tough vehicles that can knock over houses more than running around with a gun.

1) The loot boxes are trash. 
I have never once recieved a tank from them. Most of the time, I recieve orders, the most impotent and disappointing idea in a game ever. Sometimes I get free upgrades or backup vehicles, but never once something worthwhile.

2) The prices are too damn high
Too much stuff is whale priced. Many tanks cost as much as a brand new premium AAA game or more on the stupid marketplace, and there are too many that are marketplace exclusive for no reason other than they probably make more money selling outside of Steam. And there, some of them can cost hundreds. Unless you can gurantee me at least 12 hours of entertainment from it (ie a full expansion or at least a bundle of 3+ vehicles), I refuse to pay more than 5-10 dollars for any in-game anything ever. Also, some of these are reskins of vehicles with no difference other than a fancy new coat of paint. Fuck off.

3) Orders are pathetic
In theory, the ability to issue an order to your team to change the flow of the battle or how they fight for a reward should be a major boon, allowing you to demand your team to do something critical or make a battle play totally different mid-way through. But instead they're useless filler for actual rewards. I've never seen anybody actually change the way they fight due to an order because nearly all of them are just "kill some enemies" with slightly different fine print. I'd rather see ones that can completely reverse a battle if a team is getting steamrolled, like calling in a playable airstrike with AI controlled escort fighters or AI backup bombers auto-targeting the enemy, an extra potent artillery strike from a battleship that effects a wider area for longer, or summoning a neutral tank that's 1-2 BR higher, that both sides would have to contend with or team up against. Better if these types of boons could only be used if there's a clear major difference in team performance, and maybe give some free respawns to make things more interesting for everyone. Or maybe changing the objective mid-battle, to force everyone to shift their focus and position.

4) Progression is too slow
It gets much worse as you go on, as research point requirements scale up as you progress, causing progress to slow down to a crawl unless you play in very specific ways. Just remove the scaling of research points from the trees and make most vehicles cost roughly the same. It can take many hours to unlock a single new vehicle, which is stupid because there are soooo many spread across all the nations, especially between ground and air forces.

5) Turn the damn voice chat back on and loosen the text chat limits already
Chat has been heavily restricted ever since the war started, because the devs don't want to be accused of taking sides or something despite the fact that it makes it extremely difficult to coordinate with a matchmaking team. You can only send one text message per minute, and if you send it too early, the timer resets. There's also many messages that you can only send once very 30 seconds, including ones you may need to use several times in a row, like marking multiple enemies when you're surrounded and need help.

6) Why is so much tied to tier 3?
Some modes and functions are only allowed if you have reached tier 3 with at least one or more countries, the worst offender being the wager mode, the only way to make a decent amount of money, already having the caveat of it being a risk, but also you need to have a tier 3 vehicle. Also all but one of the daily missions require tier 3s, for each class of vehicle. I've played 200 hours and have zero tier 3s, mostly because I try and play each country roughly equally. Also I don't want to keep playing the same tanks over and over and over and over. I want variety, so I'm not gonna just grind one country. Tier 3 takes forever to reach. Just please remove that requirement from at least wagers and the daily missions.

This game could be awesome, between the realism of the vehicles, the way their movement is tied to physics and the functionality of the vehicle (i.e. having a track disabled causes you to spin in one direction in a tank, having an engine disabled in a plane causes you to just be unable to use it to accelerate, either forcing you into a glide or making you lean/spiral, leading to you learning real-ish world flight physics and tank piloting tactics such as conservation of energy in dogfights and hulldown maneuvers. But it's plagued by some of the worst stuff gaming has to offer. I'd ask you to fix it, but you won't. Because why make the majority of your players happy so they all want to spend money to support you when you can abuse a handful of neurodivergent people with predilections to gambling addictions and impulse buying to relieve the stress of their lives who will spend way more money until they're penniless?

Strongly suggest you avoid this game.  Any "positives" far outweigh the negatives, so I'll outline the issues:

Almost every aspect of this game is unbalanced.  Such as...
- Late '40s/early '50s jets will be placed in matches with more advanced jets with A/A missiles.  
- Every tier of vehicle (air, ground, naval) will be mismatched.  You'll find yourself frequently stomped on by upper tiers.
- Many vehicles, especially the premium paid ones, are ridiculously out of balance and the developer doesn't care.

Economy suffers from late-life game development that has gone so far off track there is no easy fix.  Such as:
- Tier 4 and higher you'll lose money, forcing you down to lower tiers just to make money.  But once you do, you'll barely earn Silver Lions (in-game currency) and be forced to grind for days just to save up enough for the next vehicle.
- Repair costs are insanely out of control and only meant to force players into the grind or to pay for Silver Lions.
- Research grind for upper tiers is so crazy it's obvious the developers intent is to make you spend money to speed it up.  Without a Premium Account, you'll spend weeks (if not months) trying to get to the latest vehicle.   Even with Premium, you'll grind over and over again in the same unbalanced matches.  Frustration will be high.  It's become a running joke in the community.  "Gaijin Frustration."

Developer is based in Eastern Europe but is openly Russian.  They were caught purposely giving Russian vehicles combat advantages.  They (and many of the Shrill supporters) claim this isn't true, but go into any Realistic match with a US vehicle (especially Air or Ground) and watch antiquated T-tanks stomp modern M1 Abrams.  Or MiG-15's run circles around an F-86, which actually out-ran and out-gunned early MiGs in real life.  You'll find yourself losing over and over again while the Russian team crushes.  None of it is based on reality and clearly there is bias from the developer.

There's many more issues than this.  Bottom line: Avoid this at all costs.  Don't fall for it because it's "free."

I would recommend and not recommend this game at the same time.
War thunder can be a really fun game but there are a lot of things that are bad about it.

I will not talk about premium and credit making but the overall the economy of the game is quite healthy.
The game is grindy but not that much. It is quite easy to grind and go through the tiers.

If you want to play this game for fun grind some historical known tanks you can do that and have a blast.
And it is what i would recommend anyone to do with this game.
You can do that as a free to play player and buy paying as well. They are both equally doable.

I would not invest my time and play this game seriously.
This is my personal opinion.

This game does not have a high skill cap and it is not a competitive game.
There  are mechanics to learn and there is a curve.
Games like world of tanks for example are. You have statistics that matter a lot there.

There are some really big problems in War Thunder that make it really bad and toxic to play.
                                                                -MAPS
The maps are just bad. The rotations for the tier you are at are not well thought.
For example i can play with a low tier vehicle and play at a map that is made for high tiers.
Every map has a distance per square you see  on the map. And many times you just end up driving for most of the time. The maps are way too many as well and variations of them exist as well. 

                                                 -How the maps are played
The maps are not well thought there are many maps that are unbalanced and no real way of how you can push or flank has been thought off. They are way too big and in general you cannot do anything to push or flank. You have no options. Yeah they are very well designed aesthetically but that's about it. You can look at world of tanks maps and how they are designed.
There are positions and counter positions as well as opportunities to push and play the game so you can win.
War thunder doesnt have that.

Also there is way too much foliage. Bushes trees and the maps are so condensed with them that you cant see anything. You cant knock a tree down and use it as cover as well it disapears so your tank is exposed either way. They dont provide any realistic cover and shooting through them most of the time becomes just a hussle and annoying. You cannot see enemies as well and shoot them. Also spotting in this game could be so much more but it is very badly designed but that is another conversation to be had.

                                         -Spawn camping and cheesy spots.
This game has a huge problem with spawn killers, seal clubbers and campers.
You have people that  fly around the map and know a position or 2 to spawn kill you and make the game unplayable. This happens on every map and it is just bad. This is a byproduct of how the maps are designed. Cheesy hill positions or out of the map areas that you can go to that normally you shouldn't be able to.
This game has a lot of seal clubbers way too many that take advantage of that.


There is killcam. In a game such  as war thunder where some times where you are matters when you kill somoene they can see basically where you are. This leads to people target killing you in planes and in tanks in general. Another massive problem this game has is that it includes Planes in tank battles. Attack planes and bombers. People when they die they go in their planes and spawn kill tanks, bomb around the map constantly and there is zero counteplay. There are antiair (SPAA's) but they just die to planes way to easily
and they are not effective at all.

There is a huge gap between how easy it is to fly a plane shoot at the top of the tank and kill it and actually being able to couterplay that. There is no counterplay and it is just toxic because people will target you over and over just because you killed them. 
There isnt a only tank battle mode as well. Airplane fighters have their own game mode but ground vehicles dont get their own and it seems totally stupid and possibly just a money grabbing attempt to buy bombing premiums and attack fighters for people that just dont want to grind for Aviation of that country.
In sort you can take a number of tanks and planes in your lineup meaning 5 slots to fill and that is only for that country.

Another gameplay issue i see is that some tanks and countries get up-tiered when they shouldnt. 
Tanks being at higher battle ratings when they shouldnt be.
There are nations that are too good at certain tiers.

I am a world of tanks player and i decided to play this game for fun because my friends play it a lot.
I am extremely good at world of tanks and i decided to take a little break and try it out. Put this argument about which one is the better game to rest on my mind at least.

TLDR. If you want a highly skilled and competitive tank game that has stats that matter play world of tanks the game is not easy at all to pick up learn and be consistent at it you will also have to pay a lot of money to actually play the game and many people cannot afford to do that.
IF you want to have some fun and play casually not spend a lot of money basically none at all play War Thunder.

Both games are Unique but world of tanks in my opinion is more flushed out more polished and just better in every way. Overall play war thunder if you like but beware that people are extremely selfish and that  the gameplay is toxic.

[h1] Good game, BUT [h1] 

This game is good, and has many enjoyable moments. Learning how to properly manage the battlefield is rewarding and getting kills is always satisfying, however I feel that most people will not enjoy it alone. Unless you have a love for the vehicles themselves, or just generally prefer playing most multiplayer games alone I think most will only get the full experience out of this game with a group to play it with. Not only can teamwork majorly impact your in game performance, but without a team the game can easily be discouraging or frustrating.

[h1] PAY TO WIN. [/h1]

[h1] Unbalanced [/h1]

- WWII tanks fight against cold war tanks and/or armament.
- grass balls with tracks (grass is pay to use, so again, pay to win).
- poorly designed maps that allow players to spawn camp.
- tanks are defenseless against planes.
- SPAA need LUCK to kill, not skill, you may hit the plane but that's what you'll get, "HIT".
- console players have wallhack and aimbot embedded ingame.
- when you get up tiered you can't do almost anything else than quit, and you'll get your tanks blocked for ~6 minutes.
- poor AI and the team is almost always full of bots, bots that just stay there watching you get killed by an 1.0 tank, let it run around the spawn, go commit suicide at the enemy spawn when game's still in an early phase, without the team having control of any of the points.

[h1] Bugged as hell [/h1]

- invisible tanks, you may see a tank, aim at it and see how it just boils out, it still there, so if you don't shoot you'll get clapped.
- shells that somehow just pass through the enemy and hit the ground behind him, without giving you even the infamous "HIT".
- poor servers. packet loss high as Snoop Dog, and you'll see when it crashes, it just send you to the lobby and block your tanks for "quitting".

[h1] Broken economy and grinding [/h1]
if you're a casual player who likes tanks, once you reach middle battle rate (5.7/6.3) you will spend at least 6 months grinding for the next tanks, and it doesn't end there, each match you cant participate because you got killed by a pay to win grassball heavy tank, you'll lose in-game currency, making it hard as fuck to even pay for those new shiny tanks that you grinded for so much time. 


[h1] Conclusion. [/h1]

don't play this game, I'd quit it if I wasn't addicted to those dopamine shots when you kill another player in an awesome way.
you'll suffer and the only way of having fun is ruining someone else's day.

Grab this review template here! 👉 https://vojtastruhar.github.io/steam-review-template/

(Review will be updated over time)

I would like to go in some depth about my experience with this game that should clear up for a lot of people why I gave this game a negative review. For many players who HAVE played War Thunder, you already know what's about to be said here.

I'm gonna be honest you guys, this game used to be so fun back then. It's take such a huge fall in the last 2 years that at this point it's a lost cause. As of about 1 week ago from the time I'm writing this, I have uninstalled the game. This is not too many days after hearing of the F-14 being announced. This right here is where I have one of the biggest issues that I will cover now.

New Vehicles, no fixes:
Now, War Thunder lately as most of the player-base knows has been adding a lot of vehicles that game is quite frankly not ready for. Even the player-base themselves admits to this, as I have literally gone into multiple matches and asked about what people thought about it. One person said (not in their exact words) "Wonderful how they won't fix bugs and balance vehicles, but they'll add a new vehicle like nothing."

What Gaijin doesn't seem to understand, or at this point doesn't want to acknowledge, is that this game is far from ready for the vehicles it's been adding these last 2 years or so. Let me paint a picture for you if you are a bit lost.

(Many people who remember the Harrier release will remember this)
Think about this: A Harrier GR.1, a Jump Jet aircraft that was developed in the mid 60's. Very capable aircraft.
On the release of this plane, it was put up against KOREAN WAR era aircraft.
An aircraft from 1947 fighting against one from the 1960's. Doesn't make sense at all, right?

That's War Thunder.
This is a big example of what happens whenever a mainstream military vehicle gets released. This process will continue to repeat every single time. The F-104 did it, the English Electric Lightning did it, the Harrier did it, and so on and so forth.

I've read some of the other reviews here, and the amount of negatives vs positives are not very promising at all
"It is unrewarding, unfun, unfair and, most of all not worth anyone's time."
To be honest, I could go on about how trashy this game has become. 
I'll let the rest of the negative reviews do the rest of the talking for me.

I will no longer be playing this game anymore. It's a waste of my time.
I'm only keeping it on my library out of some desperate hope that it will get better, but...
If this game doesn't show anymore improvement (Which it likely wont at this rate), I will be removing it from my account.

Stay the fuck away from this game. Please.

Edit 6/29/22: Danger Zone Update.

So from the videos I've seen from other content creators of War Thunder, its not looking too good.
The F-14 seems as broken as I thought it would be upon launch.
It's been said that this update has broken so many things that it has made the game practically unplayable.
Upon launch, the game experienced graphical glitches (Not too unusual for this game tbh) and in some cases for ground RB, I hear that tanks sound effects have been broken to the point where certain vehicles can sneak up behind someone and you wont hear a sound. I have not played the game by this point, so what you're reading right now is just observations from other players' experience.

Speaking of Ground RB, I should cover the issue I've had with that in my personal experience.

It's so broken. It drove me mad with how many times I've had good vehicles get nerfed into oblivion, the armor penetration is extremely inconsistent, overpressure is buggy as all hell, etc.
I'll get really specific with my experience.

Some of you who have played war thunder long enough may have heard of the Sherman Jumbo (76). A decent tank that was moved up to 6.3 a few updates back. What this would mean for this tank is that it would face kingtigers more often, and on top of that; tanks with HEATFS (Which showed up a lot).
This wouldnt be so bad if the Kingtiger variant you were facing was a (P) model, the variant with a round mantle that serves as the ONLY weakspot against a 76mm. That was not the case.

Most of the battles I've had in against a Kingtiger whilst in a Jumbo Sherman was the (H) variant; the Kingtiger that can't be penetrated from the front whatsoever unless you have a *100mm* sized cannon or bigger.
I can only assume that the wehraboos complained enough about not being able to pen the damn thing to the point where gaijin just decided to solve the issue by putting it in a spot where it had no chance. 

More importantly about this "rant" if you will; thanks to uptiers, 6.3 immediately equals 6.7-7.0, so trying to have fun in this tank is virtually impossible because everything you'll be facing will slap the everloving shit out of you before you can even do anything useful. 6.7 is already a nightmare in itself too, so good luck having fun there.

-------

I remember a time where War Thunder used to have historically accurate matchups in terms of countries fighting each other. It used to be the standard Allied vs. Axis combat in RB, ground and air. Now it's just a hot fucking mess where you'll get matched up with Germany on the same team as America.
And don't bother about BR decompression, because the reason Gaijin won't do anything about that is the same reason why they removed historical matchups. 

"It WiLl MaKe QuEuE TiMeS ToO LoNg"

So what?! If it means the game I'm waiting for will be FUN and FAIR then I don't mind waiting a bit. It's such a half-assed excuse for something that could probably change the game for the better.

Did you know that the bombers still have placeholder cockpits that haven't been replaced with actual cockpits since they were supposedly first added to the game? But they'll add a new mainstream overhyped aircraft like its nothing. Says a lot, doesn't it?

Okay, I'm done for now. I'm gonna keep tabs on this.

There should be a support group for players of this game.  I've heard it said that War Thunder is the game you're almost allowed to have fun with and it's 100% true.  The frustration and emotional damage wrought by War Thunder is a war crime in itself.  You get just enough non-BS matches to keep you hooked while Gaijin panders to select groups just to milk more money from them.

Every vehicle you research just brings you further up the frustration ladder and it doesn't get better until you reach near the top.  Until then?  Well, prepare your hind quarters for an almighty violation.  Unlock a WW2 era tank?  That's ok, you'll be facing Cold War era gear.  Your mighty 1942 heavy tank will be strapped down over and over again by HEAT-FS rounds not developed for 10 years.  Got yourself a brand new, shiny jet?  Don't worry, you'll be fighting other planes outfitted with guided air to air missiles.

To make it even better, you're required to either pay lions (the in game currency) or wait to repair your vehicle.  The costs of those repairs are *supposedly* based on the effectiveness of the vehicle but there are patterns evident that rule that out.  For instance, planes with no guided munitions will cost more than a plane just a step above it that can erase you from existance with nothing more than an afterthought.  But that plane a step above will be half the price.

The game mechanics that sounded so cool when you first read about them?  Just another avenue of frustration.  Volumetric rounds, for instance, are great until they're not.  Theoretically, the rounds have an actual volume, instead of just being the exact pixel you aimed at.  Actually, it's not even that, the exact pixel that Gaijin's screwed up mechanics decided that the round actually went.  That round has volume, but only most of the time.  Sometimes, rounds that should have bounced off due to the armor (if they were truly volumetric) just magically go right through.  

When you're not dealing with that, you'll be dealing with magic glass that eats every bit of a tank round or pilots being "knocked out" with a frequency that defies logic.  Probably 90% of my deaths in a plane are because the pilot was knocked out.  Doesn't matter what kind of maneuvers you're doing or the range you're at.  Gaijin decides the moment that round is fired whether it hits and nothing you do matters in that.  

And don't even start on the crew levels.  Until you've nearly maxed them out (a process that *requires* real money, FYI), they're near useless.  Want to turn?  Hope you've coughed up for the Golden Eagles (currency paid for with real money) to skill them up, otherwise, they'll black out almost instantly.  It gets worse too.  Haven't maxed out that tank crew yet?  Hope you like being killed by invisible tanks hiding behind what amounts to a stick because your crew's spotting skill wasn't high enough.  

Every once in a while though, you'll have a good match.  One where you get paired up with vehicles that are near enough to your own to make it fun and when the almighty RNG-esus smiles upon you, granting your vehicles some semblance of normal performace.  It's just enough to keep you playing but it'll destroy your sanity in the process.

Well, after over 1,500 hours in the game and reaching 11.0 in America. I feel qualified to write a review about the game.
General playing:
First off, it's a grind. However, if you set yourself a goal and identify a tank/Aircraft you really want to aim for, it's achievable.
Since the disabling and reintroducing of the chat under stricter rules, it is much more friendly.
I'm unsure how to feel about all tanks being able to repair each other now. It does help in making it a bigger teamwork experience. However, it's lessened the role taking of a scout tank/player.
Artillery strikes seem to hit everywhere except for you or the enemy player, but when it does land... glorious.
Overall, the general day to day playing of this game is very enjoyable if you are into your vehicles. You'll find yourself get mad for 5 minutes, alt-tab, watch a YouTube video and then be back for more.

Updates and Patches:
I have to say, Gaijin are very proactive with Patching and releasing exciting new content. Every few months we have a new battlepass and a update with new vehicles. They have done a great job in moulding the game to create new, fun ways to play.
With the introduction of realistic bomb craters to shape the landscape, bulldozer blades to move the ground for protection and soon, napalm to demolish areas of trees.
There's been a fantastic gradient of releasing modern vehicles and we are continually getting a taste of new technology.

Overall:
As an overall, i'd recommend this game to everyone to at least try.
It isn't going to suit you all, the grind is real and without premium you can double the timescales.
But, for someone into mechanicals, the x-ray shots of tanks and damage models are great.
IF... you look past the odd "that should/shouldn't of penned!!!" moments.
I've enjoyed with friends, made new ones and loved experiencing tanks through the years.
There will always be moments in this game you will become frustrated, as with any game. But... it's worth the grind.

My tips for new starters:
Map knowledge and vehicle knowledge is KEY! If you get killed by something or struggle to kill, go back to the hangar bring up the damage model and see where to shoot or how to angle your tank. Over the years, this has become ever more important!
Look forward to seeing you on the field!

Ranking up via the tech tree in this game is an issue. Most free-to-play players quit around tier 5 and often become crippled by repair costs. The game is amazing but suffers from greedy game devs. You'd be lucky to reach the top of a tech tier in any nation within a year. The gam essentially cripples players for playing.  The marketing for this game is even worse, they advertise top-tier vehicles and get new players excited to play these cool cold war esc planes and tanks. yet no one will reach them. Some of these tier 5 tanks can be crazy in cost as well. you have to pay for the tank, repair costs, a crew, training the crew, etc. Im going to stop playing the game and move to another cause the game wasn't what it was advertised as, but if you like these realistic war games give it a try. I love it, I just don't want to grind the game this much. I have a love-hate relationship with this game.

"Pilot knocked out"

Enjoy seeing that message when doing air battles, because you're going to see that a lot. You can unload a maelstrom of bullets into the enemy plane and maybe get a critical hit, but they always take out your pilot with 3 shots maximum. 

Also, enjoy wasting hundreds of hours grinding away at this game for vehicles that may be worth or not worth the time it took to get them. This time can of course be cut down by showing the game your bank account, but surely you're not a whale, right?

Don't get the battle pass unless you have rank II and III vehicles, otherwise you won't make any progress in it as battle tasks require you to use vehicles of a certain rank to complete them. This means you're going to be SOL as a new player with nothing but the worst rank I vehicles to start with. 

This game is a painful experience that will have you utilizing the Alt-F4 function multiple times on a daily basis.

But I don't hate the game. In fact, I get enjoyment from it. The grind process is pure tedium but you can genuinely have fun games that can make it all worthwhile. 

I would recommend this game in the end. It's definitely not for everyone, but it works for me.

War Thunder is a really fun game, though there are definitely things to keep in mind *before* you play. 
1.) War Thunder is not realistic. It tries to simulate realistic damage as best it can, but the system for that is extremely simplified and rather bad.
2.) War Thunder is fairly pay-to-win. Premium vehicles out-perform free ones more often than not. This is also taking into account using premium currency to add bushes that act as actual camouflage, buying all your crew upgrades immediately and not having to grind to make your crew better, skipping vehicle progression, and earning RP and SL being fairly slow without a premium account to the point that you will reasonably struggle to get enough SL to purchase new vehicles and train crews for them at the same rate that you research a new vehicle.
3.) You probably will learn that it's better not to play back-to-back. With the amount of SL earned having been decreased recently and vehicles needing to be repaired for SL that you earn, it is possible to lose in-game currency while playing unless you turn off auto-repair. Unless you're also upgrading your crew using real money, a tier 3 tank (out of 7 tiers) can take longer than 24 hours to repair.

Overall, War Thunder is not really free-to-play. If you want to experience the game fully, you kind of have to fork up some cash or play amazingly well which just isn't going to be a given for new players.

Most sane people don't want to spend a month straight grinding for a reward that's not that great. I agree with them but then this game does something that is hated by the community. People in the community hate others that "Pay To Win" in other words, buying top tier stuff in order to skip the grind. Now another problem with this game would be that it does not have very balanced stuff in all tiers of tanks and planes which makes it hard to play and especially frustrating for old and new players which is why this game is dying. I would only recommend this game to someone who is willing to grind, keep their cool, and willing to learn how to play the game well. If you are none of those then I WOULD NOT get the game. After having played this game for a long time (the 300hrs is wrong since I now play it without starting it on steam, so in reality maybe closer to 1000hrs by now) I want to write a review.

First of all I want to say that this game has great potential and if it were like a AAA title I could buy for like 100 bucks and that's it it would be awesome. The problem is however, that in my opinion this game is very much play to win in many different ways that in the end forces free-to-play gamers to become the product for whales sending Gaijin chunks of money.

For all of those, who are not familiar with this game: Warthunder is a game that offers the opportunity to play tanks, ships, helicopters and planes and to fight against other players in multiplayer battles with these vehicles. It offers arcade battles for those who just want to play tanks/planes/whatever but also realistic battles and simulation battles for those who want the full realisitc but also much more difficult experience. The game offers for each type of vehicle several nations and in order to play certain vehicles one needs to research these. While it is fairly easy to reach mid WW2 vehicles it takes hundreds if not thousands of hours to reseach completely research and get all vehicles of one nation and one vehicle type (e.g. tanks)


My personal problem lies not within the fact that the game becomes very grindy if one does not pay for the premium account (temporary booster in research points and money obtained), but rather two other things that majorly impact the game:

1. Premium Vehicles
2. Premium account

Let's focus on the Premium vehicles first of all. Besides the general fact having vehicles that are only accessable after paying up to 60 bucks for each, there are some clear benefits for these: 1. the repair cost is much much lower which offers to use them in a different play style than otherwise possible. Secondly they offer usually 2x money and research reward, thus speeding up the process of finishing one research tree a lot (this is prob the only thing I would accept). Some guy on reddit even made the effort to calculate how much one would have to pay to get every premium vehicle there is and got a value of around 4000$ - an insane amount. Besides this there is the premium account that gives you many benefits out of which I will only mention a few: you get more money and research points, you can choose (or disable) maps you don't want to play in multiplayer (as maps are usually chosen randomly) and you can play with more than 1 friend together (otherwise only 2 people can choose to join together a match).

So how does all this make the game unfair? The reason lies in the cost of repairs for vehicles. To illustrate with the swedish tank 103/A: To fully repair the tank (i.e. after you got shot down) you have to pay more than 9000 in game currency. For each tank you destroy you get usually around 1300 currency. Hence one either has to make sure not to die, or needs to destroy almost 7 enemy tanks wihtout dying to break even. In other words: if you have a 7-1 kill-death-ratio you still only get enough cash to continue playing the tank - there is not enough cash to buy new vehicles or anything. Hence you need to play very reserved, do not push to objectives and play from practically your base to be safe. Otherwise, you loose money and cannot play anymore (as without the money, tanks cannot be repaired and hence used in the next battle). On the other hand, the S103/0 - basically the very same tank but as premium vehicle - gives you twice as much for each destroyed tank (say 2600) but at the same time costs only 2000 to repair. You can down less than one tank per game and still make money to buy new vehicles. This means you can afford to play the game how you like it and not care that much: you can push the enemies, take objectives and actually play an active role for winning the match rather than being forced to be a side role in the back. One can also see it like this: either you are in the top 20% of players so that you can get the high kill ratios or you have to pay premium...

The same is true for premium. While it does not reduce the repair cost, it significantly increases the rewards for each kill and hence makes it possible to play vehicles with which you usually only play with a 1-1 ratio.

I would not mind if the game would only be a grinding feast for free-to-play players but otherwise the gaming experience would be identical. But how it is like this you cannot really enjoy the game as a paying player as you are forced to play the game in a very restricted manner. What needs to change is that the there is no longer such a difference in repair costs so that one can play the game how one wants to regardless of paying or not.

A really fun game to play. And there is a lot to it. I only play as tanks and that is interesting enough to me but there is also the option to play as battle ships and airplanes. And tank battles and sea battles have the option to play as airplanes on the same battlefield as well.
Since you have three vehicles in tankbattles you need to be somewhat cautious, though a mistake will not necessarily ruin the battle for you. Teamwork is rewarded, and the community is generally friendly. There are tactical choices to be made, high explosive shell with little penetration, or high penetration with little damage? Finding a place with a lot of cover or surprise the enemy. A lot of cover can be negated by artillery fire though adding balance to the game.
Besides the battlefield there is also the researching of improvement of your tank which have real battlefield implications. As well as researching new vehicles for which new ones are added regularly with the recent addition of Israel as a playable faction. Adding a reason to play well.
The only downside I can find with this game is that recently it stopped working properly with Manjaro Linux, hope there will be a fix soon.

I gotta say no, honestly. While yes, it IS free to play, you'll get spanked by pay to win guys every time. The grind without paying for anything is insane past the first couple ranks of most countries, which ends up burning out people really badly. This is the 5th time I've tried Warthunder, accumulating over 5,000 hours between all of my accounts, and I think it's honestly gotten worse in recent years. Extremely biased towards German and Russian tech. 
    I generally fly, and its bad. Bombers, for one, are near useless if you play anything other than a certain couple in Germany or Russia. You'll be shot down before ever even getting near the battlefield. The gunners are horrid even with a maxed crew. Almost all of them fall apart at even the slightest hint of damage. Attackers are OK in some instances, but often are a near impossible grind as well if you don't actively play tanks often. They can be game changing if you get lucky, stay low, and ground pound. Flying is focused almost soley on fighters, and even then, the extreme bias is real. Good luck ever winning American or British matches past 4.0BR, Germany and Russia almost exclusively win up until the late jets available. Most other countries will depend on whether they get pitted with or against Russia and Germany. 
  I can't say much for the naval, as I've only really used it to fool around with friends. Last time I played, higher BR were generally full of ridiculously overpowered AI because there was such a small group that actually have high tier ships. 
  Tanks are fun for low br, regardless of country. Mid to high br, though, it really just turns into a cross-map shooting gallery where nobody moves past spawn. Get your first couple tiers of tanks, and never bother with the rest. 
 Helicopters... yes. I can't say, there's not even a normal match making que for them, so they're all throw into the same match. If you didn't buy a high tier right off the bat, you are not going to enjoy Heli fights.

Spawn camping/killing ruins this game.

Die once in ground mode? More often than not you'll spawn to one or more enemy light tanks that zipped across the map and are camping with a perfect shot into your spawn. Oh there's spawn protection? Well if you don't make it to cover or out of sight in 10 seconds (most tanks are not that fast) then too bad. Oh there are no tanks camping? Phew, that's a relief (bomb drops from enemy plane in spawn) *dead*. Well at least I don't have to pay crazy amounts of silver to repair my tank that was killed in 15 seconds of spawning. Oh wait, my brit tanks cost around 10k SL to repair when destroyed.

Better switch to germany since they have cheaper repair costs and the feared Tiger 2 (aka king tiger!) whooo!!!! Oh hell there's a sherman that I can't pen his front armor. Good thing the Tiger 2 is so heavily armo- (Sherman one shots me through my front plate).

Game is not P2W? Well I guess that depends on your definition of P2W. Progression without premium account is agonizingly slow, especially if you have to slog through a crap tank line to get to their mid tier when things finally start getting good. Finally made it through that slow painful grind? Haha, the other team bought super fast light tanks with gold and now we're all the way back at being spawn camped because my stock tank pushes 8kmh when going up a slight incline, while they spent real money to get a super fast light tank with 300+ pen that can make it across the map before most of the team has made it 1/4 of the way across to the first cap base. If you get really lucky and those spawn campers and bombers get killed, now you have to deal with an entire team that just camps somewhere useless because no one wants to die when there are ridiculous repair fees for a tank that gets immediately killed and spawn when you have no chance..

The game is fun but issues that have been reported to the dev for literally the last few years, have gone completely unacknowledged and ultimately take all of the enjoyement out of it.

NO I would not recommend this game to anyone until Gaijin even pretends like they care. But who cares, they just need to put out new super fast premium vehicles to give players another edge and people will keep spending money.

The gameplay is fun. But the crappy money grabbing and silliness of the ground battles is infuriating. You're consistently playing against players who outclass your shiny new tank by 1 or more battle rank. Your nice new cannon bounces off the enemy and they one shot you. You have to repair your blown up tank every game, costing you in game currency. The whole thing is set up to steal your money. It's fun if you make custom games with your friends, but thats about it. As for ground battles, why the hell do you allow planes? There's a plane mode! I should't be getting bombed by jets while riding around in a paper bag of a "tank" and consistently being outclassed. It's annoying.

This is honestly the most frustrating game I have ever played and have had the worst gaming experience with. The Developer simply doesn't care about improving the game, all they do is add new shiny vehicles that 90% of the playerbase will never reach because it takes forever to unlock stuff and people will probably leave well before they get there. The BR (Battlerating) system they use to tier vehicles is the worst tiering system I have ever seen in a F2P. It results in several vehicles being completely outmatched in a fight, WW2 vehicles have absolutely no business fighting post-war/Cold war vehicles but this game forces it instead of doing the right thing and separating time periods.

Several nations are simply outclassed compared to their competition (avoid France and Japan if you do start playing), again the tiering system makes no sense. Vehicles that are completely worse then others will be at higher BR's for no reason, but Gaijin doesn't care about fixing the issues, they just keep adding shiny new stuff to get people to spend money instead. They also mess with BR's of vehicles way to much, ruining line ups, and of course they mostly do this by raising crappy vehicles BR's and not raising BR's of vehicles that actually need to be higher.

The only time I have any fun playing this game is when I'm winning, playing quirky vehicles, or playing low BR. A game is meant to be fun, not constant frustration. A game should reward skill, not who is using the better vehicles, and even if you out-skill someone in a better vehicle the game punishes you with a stupid kill-cam that tells the person you killed exactly where you are and who killed you, thus they will come back in an aircraft and kill you (called revenge bombing). In a game where positioning and stealth is such a huge aspect something like this is inexcusably stupid. I'm not even getting into the Naval aspect, just play World of Warships. If you want to play this game do Air battles, those are mostly fine.

Tanks people payed for are still broken several years after release, because Gaijin doesn't care. Oh, and you better be ready to fork over cash for a premium tank or premium time cause you WILL run out of money otherwise unless you quickly become a god at the game. You earn pitifully little research points and silver lions without one of those two things. If your just looking for a tank game, play World of Tanks, if your looking for a tank simulator, look at every other option instead of this. Wargaming (World of Tanks developer) isn't perfect, but at least they bother to fix game bugs, have some general sense of balance and TRY to listen to their playerbase.

Gaijin simply doesn't.

This is a very good example of a realistic/historic vehicle war game. Graphics are great for its age, sound effects are beautiful, and overall the game feels good, although there is a large learning curve. HUGE issue with the game though is that there is about 6 or 7 "tiers" of vehicles, so there is a lot of variety (which is great) but once you start working on tier 3 vehicles, it will take you atleast 10-15 matches just to unlock the next tank. And that's only if you do incredible in those matches. You will normally only get about 3000 research points (on a good game) and it costs 40,000 to get most tier 3's. So It gets very grindy VERY early

Of course I recommend the game, But!
There should be a possibility that you can opt out of aircraft when driving a tank.
For example, in recent matches I have not had a chance against the opponents due to the fact that you do not get an opportunity to enter the battle when the fucking planes come and knock you out. Excuse the language, but I'm actually right. The only times but have a chance is at the beginning of the match or if you find a roof where you can take protection. But then you can not do much more than watch when your partner becomes Schweiser cheese. What you have to do in that case is to drive a thickly armored tank, but since I follow the Swedish tree, it is practically impossible to survive from aircraft as new ones arrive every minute and you get an absolute 0% chance of surviving. I love tanks, absolutely! But what's the point of driving a tank if you've decided to fly a plane anyway?

The game itself, apart from planes fighting in a tank match, is fun and detailed, but also expect players who do everything to bring you down!

You don't have to be  an 100+ IQ person to understand war thunder, its a great game and has amazed me on multiple platforms, the logic is not 100% sound but the fun is when you start to get your first heavy tank, it takes a long time to research a tank without eagles in my case at least, I mostly love the games mechanics and physics the developers put a lot of effort to show their passion for the war thunder project. good game.

i think war thunder is a game that nobody will truly see eye to eye on for two big reasons:

the first one being that everyone has a different 'tolerance' for what they deem to be a waste of time or money. for some people the grind with or without premium is way too sloggy. and for others like myself, i dont even notice if im grinding because im always 100% focused on the matches im in every single game. im never sitting there like "ugh god this grinding is so annoying." the game is just so immersive to me that while i do agree its a grindfest, its one that i thoroughly enjoy playing through because the core mechanics are solid.

and the second reason being that the grind is mainly dependant on your performance match-to-match. if you go DUMMY on some fools in one match it could equivalate to as much research points as 6 or 7 bad matches with mediocre score. this is the other reason i think alot of people cant get into war thunder, if you're trying to learn but get slapped by dudes that know every map it can be difficult to score enough research points for it to be worth playing in the first place. its a fat smack to the jimmy when you first start playing war thunder, but alot of people i know who've stuck it out over the course of many years still play to this day and i think thats indicative of something positive. 


if i had to generalize my opinion on whether or not someone should play war thunder i would say that its atleast worth a shot. try it out, if you dont have a friend to guide you than do some research on youtube. the worst that can happen is you dont like it. none lost none gained.

GFX: Good.
Sound: Good.
Grind: BAD.

*Needs submarines and CV, alot of seal clubbing going on, too much tbh. - Raise the height of some island on some maps.

*Also i would like to see a more Skill match based on crew skill, cause it matters a lot after 5.0*

There are so many amazing things about this game. The attention to detail on vehicle models, the varying effects of different shells against different armors, and the wide variety of vehicles (both air and ground), to name a few. However I can't recommend this game. The first few ranks of your first nation grind will be unlike anything you experienced before and it will be very fun learning the dynamics of the game, the weaknesses of different types of tanks, and how to play your own tanks' advantages (same for Air). However, once you hit rank 4 or 5, it becomes painful. High repair costs, constant uptiers where your lineup is entirely ineffective, very skilled players in meta tanks who've probably been playing for years, and very high research costs all make the grind slow down to a snails pace. You may go into this planning to stay F2P, and some do manage it, but this makes grinding even worse. Soon, you'll only be getting fleeting moments of the fun you had in your first 100 or so hours, and maybe realize this game is taking too much of your time and not providing enough for it. You'll be telling yourself "Things will be fun again after I get through this shit section of the tech tree" but it never really is.

Other games to check out with less pain than this one:
AIR
- Ace Combat (more arcadey)
- DCS (more sim)
- Vincemus (EA)
- Warplanes (VR)
- Wings of Prey
- IL-2

GROUND
- Gunner, Heat, PC (EA available soon)
- Sprocket (EA)
- Steel Crew (EA)

Feel free to comment with other suggestions

now i'm over 1000 hours in this game i think i can write my review, the game can be fun, but this game is skill based in my opinion as the best players will know where to shoot an enemy's weak spot which becomes important in higher tiers and mainly against the Russians as they have the trolley armour. The grind is also insane and can take you months just to get to cold war era vehicles, with tanks generally take longer and planes are faster for some reason, however the best way to grind is to get a premium vehicle and account as this boosts your research points and silver lions, whilst yes this can be expensive you can buy pack with both in them, nut what ever you do never buy a high tier premium without knowing what you're getting into and they cost the most with all top tier premium tanks costing £51. personally i like this game, however it's not for everyone and i advise you put a couple hours into the game before buying any type of premium time or vehicles, and if you do like the game and want to get a cheaper premium stuff i'd advise getting the starter packs as they give you a premium tank and plane with 125k silver lions and majority of the factions have one.

This game is fun, but I do not recommend it. Its economy is so broken that after a certain point you can only play once and then have to wait several hours for vehicles to repair if you don't want to lose SL. The repair economy is pointless in the first place, its only purpose is to make the game pay to win. The game itself is enjoyable, but impossibly frustrating. I can't imagine the amount of work and time it must take to move further in the game after taking over 3 hours just to get enough SL to buy tank I already researched. Trust me, after getting far enough, all you will ever think about is how broken the economy is.

This game is so unimaginably fun and horribly unforgiving at the same time. The game is a part of my life now. It's a staple for friends I've met and relationships I've had. Play this game with friends and have the time of your life laughing at random shit, killing each other in custom games or grinding planes/tanks/boats/helicopters together.  Play alone and you will send yourself into a pit of despair. The pain of constantly dying to bullshit over and over again never leaving. Only growing in my soul till I finally snap.  Having to get back on again with just the little bit of hope that this time is different. That this time I have a chance to break free of this devilish curse. Alas the never ending cycle of going into battle just to get bombed or sniped by a tank. The greed, it whispers to me, softly lulling me back with sweet lies. "I will get that next tank, I will prevail" I say, finally excepting that this is indeed my fate, as I press "To Battle", I take my final decent down, into the darkness and insanity.

It never ends. 

Its pain, its love, its laughter and its chaotic.

War Thunder is a aircraft battle simulator game. To that goal it dose a good job. 

If you want to play tanks, ships or god forbid helicopters. Good luck. Every game mode except helo on helo has aircraft in it. Whats that? Your in a open top spg? oh here's an aircraft to kill you with its mgs. Oh your in a tiger now, feel invincible? No here's aircraft to 50 cal your tracks and leave you vulnerable in the middle of a field. That is of course if it dosn't have bombs/rockets.

In GROUND BATTLES I get killed by aircraft about 4/10 times. And I know what wt vets are going to say. Just hide. Get to cover. Pop smoke. I would do that if half the maps aren't wide f***in open with no cover. Maginot Line im looking at you. The only time I feel I can play tank on tank combat without the aircraft butting in is when its a city map. Also how would you feel if air rb had player controlled radar sam sites? Yeah, not too fun huh? 

Like I said this is a air sim game with tanks/helos/boats added on for you to shoot. Thats not the worst of it tho. I have seen few games be soo pay to PLAY. First lets start with progress. Did you see all the advertisements with modern vehicles? Want to fly the skies in a A-10? or drive around in a M1A1. Too bad. You must spend hundreds of hours in grinding from literally the beginning of ww2. For each country. For each air/helo/ground/boat separately. Unless of course you drop 80$+ per vehicle just to play modern tanks. If you don't have a premium account, both your research points and in-game currency (SL)are halved. Premium for a year is about 90$. yeah 90$ usd. The game also has multiple currencies just to confuse you as well. You can use you stored research points to research vehicles and upgrades instantly for cash. Its says GE but its just cash. Oh and there's a battle pass you can buy too. I have 200ish hours in the game and have spent them getting USA and Germany ground forces to rank 3 out of 7.

The game is running on a 10 year old engine. And it shows. Some vehicles are modeled and skinned great. Alot of the older models are showing their age, but thats not the problem. Its the bugs. This thing is infested. I think the game is just too old and they've tried to add soo much to an ageing engine that was never built to handle. Like laser guided missiles, heatseekers, radar, ships ect. Its engine is just made of patches duct tapped on to it and creates soo many bugs. Not to mention their server connection/latency is bad. Always. 

Also every game I get, the top 3 on each team get all the kills. Half the score card are players with 0k 3d. and this is at rank 5.7 not under rank 3 with bots. Also majority of the games turn into curb stomp matches where one side totally dominates and camps your spawn. Oh and spawn protection is 10 sec. 10 sec to get to cover and hopefully he able to spot and engage the spawn killers. Hope you have your engine upgrades!

Long story short. Very Grindy game. Very pay to play. Feels like im flailing myself if I play it. Don't waste your time. This game is for the people who have been playing the game for years and are too invested at this point to stop playing. Just don't start, their are plenty of games that are 60$ and developers that give a shit. WT doesn't care about fixing the game or making it fair. They only care about the cash cows. Remember if your not paying for a game, you are the content for the players who do.
The game is good but the grind is endless and the swed tanks are the definition of pain.

Game Fuck

I would not recommend this game. Bottom line, if you don't want to hate yourself and get angry at a game, do not try it. The gameplay itself is good, however, there is very much a pay to win aspect of it that you hit in a nation's tech tree around the middle or so. There are premium vehicles people can buy with money that are often much better than the normal tanks. That in itself is not that bad, but to progress in the tech tree you need to earn both money and research points, which increase in requirement the father you get, and once you get into the middle of a tech tree, if you do not buy a premium account, it takes a VERY long time to keep going, especially if you are just an average player (like me). 

The rage part comes in when the game itself does not work like it is supposed to on occasion. Every once and a while, your tank round will hit a glitchy spot in some armor and bounces off, or something called a ghost shell, where you round seems to hit the target and disappear. There are other reasons why this game induces rage, including when your teammates purposely get you killed (not super common, but has happened to me a few times). And getting your tank immediately spawned killed also sucks (the map designs ENCOURAGE this), because tanks cost money to repair, and that takes away from you being able to purchase your newly researched tanks.

All in all, this is still probably the best tank game out there right now. It does not start to suck until around the middle of a tech tree, when it becomes pay to win and you really need a premium account. At that point, you could get away with just starting another tree and having a decent time until hitting the middle again. Unfortunately though, that ruins a lot of the experience for me.
