I'm not quite sure how War Thunder will continue attracting new players, as an already vast gulf continues to widen between what is teased in the marketing and the reality that will confront enlistees when they're given a monoplane (or biplane) from the 1930s to fly into battle. Moving up through the tiers, from there, is a slow grind, and there are a bunch to progress through to get to even some early models of jet aircraft.

The situation on the ground is similar, but less dire, as the lightly-armed and armored tanks of the early tiers are at least pretty fast moving. Something that cannot credibly be said for the rickety old crop dusters of low-tier air battles.

This can all be addressed, of course, by opening up your wallet. But I would advise having someone on hand to fan you gently in preparation for the sticker shock.

I will pay War Thunder one compliment. It covers some under-served areas of interest for gamers fascinated by historical air and ground combat. Such as using post-WWII tanks like the Walker Bulldog on a Cold War battlefield, or dogfighting between cannon-armed, subsonic early jet fighters.

But in its current incarnation,.it seems to either take far too long, with its interminable grind, or cost too much, with its aggressive monetization, to get to that point.
Works as a flight simulator

If you have any interest in air-, land- or naval combat you will probably like War Thunder. A great mix between simulation and arcade, with what is probably the best flight mechanics for mouse and keyboard ever. The damage models, details and tech trees are on point. 

A lot of people are complaining about the games economics, to be honest I never had a real issue.
Firstly, the game is free, and you can play it completely free if you are in no hurry. I think a lot of players get frustrated because the jets and modern tanks are at the very end of the tech trees (which it should be), i.e. many, many hours to reach. To get around this they pay for high tier premium packs, join a battle and get wrecked in seconds, with a loss of the game's currency as a result.
In my opinion the best content gameplay wise sits at low to mid tier and no one should have a problem to keep up with the economy at that point. 

Sure it is a grind, but if you relax and enjoy the content on the way, then it's truly a great game for the fair price of zero dollars.

What the game lacks is a bigger variety in game modes, foremost the game would greatly benefit with the addition of a permanent enduring confrontation mode for realistic air.

Would also love to see the single player component fleshed out, with more modern campaigns and missions. Updated a.i. would also be amazing.


It’s about the journey, not the destination.

Updated more times whenever i encounter something new and playing some extra hours to get some insight of what's going on here. I'm no WW2 expert, hats off to the game devs for making this as realistic as possible but reality is cruel so bare with me as i explain my experience. From the perspective of a regular, not P2W or P2P player. You may find odd i will frequently use the word "terrible", so excuse my bad English. 

  Game in general is hard and frustrating, as a result you'll encounter more people cursing ingame chat at higher ranked games, just a bit bothersome.
To make things clear, i'm talking here just about the TANKS which i find fascinating and the main reason for playing this game. 
   Played a bit of aerial battles but they were just a serious waste of time for me, from take off to gun jamming-no repair in mid air, period!

-Ingame tutorials are, surprisingly... not terrible
-Game mechanics is very unbalanced, PvE battle rating fights are very expensive and unbalanced (end levels are mostly impossible to win) (you die-you pay more, so duck and cover and wait for the aliens the take care of the enemy units). 
-Game economy is unbalanced ie all over the place, multiple ingame currencies, squad currency. But fear not, real money input (golden eagles->$$) for the win. If however, you don't win the match, rewards are terrible for the "regular" people.
-PvE you get hit instantly whenever bot has a lock on you through buildings and terrain and the engine calculates the human eye can't figure out how the replay shows the humanly impossible hit. Hit replay lacks of camera control. Game replay doesn't have a selectable time scale?
-Even with active boosters, for missions, the amount of silver lions and RP gain is pretty low.
-Also a major flaw, vehicles with 25s+ reload rate get less activity reward because only thing you can do is wait to reload, this is terrible. At most, you can shoot 3 times per round while others 10+. 
-Most if not all PvP maps are top notch! Some PvE maps are terrible, strategically in PvE, Japan (barricades are useless) and Sinai (ai sometimes shoots through buildings, some rocks are not 100% solid wth?, on rare occasion enemy projectiles fly to their targets before AI tanks spawn) for example. 
-AI airplanes sometimes have no smooth turning or ground vehicle tracking aim is picking up some irregular airplane movement, whatever the case this makes your aim terrible. AI planes flies sideways as well! AI bombers are extremely precise.  
-Machinegun meter is bugged whenever implemented.
-PvP is more realistic but it's a camping game, bigger caliber wins, If you start losing to stronger units, better give up because the opposite team already has the advantage. Most matches end up with spawn camping, this is terrible. 3 respawns in PvP makes some sense but upgraded $$ crew and vehicle makes all the difference+backup cards.   
-More interesting battles with low br rating vehicles. So, once you go high, other weaker vehicles become obsolete and the time you put into them go to waste. No refund policy! Mastering the Ace rank for any vehicle is useless, wasting time to be precise. 
-PvE match time is terribly long for a single session, about 30 mins. Can you afford playing 2 hours per day to actually earn some "lions", your doctor will say go out more, make friends offline and avoid spinal deformities from prolonged sitting. Where was i... there was a bee...
-Crew replacement time is terrible, that destroys the shooting part, dynamics, of the game. 
-Newly purchased vehicles start without the repair ability in combat, so basically you're the kamikaze/naruto or crouching tiger/hidden sloth. 
-Customization of the vehicles is terrible but it's fun to play for hours and hours just to get that one upgrade. Tanks are pretty much sitting ducks from the big bang until the end of time, just the way i like it (the ww2 period). After that homosapiens continue to degrade, including it's brain mass. 
-Ammo distribution/quality/quantity is terrible, blame history for this, it's realistic alright. Rabbit of turtle is what you can be here. So what do you do, make yourself useful and run around like dog chasing frisbee. Fragmentation ammo is useless in PvE, a side note. 

I could go on and on but 400+ hours does it for me, i press a red buzzer [X]. 

   It's a fun free to play game so there's nothing to worry about, you've just wasted some of your free time, no big deal. You do what you want with your own time and money, i ain't paying a dime for this piece of a beautiful nightmare!

Yes I have played this game for quite a decent amount of time. Yes I have "fun" with it. No I would not recommend you play it. My "fun" has been more so an addiction. Just like an addiction, I would not recommend people start, even if I keep on doing it.

Gaijin as a company is far more focused with fancy new features, gimmicks, and modeling tank armor than balancing any of their games (looking at you, Enlisted). Balance does not exist in their vocabulary. They can figure out how to accurately model every tank in the last 80 years of warfare with stunning detail, but can't wrap their heads around preventing you from getting spawn sniped by ten different tanks several tiers higher than yours because your team got steamrolled as is the case in a vast majority of games. There is a tremendous skill curve to add atop the mountain of unbalance issues Gaijin refuses to acknowledge likely because they do not have answers. The problem isn't with overpowered tanks or guns, the very core mechanics and foundation are incredibly "realistic" meaning expect to get one shot killed by a guy ten miles away after spending five minutes crawling from cover to cover, carefully surveying the surroundings. Maybe that sounds fun to you. I can understand why people enjoy this game, and I don't think it's wrong to do so. There's only so many times I can spend a match getting dunked on by vehicles far superior to mine or watching my team roll over the enemies with no resistance before I stop having fun and remember why I keep uninstalling this game. It's an addictive trap that lures you back in. The memories seem fun until you remember the pain after a single match coming back from a long break.

And good luck even getting close to the fancy modern vehicles they spend so much time adding more and more of to the game. They don't expect you to pay to win, they expect you to pay to progress. See that fun new A-10 they added to the game? Maybe if you work (or spend) real hard, you'll be able to fly it yourself one day after ten years, only to get blown up on the runway by a teammate who thinks it would be funny to kill you right out of the gate.

If you're a fan of this game, I understand. It's a cool concept. There's cool tanks. It sounds cool, it looks cool, it feels cool to drive / fly, etc. I just hope we can acknowledge the serious issues here.

If you haven't started playing this game yet though - don't start.

A once great game that's grown far too complacent. Refusing to innovate in any meaningful way in the past few years. Or address its foundational problems. A product built to prey on people with addictive personalities and exploits FOMO to the extreme. Operated by one of the most morally and creatively bankrupt developers I've ever had the displeasure of dealing with. I've played this game for nine years, mostly through Gaijin's client. So the true number of hours played are not available. Just don't bother with this cash grab. Unless you're a raging masochist looking to get pegged by the snail.

To be honest. This game is amazing from rank 1 until rank 3 (1.0 until 6.7 or so). Amazing, fun and memorable gameplay experiences within those ranks. Very fluent, a lot of bouncing that makes you feel powerful and unstoppable. If you like to play the role of WW2, then this is your game, both for tank, planes and ships.

Now when you get to rank 4, the thing changes a lot. A very lot. No bouncing, everything is one shot, and no, you hardly ever do that. Doesn't matter if your tank has 400+mm penetration. The moment you're playing and shoot, hitting a tank with no more than just 180mm ish of full thickness, the game doens't recognize it. It just said hit, but no penetration or damage of anything. Here now I know why in the community they say 'Low tier, fun tier'.
Oh. We cannot forget the rockets/missiles you get hit from nowhere to be seen, kill you one shot. But you shoot one and do no damage.

Do I recommend it? Yes. But my recommendation is for low tiers until br 6.7 and that's it. Anything after that makes me sick in the head, because you don't enjoy it. You just rage by being one shotted, which you cannot do to them even in the weak spots, and campers. Lots and lots of them.

So yeah. This is a review and also a rant. Enjoy the game!

I have spent too many hours on this game.

The game itself is a lot of fun. But there are some rather frustrating issues, and scummy business practices.

The first issue is that the game is very exclusive and performance based - and by "performance", I'm referring to player performance. Good players are rewarded, and bad players are punished.

If you go into a game, head out onto the map, and get yourself blown up in one hit by an experienced player, before you can even fire a shot, you either have to go back to the main menu, or spawn in one of your other vehicles, and you need to pay for the repair costs (or wait for 12-24+ hours for a "free repair". If you perform very well, you gain a lot of progress. If you perform poorly, you LOSE progress. You still gain some research points, but you'll never be able to buy a new vehicle. Better hope you don't have a streak of bad games.

The second issue amplifies the first. There is no ranking system in this game. Good players do not face off against other good players. In other words, every game you have a chance of facing at least a handful of players who are much better at the game than you are, unless you yourself are very good at the game. It is entirely possible to go 10 straight games earning negative progress.

Then there's the scummy business practices. You can buy premium vehicles, only available with real money. Most of the unique vehicles (like the Katyusha, Panzerwerfer or Calliope rocket systems) are premium vehicles. There is no way to earn most of these, no matter how long you play. You can buy camouflage with real money to place on your tank, and you can place twice as many pieces on your tank as a paying monthly subscriber, turning your tank into a mobile bush, giving you a significant advantage. They have repeatedly disabled the ability to chat in the game, because they don't want to deal with moderating their own game. They have a daily login reward that spins like a casino wheel, showing you what great rewards you could get, and then usually landing on some 10% booster that will expire unless you keep playing. The whole game is designed to get you to grab that credit card to be able to get anywhere. I have unlocked rank 4 tanks with one faction after 400 hours of gameplay. There are 7 ranks. Yes, there's quite a bit of content, but it's locked behind hundreds, or thousands of hours, unless you grab that credit card.

The last issue is the Battle Rating (BR) system. In virtually every single game that I play, there are people with vehicles 1.0 BR higher than my highest vehicle. I frequently play with 5.3 vehicles like the Panther or Tiger tank, and always go up against several 6.3 tanks like the IS-6. These tanks simply obliterate mine in one hit, while I can scarcely scratch their paint. This further amplifies the other issues already mentioned.

This last bit is entirely my opinion and should not be regarded as fact:
It is quite clear to me that Gaijin is either pro Russian, or have no sense of gameplay balancing over their desire to keep the game as true to realism as possible. Mid-to-late WW2 Russian tanks are simply better than German tanks. This was true in reality, and this is true in this game. The difference is, in reality, the Germans still performed quite well against the USSR, because their tank crews had a few years of experience already. Meanwhile, the Soviets had just done the Great Purge, which meant they had to rely on poor, inexperienced leadership and tank crews - the T34 was superior to the versions of the Panzer III and IV available to the Germans at the time, but they were still a match due to the difference in experience. This is not accounted for in this game. The T34 is simply better. The IS-2 to IS-6 are better than the Panther G, Tiger I and Tiger II.

I don't expect anyone to read all of this novel, nor agree with all of it, nor be swayed not to play this game because of it. I wrote it mostly to get my frustrations with this game out. Peace.

The Germans get automatic tank cannons in tier 1 and they shred american tanks. And there is no balancing what so ever, I shot a tank, in its back armour, with an anti tank gun in the m3 lee, and it didnt penetrate, a massive anti tank gun, the thing that its sole purpose is to destroy tanks, couldnt penetrate rear armour. Most of the overpowered tanks are locked behind $15aud paywalls, which most of us cant afford. The A10 warthog, which right now is on the banner of the game in library and in store, you need to pay $90aud to get it, I wouldnt mind at this point, if the devs made it so the game cost $15, and made all the tanks free, but instead they make the game free, and give people with access to their mummys wallets all the fun tanks. For a "realistic" game, they sure made it unrealistic as possible, tell me how a massive tank destroyer, shoots a HE round at a jeep, it gets set on fire, the people on the autocannon on the back are wiped out of existence the cannon still somehow turns around, shoots one bullet at me, disabling my cannon, shoots 30 more at me and I die, with a fucking jeep A FUCKING JEEP fine enough to be repaired and driven again, when the whole thing was up in flames. I am trying my absolute hardest to love this game, but it is so stupid, horrible balancing, paywall tanks, $90 for a plane that is used for advertising the game. Devs, if youre reading this, balance the fucking game, and I will try to change my review.

I am a 45 yo father, probably one of the oldest people playing this game. I am a single farther to my Son, who is 14 now. My son got this game for Christmas from his uncle, so we installed it on his computer and he started playing. By the end of the week he had 24 hours on this game. This was horrible for me, as it was already hard for me to find ways to spend time with my son, as he is always out with his friends or just, watching YouTube. So i decided to make a Steam account and get this game to see if I could maybe play alongside him. loaded into the game, made my character and world and started playing but I was stuck on what you where supposed to do. I asked my Son for help and he hosted a game for me to join. loved it as it was the best time had spent with my Son since my wife had died. This game has ever since brought me and my son closer again and now we actually spend time together outside the house together as well. This game reminded me that there's fun to be had in everything, and it has brought both me and my Son many happy memories.

Although I have enjoyed many hours of this game, it has come to the point where Gaijin cares no more about the player base. War Thunder is a game I love, but also hate with a passion.

It has solid game play, the vehicles and planes are modelled brilliantly and look fantastic. They use damage models rather than a HP meter like in World of Tanks. Which means that when you shoot a tank, if you penetrate the armour you damage the components inside as well as injure the crew.

This means as an example that if you hit the ammunition you can explode a tank outright. If you kill the crew members until their number is less than 2 then the tank is also considered destroyed. However this is where you'll likely face your first issues with the game. The damage system works well enough, but sometimes your shell just doesn't do what it's meant to do. Sometimes you'll experience a 'Ghost shell' which is where it basically disappears without doing anything. Other times you'll hit a tank and penetrate it but everything will get absorbed by the optics. It doesn't take a genius to work out that a piece of bullet proof glass being hit by a tank shell would not absorb the shrapnel.

The game itself has several modes to play, with the focus being the multiplayer options. The single player portion of the game is woefully outdated. Some of it even being unplayable or impossible to complete due to game updates. Gaijin wont fix this however as single player doesn't make them money.

The game also has several nations to choose from; USA, Germany, USSR, Britain, Italy, France, Sweden, Japan, China and the recently added Israel.

Although as far as I understand it, Israel is a premium only nation right now as it requires you to buy a premium tank before you can even start working on the normal tech tree. It's also worth noting that the nations considered 'Minor' like France, Sweden, Italy and China tend to borrow tanks and planes from other nation tech trees, to help fill gaps and to represent lend lease agreements countries had between one another during times of war. Despite this, Minor nations can have large gaps in their tech trees making the grind to the next BR level even more of a pain.

The matchmaking leaves a lot to be desired as does Gaijin's form of balance. They compress the BRs too much which means that WW2 tanks face things from future era's. You'll find yourself regularly uptiered in a match which can make things even more of a pain, and a struggle to be enjoyable.

The game is freemium, which means free to play but with premium options. However Gaijin has balanced the game and it's rewards in such a way that it essentially pushes players to buy premium or premium vehicles. You'll not notice this in the lower tiers, but as you start climbing through the tech trees you'll start to find the costs for repairs and just vehicles themselves increase exponentially on the previous tier.

This also means that as you climb the tiers, having a bad game or even having a mildly successful game will still land you negative Silver Lions due to repair costs, restocking ammunition and so on. Sometimes even having a really good game can still net you negative silver lions if the vehicles you took out had extreme repair costs. Oddly this seems to affect the minor nations the most, as a lot of the better players seem to play them which means overall the vehicles get better statistics so Gaijin 'balances' the vehicles out with higher br's and higher costs.

This makes the game an extreme grind. As an average free player you either slowly hemorrhage Silver lions at higher tiers or buy premium to try to compensate the loses. Although sometimes even having premium wont do this.

I understand that developers need to eat and need cash. But War Thunder was one of if not the most profitable online game within recent memory. And Gaijins game design and money grabbing tactics are predatory, and deliberately make the game a grindy, unfun, buggy mess.

I cannot in good conscience recommend this to anyone to pick up and start playing. Unfortunately it already has it's hooks into me, but I shall not give the snail a single penny. 

You can still be a profitable game developer and make money with a good game. Unfortunately the Snail has taken the greedy route and it's drastically affected the quality of their product and what it's user base experiences.

Been playing since 2013 but at this point I can't recommend anyone play this much less buy anything. It was once a solid and fun game, but constant pushes for more monetization, the lack of Battle rating decompression, the economy being nerfed to push towards an even more frustrating experience if you don't pay money for a talisman and premium time, it's become a shell of it's former self. It's designed to be frustrating and the top tier things most people want is behind such a long grind that you almost have to buy one of the high tier premiums to progress at a reasonable rate.
Frankly, not worth it.

This is a really good game as a flight/tank/ship simulator. It surpasses all other sims on the market (like Wargaming). Attention to detail is great. You see pilots/crew/etc in your vehicles. BUT

THE GRIND IS INSANE. I have played War Thunder for years. I have the Old Guard title. I play a few games a week. I am NOWHERE NEAR unlocking high tier vehicles. Also, the more you progress up the tiers, the more frequently you will die and have to quit. You cannot effectively casually play each technology tree as a casual/F2P player. If you are F2P you HAVE to focus on ONE: planes/tanks/ships. You cannot focus on more, and the higher you go the quicker you get killed instantly and cannot respawn. To reiterate: THE GRIND IS INSANE. The game advertises jets and modern tanks etc but you can only get these if you play the game 24/7 and run meta builds.
HOWEVER it is a nice game to jump in for WW2 enthusiasts to fly a plane about in Realistic battles for a bit, take off and land etc. Not worth keeping installed if you don't want to do any more than this

I only have 235 hours in War Thunder currently. The highest tech tree I have climbed is China ground forces to Battle Rating 6.0. Ground forces are easier to climb through, but getting past this point is a long grind. I've bought premium and golden eagles only for the boost to RP. The tanks and planes are not really that great that come in the packs. All the good packs are AT LEAST $50. That being said, the one tank that I actually would by is $350 on Gaijins auction website. Air forces are hard to grind through and Naval is very slow. If you don't have a good plane to bring into ground RB you might as well not even take a plane.

I would not recommend this to someone who has never played before. There are better games out there that have a lot better tactical elements and you can actually work together with other players. There is no ranked play, so if PhlyDaily comes into a 2.0 match with a premium tanks to give viewers a review of that tank that day, you're screwed. Don't think that because you are in a rank I tank with reserves that you are learning with everyone else. There are always rank 100 players in every match ending new players games before they even see the round coming.

It's frustrating because I want to enjoy this game but the devs make it almost impossible. And I've dumped too much money in the game to set it aside. Dear reader, I hope you don't make the same mistake so many other have made. Do not play this game and sacrifice your hard earned money and sanity.

In short, do not play this game. It is unrewarding, unfun, unfair and, most of all not worth anyone's time. Just relax, don't download it and keep watching other players play it on Youtube/Twitch instead.

Unless you have a Premium Account, you will not progress through the game at a good place. (Also, trust me, you WILL NOT get any Premium Account time for free, no matter if you have been for A LOT of time or you just logged in and are ready to get your welcoming bonus of a POS vehicle, hat you will play on once and then forget it exists)

At the lowest ranks, you will feel like it take a bit of work to get a new vehicle. Yet, once you will start getting clsoer to first MBTs and IFVs, the game gets ungodly bad. It can't even be called grindy anymore, because you will literally be spending more SL than you can make with a good KD, even if you win. Speaking of that, even if you will be doing great, helping your  teammates and keep winning, sometimes you will be loosing money. Yeah, even if you win. To be completely honest, I do not care how much anyone will say "Repair Cost", punishing people even for winning, just because they died to some ATGM-enduced cancer too many times is too much.

Your teammates will be braindead 70% of time. They will not help you, they will not do the objectives properly. Only sometimes will you get teammates, that are actually healthy-minded and know a word "Teamwork".

Your enemies will always have some kind of wonderwaffle, that you will not be able to fight properly or fight at all. Tiger 2 (H), T34, Ikv-91, E.B.R and etc. And although it is satisfying to kill them, most of the time you will not be able to do anything about them, because they are too far/hiding in the bushes on your flank/teammates will just straight up let them pass and get close to you.

The gameplay: Drive forward for ~3-5 minutes, get shot from a hill, covered in bushes ~2KM away, die. That's it. The same for Air Battles. Fly for 5 minutes. Realise, that there is an enemy above you and that their climbing rate and energy is much higher than yours, get a half of your wing snapped off/Pilot knocked out or some other rubbish, return to the hangar.

Although I have almost none of the hours here, on Steam, I ahve played for about a 1000 hours in total. All I got to were T-44-100 and T-54.
10/10 experience, would spend half my life and money getting to the jets again

Very, very steep learning curve, do not attempt to buy your way to the higher tiers if you lack experience, you will die a LOT (You will have way more deaths than kills) and be a hindrance to your team, especially if you only bring one vehicle to a match. Wait until you've researched a vehicle of roughly the BR of the vehicle you want to purchase first, you want to bring multiple vehicles of a similar BR to battle and you will be more experienced by then. The grind is very long, you will have plenty of time to get experienced enough to play these vehicles. Once you have figured out how to play, it can be pretty fun unless you get unlucky and die or miss kills to things outside of your control. Would overall recommend if you enjoy military vehicles and are willing to get through the learning period. Would not recommend if you have a history of raging in games, this game is easily one of the most rage inducing games I've played when things aren't going well in your match.

Had a really successful day yesterday, things felt relatively normal until I was doing too good and then started getting one shot constantly or couldn't kill anything. This game is both the worst and the best out there. It is the only game that really gives a good feeling of mixed combat with airplanes and tanks. It provides alot of really good airplanes and tanks that are models amazingly, But.. And unfortunatly this game has a butt that is about five C's thick. The grind is terrible, utter and horridly terrible. The first handful of ranks are not bad, but there are two games here really. The original, semi well balanced world war two game in the center, and the cold war era war game that has mutated out of the top tiers. Jets, guided missiles, helicopters, reactive armor, and so much more. I'd love to play with the Mirage, or the Jaguar, heck so many cool top tier tanks and aircraft that require lifetimes of grinding or a bank account of thousands to assist the grind. not to mention that upper tier vehicles require premium accounts or else you will end up in the negatives and unable to repair any of your tanks. not to mention how awful and horrible the naval battles are. 

Honestly between the grind, the obvious attempts to make it pay to play at all, and a corporation that was using youtube trademark strikes to go after anyone showcasing issues or bugs with the game that needed to be fixed, to the ham handed way they handle player issues and problems... just don't the game isn't worth it anymore.

I've been a World of Tanks player since Beta, but over the years that game has become stale and there was a lack of new historical tanks to play. I decided to try out War Thunder one day just to experience some of the different historical vehicles that were lacking on WoT. It took a little to get used to the minor differences in gameplay, but once I did I don't think I can ever go back to WoT. War Thunder is IMO overall now a more polished, interesting, historical, fun, and satisfying experience. Graphics and attention to detail is amazing; I mean you can get stuck in mud, your tank gets dirty, and the wind even moves your tanks antenna! As far as vehicles go there is SO many that it is going to take me years to grind through them all. And as far as gameplay goes it is intense, varied, and fun. Granted there can be moments of frustration, but what online multiplayer game doesn't have that?

[h1] The game is much more painful than it used to be [/h1]

The game used to be fun. Grinding tanks in fair BRs was fun and what tech tree they offered. Before I even downloaded this game on steam, I already have at least 2-3 years of game time in and I had half fun and half pain. Now that I have 1000hrs+ plus on steam and have been playing the game for an additional 1 1/2 years, everything started to lose sense. There are so many things to name that went wrong. True, some of the players are to be blamed for their rash decisions, but most of them are the game's fault.

Starting with the latest changes. The PUMA and BMP-2M are at 9.3, and the Begleitpanzer and Radkampfwagen are at 9.7 which is understandable and fair enough, however a concern that the TAM is still at 8.7 and not swapped out with the PUMA is infuriating. What would be the purpose of the tank, as by then it wouldn't be useable due to the enemy team already having thermal optics.

Another concern is how long it takes for you to grind up in higher ranks (rank 6 to 7 tanks). I am not the best player, so grinding has been a pain for progression. One thing that I've noticed is with the Israel tank tech tree that the grind for the Tiran 4S and Magach 6 is so painful without the help of a premium vehicle. It was very slow compared to the grind with other nations which I had hoped that the developers would have done something about it.

To not make my comment too long, I will give a dislike to the game. It made me feel like the time, effort, and money has been wasted especially within this month's amount of updates. Not only has the battlepass repeat itself by putting up already existing tanks but with add-ons/different nations, but the recent changes just makes everything much more pointless and painful for an average player like me. However, my review would be changed if and only if some nice changes were to be added into the game. [b]SOMETHING[/b] at least an average player like me would enjoy.

A more toxic relationship than Hollywood marriages. Warthunder is a love - hate game, featuring neat gameplay concepts and mechanics that makes it special. However, with all those nice features and interesting content it suffers from generic business practices that range from slightly annoying... to ridiculously unfair. 

Pros:
-Instead of relying on HP damage systems, Warthunder focuses more into realistic depictions of vehicle warfare via module based damaging where every vehicle part dynamically react to each other. 

If you're interested on a F2P combined arms warfare that focuses into realism- then yes, you would like WT's general gameplay.

-It's not all about realism- what do I mean by that? Warthunder features a simplified control scheme for players, as it mixes realism and arcade-y mechanics quite well. There are also several gamemodes to choose from, the primary ones are Arcade, Realistic and Simulator battles.

-Surprisingly enough, Warthunder has its fair share of fun April Fools events and community content. When you just want to chill and try something new, try out user made skins, mods and even missions. Although personally, I haven't tried out any of the April Fools event.

Cons:
-The very grind-y status of the game. This is pretty much where it starts to go downhill for most players. Warthunder indirectly forces players to use real money to be able to progress smoothly as possible. From the extreme repair costs, vehicle prices and research EXP. This pressures players to spend their money into the game, making up for its F2P business model.

-The removal of certain vehicles for 'realism' on the tech tree, hear me out on this one. Warthunder has been known for their wacky updates throughout time. These include but are not limited to; absurd balance changes, new mechanics, and even the removal/hiding of vehicles. This one is admittedly a bit more nit-picky, however, if you're expecting to see (or play) vehicles that were never produced (or only had prototypes)- well too bad.

Conclusion: Warthunder is something unique, that suffers from your usual business strategies. Overall rating it a TetraFin Flakes Goldfish score of 7/10.

I've been playing for years, and some of my time isn't even listed on Steam. So with all that behind me, what do I have to say?

War Thunder is a hard game to learn if you want to be good from the start. It's not quite a simulator with 60 different keybinds being thrown at you, but over time it has certainly gotten more complex. Inconsistent mechanics and frequent "balance" updates can make the ground highly unstable even for more experienced players, depending on what they want out of the game.

What can you get out of the game? Considering how bland the main gamemodes become after a while, it's impressive how well War Thunder remains interesting, with a huge variety of vehicles to use, through different classes of tanks, planes and I guess, if you really wanted, ships, there will always be something to learn, and new ways to challenge yourself.

The grind is heavily reliant on players buying premium vehicles, making some more modern equipment immensely tedious to unlock for free, but the majority of the game is available for free.

In short: If you like war machines of any type, or are looking for an alternative to the standard FPS formula, War Thunder fits the bill, but it won't be without frustration at times.

Game play is excellent and graphics are phenomenal- there are many game modes from arcade, realistic, and full sim in planes, helicopters, tanks, and ships. There is absolutely no need to worry about purchasing premium content to compete - there are enough vehicles in every countries trees to be competitive. Having said that, I do have premium vehicles in my lineup because I am a supporter of Gaijin, the games creator. The game is free to play. Games can be up to 16 players vs 16 players and in arcade game lengths vary from approx. 7 - 10 minutes.

So after alot of hours in this game here is my opninion.

The game has a large variation of gameplay. Ground vehicles, Naval and Air battles. So far i've mostly been enjoying the ground realistic battles. War Thunder uses a battle rating system wich quite often gives you an uptier. Very rarely i do get downtiers in this game. 

This is a game you should play with friends through voice chats to improve the experience of the game. 

Some will enjoy the game and others will hate it. I still log in every day to claim the daily chest, but somedays i don't play the game mainly because the game can have really frustrating moments. 

The game seems to be most popular during the evening in weekends, wich means the more skilled players will appear more often in game to hunt you down. 

Sadly most will suffer the pain of the silver lion system, without VIP it almost seems undoable to gain profit, but it is possible when not running(driving) around like other shooters with a rapid gameplay. Patience is key in this game. Sometimes you'll get to a spot to park in place and wait for the enemy to appear. During progress you'll learn all the nice spots in the maps they currently have for you to play and enjoy. 

Hopefully the game developers will balance the silverlion system and make it a little easier to gain. 

Overall my experiences been mixed, yet i still recommend the game when playing with friends. Some days it goes great and you'll be having alot of fun, other days you'll get your ass kicked in game by the more skilled players. My worst nightmare in the game so far are the more skilled jets flying around in higher battle ratings. I mostly enjoy the 4,7 ~ 7,3 battle ratings as they seem quite often to be more fun. 

But if you want to progress in game you'll have to grow slowly. Don't worry you'll get better in time when investing the time correctly. In my case i jumped straight into realistic mode, some say you should start with arcade modes. But thats all up to you. 

Goodluck in the game!

This is essentially a brainless arcade game, even in realistic don't expect anything other than flying around for 15 minutes then getting forced into head-ons, you will find yourself either swarmed by enemies or have nothing to shoot at. Teamwork doesn't exist. Balance is questionable. Bombers get to start in the sky, often flying so high as a fighter pilot you wont ever reach them before they get their first bombing run in, they get AI turrets to watch their back. You cant punish them when landing, AI AA guns are lasers. In ground battles get used to fighting tanks you have no hope of killing. Micro-transactions are encouraged to skip the brutal early tiers and tech upgrades. As for Sim mode, there are better games out there. Don't waste your time on this game, it is not fun.

This is a game of such potential wasted by pure greed. War Thunder is really addictive, the game mechanics are very well done. Unfortunately Gajin continously decides to spit in the face of players. 

What you've got: pay to win - premium tanks being way better.
Frustrating game loop for grinding - pushing you to buy premium and take "shortcuts". I didn't take those, put around 600 hours into a single tech tree - and got to about 40% of it. That's how grindy this game is.

The devs don't care about their players, only their money. Community has raised issues that were ignored for past couple of years now.

Unbalanced spawns - you will find plenty of games with lifetime clocking at about 20 seconds because you will be killed as soon as your spawn protection wears out.

No tank-only gamemode - Pretty simple, right? Well that's not happening ever. Dying from a bomb is the biggest disappointment in such a nice game mode. 

Severe issues on performance for some players - just google around for stuttering issues. You will find that the game doesn't utilize your resources fully - CPU, GPU, memory and still experience plenty of crippling stutter.

The saddest thing is that I love this game for what it can be and hate it for what it currently is.

**Warning**  This game is highly addictive.  Do not play if you have responsibilities.

This game is literal hell.

I first played this game well over 7 years ago by now (it's been so long, I can't pin point when I first played this). It was an absolutely wonderful game to play with. Myself and my friends loved it and played it hours on hours without end, being so excited to play it during weekends as we felt this is the one game that unites us on having to work together and have fun together and with the community. 

As time goes on with this game, they have made many improvement for the players and it's great to see a game evolving in graphics visually, adding new vehicles and new game modes such as ships, it's what we all want. There was however a slight error possibly unintended by the developers that if you played tank battles, having a lower graphics gives you an advantage to see enemy tanks before they see you (assuming they are running on a higher setting) Whether that has been resolve I don't know. I gave up using tank battles as it's incredibly challenging, and that's great that players are engaged with this game and their skills are developing, no doubt they're passionate and learned every little details to increase their survival and help their team win. It's just too tedious to keep playing and find myself losing interest in tank battles. 

I am not sure how match making works, if you play it long enough then you'll find yourself having a very one sided battle, occasionally you will see it being balanced with grounds contested back and forth and that is when it's a fun tactical game. I would like to see more transparency on how players are matched, while I offer my opinion that I think it should have some sort of skill rating to make it more 'balanced' for most players, I know other will disagree and that's ok. 
With the community chat, it can be very toxic unfortunately. No doubt they're getting riled up by the state of the battles and that's not going away ever. You'll find players like that across the entire gaming world so you just learn to ignore them and if not, you can change the settings so that you can limit what channels you'll receive the chat, even to friends only in a squadron and that's great. It can be a shame as there are genuinely nice players in War Thunder and still make friends with them time to time. Now yes I know there's a chat ban at the moment due to the War. Can hardly be a surprise as you do get matched up with Russian and Chinese players and the following nations within that region that shares a same ideology. What a time to be alive.. and yes it can get very political in the game. Better take it out on each other in a video game than real military action tbh. 

The problem with this game now is that in my opinion the developers got too greedy. Myself and my friends have purchased premium vehicles, premium account times and one occasion battle pass. It got to the point where you're asking yourself 'What the point?'. It is increasingly expensive now more than ever to find yourself in a comfortable position in terms of Silver lions. This is largely due to the repair cost feature that is increasingly expensive. Some vehicles you would need to score well, have premium just to barely make profits on it, without the booster of course. My friends eventually quit playing this game one by one and I found myself playing this game on my own and it's literally depressing knowing how good it was in the past. So even players like myself and my friends that got sucked into their marketing strategy are getting fed up and eventually stopped playing the game, mainly for mental health reasons.

This tedious and stressful level you will expect when going at the top tier battles, this is where a lot of things are expensive and crazy. I have noticed and no doubt many people are fed up of this. It's the modules of your vehicle. You won't seem to notice that much and not a hassle when you're starting out on a lower BR tech tree. It can be maxed out quickly and you're good to go to enjoy the game. It's when you go up and up and up... it's gets more expensive, time consuming to max out your vehicles. It got so bad that players that made it or paid their way to upgrade it is having a huge advantage to those that doesn't. For example Night vision, heat vision, tank shell round types for Tanks, planes it's missiles and engine along with other wide array of upgrades to choose from. These are the reasons why many players are divided on this game. For that reason alone I stuck with low BR games as it's more enjoyable to play with that high BR games. 

I personally just don't get it. Even with battle pass and premium account, you're still given an impression from the company that it's not enough and it's only limited time to reap those benefits. You play this game long enough, you can eventually just walk away and not give in. I admittedly spent a lot of money on this game. The premium vehicles are still there, that along with some items from BP is all you're ever getting to keep when it comes to spending money on something, the rest is just a temporary boost which is very discouraging. 

I wish there are more game modes available where for example in air battle would have bombing focus, ground units focus, and air battle focus instead of all in one, perhaps even with pve where players can chill and just enjoy the game with friends or teammate without being incredibly rage inducing in a competitive environment with pvp. I am aware they did some testing a while back which i took part in tank battles. It's great and it would attract players like myself but they seem to be incredibly slow on that matter.. I haven't kept up to date since I stopped playing but one friend I do know that played it recently said it's still the same as it was when I last played. 

I am overall sad how it turned out for myself and my friends I've made along the way with this game. I have many great memories with this game and I will always cherish those memories and epic battle moments with my friends. Maybe I will come back one day but it will be cautious on what to expect when playing the game, certainly no more penny on them as I spent more on it than you would buying a single game at a fraction of what I've spent on this game and I know how Gaijin thanked me in return. 

Overall, great game when you're starting out, fun with friends. Going up comes with a cost not just to your wallet but also to your mental health. I will give it a thumbs up for what it's worth overall, Personally i'd pick between the thumbs up and down. My advice to new players is to just stick to a low BR range and experiment on all variety of vehicles.

If anyone literally stuck around reading this, kudos. I'd love to hear your opinion and experiences with the game, the good, the bad, the ugly.

You think the Germans had the best WW2 Tanks? WRONG Russia.
You think the American P51 ruled the skies in WW2? WRONG Russia.
You think the British have a great navy? WRONG AGAIN. RUSSIA
You think Japan had the bes- NOPE RUSSIA
Sweden, China, Israel, Italy... doesn't matter, the game has Russia.

So take sweet enjoyment when you shoot their flying tank planes down, and manage to sink a tank shell deep enough into a "weak"  spot in their indestructable tanks to kill the crew, or when you manage to land enough torpedos and broadside hits to sink their perfectly engineered unsinkable ships...

Everyone else is a 50/50 and actually good fun, depending on player skill.

So the game is like Ukraine, good and fun until the Russians get involved.

Worst issue with the game is their greed and the grind needed to get into Cold War+ vehicles. It's absolutely atrocious and screams low ethics and 0 care for their player base.

Second issue is that there is a severe bias towards Russian vehicles in the game due to the company being founded in Russia and ran by Russians. I believe you have all the proof you need in Ukraine that Russian vehicles don't work as magically well as you think they do Gaijin.

Otherwise the game is fun enough I guess, again the grind just kind of kills any love you can foster for the game.

Spawn camping is also a major issue, half of the games will end with one team being soft locked from winning due to the opposing team spawn camping, because your spawn protection essentially wears off about 5 seconds after spawning in, you immediately get your tank or ship destroyed without having a chance to react.

Playing more I'll articulate more of my thoughts. I understand there is an amount of randomness in the fights and damage, but consistently it seems like the game doesn't give enough information or its broken. For example doing damage doesn't always grant an assist and shooting down a plane doesn't always grant a kill. I can be the sole reason a plan goes down, and not get a kill or assist, I can get a dozen hits on a plane then someone will get the last hit, and won't get the kill or assist.

Damage is also incredibly weird, very consistently I will hit a plane 5-10 times, sometimes scoring multiple crits, and it doesn't seem to effect the plane at all, meanwhile I'll almost always be one shot, regardless of my plane, my targets, or attackers. I can shoot directly into a cockpit, seeing my bullets land and hit markers showing up, and seemingly doesn't effect them somehow.

Additionally the micro transactions are shameless, I get its a free game, but you can't even just buy premium, you just buy a time period of it. Repairs for your planes aren't free, you have to pay for them with Silver Lions, which EVEN WITH premium, battles won't cover the cost of doing repairs unless you do really well, so you have to wait or pay money. Planes cost 60 dollars, individual planes cost up to 60 dollars. Ranking up to the next plane takes huge amounts of time, unless you pay of course

Also the historical and AI battles are a laughable waste of time, they're unexciting and reward barely any points
This is a very good realistic ww2/ modern warefare pvp game
pain

So, after years of playing this game and over 6k hours played. (1,500 on this account 4,500 on another) I've finally decided to review it.

I've played this game since November of 2014, and it's grown to be one of my favorite games that I've played my entire life. However, that said it has major flaws. The game is extremely pay to win if you don't want to spend years grinding a single nation. Gaijin pretty much encourages you to buy premium time and on top of that premium planes/tanks/helis/naval ETC. And being the sucker that I am, I unfortunately have done that. I not only have a disgusting amount of time in this, but also a disgusting amount of money spent. 

I know this game will never be the way that it should and I'm okay with that. It's a free to play game, and I still enjoy playing it to this day.

The gameplay is alright but the menu system and interface is unusable.

Update - An extra 19 hours in.
Pros -
Planes are pretty fun

Cons -
The menu and interface system still feels like it was designed an intern over a 30 minute coffee break.
If you want any hope of having both a social life and/or a job and also playing this game, you will need to pay for the premium feature - giving you 2x+ exp.
If you want any hope of not instantly dying in a plane, make sure to spend real money on exp for its crew.

Logic would dictate that if you get a new variant of a plane (The one i did was literally the same plane with 2 extra guns) your pilot training would carry over to a degree, this is not the case. So just be aware all that time and/or real money you put into training a crew is going to waste the second you decide to get a new plane.

Some reviews do not tag this game with "Pay-to-win" But when you have a bomber for example, you only have 1 trained gunner and 4+ extra gunner seats, now you technically do still have gunners but they couldnt hit a plane even if they were stationary right next to you. You'll have to bust open the wallet or take a week off work in order to get those other gunners trained. Feels pretty pay to win to me.

Please don't play this game. Its nothing but a waste of time and it ruins your mood to a point where every time u get into this game, it punishes you for playing. The greed of these developers are so astounding to a point where at every turn you are required to pay silver lions. The balancing of matches are just pathetic. And anytime u activate a booster namely RP booster you are matched up with people way above you in terms of skill deliberately to make you fail the game. I am a decent player and i know this for a fact because i have tested it several times. And it is almost impossibly time consuming and tough to progress through the game after second rank, the amount of time one should invest just to unlock a higher level tank is absurd to a point where i just burn out completely. They force you to avail the premium and spend so much money because that's the only way you'll progress through. Or else you'll either have extremely bad matches and not get much RP or you'll run out of silver lions from buying absurdly expensive tanks. And oh wait even after you buy a tank, lets  say a rank 3 tank, you still have to pay 50k more to get the crew. I've seen people defend these practices in-game, to them  i say nothing but stop using your parents credit card and act like this game is all amazing and it deserves all this money through malpractices like this and get a job and know the value of each dollar. Also lets not forget  about the rewards from matches. Every time your tank gets damaged it requires silver lions to repair it or else you'll have to wait days to play that tank which you already own. Rank 1 is a breeze, the time and number of matches required to unlock a tank and the cost etc are all fine but as soon as you get midway through rank 2 the pathetic grind starts and the greed of the developers and company as a whole shows. If you just experiment all these and calculate it like i did. You'll witness the evil and greed that this company holds dear to its heart. You can see an in depth explanation about the pathetic economy in this game in a review below or above written by TARKUS. I urge you to read that. You'll understand how we basically lose silver lions just for playing a match in which you fail. We basically get penalized and it means that these people are ding whatever they can to get us to buy premium and spend TONS AND TONS OF MONEY. And they pair us up in a way that we  guarantee do fail or at least lose silver lions most of the time.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

Recently, servers have been absolute trash. I keep losing my connection to servers at the most crucial timings, locking my vehicle crew out/causing me to lose my vehicle in-game. The game also suffers from FPS drops like never before (I run a Ryzen 5600 with a RTX2060 Super with 16GB RAM). Doesn't help that all the servers are at minimum 100ms ping, and I keep getting lag and packet loss. 

War Thunder has always had problems with the low player count, the long ass grind, and freemium system, but server issues are the last straws that break the camel's back. Over a thousand hours in the game over the course of 5 years and only 2 half-completed ground tech trees should tell you all you need to know about the grind. The game is frustrating and seldom rewarding, and it's time I put it away.

Grab this review template here! 👉 https://vojtastruhar.github.io/steam-review-template/

Would I recommend the game? Overall, I'd say yes. There really is nothing out there even close to War Thunder (which could be a good or bad thing). The game play itself is pretty good and polished all things considered. Sure, there's some questionable choices and such, but just the sheer amount of vehicles in the game is insane. The game is also BEAUTIFUL if you have a rig that can run it on max. 

but

Unless you are only interested in up to WWII era and only 1 or 2 nations, it's absolutely not a free to play game. The amount of time you'd need to dedicate to get anywhere substantial is pretty insane, especially if you aren't willing to fork out for premium time + vehicles. Sure, it's possible to get to top tier without spending a penny, but it's going to be a hell of a grind and a lot of suffering. I'm talking months if not years here. 

It can be an incredibly fun game, but also incredibly infuriating too, and will quite easily bounce between the two regularly. 

My suggestion? Play it for free, don't spend any money on the game, and go from there. If you are enjoying it, grab a week of premium and see if it was worth it. If you have your eyes on a specific premium vehicle, wait until you have something of a similar BR to play along side it before buying it. 

It can be an amazing game, but it has plenty of flaws.

I am playing since before it was on Steam. I have over 1000 hours in this game. My PC specs are outstanding. I have unlocked USA tanks & planes until 4.0 (I don't like grinding + I believe that it is more fun at around 2-3, particularly regarding planes). I will focus on the negative points, since I am too lazy atm. to make a full review, but safe to say that everything bar the negative points is good or even outstanding, like the soundtrack, visual details.

At this point I can not recommend this game for most players. The game is a grind fest, it takes forever to get to the good & modern stuff. Arcade battles in tanks & ships suffer from built in aids that are really bs, you can basically aim at tanks with predicted hit markers through any foliage and have the enemy spotted pinpoint as a 3D model for extremely long distances and extremely long time, it is a joke.

The second main reason not to get this game is: Cheater problem, and a significant one. And just to take the stupid comments away from the get go, I know what a cheater looks like, I have worked for anticheat in the past.
Most players can only recognize the obvious ragehacker, but very very few can spot advanced cheats that are tweaked to not be too obvious. It is also nearly always that anticheat solutions catch only the simple cheats; professional cheats are rarely detected, also due to them being regularly tested, updated and tweaked so that from replay they look the least suspicious.
Still unconvinced that this game has a cheater problem: Well you can Google around and what you WILL FIND is: Competitive War Thunder is pretty much cheaters only; it is so bad, that even if you could keep up with the cheaters, teams still want you to cheat, because otherwise you are a liability. It is a huge joke. But unfortunately this seems to be a trend in competitive games, as i.e. CS:Go suffers from something similar (see Flusha). I even would go so far as to claim that longterm PVP will die and be replaced by PVE (AI is slowly getting to the point of being a suitable replacement experience).

Tank battles I encountered it a lot more, than in planes. If you still want to do tank battles, I also recommend to go do "realistic" battles (not simulation) for tanks as then the worst in game aids are not available anymore, which is imo a much better experience. For planes Arcade is fun, particularly between 2.0 - 3.0; great dogfighting.

Reasons not to play this:
Russian bias, easy to exploit glitches/hack, pay to win, forces you to buy premium, requires extreme amounts of grinding (100+ hours, still not above BR 7, and ive seen people go upwards of 300 without getting very far past 8.5), and very broken at times, for example your shot might go through a enemy without registering (especially at close/medium range), or a enemies shot may completely miss you, but still kill you. 

Reasons to play this: Looks good,the games popular rn, although its not completely realistic as some people and Gaijin advertise its the most realistic game out there (Not completely realistic because of tank balancing, and some things just arent accounted for when balancing tanks, and a lot of small thing that arent really important enough to list but are still pretty bad when combined.)

If you like raging, get this game
If you like sanity, this game is not for you
if you love russia to the point its not socially acceptable, you'll love this game
If you like being able to exist as a American, German, British, or french tank/plane, this game is not for you
If you have a lot of time on your hands and you like a long game where you progress over time and slowly build up, even if it causes frustration, this game will be great for you
If you wanna play a game where you can use your favorite tanks without having to spend hundreds of hours, or if your a person that just doesnt have a lot of time on their hands, I wouldnt recommend this.

Okay boys and girls, buckle-up for this one... 

For me, it all started back in 2013. I was in middle school, and was starting to really get interested in history. So when one of my friends told me about a simulation-style, plane game that was making headway, needless to say, I was pretty excited to check it out! Seeing as to how the progression system works, I was SO excited to climb the fighter ranks! 

Over the years, I watched as the game added aircraft, after aircraft, as well as upgrades to the graphics engine. It's like I just couldn't quit playing! Switching around to different nations, trying different aircraft, it was definitely the one thing I thought about at school all-day long. 

One day, I launched the game to find that Ground Vehicles were being tested... That was it for me... My favorite game just got even better! I could now experience something that is unheard of in any other game, accurate shell tracking and physics, combined with detailed, accurate vehicles. 

I also recall the day ships were added, a day I had been waiting for, for a very, long time. Honestly though, Ship battles just aren't for me. I would rather experience my favorite game mode "Ground Realistic Battles", where I can use my unlocked planes and tanks to unleash havoc against my enemies. 

The amount of vehicles and nations increases every update, making sure to keep us long-term players buried with content to enjoy. Personally, I have HUNDREDS of vehicles.... but that's nothing, considering there are OVER 2,000 VEHICLES IN THE GAME!!! 

I know you're probably thinking "It's a Free To Play game, it's probably full of Pay To Win garbage". Well, you're wrong. While War Thunder DOES have paid vehicles, you DO NOT have any advantage over players who choose to not spend a penny, at least in terms of game play. That is because War Thunder balances vehicles by giving them a "Battle Rating", or "BR". To sum it up, the vehicle stats are calculated based on survivability, as well as capability. For example, if you have the old, WWII, German Tiger H1, you don't want to face the modern, American M1A2 Abrams, in battle... That all being said, the advantages to spending $, are more "Pay To Progress". If you use a "Premium Vehicle" (vehicle obtained through the store), you earn an additional amount of research points towards whatever vehicle you are researching next in your tech-tree. You can also purchase a "Premium Account", which effectively does the same thing. Of course, you can probably see that combining both a "Premium Vehicle" and a "Premium Account", gives you a significant boost towards unlocking new vehicles, but like I said, that creates NO "Pay To Win" functionality. 

To wrap things up, War Thunder is BY FAR my favorite game, being that it takes all of the things that I love, and applies them all into one, single, package. It STAYS updated, not only in terms of new vehicles and graphics, but also in terms of the re-balancing of vehicles. I honestly can't think of ant other game studio that keeps their game so up to date, as Gaijin does with War Thunder. They have an EXCELLENT YouTube channel, where you can learn real history, AND new features/gameplay mechanics that come along with every update. 

I've put off this review for so long, simply because I don't feel like I could ever explain everything I love about this game in one sitting. Guys, Gals, try it. Watch the YouTube videos, learn the game, and I promise you, you WILL fall in love. Thank you Gaijin Entertainment, and may this game last for many, many, more years to come... <3

this game is only free to play if you can suffer the grind. having a premium account is practically necessary unless you want to spend hundreds and hundreds of hours grinding each nation's tech trees. the nice thing though is that even with 200 hours of premium, there's still plenty more to attain and work towards. each nation offers something different, not to mention the several game modes from arcade (very basic flight models, more UI elements enabled, generally easier and faster paced) to simulator. 

this brings me to the next point: one of the best ways to succeed is to know yourself and your enemy. for a player that doesn't have a lot of time or interest in doing out-of-game research, this is certainly a negative, but for serious players, it adds a level of mastery to the game. war thunder is a game that you need to give time and focus into researching and mastering, otherwise you'll find it difficult to truly succeed.

Very fun game. The only main issues I have are the fact that there are a lot of micro transactions. Though not truly important, there are multiple problematic micro transactions. For example, if you want really good camouflage, such as bushes on your tank, you have to spend money. Over all, I would recommend this game if you're a military vehicle/history buff. I would especially recommend it if you're interested in WW2 vehicles. If your looking at the game just because of modern vehicles, I would not recommend it all that much, as you start with pre-WW2 vehicles and have to do A LOT of grinding to get to modern. I've been playing the game for a little over 3 years and I only just now got a post-WW2 vehicle. Even with all of the problems, like I said before, the game is really fun. You do have to grind a lot, but the game is still fun. There are multiple features that don't exclusively involve online multiplayer, but connection to the internet is required. The UI is not the greatest in the world, but you'll get used to it over time. The vehicles (for the most part) are very accurate to the real vehicles. I only recently started playing on PC instead of console, and I have to admit, the PC version is superior in almost every way. Over all, I would definitely recommend this game, but do expect a very long grind.

The realistic battles are fun, especially ground battles.  The air and naval battles can be fun also, but the naval battles take a really long time and the air battles are a bit repetitive, just dog fight after dog fight after dog fight.  That's not the fault of the game developer, it's just the nature of the beast.  The arcade battles can be fun, but they mostly just turn into people trying to snipe each other from as far away as possible.  I get issues because I'm running off of a macbook pro and the graphics card barely meets the requirements.  So, if I have too much else running, it will often crash or have issues on screen.  The files are also quite large (~100GB), so that's a lot to have on the system as well (only 256 GB of ssd).  Luckily you can select a smaller file size and give up some quality.  Again, I don't think that's necessarily the fault of the game developer, just something to keep in mind if you are thinking about powering this game with a macbook pro or similar (p.s. it doesn't really run at all on my surface book, mac graphics ftw).  There are in game purchases available, and I can see how they can give you an advantage, but I haven't spent any money on the game and continue to feel competitive and enjoy the game after a little over 100 hrs of playing.

Fun for a F2P until you hit a certain rank, then it's all downhill once you're stuck playing the same tank for weeks and you start to notice things not adding up, the stupid meta gameplay that's driven by a complete lack of coordination and teamwork, the endless kill-die-repeat cycle with very few actually hard fought kills to spice things up.There's a few moments where the fights are actually drawn out and exciting, but most of the time you're either dunking on someone, or being dunked on. Naval battles are probably the most enjoyable part of the game now, the fights last a while, but the map and game design still push players towards slugging it out without any nuance or strategy. Guess that's to be expected from an F2P. 

There's a very obvious Russian bias from the Russian devs, pretty much all history tells us that stated Russian equipment specs were part of the information war, not actual reflections of the performance of the vehicles, but the devs take these numbers at face value and trust the Soviets to accurately report on their own shortcomings. If a person's only knowledge of WW2 and Cold War matchups was from this game, they would think that Russians are the world's greatest engineers, then wonder why nobody outside of Russia and India has every driven or ridden in something made by Russians. 

Some of the worse F2P elements include tedious grinding, uselss teammates who wear horse blinders, and every new premium ($$$) tank comes out overpowered to encourage people to buy it, then gets nerfed once the devs have made their money. 

The last straw was the removal of the chat. Apparently they didn't like people talking about Russia's invasion of Ukraine, so they just turned off chat. Any claims of this being over user toxicity can be disproven by the fact that chat was already toxic, because why wouldn't it be in a game that all of the longtime players hate but feel too invested in to leave? The toxicity just finally happened to strike a nerve with the politics of the devs (who didn't mind all the racist and pro-nazi chat before), and now chat is gone, the only part of the game I could still just laugh at and have fun with. 

I'm glad I got a favorable return for my money spent in terms of hours burnt, but this game leaves a bad taste.

"Free to Play" is stretching it. Most games that claim to be "free to play" get their money from people buying decals or cool-looking weapons or special features that are neat but don't actually impact play. This is not one of those games. They have at least 4 separate currencies in-game that effectively have to be purchased with real money. Yes you can earn some of these types of currencies by playing, but only up to a point, eventually you will need to spend real money to advance. You will not be able to play anything but WWII era vehicles without spending money. It's also not just a little bit of money either. You'll need to be shelling out a lot of money because you need premium to "research" vehicles at any reasonable rate, then you need money to purchase the vehicles to use and then you need money to repair the vehicles that get destroyed when you play. I tried this game. I really wanted to have fun without dumping loads of money into it. But it's not possible. Even if you're really good at this game you'll still going to be slugging it along at a snails pace crawling up to the modern era while people with every tank modification in your current level devastate the heck out of you. I thought about not writing this review but then I realized that this game really is addictive enough that I can imagine a lot of people getting sucked into it and dumping their money into it. If this were a game where I just paid a one-time fee for the core content I'd be okay with it. But it's actually a down-right deceitful game. Uninstall this leech.

At first glance it seems a nice looking battle royal type game but with war machines, (jet fighters, prop planes, tanks, battleships, and all variations of motorized weaponry). However on closer inspection this game is highly detailed in terms of the physical abilities and limitations of these weapons of war. From the speed advantage with loss of momentum energy due to the mass of the P38 Lightning to how the placement of the turrets on the USS Porter made anti-aircraft defense terrible within 2 kms of the vessel, this game is highly detailed. Whether you approve or disprove of how the developer is managing the actual game client and the game's economy, the actual game itself is very impressive.

Very nice game to play, enjoyable and fun to play with friends but, there is a lot of grinding and pay to win but it's still pretty good. The game also has very realistic vehicle models and a enthusiastic experience is given to the player.
I feel existential pain after each round, I recommend it to everyone ;3

The art team of Gaijin did an amazing job renditioning the vehicles, the models and the effects all look amazing, the sounds sound punchy and you can really feel the weight of the vehicle. On that aspect, it's amazing. 

HOWEVER, what completely destroys this game is the poor network stability. You're going to face frequent ping spikes and connection drops, for a purely online game that kills the game. Not to mention the extremely long grind for higher tier vehicles and the matchmaking compression that sometimes pit WW2 vehicles with cold war vehicles. 

They could have a real banger on their hands but due to poor management of what they have, I don't recommend playing this.

I started Warthunder with the closed beta in 2013, it was all about experiencing a new wargame with planes. At the beginning the devs really cared about the game and the community, sure you could invest money to progress faster but it did not change the spec of the game. But after they added tanks and more and more premium packs it obvious that this is a pay to win game, where you just spend X amounts of money to win. Immo the game is not worth playing anymore.
Fun, but the pay to win is annoying.

Feels like I'm fucking working, except I don't enjoy any part of it. Enjoy grinding for an entire week of 1/10th the way of a bar to research a new interesting tank (oh and as a bonus nothing is unlocked on it and it is literal cock and ball torture to unlock anything on a brand new tank). Enjoy getting one shot out of spawn by someone with every tank unlocked and 9 million hours on each tank with a bajillion premium paid shitter bushes on his shit so he blends in with any environment, oh but you killed him? He'll just hop in one of his million different super unkillable planes with bombs that replenish every 30s and huge cannons since you don't have AA then proceed to revenge kill you and your entire team the remainder of the game. Very fun! Very engaging gameplay! Super enjoyable getting sent to hanger with 0 to 1 kills after 5 minutes. God forbid you play a TANK MODE with ONLY TANKS. Nah bro! It's COMBINED ARMS you gotta get SHIT ON CONSTANTLY by planes that you can't do a single thing about, and nor can you do anything in your planes because you hate playing planes and can't unlock shit for them. Have fun playing Air Realistic by the way, enjoy holding W to the point for 5-10 minutes only to get one shot by some shitter that does nothing but play his unstoppable killing plane 24/7.

Oh, but you happen to have a great game, and manage to kill a handful of tanks or planes, or what-the-fuck-ever? Here's barely enough in-game currency to repair your lineup of tanks. We got a ton of different premium paid tanks that cost as much as literally brand new triple AAA videogames though for you to buy and shit on people that don't want to spend all of their money on virtual fucking tanks.
