No, I can't recommend this as of now, the devs have handled this game horrendously with a plague of imbalance as a result.

Note: I have very little experience playing as anything not a tank or ground vehicle so I won't talk of air or navel battles, I have also never spent money on this game or any others like it.

SL= silver lions, the non-premium in-game currency

RP= research points

CAS= close air support

BR= battle rating, determines what fights what

Problem 1: The grind was long when I started 5 years ago but now it looks extraordinarily easy compared to now. 5 years ago if one were to get a nice 10 kill game and a victory (without a premium account or premium vehicle) they would get around 5000 research points and 30-40,000 silver lions (correct me if im wrong as my memory is not perfect), which was still not adequate as the grind was still so long one would need a will of obsidian to get to top tier. Now if one were to achieve the same results as mentioned they would get the same silver lions but maybe half the research making the grind nothing more than a colossal waste of time, especially with the devs constantly adding vehicles with ludicrously high RP and SL costs. Unless willing to spend literally thousands of dollars one will never realistically make it to top tier. (top tier is Battle Rating 11.7 as of now and I am only at 8.0 with only 2 re-searchable vehicles owned at that BR)


Problem 2: This game is heavily pay to win and it really doesn't have to be; seriously it should be 60-70$ at most with no pay to win. Premium accounts double RP and SL gains while (with bonuses stacking) premium vehicles double RP gains, some can be obtained for free but its either very hard or the vehicle in question is not very capable. There is a premium German version of the Tiger 1 that has double the front armor at the exact same BR at the Tiger 1, the Soviet IS-6 is at 7.0 and can easily deflect most things shot at it and easily kill most things it fights, the British Centurion mk5 AVRE can kill anything it will fight with no careful aiming at close range, the Soviet Object 120 can easily kill anything at any range and be wounded but survive most counter fire, the US T28 is literally a T95, a 7.0 BR re-searchable tank at 6.3, the German Tiger 2 H sla.16 has the same BR as the normal Tiger 2 but is faster. Those were just a few examples of pay to win tanks,  but there are many more overpowered pay to win vehicles and that isn't even mentioning the ultra rare event vehicles, which are a whole other type of evil.


Problem 3: This problem is exclusive to ground battles and it is that aircraft are allowed to be used in them, although only after doing mildly well in a tank, this means that close air support aircraft are able to quickly be spawned and are able to bomb/strafe/rocket anything of the ground with very little risk to said aircraft as while there is anti air tanks they are very hard to use and quite often garbage at low to mid tiers and early high tiers. of course fighters are spawn-able and are good counters to CAS, the CAS will often spawn before any fighters and get a couple free kills and is also likely to have fighters defending it when an opposing fighter does spawn. The weird thing is that very few people in this game seem to care about this problem and do not recognize it as one.


Problem(s) 4: The devs very rarely listen to the player base and act like nothing is wrong, it is positively infuriating. There are also too many cases of imbalance with the re-searchable vehicles to count and there is this weird glitch called "ghost shells", as per the name sometimes (as in quite rarely so its not like it effects game play that much) in ground battles when a shot is fired the game will fail to recognize the shell as real making the shell do nothing, it is supposedly fixed by the devs every single update but it's always there anyway.


Positives: The game is, as far a mechanics, damage models and graphics, clearly made with a lot of care and has no bugs that make the game unplayable, making it very worthy of the previously mentioned 60-70$ price and while the community can be toxic they certainly aren't the worst. Also this game can be plenty comedic with its many hilarious little bugs that I hope are never fixed as they add such an unserious, happy atmosphere to the game.

Please remember this is my opinion and it obviously is not perfect.

this is by far one of the best video games i have ever played. i used to play crossout, another game by gaijin, but when i looked on the website and discovered war thunder, i new i had to get it. i would definitely recommend this game to anyone who like flying planes, driving tanks, and operating naval destroyers. i would also recommend crossout to people who like assembling vehicles with 30 mm. minigun-cannons. both are definitely great multiplayer games. i especially like the aircraft attack and bomber planes. one thing i would say is it's definitely a good idea to buy a couple thousand golden eagles to get started. i bought the invader a-26 pack and an additional 1000 eagles and with the proper strategy, i had gained 6 planes that day (a-26,p-38,PBY-5 Catalina, PBY-5a Catalina,b-18, and maybe the b-34, i don't remember), four of those through researching. it may in some cases be difficult to shoot down enemy planes, which is why i like bombers, but it's easy to get the hang of it. definitely a 5 star game.

Not free to play!! After playing this game for over 200 hours I have made some discoveries into how this game works. In order to enter a battle you must have a repaired vehicle, which cost large amounts of in game currency (which is insanely grindy to get). You will end up playing the same vehicles over and over again. If you do not purchase premium you will end up fighting more vehicles from the future/ better vehicles. One might think that if you play a game for 200 hours youd be close to finishing, nope. I am not more than a quarter through the American tech tree. So in short, this game is not free to play, if you dont empty your wallet into it you will not go far. Save your time, go play world of tanks which is actually free to play, unlike this pay to play, pay to win garbage

I want to love this game, but every time i get back into it i'm always reminded that the same problems still exist even after long breaks between playing. I like the way tank and air combat works, but besides new vehicles there really hasn't been much new in terms of game modes (except April fools events, but they obviously don't last) and the games balance gets hammered the further you get into tech trees. What really kills it though is the slow progression and the fact that your new vehicles are gimped making it a very painful experience to progress especially into the later tiers. I know why they do this (to get you to buy in), but would it really kill them to give you some repair/equipment to start. In the end there's nothing really like this game, it's too bad that it becomes such an investment to make any reasonable progress.

If you're looking for a review on this game you've come to the wrong place, but if you're looking for an outstanding pie recipe you've come to the right place.

Ingredients:

1. 6 tablespoons unsalted butter
2. 1/2 cup white sugar
3. 1/2 cup brown sugar
4. 1/4 cup water
5. 1/4 teaspoon cinnamon
6. 1 pinch salt
7. 5 apples - peeled, cored and sliced
8. 1 pastry for double-crust pie

Directions:

1. Preheat oven to 425 degrees F (220 degrees C).
2. Combine butter, white sugar, brown sugar, water, cinnamon, and salt in a saucepan over medium heat. Bring to a boil, remove from heat and set aside.
3. Roll out half the pastry to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Place bottom crust in pie plate; pour in apple slices.
4. Roll out top crust into a 10-inch circle. Cut into 8 (1-inch) wide strips with a sharp paring knife or pastry wheel. Weave the pastry strips, one at a time, into a lattice pattern. Fold the ends of the lattice strips under the edge of the bottom crust and crimp to seal.
5. Pour butter-sugar mixture over top of pie, coating the lattice, and allowing any remaining sauce to drizzle through the crust.
6. Bake in the preheated oven for 15 minutes. Reduce heat to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C), and bake until the crust is golden brown, the caramel on the top crust is set, and the apple filling is bubbling, 35 to 40 more minutes. Allow to cool completely before slicing.

As we all know, War Thunder is a great game with great (and a lot of missed-) potential. 
As for the grind, we all know you're in for hell once you commit to a grind in War Thunder because if you can't put in 20 hours a day it'll take about 1 year to spade a whole country (air and ground).

However.. after 2300 hours I think that my game life will never be the same after we one day lose it. 
I mean.. it'd be a huge relief but also a part of your life that gets ripped away.

What I'm trying to say is.. if you're a person who enjoys grinding games such as Warframe, GTA (doesn't have to be relevant to the militairy theme of War Thunder), I'd recommend WT to you.

I'd say, give it a shot, cuz if you do and you get invested in it.. It'll be part of you forever.

I want to recommend this game - Really really do, but it pains me to thumb it down.

Over the better part of about 30+ days I've decided to try War Thunder after seeing videos on Youtube about it, looks fun right? And it is for about the first 2-3 tiers, and that's when you start to see the nature of Gaijin suck their paws into your wallet.

The FTP format works okay up until about tiers 3 onwards. If you do not have a premium account, expect to spend countless hours farming for silver for repairs and basic upgrades / new tank designs. Premium account time will give you a bonus on these, quite honestly if you want to go further then tier 3 you NEED to have a premium account. 

There is also the battlepass tier system, have a life but want to get that sweet Elephant tank - well good fucking luck because although you get a daily bonus for logging in, if you do NOT do those dailys or spend sweet premium / silver tokens until you get the easier dailys you will NOT unlock that sweet sweet Elephant tank.

But hang on you say, there's premium vehicles - very over priced premium vehicles that give you bonuses to earning MORE silver lions but at a cost of your fucking soul. Not only that, your precious mKPz M47 German tank that cost nearly about 6 months of premium time will get destroyed because the match making / BR system is so broken that the moment you purchase one of these bad boys you will be put with others with much more impressive premium hardware making your Tier V supposed sex machine a literal fucking smoking tin can.

My advice - stay away from this terrible yet wonderful game, you will get addicted, you will spend premium currency and you will regret it the end.. now im off to play War Thunder because fuck me I want that sweet Elephant Tank.

Has all the groundwork of being an amazing game and I have played it since before it was available on steam and before ground forces were available.
Sadly the game seems to be in a downward spiral and definitely lost the enjoyment it once gave me.

That being said, the direction of the game, the economy, the lack of vehicles in some tech-trees, the massive amount of vehicles either for real money or through FOMO-events are just sucking all the fun out of the game for me.

Not even talking about there being literal bushes you can buy for real money and stick all over the front of your tank to get a TANGIBLE advantage over non-paying players by basically being invisible and covering up weakspots, chat now being disabled because of the war in Ukraine, new players not being allowed to use decals on their tanks anymore, decals being restricted in size, every event being a painful grind if youre not spending money to progress etc etc...

If you are looking for a casual tank game this might be fun but don't even attempt to get past tier 3/4 without a premium account and massive amounts of grind, in the current state the higher rankings are simply not meant to be reachable in an adequate amount of time for a normal player.

When it comes to amazing and capable engines and massive online gaming communities it gets discouraging when the developers start to charge you for features. Fortunately this game feel pretty solid without paying a dime as long as you don't get sick of the pre-ww2 combat trying to get to the later tiers.

The price Range for the extra stuff ranges significantly with planes being sold for a upfront 80$ or and extra squad slot for just a dollar. Each unlock you grind for is worth around 15$ bucks to Gaijin and probably about 3 dollars for the overall value for your account.

This game saved my life.

I am 50.

My ex-wife and I have a daughter together, and adopted our son together. They are now both 4 years old.

When we were going through our separation, I found myself lost and miserable. I was self destructive. I got so mad one day from everything spiraling out of my control that I punched some concrete in a moment of overwhelming emotion. That caused me to break my 5th metacarpal in my right hand... my working hand... my games hand.. the hand that I held and carried my children to bed with.. The hand I desperately needed to make sure I could continue to provide.

After learning of the severity of my self-inflicted damage, I was borderline suicidal. Keep in mind that just a few months before this, I was the happiest man with no history of depression or anxiety. I have never had fits of rage, or been one to break down and cry, but I was in a low spot that just really buried me from being able to see the light on the other side.

Having nothing better to do, I searched for a game I could play, ONE HANDED while I recovered. I somehow stumbled upon this game and read some of the reviews. I decided that it had to be worth a shot... I must admit, I didn't beat the game, or play nearly as long as some of you. In fact, I may have only played this game a day or two.. With that being said, after doing so, I had a new found joy and hope for life. I was able to put behind me the pain and suffering that had been cast over me. I was able to experience other peoples joy and happiness. I was able to see the fruits of my "labor". I relaxed for 5 ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ minutes to this music long enough to realize that I was going to be okay.

After coming to that realization, I turned the game off, and I went back to work. It hurt my hand like hell but I was motivated. I stopped feeling so damn sorry for myself, and I became the father I needed to be in that moment, not the weak boy I was behaving as.

I can't in good faith recommend this game. The foundation is solid. The historical accuracy, the plane/tank models, the damage model, are all there, great and very realistic. But all of it is ruined by the economy and questionable developer/balance/gameplay choices.

The progress in unlocking and researching new vehicles is very quick and satisfying in rank 1. But by the middle/end of rank 2 of any nation progress will become increasingly slower, and the cost to buy the already researched vehicles grows more and more, so much so that you can barely afford anything at some point. Almost everything costs silver lions, one of the MANY currencies in game, even the ammunition for each vehicle, and if you don't have a premium account, and at a certain point even if you have one, the mission rewards won't be enough to let you play at higher ranks continuously. It's bad, and it ruins the whole experience. 

The worst thing is that, when your vehicle gets damaged in a mission, you'll have to pay silver lions to repair it, OR wait several hours or days for it to repair for free. While in the first few ranks the cost is acceptable as you get rewarded way more than that for each mission, as you unlock more expensive vehicles the repair cost will be too much to be sustainable. Which means you'll probably have to wait up to days to play with that same vehicle again.

This creates a vicious psychological cycle. You don't want to be destroyed in a mission or get your vehicle damaged as when that happens you'll most likely become very frustrated.

The more you advance through the vehicle ranks, the more skill and knowledge is also required. Which is kind of fine, if the game was sustained by a fair economic system and didn't have questionable balance and gameplay designs.

I have mostly played with air forces throughout my many hours in game. While the arcade game mode feels pretty balanced, the realistic mode is not. I'll make an example about gameplay and balance design choices that I dislike.

In the last few days I was going through rank 2 of the american air force. There's this airplane, the P-51: when you spawn as a fighter in a realistic battle you will have to take off from an airfield, both factions do. The P-51 has one of the worst climb rate in the game in its rank as a fighter. And it's a boom and zoom plane, which means the plane is required to be at a high altitude and have enough energy/speed to be effective. Since both factions airfields are very close to each other, with that plane you won't be able to climb high enough to have the effectiveness that the plane requires. Even if you side climb, the plane will lose effectiveness once you reach 4000 metres of altitude and beyond due to its engine limitation. And by that time the game is probably already decided, meaning you've spent 10-15 minutes climbing without engaging in any fight whatsoever.

I have tried to play the plane differently, using it as a low altitude boom and zoomer, or as a turn fighter. If you play as the former, any other plane which has the altitude advantage over you will gun you down, and there will be. If you play as the latter, every fighter will outperform you and kill you, as the plane turn rate is very bad compared to other fighters. Once an enemy fighter has you in its sight, it's game over. This happened over and over again, as frustration mounted I felt helpless, the plane was basically unplayable. Its only usefulness, then, was to use it as a bomber killer, as at least its guns are formidable: but since most bombers at rank 2-3 will stay at a altitude higher than 4000 metres, getting to them will be hard and still take quite some time

This is just one of a few examples I could make. Bombers effectiveness is also questionable at best, as most fighters will gun you down at some point during a match. That is more a question of when, not if.

The game also has several single player modes that you could play. Some are free, dynamic campaigns is one them, some are not, the Pacific campaigns, which, from what I've read, they were last updated so long ago that some missions have become unplayable over time, as patches have changed the game and the specifics of each plane.
I like dynamic campaigns though: but again, Gaijin doesn't care about them. Some missions are almost impossible to win. They also have a daily limit, which means the rewards get scaled so much after you've completed a couple that you won't be able to get any research points nor silver lions by completing them. Developers want you to play online, not some unfinished single player mode they don't care about.

Do yourself a favour and don't play this game. You may get sucked into it, because as I said the foundations are all good and there, but over time you will realize you're mostly getting frustration out of it and you're wasting your time as the economics is completely rigged and want you to spend money on every turn.

I almost forgot to mention, after the war in Ukraine the developers decided to remove the chat, making coordination with teammates that much harder. It's been disabled for more than a month now and who knows when it will be back.

This game has allot going for it. They have allot of cool ideas and mechanics that surpass other games IMO with the damage/kill system. It's very addictive and more interesting than most shooters and war games when it is at its best. I will grant that this game is FTP, but it has a painful grind made to squeeze money from you that outstrips almost nay other freemium game I've played.

However the game has a few core problems that make it frustrating more often than fun. 
-It's a loooonngggg grind, hundreds of hours atleast
-You must pay to repair and this means you can easily lose money if you are unlucky (causes way more problems bellow)
-players don't play to win. Winning pays fairly little, so it's safer and more profitable to drive past objectives and camp.
-only one game mode, while their are some slight alterations and decent number of maps, it's all point capture.
-in game purchases, should you chose to do them, are VERY costly and might help a bit, but do NOT fix the games core issues.
-in game chat is disabled, which while maybe understandable, makes coordination impossible 
-some P2W elements

It's fun at time but I would only advise playing f2p, and expect to only be playing up to early-mid ww2 tanks if you want to avoid making yourself miserable.

~Sighs~

They just keep adding more and more things without bothering to fix what’s already in the game. Most players won’t even reach Rank 6 and they’re already adding more Rank 7 vehicles. 

The American tank tech tree is overtiered, sub-par in hard factors (armor, speed, firepower), and are downright inferior to their competitors, Germany and Russia. The Sherman was an amazing tank. Featuring 24 degrees per second of turret rotation, a ferocious 450 horsepower engine, and 100% of original penetration values. But now they are shells of their former snails. Their turret rotation is almost halved, now having 16.8 degrees of turret rotation, a sluggish 400 horsepower engine, and 75% of original pen value. Germany is babied by Gaijin and the Russians get their biased RNG armor and APHE shells, while America only sees nerfs. There has only been one major buff of American equipment, and that is the stabilizer buff. Even then it was brought along with a wave of nerfs. The only redeeming aspect of the American tank tech tree is the stabilizer and generally better players. Even then the stabilizer is used a reason for the many nerfs America sees from Germany and Russia. With the  Germans and Russians believing the stabilizer is some mythical war winning weapon! I have played all three nations and the stabilizer is not an ‘I win tool’. It is a handy tool to take advantage of when your sub-par armor, speed, and firepower doesn’t allow you to play on an even field with your competitors. “America Suffers” is a by product of “Germany Suffers”, and the best American players can hope for is to only get better as their equipment only gets inferior.

Now, onto the mode that is Air RB.

Air RB has been screwed over badly, and it’s never going to get fixed. Fighter mains are catered towards and any opposition/suggestions against them have never been fully successfully executed by Gaijin. Air RB has been turned into some sunset showdown where Winston Churchill and Adolf Hitler shake hands, agreeing to send an equal amount of planes towards a designated location for a 'fair' good old show down! Que the wild west music, Yeeehaaaa! Aircraft were originally intended for ground support with reconnaissance, bombs, whatever. But Fighter mains have complained that an objective based game where they must support ground forces does not interest them and would rather have some game mode of KILL EVERYONE! Gaijin has and always will cater to them! The problem is in the air 'realistic' game mode.  It needs to be fixed how the battles play out.  The main problem is everyone treats air 'realistic' as a giant death match.  Nobody cares about the objective of the map.  So when bombers actually started playing the map it took away the fighters way of life.  Death-match.  Forced the fighters to actually play the game instead of just turn-fighting each other.  Forced to climb to 5,000 meters often in a straight line for 10 minutes to catch a bomber and shoot them down.  They found it boring and ended the matched too quickly.  Called us bomber pilots names and now we are shunned again. All Air RB has evolved to after years of development, rather devolved to, is Call of Duty featuring fighters! 

Another example of Gaijin protecting Fighter mains would be the request of Ground Forces players asking Gaijin for years on end to host a tank/ground vehicles only game mode separate from Ground Realistic Battles with close air support, or rather target practice for planes. This game mode has existed when ground forces was still in its early infancy and it was actually well received. But Fighter mains have once again complained! Because APPARENTLY target practice with player controlled targets is just so much more 'fun' than shooting AI controlled ground targets in Air RB. Fighter Mains also tend to disregard ground units waging a LITERAL BATTLE just below as decor, with the only reminder of its existence as mid-map anti-air installments. Not only that but these Fighter Mains also tend to sport a sense of 'honor' and an ego to boot. They view such tactics as Air Field Camping and Spite crashes as un-sporty! Despite these tactics clearly holding an advantage to those that use them. Air field camping provides an environmental advantage over your opponents, forcing your opponents to fight you on your terms. Yet this is again seen as un-sporty. Spite crashes done by bombers attract fighters. These fighters lose their initial altitude advantage sacrificing one of their advantages when fighting other fighters. They tail sit and proceed to dump ammo (usually missing all shots from my experience). Then the bomber proceeds to nose dive crash, wasting the fighter's altitude, time, and possibly ammo. Fighters then proceed to scream "how un-sporty that the bomber didn't fly directly into my line of fire!"! Then proceed to brag about themselves carrying their team via their 'skill'. Even then, I'm sure if these Fighter Mains decide to play Ground Forces RB, otherwise known as Air RB featuring player controlled ground targets they would scream "HOW UN-SPORTY" when someone decides to take cover, camp in positions that can defend an objective well, and other various under-handed tactics. It's as if the British military officers from 17th hundreds gained a time travel portal and are now playing War Thunder, screaming "how un-sporty", "what cowards", "what barbarious tactics"! Air RB has turned into the Death match game mode it is now and has been for YEARS because of these fighter Mains'' 'integrity', 'honor', ego, and 'skill'.

~This Fighter influence needs to be exterminated!

All in all, no matter how infuriatingly bad this game is, I love this game and wish for it to stop piling on new 'content' to take the time to fix the current problems that it has, old and new.

Here is an extension to my argument. I did not write this; this work belongs to MH4UAstragon, whom can be found on the War Thunder forums. I believe their words need to be read concerning the state of development of Air RB. - 

"Basically, any and all changes that have attempted to flip the table in Air RB, or even just "stir the pot," always run into a wall I refer to as "toxic pure fighter mains," even before running into further walls based on what the dev team's choices are or aren't. Of which in your proposed changes, the feature of having respawns would stir things the most. 

The mode remains stale because certain obnoxiously loud portions of its playerbase like it in its current deplorable state, simply because it caters to just what those portions of the playerbase want and nothing else. One person on this very forum literally said:

"If for any reason I need to abort a fun dogfight I am having to go save or kill some xxxxing bot farmer or spacebar warrior, or lose the match, that is the day I uninstall War Thunder."

You cannot argue with "pure fighter extremism" like that. You cannot compromise with it either. Any time you try to compromise with it, such people then resume screaming while claiming "but muh fighters take more 'skill' to use!" and keep screaming until all the bombers and attackers are worthless trash, which is most of the current problem outside a couple oddball maps that favor attacker zergrushing (Spain, Poland, and Normandy are examples).

All these folk care about seemingly is one-life dogfighting til hell freezes over, and using the results of that dogfighting as a xxxx-measuring stick. 

How do I know just how much of a problem these people are? The last time we had a significant game mechanical change to the mode was in 1.63-1.65 when the extra vehicle spawns were added at the 20 minute mark. Those things were added as something to kill to force an end to a round where the last bomber is climbing to space or the last guy is AFK on his runway shielded by AAA. But then due to their ever-increasing uselessness, bombers and attackers with significant bomb payloads got creative and started saving a few bombs til late gam

War Thunder is stunning and has amazing graphics but that's about it. the game claims to be free to play but in tern has an incredibly long grind just to be able to play the jets that you love, and how do you shorten the grind? money. lots and lots of money. in fact spending money on premium planes and and premium account can shorten your grind by an EXPONENTIAL amount. And with repair costs of vehicles (literally costs you money just to use a vehicle) the game punishes you for loosing/being bad and 90% of the vehicles in the game require you to get 4 to 5 kills just to break even. want to know how to boost the money you earn by getting kills/winning. more money. the economy with this game is so bad that spending no less then 100 dollars can shorten your grind for rp and silver lions (ingame currency) by 75% (the get to top tier USA would take upwards of a year but with premium it would take a few months). and all of this money you are spending to shorten the grind is supporting a dev team that does not care about their community at all. there is an incredible amount of bugs that have been around for so long and many many people have complained directly to the devs about and they have done NOTHING. speaking of the community, pretty much everyone is nice and willing to help, until you mention that you play arcade battles (aka the only somewhat enjoyable mode aka easy mode with respawns, unlimited ammo, etc) and then they instantly turn on you and shame you for simply ENJOYING THE GAME. i have personally played this game off and on for about 3 years and i just two days ago finally got the jet that i started playing the game for. so if you see the game and are expecting to play with a certain jet chances are you will have to spend a ton of money and or time just to be able to use it for 2 minutes a match and instantly get shot down by someone way better then you. horrible game

I firmly believe this is one of my favorite games out there. I have always loved planes and tanks (and war in general), so this game has met every single one of my expectations for a war game and I absolutely love it. The only issue is the grinds and repair costs for silver lions, as I feel even in lower tiers I am losing 2-3 thousand more silver lions than I am gaining (even with premium)

When you get down to it this is the best "realistic" combat vehicle game out there. Thats not really upto any debate at this point. You can say you like the other plane/tank games more thats fine. But this is the best your going to get if you want simi realistic tank/plane combat. Now the Navel modes are more or less a waste of time as of this review. The game play just is not good on that front. 

If you decide you want to play this game a couple things ill say is dont stay in arcade for to long. You loose alot of research by playing arcade. Im not hating on arcade but it is awful if you want to unlock things past Teir 3. Something else you want to do is play with some experienced people so they can teach you about all the mechanics the game dosent help you with, if you dont want to do that then you need to watch some Vids. Dont get me wrong the games not super hard or anything, but you will have a better time if you have help in the beginning.

My last major point to cover is money. This game is free but it can get very expensive very fast. Ive probably got 1000 dollars in the game easy. Now i have about 4000 hours in this game and have been playing on and off since the beginning, so 1000 dollars over 6-7 years is not bad IMO. What my advice on buying things in this game would be to wait for sales. You can always google when the next sale will be it wont be exzact but it will give you an pretty good idea of when it will be. The one thing ill say not to wait on is a premium account, BUT with that only buy enough to get you to the next sale then buy a whole year at half price during sale. 

Please dont buy things untill they are on sale.

Remember this game wants your money really bad and its not shy about it. DONT BUY ANYTHING NOT ON SALE. Except premium and only enough to get you to a sale.

This game is a very long grind.  Ground has always been terrible for grinding but air used to be ok. Now all the modes are awful at the high tiers. Its going to take you over a year to get the top vehicles for one Nation and thats if you spend some money. You can definitely get them faster but not if you new unless your just good right away. 

In the end i recommend this game if you like Military vehicles just know what your getting into, go watch some videos/streams ask around in your friend group if they know about the game, and join a squadron thats welcoming to new players if you can.
